This property is ideally located on the doorstep to Lloyd Park while also moments from the amenities on Hoe Street.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This first floor one bedroom flat for sale in Leytonstone is located in a converted corner property in the popular E11 area of Bushwood, with easy access to both Leytonstone High Road Overground and Leytonstone Underground. It also puts you on the doorstep of the wonderful Wanstead Flats for the best that the great outdoors can offer.

This first floor one bedroom flat for sale in Leytonstone is located in a converted corner property in the popular E11 area of Bushwood, with easy access to both Leytonstone High Road Overground and Leytonstone Underground. It also puts you on the doorstep of the wonderful Wanstead Flats for the best that the great outdoors can offer.

As you enter the flat into your small entrance hallway, directly to your right you'll see the lovely bright bathroom, perfectly furnished with the essentials of WC, sink and bath, and with a handy over-bath shower for when you're in a rush. The fresh white walls and neutral bath tiles are complemented by the sense of warmth provided by the charming engineered wooden flooring. A rustic shelf over the WC also provides a handy space for your toothbrush and toiletries.

As you exit the bathroom, walk straight across the hallway to the double sized bedroom that lies opposite. The beautiful flooring continues into this space, and the large, front aspect triple window bathes the room in natural light, opening up this room even further. An unusual, quirky and useful feature comes in the form of a large recessed space - much like an internal side return - allowing a huge amount of room to purpose as a wardrobe and/or shelving storage, so you can keep the main area free of clutter. This room can comfortably accommodate a double bed, bedside unit, and drawers or a dressing table – plus there's a second recessed area that can serve as a clothes hanging area and also space for another drawer unit or even perhaps a TV table.

Heading back into the hallway and turn left into your reception… and what a reception awaits you! The two things you'll immediately notice are the immense amount of space available and the incredible sense of light. It's a real showstopper. The room features the same beautiful wood flooring as seen in the bathroom and bedroom, along with fresh, bright, white walls to further accentuate the airy atmosphere that promises many happy days and nights. With sprawling walls largely unencumbered by interruptions, this is a space that offers the flexibility for a wide range of furniture configurations – there's almost no limit. The room is easily large enough for a good-sized dining table too, for casual dinners, remote working, games nights or socialising with friends.

To the rear left of the living room is the open doorway into the wonderfully equipped kitchen, decorated in a stylish combination of white and dark grey. There's a range of base and wall units in bright glossy white, white walls and wall tiles, and mottled charcoal grey countertops and harmonising floor tiles. A washing machine and fridge are already in-situ for your move, so you can chill that celebration bottle of bubbly and keep the milk fresh for those essential brews. From the sink you can look out of the large sunny window onto the street and there's a dedicated space ready for your cooker.

While the beautiful windows in this property are not double-glazed, central heating throughout will ensure you're cosy even in the colder months.

This gorgeous one bedroom flat is also a stone's throw away from Bushwood's gorgeous green spaces, the natural expanses of Wanstead Flats and park. For those day-to-day essentials, the bustling and friendly high road is just at the top of your street, where you can access an Argos, Matalan, Post Office, a gym, a McDonald's and both a Tesco superstore and Express. Popular local pubs like The Birds and The North Star are also a short stroll away, and there's plenty of fabulous restaurants and takeaways for those days when you just don't feel like cooking.

What the owner said...
'i've lived in this flat for almost seven years and loved it from the start. There is a warm and relaxed vibe about the flat and the neighnourhood. I particularly love spending time in the bright and silent living room overlooking the greens of the garden. In the late spring when the sweet mock orange tree is in full bloom there is a wonderful scent throughout the flat. I like my neighbours - very nice and respectful people. Everyone in the building owns their flat and have been there for over ten years (despite being young and international) making it an unusually friendly community for London.

I'll miss immensely walking home in my street late at night and being greeted by at least two cats and sometimes a fox. It will be difficult to find a better weekend morning routine than going to run to Wanstead Flats - just behind the corner - carrying on in Wanstead park and having breakfast at the Wild Goose, a lovely local cafè.

In more pragmatic terms, i've appreciated the very low expenses associated with my flat, its convenience to the city centre (I used to work at the lse in Holborn and it took me 25 minues to get there by Central line), easy parking when I got guests, and reaching Stansted airport in 30 minutes. I hope you'll enjoy and appreciate this flat as much as I did'!

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A smart and spacious two double bedroom first floor ex Warner apartment with a balcony and shared garden in our Coppermill neighbourhood. Both Walthamstow High Street and social hub crate St James are less than five minutes' walk, there's a wealth of potential and you're well-placed for transport, too.

St James Street overground station is a four minute stroll away and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty. Alternatively, ride one stop in the other direction and you're at Walthamstow Central, for direct twenty minute West End access via the Victoria line, or cyclists can join the same line at Blackhorse Road in four minutes. Two-wheeled enthusiasts can also hit the Q2 cycleway from Glenthorne Road (literally around the corner) to speed you to Hackney and the City.

If you lived here...

You'll be relaxing in your 130 square foot lounge with a triple set of sash windows framing lovely leafy street views and filling the space with natural light, plush grey carpet under your toes and a blank canvas on which to realise all your interior design inspirations. There's plenty of room for a dining area or home office here too, with a canny use of space. Next door bedroom one is similarly attired and suitable for a child or study, depending on your needs.

Continue across the hallway and your bedroom's a generous double of 130 square feet with built-in storage and a garden view. The kitchen comes with slate-effect flooring underfoot, matching worktops and a pine suite of cabinets, while the bathroom's decked out in a traditional white suite. Step out of the door to the rear here for your balcony - it's another spot set to sing and ideal for coffee in the morning. Next, descend the stairs for your shared rear garden. With some landscaping and/or green-fingered know-how this is a space set to transform into an urban solace.

Outside and our latest social hub of crate St James is just around the corner with an eclectic collection of independent entrepreneurs with offerings currently including mouth-watering vegan fast food, delicious burgers and authentic Vietnamese cuisine, plus St Best Jamaican Cuisine is coming soon. Walthamstow High Street is right next door, with its renowned street market and array of supermarkets and shops. Take the ten minute stroll up the High Street and you come to the Walthamstow Mall, nine screen Empire Cinema, a vast choice of fine restaurants and the aforementioned Walthamstow Central station.

What else?

- You're well served for local schools here, with nineteen primary/secondaries within a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted including the 'Outstanding' South Grove Primary a mere ten minute stroll away.
- You've a wealth of open green spaces within easy reach with St James Park and Stoneydown Park, which plays host to the Stoneydown Park Festival in the summer, both within a nine minute walk.
- Fancy a lengthier stroll? London's largest nature reserve, the wildlife haven of our 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands, is just three quarters of a mile on foot. Free to enter all year round, it's an incredible urban retreat.

detailedDescription:
This three bedroom chalet bungalow offers an abundance of history and heritage, whilst allowing for ample living space and substantial potential to re develop and build the property up. Further benefits include a self contained one bedroom flat (sold with tenants or vacant), has a 110ft garden, and is being sold on a chain free basis.

This three bedroom chalet bungalow offers an abundance of history and heritage, whilst allowing for ample living space and substantial potential to re develop and build the property up. Further benefits include a self contained one bedroom flat (sold with tenants or vacant), has a 110ft garden, and is being sold on a chain free basis.

The main house comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with the through lounge welcoming you on the left hand side and offering the ideal space to entertain friends and family. The three piece shower room greets you on the right hand side with the kitchen located to the rear. Whilst the kitchen is spacious there is much more you can do to open it out and create a more open flow to the property. The conservatory completes the ground floor of this charming home and gives access to the stunning garden.

The garden is a wonderful place to unwind in after a long day's work. Such is the size of the garden (110ft and 33ft wide), should you wish to do a rear extension (STPP) there is still ample garden space to enjoy.
The first floor of the property simple houses the three bedrooms, two of which are doubles and a good size single bedroom. The master bedroom also includes the luxury of spacious en suite WC room that can be turned into a shower room. Further loft space can be located on the first floor and is a great space for storage as it is.

The one bedroom self contained flat which has been added to the side of the property includes its own front door and rear access into the garden meaning you will never be disturbed should you wish to rent the property out. If you're looking to add the space of the one bedroom flat to the main house you can very simply link the two properties through the historical doorway that was previously in use. The flat itself is made up of a shower room, kitchen, reception room, dressing room and bedroom.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated between Hall Lane and Chingford Road both offering an array of local amenities including a selection of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. Highams Park station is within walking distance or even a short drive should you prefer, which gives access to the overground station.

When it comes to schools you are truly spoilt for choice including Chase Lane Primary School, Ainslie Wood Primary School, Salisbury Manor, Burnside Secondary School and many more to choose from.

With all rooms leading from a central hallway which benefits from large storage cupboards, the apartment is well laid out with natural light flooding all main living spaces. There are two double bedrooms with the main bedroom benefiting from a handy en-suite shower room, a contemporary fitted kitchen, family bathroom and large lounge/diner which currently accommodates a good sized sofa suite and six seater dining table comfortably. Externally there is one allocated parking space and visitors parking available within the development.

detailedDescription:
This three bedroom end of terrace house is the perfect family home that offers a very practical layout and can be moved into immediately due to the excellent condition throughout. Further benefits include two reception rooms, a summer house located in the garden, and with the incredible garden space there is an abundance of potential to unearth with the property either by extending to the rear or into the loft space (STPP).

This three bedroom end of terrace house is the perfect family home that offers a very practical layout and can be moved into immediately due to the excellent condition throughout. Further benefits include two reception rooms, a summer house located in the garden, and with the incredible garden space there is an abundance of potential to unearth with the property either by extending to the rear or into the loft space (STPP).

The property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with the first reception room greeting you on the right hand side. The reception room is a great space and has been superbly finished with the hardwood laminate running underfoot throughout the two reception rooms and the crisp white walls allowing for someone to come in and put their own stamp on the property.

The bay window in the front reception room floods the room with natural and allows for more usable space. Should you prefer a more open feel to the property you can very easily open the two reception rooms giving you a through lounge, but as it is, the second reception room offers a great space for dining and entertaining friends and family. The galley kitchen completes the ground floor of this charming property and includes space for all appliances. The kitchen is complemented by the eye catching gloss black spashback tiles and vinyl flooring.

Access to the garden is provided via the kitchen and second reception room. You are firstly welcomed by the patio area with the rest of garden laid to lawn. To the rear of the garden is the brick built summer house with a fully functional electricity supply. In today's world this is an incredibly useful space which can offer a multifunctional room – a play room, home office, or a gym – whatever suits your needs.

The first floor of the property comprises of two double bedrooms with the master bedroom again including the bay window giving more light and space. The hardwood laminate flooring continues underfoot throughout both bedrooms and the third bedroom as well, accompanied with the unadorned walls. Rounding off this charming home is the three piece family bathroom suite completed with polished grey tiled splashbacks.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated within a mile to Walthamstow Central and half a mile away from Wood Street station. Wood Street itself is a stone's throw away where you will find an abundance of local amenities on offer including plenty of bars, restaurants, shops, and the indoor Georgian market, often described as the gem of Wood Street.

You are truly spoilt for choice when it comes to schools including Frederick Bremmer School, Thorpe Hall Primary School, Woodside Primary Academy and many many more.

detailedDescription:
A handsome two bedroom apartment on the second floor of this highly sought after development on the site of Walthamstow's iconic dog racing track. The access road follows the layout of the track itself and there's plenty of original architecture amongst the communal grounds, plus an on site gym and store.

As well as your private balcony overlooking the original Toteboard, you have access to the beautiful communal roof terrace. A great spot to enjoy the views and meet your new neighbours, a real community with an active residents' association and Facebook group.

If you lived here…

You'll be stretching out in over 700 square feet of living space in one of our wonderful borough's most legendary locales. First impressions are immediately impressive, with your spacious hallway providing plenty of incidental space and a welcome wealth of integrated storage. Your bathroom's immediately on your left, boutique-chic with recessed overhead lighting and a wall-filling mirror reflecting the floor to ceiling tiling.

At the other end of the hall's your living room/kitchen, topping out at around 250 square feet. Your kitchen sits on one corner, a subtle right angle of glossy battleship grey cabinets below chrome fittings and matching smoky grey countertops, all home to a full complement of integrated appliances. Blonde hardwood runs underfoot throughout, while patio doors and extra windows usher in light from the balcony, where you have lovely views of the grounds. Finally, each bedroom is a solid double, carpeted and bright.

Outside and whenever venturing forth from your legendary location there're plenty of bus routes right outside; the 357 and 34 will get you straight to Walthamstow Central in about ten minutes for the top of the Victoria line (just fifteen minutes to Kings Cross and you'll always get a seat) and twenty minute runs to Liverpool Street via the Overground. Plus, next door to the station you have the Empire Cinema, Walthamstow Mall and Europe's longest street market.

What else?

- Your new local is The Dog & Duck, less than half mile on foot with charming beach huts in the lovely, large beer garden.
- The landscaped gardens and open green spaces of Lloyd park are just a ten minute walk and home to cafes, courts, babbling brooks, an outdoor gym, regular farmers market and, of course, the famous William Morris Gallery.
- The lease is long enough not to cause you any renewal worries.

Storage X3

"I have absolutely loved living in this flat for the last 5 years. The huge open-plan living area and balcony are great for entertaining family and friends, as is showing off the communal roof terrace when the weather is nice!
Living on the iconic site of the old Walthamstow Dog Stadium has been brilliant and I love the features that have been retained on the development, including the amazing street sign. There's a real sense of community on the development too, with an active residents' association and Facebook group. It's a perfect location with two supermarkets and a gym on your doorstep, as well as easy access to Walthamstow, Highams Park and Chingford. So many nice outside spaces to explore nearby too, including the famous Walthamstow Wetlands."

There are some good local schools and just around the corner is a play area and there are great parks nearby such as Chase Lane Park & Memorial Park.

The property is nearby local bus routes which can connect you to Walthamstow Central which is serviced by the Victoria Line from where you are around 15 minutes to central London.

Forming part of the major development in the Leyton Orient Football Ground, this modern two bedroom apartment, located on the fourth floor has been tastefully redecorated throughout and is being sold with a long lease (over 100 years).

The property comprises; Two Double Bedrooms, Re-tiled En Suite to the Master, Family Bathroom also Re-tiled, open plan Living Room/Dining Room/Kitchen, private balcony overlooking the Football Ground and underground parking space & is available with no onward chain.
Full length windows augment the natural light throughout, with comfortably sized living accommodation offering the ideal first time purchase, or attractive rental investment.

The Location

Aside from being next to the green open spaces of Coronation Gardens, Bloomfield Court is located close by to a great range of local shops and amenities on the High Road, and transport links are excellent with Leyton Underground Station ( 0.8 miles ) only 1 underground train stop to Westfield shopping centre via Central Line.

Owners comments

“ This is a wonderful, spacious, bright flat which we have been very happy to call home for the last 7 years. It has beautiful balcony views over the Leyton rooftops and Leyton Orient pitch, perfect for al fresco dining. Leyton has a great atmosphere with lots of bars, cafes and restaurants on the high road, and nearby Francis road. Excellent transport links with the central line and overground nearby.
Coronation gardens on our doorstep is a fantastic green area for outdoor picnics and walks.
Leyton Orient fc right next door is an added bonus. We have become avid Orient fans.
Definitely worth viewing"

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A bright and pristine one bedroom house, intriguingly laid out over three floors of this eye catching designer development sat on communal grounds on the site of Walthamstow's famous Dog Track. You have almost 900 square feet of living space throughout, including a large, sheltered roof terrace.

The development's facilities are impressive, with on site gym and general store, as well as children's play areas in the communal grounds. Eye catching elements of the original architecture remain, and there's private parking spots available in the development at an added cost.

If you lived here…

You'll be enjoying an elegantly arranged suite of rooms in one of our borough's most iconic spots, bursting with natural light and inspired designer flourishes throughout. Step through your dedicated front door and you have a welcome wealth of integrated storage on the left, with your skylit 270 square foot lounge/kitchen on the right. The kitchen area is smartly decked out with glossy battleship grey cabinets sitting under a large skylight and home to a full range of integrated appliances.

Head into the substantial lounge and you have plenty of space for dining and relaxing, with blonde engineered flooring underfoot. A sparkling spare WC completes the ground floor. Upstairs your 180 square foot bedroom breaks off the hall, with angled floor to ceiling windows filling the space with light. Your bathroom's across the hallway, delectably appointed with designer fittings and large format tiling from floor to ceiling. Finally, head up your second skylit staircase for your 200 square foot roof terrace. A great little suntrap, surrounded by high timber fencing for privacy.

Outside, and beyond the iconic environs of your legendary site, you're surrounded by the open green spaces of Highams Park, Walthamstow and Chingford. The landscaped gardens of Lloyd Park are just a fifteen minute stroll, home to cafes, courts, an outdoor gym, thriving Saturday farmer's market and wide range of sports clubs and classes. Fitness fans are also exceptionally well served by the multi million pound sports facilities of the Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre, just a few minutes further and complete with Olympic swimming pool, state of the art gym, climbing wall, health suite, trampoline park and more.

What else?

- Ten minutes away on foot you have The Dog& Duck, a charmingly esoteric gastropub with a great line in sourdough pizzas and beach huts in the beer garden.
- With a lease of over 120 years, you'll have no renewal worries.
- Drivers can be on the North Circular in less than five minutes. Alternatively Highams Park overground is just fifteen minutes on foot and will get you straight to Walthamstow Central in six, or Liverpool Street in twenty seven.

A word from the owner...

"We fell in love with our house due to the sheer volume of space it affords as well as the copious amounts of natural light that pours in on all floors. We have spent many a summer's day relaxing on our privately fenced roof terrace, next to which we have set up an office space for when we're both working from home. We love the location and how well connected we are to Walthamstow and the Victoria Line, but it's the friendly and leafy
Highams Park where we spend most of our time - fabulous cafes, restaurants and the best wine bar in the country only a 15 minute walk away. We are also only a short walk away from the glorious expanses of Epping Forest."

title: 1 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A perfectly presented three bedroom, two bathroom Victorian terrace conversion, on a quiet turning just off Wood Street. Freshly developed to the rear and over three floors, and finished to a superb standard, this impressively generous family home needs nothing but new people to make it their own.

Everything here is immaculate, from the carefully repointed yellow brick frontage to the newly laid lawn to the rear. You have parquet style low-maintenance engineered flooring below, and fitted carpets to the stairs and bedrooms. Thoughtful vintage touches nod to the home's Victorian heritage and beautifully set off the elegant muted neutrals of the walls.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your hallway, admiring the exposed brick, and find your first reception on the left. It's almost 130 square foot with a large bay window to the front, parquet style flooring and striking green feature wood panel wall. Next along is your second reception of around the same size, with built-in shelves to either side of a handsome cast iron fireplace.

There's a spare WC to the right, a lifesaver on busy mornings, then you step down into your splendid kitchen. There's an abundance of smart wood fronted units, a double Neff oven, and polished stone worktops with matching backsplashes. The perfect space for cooking up a storm. Step out from here into your neat garden, with brand new paving and freshly laid lawn as well as raised beds ready for planting.

Back through the hallway you'll head upstairs, finding your main bathroom at the top. Fully tiled with contrasting patterns, it has a traditional white suite with freestanding rolltop tub. Your first bedroom overlooks the garden, and offers 100 square foot of space. Your second bedroom sits to the front, and has twin sash windows with an antique style radiator between them. There's over 145 square foot to spread out in here, and soft carpet underfoot.

Up into the loft you'll find your third bedroom, a substantial double of 135 square foot, with recessed lighting and skylights above and brand new carpet underfoot. A pocket door opens onto your en suite, fitted out with a dedicated corner shower cubicle and concealed cistern toilet. Immaculately tiled in metro white it's the perfect complement to the penthouse suite. There's eaves storage up here too.

Step out your front door and it's just seven minutes on foot to Wood Street for the Overground, which will take you to Liverpool Street across the marshes in twenty minutes, or just a one stop to Walthamstow Central for the Victoria line. Walthamstow Village is a twelve minute stroll away, with cycle-friendly streets filled with wonderful places to eat, drink and shop. A thirteen minute walk takes you to a beautiful part of Epping Forest, or it's a mile to Lloyd Park for lavishly landscaped gardens.

What else?

- Your friendly local garden centre Lancasters is close by whenever you need house plants for indoors or out, or when you want to treat yourself to some Japanese garden tools.
- Your new local is The Duke E17, where you can try your mind at the quiz or book The Cabin for a private party.
- Nearby schools rated 'Outstanding' by Ofsted include Greenleaf and Barclay Primary Schools, and Walthamstow School for Girls.

detailedDescription:
A smart and bright two bedroom family terrace, immaculately finished with plenty of character and developmental potential. Alongside a wealth of original features, you have a large, lush rear garden and a prime location on a leafy turning just off Chingford's thoroughfare of Old Church Road.

With the generous loft space so far unconverted, you have the potential to add your own whole new storey as some of your neighbours have done, ensuring that this property can meet your needs for years to come (subject to the usual permissions).

If you lived here…

You'll be stretching out in over 800 square feet of living space, most notably your 130 square foot lounge and separate, dedicated 140 square foot dining room, providing plenty of hosting options between them. Richly finished original timber floorboards run underfoot and both spaces are awash with natural light. Elsewhere your kitchen has a pleasant rustic feel with pastel splashbacks and on trend smoky terracotta style flooring underfoot.

Step out into your rear garden and you can delight in one of this property's many highlights; over thirty feet in length flanked by lush thriving beds and ending in a raised patio, secluded, perfect for barbecues and home to handy shed. Upstairs your bathroom's also a real show stopper, with a freestanding clawfoot tub, dedicated separate shower cubicle and a wealth of vintage fittings. Finally both bedrooms are substantial, handsomely appointed doubles.

Outside, the many and varied amenities of Chingford Mount are right on your doorstep, with all your day-to-day needs from shops and supermarkets to cafes and take-outs within easy reach. You're surrounded by open green spaces, with both Memorial Park and Chase Lane Park mere moments away, and even the wild expanse of Epping Forest within easy walking distance.

What else?

- There are five primary/secondary schools less than a mile away from your new home, all rated 'Good' by Ofsted.
- Highams Park station is fifteen minutes away by bus or bike, and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three. Alternatively just ride two stops and hop off at Walthamstow Central for a quick swap to the Victoria line.
- Chingford Leisure Centre is fifteen minutes on foot for a wide range of health and fitness facilities including gym, swimming pools and fitness studio.

Auction closing date is Monday 2nd August 2021 at 12pm Please note that this property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with Traditional auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer-friendly method of purchase. We do not require the buyer to exchange contracts immediately, but grant 28 days to achieve exchange of contracts from the date the buyer's solicitor is in receipt of the draft contracts and a further 28 days thereafter to complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 3.6% (inclusive of VAT) subject to a minimum of £6,000 (inclusive of VAT) which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to sign an Acknowledgment of Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Legal Pack which can be downloaded for free from the auction section of our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by Douglas Allen powered by iam-sold Ltd.

All dimensions are approximate and quoted for guidance only as are floor plans which are not to scale and their accuracy cannot be confirmed. Reference to appliances and/or services does not imply that they are necessarily in working order or fit for the purpose.

We are pleased to offer our customers a range of additional services to help them with moving home. None of these services are obligatory and you are free to use service providers of your choice. Miller Mews is a well crafted development of 4 apartments and 2 houses nestled within a private and gated garden space in Leyton E10.

Located within a few moments walk of the bustling shops and bars on Leyton High Road these apartments are also located only a 10 minute walk from Leyton underground station.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A magnificently mansionesque five bedroom, fully detached family home, set among huge gardens behind a substantial private driveway. Situated at the end of a peaceful no through road and backing onto nothing but The Truman Cricket Ground, you have rare rural tranquillity here, with Higham Park just moments away.

Highams Park overground station is an easy stroll away and will get you straight to Liverpool Street in just twenty seven minutes. Alternatively, ride two stops and five minutes for Walthamstow Central, and a quick swap to the Victoria line.

If you lived here…

You'll be one of just five plentifully spaced properties arranged around the end of this peaceful cul de sac on an enviable sweet spot between Chingford and Highams Park. Inside you have well over 2000 square feet of living space, artfully arranged across two extensive storeys, including a substantial double garage amid immaculately landscaped, wrap around, entirely secluded gardens and expansive driveway.

Design & Decor is sleek and modern throughout, with your 290 square foot through lounge being a prime example. Rich dark hardwood runs underfoot, walls are finished in soft dove grey and there's an imposing Portuguese sandstone fireplace taking centre stage. It's all awash with natural light, with the large bay window framing leafy green views to the front and French door opening up to your impressive gardens at the rear.

Elsewhere there's a dedicated dining room between your lounge and substantial kitchen, itself also offering room for dining and smartly decked out in solid oak cabinets with plenty of workspace and home to Sub-Zero & Wolf, Miele and Fisher & Paykel appliances, including a wine fridge. Step out from here onto your curvaceous sheltered patio, ideal for garden parties or dining al fresco overlooking your vast expanse of lawn. It really is impossible to overstate how impressive your outside space is, by London standards or anywhere else.

Back inside and the ground floor's finished off by a dedicated study, indispensable utility room and spare WC, a life saver on busy mornings. Upstairs and you have a wonderful array of bedrooms and bathrooms. The master to the front is a superb example, vaulted ceilings, a Dormer window and a feast of floor to ceiling fitted storage. It all comes in at over 250 square feet, including the boutique en suite, with walk-in rainfall shower and, as in all your bathrooms, fully tiled in floor to ceiling porcelain.

There's a second substantial double bedroom to the rear, cosily carpeted with a striking statement wall and totalling more than 250 square feet with its own delectable en suite; this is a rare property with two masters. Your remaining bedrooms are all solid doubles, finished in a variety of polished, characterful styles while finally your family bathroom is handsomely equipped with an embedded rainfall shower over the tub.

What else?

- Local schools are plentiful and excellent. In a one mile radius alone you have fifteen primary/secondaries rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.
- As noted, with both a double garage and extensive driveway you have plentiful private parking. Drivers can be on the North Circular in less than ten minutes.
- You'll never want for open green spaces with both Epping Forest and The Highams Park close at hand. The latter is home to the Highams Park lake, created at the turn of the century by legendary landscape gardener Humphry Repton, and more recently made famous by Blue Peter.

The area has everything you could want from shopping facilities, train links into the city to walks in the forest. The house offers the best of both worlds being so centrally located but at the same time offering a peaceful retreat being located in a quite cul d sac with an unoverlooked rear garden together with the added benifit of ample parking from the two driveways. It really has been a wonderful family home and we are sure the next owners will enjoy the house as much as we have."

detailedDescription:
This is a rare opportunity to acquire an outstanding home in this wonderful position in Walthamstow. Beyond the attractive exterior of this period property you will find substantial accommodation that truly does need to be seen to be appreciated. The ground floor houses a lounge/sitting room and a kitchen which is crying out for extension and has doors opening on to the charming rear garden, perfect for those summer BBQ’s and evening cocktails . On the first floor you'll find the family bathroom and two good sized bedrooms with the second floor comprising two more bedrooms and a further shower room. Throughout, this home feels modern, spacious and bright.

Ideally located on the edge of the ever popular walthamstow village area giving fantastic access to the vast array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and places of historical interest the Village has to offer. Within easy reach of Walthamstow Central offering the Victoria Line, Overground to Liverpool street plus many bus routes.

address: Grosvenor Park Road, Walthamstow, London E17
detailedDescription:
This has been designed by a local interior designer and the results are incredible! It already measures out at 1460 Square feet (135 square meters) and also has planning permission to extend in to the loft. The frontage has been completely restored by cleaning the original brick façade, restoring the original sash windows and recreating the Victorian pathway. As you walk in to the hallway the first thing that you notice is the extra width with how much brighter it is than a standard Victorian house courtesy of the huge sash window on the landing. The large through lounge to the front has Victorian style radiators, stripped wooded flooring, original doors, covings, cornices and two stunning fireplaces. You then move on to the large open plan kitchen/diner that has three large skylights and stunning crittall style doors to the rear bringing the 80ft x 55ft garden into the house. The fitted kitchen has integrated appliances, marble work surfaces and the finish quality is just exceptional. There is a ground floor cloakroom and the current vendors have also created a separate utility room.

On the first floor there is a huge master bedroom to the front with exposed wooden flooring, an original fireplace and a large bay window. Just behind is the second double bedroom which has original stripped wooden floors and an original fireplace. Further down the hallway, you’ll find the third double bedroom, a stunning family bathroom with a free standing bath, separate walk in shower and double height ceilings with skylights, as well as access to the loft, that also has planning permission for extension. To the rear is an unoverlooked South facing garden which measures out at around 80ft x 50ft, has a large patio area and side access which is great if you have bikes and the current vendors have created off street parking to the front.

Grosvenor Park Road is located in the heart of the Walthamstow Village Conservation area and is one of the most sought after streets in the area. Walthamstow Central station is around a quarter of a mile away giving easy access to the Victoria Line and the overground will get you in to London Liverpool Street in around 30 minutes. The bustling Orford Road being just minutes away with its variety of bars and restaurants and the great pubs and cafes on the surrounding roads. School catchment areas are great with Henry Maynard, St. Marys and Barclay primary schools being close by, which makes this a great family home.

This one really must be seen to be fully appreciated as the finish quality and interior styling is just exceptional.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
This spacious, two bedroom ground floor conversion flat has been modernised throughout to a high standard but has still managed to retain its Victorian feel. Benefits include: A charming bay fronted lounge with a cast iron fireplace, a stylish fitted kitchen with stripped wood flooring opening out on to the sole use courtyard.

Eldon Road is set in the ever popular Central Walthamstow area, providing a fantastic location for all the great local amenities such as Walthamstow's famous open air market and the Empire Cinema, restaurants and the shops of Walthamstow Mall. With Walthamstow Central Station a 10 minute walk away commuting in to Central London and The West End is just 20 minutes on the Victoria Line Tube or Overground trains. Walthamstow Village is nearby and home to a variety of trendy restaurants, cafes and shops making this the perfect destination.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a beautifully presented ground floor Warner flat with large proportions moments from Lea Bridge Road Overground.

This property is extremely well located for transport links, Lea Bridge Road Station is a short walk and offers a five-minute journey to Tottenham Hale (Victoria Line) and Stratford (Central Line) Stations, as well as 28 minutes to Liverpool Street Station. Buses to Hackney and Central London are outside. The green open spaces of Jubilee Park, Hackney Marshes and Walthamstow Wetlands are all a short walk away.

This Warner flat is in excellent condition and has been stylishly decorated. There is a spacious and light sitting room to the rear of the flat, which overlooks a lovely 30ft South/East facing shared garden. The garden has a decked area, perfect for alfresco dining and a lawn. There are original wooden floorboards throughout the flat and high ceilings that add a sense of grandeur. There are two lovely double bedrooms and a gally kitchen with lots of storage and preparation space. The bathroom is modern with monochrome decor and is generous in size.
Out and about

Chatsworth Road - A short walk across Hackney marshes, Chatsworth Road has an abundance of cafes, pubs, restaurants and a fantastic Sunday market.
Hare and Hounds - lovely pub with great burgers, live music, comedy and an all-weather beer garden.
Leyton Jubilee Park - Great facilities for sports and recreation and a natural meadow during the summer. Grab a coffee from the cafe or an ice lolly on a hot summer’s day.
Turning Earth E10 - Artist led space running ceramics courses and studios for ceramicists.
Walthamstow Market - Europe's largest street market. The place to pick up a bargain!
Walthamstow Wetlands Nature Reserve - Area of protected wetlands, great for a walk and to visit the Engine House Cafe.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A smart and sleek two double bedroom apartment with a garden and cellar on the ground floor of a Victorian terrace. Here the shops and amenities of Lea Bridge Road are on your doorstep, Leyton Midland Road overground station's just half a mile away, plus there are plenty of nearby green spaces to explore.

Alk whenever you fancy relaxing in nature. Elsewhere, Walthamstow High Street is an eighteen minute walk, seven minute cycle or quick hop on a bus from Hoe Street, for a huge range of shops and cafes. Here's also where you'll find Walthamstow Central Station for direct, twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus and Liverpool Street.

If you lived here...

You'll be relaxing in your ninety five square foot lounge with flawless engineered hardwood underfoot, walls attired in luxury wallpaper and plenty of space for dining. Next door and your kitchen comes in a white suite of cabinets, smoke grey tiling to head height and garden access. Step out here for your rear garden – it's a gorgeous blend of pristine patio and lawn plus a canopy of foliage. With high fences for privacy it's ideal for al fresco entertaining.

Head back inside and the bathroom's an immaculate space resplendent in more of that grey tiling with a shower over the tub and mirrored cabinet. Your master bedroom's a very generous 145 square feet enjoying a classic bay window and vintage ceiling moulding overhead, while bedroom two's 110 square feet and home to a luxury wallpaper statement wall. Lastly, the cellar's 130 square feet and suitable for storage or conversion, as you wish.

Outside, head towards Leyton Midland Road station to land at our latest local addition, the Gravity Well Taproom, in ten minutes. Serving up craft beer bar with both inside and outdoor tables as well as mezzanine seating, it's sure to become a favourite. Francis Road's a genuinely treasured destination and just fifteen minutes' walk or a four minute cycle away. It's bursting with independent offerings vying for your attention including the brand new Morny Bakehouse, an incredible modern Viennoiserie from Sophie and Natalie. You'll find milk chocolate laced cruffins, cheesecake brownies, coconut lamingtons and nutella honeycomb doughnuts tempting your tastebuds here.

What else?

- You have a wealth of fine schools nearby; there are twenty eight within a one mile radius rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted, eight of which are deemed 'Outstanding'.
- Fancy a swim or some tlc? Leyton Leisure Centre is just seven minutes away on foot, with two pools, a water slide, gym, sauna and a health suite.
- The 69 and 97 buses run from outside the Leyton Midland station to speed you to Leyton underground station for the Central line every five minutes. From here you'll be at Stratford in two minutes and Liverpool Street in eleven.

Like much of East London, Leyton has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 12 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in 20.

With the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park just across the A12 you have all manner of shops and amenities within easy reach.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. Placed in something of a sweet spot between location and affordability, there are still bargains to be had.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £300,000-£335,000. Conveniently located just 0.4 miles from Leyton Underground station, this bright and freshly decorated one bedroom, first floor flat would make a superb home for a single professional or a couple. Completely ready to move into with all essential appliances, this spacious property also offers immediate access to the thriving Leyton High Road.

Guide Price £300,000-£335,000. Conveniently located just 0.4 miles from Leyton Underground station, this bright and freshly decorated one bedroom, first floor flat would make a superb home for a single professional or a couple. Completely ready to move into with all essential appliances, this spacious property also offers immediate access to the thriving Leyton High Road.

As you approach the property, you'll note the attractive architecture and small walled front yard, with its black and white tiled walkway that leads to the external green door – shared with your downstairs neighbour. As you enter, your private, secure front door lies directly in front of you, leading straight to the carpeted stairs that take you up to the property itself.

At the top, you'll note the neutral stair carpet continues throughout the hallway, and straight up ahead you'll find the generously sized kitchen – a super-bright space thanks to the large dual-aspect windows that flood the room in natural light. This fully fitted kitchen benefits from a fantastically functional layout with a wide range of base and wall units, plus an oven, gas hob, extractor fan, integrated fridge and slim-line dishwasher, washer/dryer plus separate freezer. The easy-to-clean vinyl flooring in grey offsets the white units and worktops perfectly, and there's also plenty of space for a dining table and chairs. There are some signs of wear on some of the cupboard door trims, but overall it's in great condition and is ready to go without the additional expense of buying your white goods.

Back into the hallway and on your right is the comfortably sized and well laid-out bathroom. Fitted with a white suite with WC, sink and bath with overhead shower and screen, this fully tiled bathroom is light and neutral in keeping with the rest of the property. It features a handy shelf extension from the bath for all your toiletries, a towel rail over the radiator and even room for a storage unit to help keep this neat space nice and uncluttered.

As you exit the bathroom and head back down the hallway towards the front of the property, an additional small flight of steps leads you to your bedroom on the right. The large window ensures the brilliant light quality continues in this room, and there's enough space to accommodate for a comfy double bed, bedside tables and a wardrobe or hanging rail. You could even add a small dressing table to the wall underneath or opposite the window depending on your chosen configuration
.
Out in the hallway you'll also notice that there's space here for an additional drawer or storage unit, giving you further options to free up space in the bedroom.

At the end of the hallway, lying to the front of the flat, you'll find the fantastic reception room – a space that's so bright, attractive and roomy that it's completely made for living your best life! The engineered wooden flooring creates a sense of character and warmth against the freshly painted neutral walls, and the vast bay window overlooking the street completely bathes the room in brightness – you may even want to place a desk or small table here to make the most of the rays on those warmer days. This gorgeous living room is big enough to hold a large suite, coffee table, all your entertainments and even a display unit... So many possibilities to put your personal stamp on this space. It also features built-in shelving to the alcoves either side of the chimney breast, for your books, media, plants and ornaments.

This spacious and airy one bedroom flat offers double glazing and central heating throughout and is in the ideal area for commuters thanks to its close proximity to the local tube station and array of bus routes.

Lying right off Leyton High Road, this first floor flat is also ideal for those who want to experience the friendly, bustling community of this popular locale. For your day-to-day needs, there's a Tesco Metro close by, a range of takeaways, bars, pubs, cafes and restaurants specialising in a range of cuisines. In the wider (but still local) vicinity, you have larger supermarkets, a Post Office, gym and the beautiful natural expanses of both Wanstead Flats and Hackney Marshes.

Owners Comments...
A bright and airy end-of-terrace flat with a spacious kitchen and living room. We loved living here and are selling as we now live overseas. It was an excellent home for us as a young(ish!) couple living in London. It's a five minute walk from the lovely community of Francis Road with lots of independent shops, cafes, a wine store,
yoga studio and excellent hairdresser. The area has a nice community feel and active Facebook group. Our favourite places for food and coffee nearby are Marmelo and Deeney's. Situated by Leyton High Road with everything you need on your doorstep: Short walk to the tube, food shops, local park etc. The Leyton Technical and Northcote Arms are great local pubs'.

detailedDescription:
Two bedroom apartment:</b> This spacious two bedroom property is a real cracker! The property has a large lounge, spacious kitchen and two good sized bedrooms. It is located within walking distance of Wood Street Station (London Overground).

<b>The Property </b>

The apartment is located on the second floor of a purpose built development and offers two double bedrooms and a large reception room. The fully fitted separate kitchen has plenty of cupboard and worktop space.

This purpose built three stroey block which is very well maintained and is within walking distance of wood street station. This property will make a great first time purchase or buy to let investment.

<b>The Location </b>

The transport links are superb, minutes away is Wood Street Station with fast links into Liverpool Street. There is easy access to the Victoria Line at Walthamstow Central.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully brick fronted three bedroom family terrace, artfully developed over three floors with twin bathrooms and a lush, thriving rear garden bursting with greenery. Inside, Design & Decor is an elegant blend of vintage features and contemporary design, all located in Blackhorse Village.

Part pedestrianised and cycle friendly, the original Warner Estate of Blackhorse Village has benefited from Waltham Forest's latest urban/rural project and is an increasingly sought after location. The transport links of Blackhorse Road station are just five minutes' walk.

If you lived here…

You'll be nicely set back from your peaceful, residential street behind a front yard and hedge for extra privacy. Inside, your hallway's immediately welcoming, with stained glass in the front door and blonde engineered hardwood flowing underfoot and into your 145 square foot reception, full of natural light and sporting a period tiled ebony hearth. Next door your kitchen/diner has large format cream letterbox tiling underfoot and a sunny suite of cream countertops beneath a triple set framing a leafy garden view.

Step into your garden and you have a handsome spacious deck giving way to an endlessly explorable lush length of lawn, fifty foot long, bursting with thriving, mature greenery and ending in a handy shed. Back inside, and your first floor bedrooms are both substantial doubles, of around 100 and 140 square feet respectively and finished in the same sunny, tranquil style as the rest of this property. Your spacious family bathroom features both a curvaceous tub and dedicated rainfall shower cubicle, while upstairs, you have the skylit, dual aspect third bedroom and accompanying en suite.

Outside and, as noted, you're just five minutes from Blackhorse Road station, which will whisk you directly to Kings Cross in less than fifteen minutes via the Victoria line. Being practically right at the top of the line here means you'll always get a seat. Alternatively, it's less than a half mile on foot to St James Street overground, with direct twenty minute runs to Liverpool Street. Here's also where you'll find our burgeoning hub of entrepreneurs at crate St James, home to a diverse range of independent offerings, from handmade burger joints to artisanal cafes to yoga studios.

What else?

- Upper Blackhorse Lane, fast finding fame as the 'Walthamstow Beer Mile' and home to a number of taprooms and craft breweries including the vast Truman's Social Club and its colossal beer garden, is less than ten minutes' walk.
- Parents will be pleased to know you have eighteen primary/secondaries, all rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted, less than a mile away on foot.
- London's largest nature reserve, the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands, is just a half mile on foot anytime you want to lose yourself in the blue and green wilderness.

Here, I found a community of welcome and kindness. In a busy area, it’s 20 minutes by tube to Oxford Circus and minutes from refuge at the Wetlands and Walthamstow Marshes. The area has everything from transport, schools and shopping, to diverse leisure and restaurants and a community which is welcoming and supportive.

It has given me the best years of happiness and safety that I could have dreamed of.

When you come to live at no 29, you won’t just be living in a house, you will be home!"

detailedDescription:
A gorgeously appointed one double bedroom, ground floor end of terrace apartment filled with glorious designer flourishes perfectly in keeping with its fine Victorian heritage. You have a dedicated front door, shared courtyard garden to the rear, private courtyard space at the front and your very own secured off-road parking space.

Outside and the independent cafes, bars and restaurants of Hoe Street are just one minute around the corner. If pizza's your thing be sure to wrap your taste buds around the best sourdough pizzas in the area at SoDo on Hatherley Mews, or sample the delicious 180 second offerings of Fireaway Pizza's 400C fire oven.

If you lived here

You'll be welcoming friends and family into your generous 180 square foot lounge with twin windows overlooking your own private courtyard, delectable chevron timber floorboards running underfoot and on trend light Sacramento green walls. Continue under the arch, a lovely touch, and your kitchen comes in chessboard flooring, gleaming white metro tiles and open shelving. Across the hallway past a handy nook ideal for home working and the bathroom's beautifully attired in white with a raised double length shower and vintage patterned flooring.

Your bedroom's another substantial space of 140 square feet with an on trend feature wall, this time in Aegean blue, and built-in storage. Lovely. Open the French doors and head up the stairs here for the courtyard garden, a mix of pristine patio and raised beds shared with the residents of two other apartments. It's a friendly community here with its own Whatsapp and Facebook groups and residents' events. Lastly, it's worth nothing that a long lease means you won't have any renewal worries.

Walthamstow Central station is a mere six minutes away on foot, for direct twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus via the speedy Victoria line and Liverpool Street via the Overground. Head a few minutes in the other direction for the leafy environs of Walthamstow Village and its huge choice of high end wining and dining establishments. Every taste is catered for on these peaceful streets, from classic foodie pubs, to craft breweries, tapas restaurants and wine bars.

What else?

- Lloyd Park is six minutes away (cut across Jewel Road) and home to landscaped gardens, brooks, cafes, courts, outdoor gym and skatepark. It also plays host to sports clubs and classes including the ever-popular Yoga Me Happy.
- Just two minutes from you is East of Eden, offering yoga and reformer pilates whenever you need to do some serious stretching.
- For live entertainment you can't beat the much-loved Ye Olde Rose & Crown Theatre Pub, popular with acts trying out their shows before heading to the Edinburgh Fringe. Plus the legendary Soho Theatre will soon be opening a new 1000 seat venue in our Art Deco former cinema, just around the corner.

Courtyard

A word from the owners..."We've lived in our beautiful property for three years having moved up from Islington to Walthamstow and have loved making our home here. 15B has been perfect for the two of us and we'll really miss the luxury of having two outside spaces (a rareity for London!) to choose from. The flat is ideally located for all the best things Walthamstow has to offer. We are less than 5 minutes from the Victoria Line and Walthamstow Central's manifold bus routes, a short walk to the stunning Lloyd Park and the many independent and artisanal shops in the. Village. Our local haunts include the fabulous Rose and Crown Pub, Sodo (thirty seconds away!) and the Empire Cinema. We also love the new Sunday Social (farmer's market) on the High Street which has become a staple of our weekends and are excited about the prospect of Soho Theatre opening around the corner. We also love the community here, we have developed friendships with our immediate neighbours who are always on hand when we need something. Living on the corner of Cleveland Park Avenue (many times winner of London in Bloom) we also enjoy belonging to their Community Resident's Association and especially look forward to the street parties held. We're very sad to moving out but are looking for more space to grow our family and we will only be moving around the corner!"

Please note that this property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with Traditional auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer-friendly method of purchase. We do not require the buyer to exchange contracts immediately, but grant 28 days to achieve exchange of contracts from the date the buyer's solicitor is in receipt of the draft contracts and a further 28 days thereafter to complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 3.6% (inclusive of VAT) subject to a minimum of £6,000 (inclusive of VAT) which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to sign an Acknowledgment of Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Legal Pack which can be downloaded for free from the auction section of our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by Douglas Allen powered by iam-sold Ltd.

The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. All interested parties must verify accuracy and your solicitor must verify tenure/lease information, fixtures & fittings and, where the property has been extended/converted, planning/building regulation consents. All dimensions are approximate and quoted for guidance only as are floor plans which are not to scale and their accuracy cannot be confirmed. Reference to appliances and/or services does not imply that they are necessarily in working order or fit for the purpose.

We are pleased to offer our customers a range of additional services to help them with moving home. None of these services are obligatory and you are free to use service providers of your choice. Current regulations require all estate agents to inform their customers of the fees they earn for recommending third party services. If you choose to use a service provider recommended by Douglas Allen, details of all referral fees can be found at the link below. If you decide to use any of our services, please be assured that this will not increase the fees you pay to our service providers, which remain as quoted directly to you.

detailedDescription:
An elegantly appointed and artfully arranged two bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a handsome, low rise development mere moments from the heart of Walthamstow Village. You have dual sheltered patios, generous bedrooms, twin bathrooms and a strikingly spacious, open plan kitchen and reception room.

Your location is every bit as special as the Design & Decor, not only is Walthamstow Village on your doorstep but you have Walthamstow Central station, Lloyd Park, Wood Street and Epping Forest all also within easy reach.

If you lived here…

You'll be stretching out in a rare amount of space for such a well-located apartment, almost 750 square feet in all, starting with a generous entryway with a welcome wealth of fitted storage and plenty of incidental space. The undoubted highlight is on your right, your satisfyingly vast reception room and kitchen, coming in at over 250 square feet there's a wealth of space for hosting, cooking and relaxation alike. Natural light floods in from the floor to ceiling windows leading out onto your first patio.

You have suspended lighting overhead, and blonde hardwood underfoot giving way to large format quartz effect flooring in the kitchen, where you'll also find a generous suite of cream fitted cabinets home to a full range of integrated appliances. Elsewhere, your family bathroom is tiled from floor to ceiling, with an oversized mirror accentuating the sense of space. Both bedrooms are bright substantial doubles, with the master featuring its own sheltered patio and a sparkling en suite shower room.

Outside, and whilst having Walthamstow Village's huge range of bars, restaurants and gastropubs barely five minutes away on foot is the undoubted highlight of your enviable location, don't overlook our borough's other nearby gems. Our exciting new neighbourhood of Wood Street is just as handy, and the overground station will whisk you to Liverpool Street in twenty minutes. Or if you fancy getting back to nature, the wild wide open blue and green spaces of Epping Forest and Hollow Ponds are just a half mile on foot.

What else?

- Walthamstow Central station, with a wealth of bus routes, overground trains and the tube, is just a ten minute walk away. We're at the top of the Victoria line here so you'll always get a seat when heading to Kings Cross or Oxford Circus.
- The lease is long enough not to cause you any renewal worries.
- You're spoilt for choice when it comes to a new local, but be sure to check out the esoteric environs of The Nags Head, with delicious food, real ales, cosy fires and friendly cats. All just around the corner.

"We’re the first people to have lived in this flat and have loved our five years here. The location is amazing; we’re a two minute walk to three breweries and God’s Own Junkyard and a five minute walk to the pubs, restaurants and shops on Orford Road. We’re also a six minute walk to Wood Street which has a great community vibe and loads of excellent independent cafes and shops and the overground to Liverpool Street. We have a wealth of wonderful green space around being a 20 min walk from Epping Forest in one direction and Lloyd Park in the other.

The flat itself has been perfect for us; it’s a generous size and having two bathrooms has been a real plus, especially when we have guests to stay. The off street parking bay is really handy too. The balconies get loads of sunshine in the morning so we’ve enjoyed weekend morning coffees on them in the summer. We have a Facebook and WhatsApp group with our neighbours to share news, take in each other’s parcels and the like which is great. We’re really sad to leave the block but as we’ve just had a baby the time is right for us to upsize."

detailedDescription:
Viewings Saturday 17th July - By Appointment Only

This is a stylish three bedroom detached house overlooking the picturesque Leyton County Cricket Club.

The property is situated on a tree lined street moments from Leyton Midland Station. The overground has connections with the Victoria line, or for central line trains Leyton Underground Station is a fifteen-minute walk.

There is a wide and welcoming hallway leading to a generously sized sitting room with a feature bay window, exposed brick fireplace and original floorboards. This is a cosy space, perfect for relaxing. The kitchen is open, spacious and light with lots of windows, trendy vinyl flooring and industrial light fittings. There is ample space for a dining table, making this a perfect family home. To the rear of the property there is a large dual aspect utility room with lots of storage and double doors that open onto an impressive mature 80ft private garden with a decked area, perfect for barbecues and alfresco dining.

Upstairs on the first floor there is a large landing, two double bedrooms and a bathroom. The front bedroom has stunning views of the Cricket grounds and both rooms have feature fireplaces and stylish decor. There is a large family bathroom with a bath and shower, metro tiling and rustic wood bath panels.

The loft has been developed by the current owners to an exceptionally high standard. There is a master bedroom with high ceilings and large windows with views of the garden. There is also a second bathroom with walk-in shower and a designated office space with extra storage. There are lots of skylights letting in natural light onto the landings and stairwells.

This is a lovely house perfect for families and with scope for a great side return extension STPP.
Out and about

Brewster Road Park - perfect children's play park at the end of the street.
Leyton Boundary Community Garden - community led garden every Sunday. Great place to meet and hang out.
Perky Blenders Project 660 – Excellent independent coffee shop.
Yardarm - Trendy Winery, Bar and Restaurant.
Green East - Indoor plants galore.
Bread and Oregano - Great Greek Cafe serving delicious Gyros.
Marmelo Kitchen - Fantastic restaurant on Francis Road.
Deeney's - Unique Cafe serving great coffee and Scottish inspired toasties.
Leyton Cricket Pavilion - Grade II listed Victorian Cricket Pavilion with cricket grounds.
Sainsbury’s – 5 minute walk away.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to be able to offer, as part of this established, attractive looking complex, a very rarely available top floor flat including 2 fantastic sized bedrooms, bright and spacious lounge and dining area, gas central heating and double glazing, entryphone system, an immaculate presented shower room/wc along with a fabulously designed contemporary kitchen to a very high specification!
The apartment also benefits from beautifully presented communal gardens, a very long lease, as well has a really useful garage at the rear! This desirable residential tree lined avenue is just a few minutes walk from the heart of Highams Park Village and train station, and is also within walking distance to local schools and amenities.

Communal Entrance
The entrance is accessed via a flagstone pathway leading up to a the main communal door with entryphone system. Stairs lead to first and second floor flats.

2nd Floor Landing

Entrance Lobby
From the 2nd floor landing the entrance to the flat opens up to a lobby area with an automatic ceiling light providing instant light. To one side there are two storage cupboards, and double doors open up to:

Lounge Dining Room (18' 05" x 17' 07" or 5.61m x 5.36m)
Double oak doors open up to a spacious living dining area with a large double glazed replacement window to the front elevation and an outlook over communal gardens and Castle Avenue beyond! Double radiator beneath, bespoke custom fitted mahogany bookcase, real wood flooring, ceiling downlighters and plenty of power points.

Kitchen (6' 04" x 14' 02" or 1.93m x 4.32m)
A stunningly stylish custom fitted kitchen finished off with polished stone worksurface and comprising wall and base units, floor to ceiling cupboards and integrated appliances including washing machine and dishwasher, cupboard housing boiler and meters, inset double bowl sink with mixer tap, space for Range 5 burner gas oven, canopy extractor fan above, space for fridge/freezer, part tiled surrounds, ceiling downlighters and ample power points and real wood flooring. Double glazed replacement window to the side elevation.

With real wood flooring and doors leading to each bedroom and bathroom off.

Outside
The property is set back from Castle Avenue and enjoys well kept communal gardens with flower and shrub borders, and mature trees adding privacy to the development. To one side is a driveway leading to a garage en bloc.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful rosy red brick fronted three bedroom Victorian terrace, enviably sat at the edge of Walthamstow Village. On a quiet turning and with period charm perfectly complemented by a simple modern aesthetic, this is a warm and welcoming family home ready to be lived in and loved by new people.

You're moments from the Village here, with its picturesque and peaceful streets, splendid pubs and super independent shops. Thirteen minutes on foot and you're exploring Epping Forest, with row boats available to hire on Hollow Ponds. Wherever you wander, you might easily forget you're within half an hour of Central London.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your hallway and turn left into your double reception. It's a bright space of over 275 square foot, with a large bay window to the front and exposed original boards underfoot. Built-in shelving and cupboards sit in alcoves and there's cornicing to the ceiling. To the rear you'll find your 115 square foot kitchen, with country style units, twin windows, and red tiling underfoot. Step out from here into your charming garden, with a neat lawn bookended by paving areas.

Back through to your hallway, you'll walk upstairs to find your three bedrooms and bathroom. Your first bedroom overlooks the garden and offers around 100 square foot of space, with soft carpet underfoot. Next is your bathroom, part tiled in metro white. There's a modern white suite, vanity sink, and rainfall shower over the tub. Also overlooking the garden, bedroom two is over 100 square foot, with bespoke wardrobe to one alcove. Your main bedroom gives you a generous 190 square foot to relax in. There's a bay window here too plus secondary sash, for maximum natural light.

It's a pleasant fourteen minute stroll through the Village to Walthamstow Central, where you can jump on a Victoria Line train to Kings Cross or an Overground to Liverpool Street, both journeys taking around a quarter of an hour. Keep going to the high street and you'll find everything from the famous street market to big supermarkets and the Walthamstow Mall. Or head the other way to Wood Street with its wonderful indoor market, just six minutes from you on foot.

What else?

- There's lots of great schools nearby, with such as Walthamstow School for Girls, Barclay Primary and Whitefield among those rated 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.
- Your new local is The Nag's Head, a brilliantly eccentric pub with possibly the best beer garden in town.
- You're just around the corner from Arte e Pasta, sister restaurant of Wanstead's beloved Bombetta, serving sumptuous sharing plates under artworks curated by Wood Street Walls.

A word from the owner....

"This has been a family home for 19 years, where I watched my daughter grow, cook in the kitchen, play with a hose in the garden and proudly bring her friends round for a sleep reminds me of family. Old Victorian houses are just built for the test of time, warm and cosy in the winter with a nice fire and cool and airy in the summer. Breakfasts in the garden, watching the bamboo sway in a summer breeze with tropical bananas! We have always felt secure and nurtured in 'our street'. The schools are all local and the travel links good. Shops have grown in the locality. I miss my home, however move on hoping a family will love it was much as us."

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A splendid three bedroom end terrace home on a quiet turning in the heart of Highams Park, lovingly and fully refurbished by the present owners. With a wealth of practical and wow-factor features including a skylit kitchen/diner, this is a fantastic family home ready for new people to make their own.

Extended to the rear just three years ago, the property still retains a huge south facing rear garden with so much space for playing, pottering and entertaining. There's also shared side access, on street parking and a generous paved front garden. Epping Forest and Highams Park are both under fifteen minutes' walk away whenever you need to lose yourself in nature.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your large hallway, see the open staircase ahead, and turn right into your front reception. It's over 160 square foot of serene space with a large bay window, and blond engineered flooring underfoot. Your second reception is next along, another 130 square foot of flexible space. Through here you'll find your kitchen diner, a superb 140 square foot space with integrated dishwasher, fan oven and gas hob. Warm wood worktops set off glossy dove grey units, and Velux skylights illuminate from above. Step out through aluminium bifold doors onto your limestone patio, and take in your spectacular garden.

Back through your second reception you'll notice the downstairs WC tucked away in the hall, then head upstairs. Your bathroom is first at the top, with modern white suite including vanity sink, and shower over the tub. Outsize grey tiling fills two walls. Your first bedroom of 130 square foot sits to the rear, with soft grey carpet underfoot and a bespoke wardrobe to one alcove. To the front you'll find your main bedroom, 145 square foot with another grand bay window and a cast iron fireplace. Lastly there's bedroom three, ideal as a nursery or office.

You're around ten minutes on foot from Highams Park station, from where you can be at Walthamstow Central for the Victoria Line in as little as five minutes, or at Liverpool Street in twenty five, with trains every quarter of an hour. If you're staying local all your amenities are close at hand. You're near to the North Circular here too, so if you're driving you'll find it very handy. Plus it's a three minute walk to the bus stop, putting Walthamstow and Woodford within easy reach.

What else?

- There's a great choice of schools nearby rated 'Outstanding' or 'Good', including Woodside Primary Academy, and Oakhill Primary.
- Your new local is The Dog & Duck, where you can tuck into a fresh sourdough pizza in a delightful beer garden beach hut.
- For any tiny family members, the Magic Roundabout Nursery is just eight minutes' walk away.

Not only have we enjoyed living in the house but having a large garden has been an added bonus. Lots of space for our son to run free!

The property is in a good location, and we get best of both worlds, with Highams Park and Epping Forest a 10 - 15 minutes’ walk away. It is also not far from Walthamstow Central, with good travel connections.

The property is local to some fantastic schools, both Primary & Secondary.

We hope whoever lives here after us, builds some amazing memories, like we have as a family."

Highly sought after three bedroom victorian terraced house close to highams park station and local school.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website

Located off Winchester Road, within a short walk to Higham's Park mainline station and an array of shops and eateries as well as a large Tesco, this property is well located and on the road for the sought after Selwyn Primary School as well as easy road access to the A406 and M11.

The property is a brick fronted Victorian terraced house offering good size accommodation with great potential to re organise the layout and extend into the loft space.

Commencing with the entrance hallway with stairs to first floor, there is is a separate lounge to front with bay window, exposed floorboards and Victorian style feature fireplace, opening onto the rear reception room with usable Victorian style fireplace and exposed floorboards.

The fitted kitchen has an integrated sink and oven and hob with floorboards. Leading off is a lobby with access to the rear garden and a door into the spacious ground floor bathroom with tiling to walls and floor.

The first floor landing has loft access and doors to the large master bedroom with exposed floorboards, a second double bedroom with Victorian style fireplace, fitted cupboard and exposed floorboards. The third bedroom is a good size with exposed floorboards and cupboard housing boiler and water tank.

Externally the Southerly facing lawned garden has flower beds, patio and a Summer House with power offering a great garden room or home office.

Beautifully presented throughout and a real credit to the current owners this is a property is not to be missed and viewings are highly recommended.

Walthamstow's Town Centre is a stone throw away where you can find excellent cafes, restaurants, The Mall shopping centre, Empire Cinema and Walthamstow's famous street market. Also, the popular Lloyd Park, William Morris Gallery, bell corner and Walthamstow Village all within easy walking distance from the property.
