title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This three bedroom mid terrace Victorian family home offers a practical layout and ample living accommodation. Further benefits to the property include two bathrooms, a ground floor rear extension, two reception rooms and is strategically located within close proximity to Blackhorse Road station.

This three bedroom mid terrace Victorian family home offers a practical layout and ample living accommodation. Further benefits to the property include two bathrooms, a ground floor rear extension, two reception rooms and is strategically located within close proximity to Blackhorse Road station.

The ground floor of the property comprises of a spacious reception room that leads into the dinning room located next to the modernized fully fitted galley kitchen including integrated appliances. There is an abundance of potential to unearth with the property and should you wish to have a more open feel, you are able to open the kitchen up into the dining area creating the perfect space to have an open planed kitchen and dining room.

To the rear of the property is the rear extension which houses the ground floor shower room. Currently the extension is used as further dining and partly a utility room – either way you choose to use the floor space, there is an abundance of potential with it. The garden is accessed via the extension and is paved over creating an exceptionally low maintenance garden that you can simply sit back and enjoy.

The first floor of the property is made up of two double bedrooms which have both been well maintained, and the three piece family bathroom suite completed with tiled splash backs and laminate flooring underfoot. The third bedroom is located in the loft, and despite having no dormer is surprisingly spacious and includes an array of storage throughout. The third bedroom is completed with Velux windows allowing the room to be flooded with natural light.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated just off Forest Road where you will find an abundance of local amenities on offer including a selection of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. Blackhorse Road station is only a short walk away (0.5 miles or a 10 minute walk) whilst Walthamstow Central is 1 mile away (20 minute walk) both giving access to the Victoria Line.

When it comes to schools you are truly spoilt for choice including Greenleaf Primary School, Stoneydown Primary School, St. Patrick's Primary School, Hillyfield Primary Academy and many more to choose from.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A two bedroom terraced house on Cassiobury Road.

A classic “doer-upper”, this property is in need of a lot of tlc and a complete refurb. However, the bare bones are here of a fantastic family home, if you’ve got the imagination and energy to bring it back to life. The ground floor comprises interconnected reception rooms, kitchen, lean to and WC, whilst upstairs there are two well proportioned bedrooms and the bathroom. To the rear is a private garden.

Is this the blank canvas you’ve been looking for...?

Living Here...

Perched just off Coppermill Lane, and thus perfectly positioned for the commute into town via St James Street or Blackhorse Road stations, the location of this house is pretty nigh on perfect. It’s just a short walk down Coppermill Lane to the Marshes, Walthamstow Wetlands (Europe’s largest urban wetland) and beyond – ideal for exercising any canine companions, or perhaps more accurately for them to exercise you! Head in the other direction and you will find this part of E17 is changing daily. Whether it be cafes and shops at the end of the market (check out the retail outlets and eateries of the crate park by St James Street station) or art and design spaces like Gnome House, Switchboard Studios and Blackhorse Workshop around Blackhorse Road. Add to that the dozens of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance (try the Sunday roast at The Chequers – it’s amazing!) and you’ll agree with us – this part of E17 really does have it all…

detailedDescription:
Knight Bishop are delighted to offer this wonderful three bedroom house, close to the banks of the River Lea Navigational Canal and the green space of hackney marshes, whilst being moments from the ever popular Chatsworth Road. The property is light and airy throughout and comprises a great living area which leads through to a conservatory, making this an ideal space for home entertaining, a separate fully fitted kitchen with room to dine, three double bedrooms and a four piece family bathroom which includes a jacuzzi bath and shower cubicle, whilst the property benefits from the conservatory and rear garden. Jarrow Way is located close to the River Lee and is a short walk to the green spaces of Hackney Marsh, the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and also the beautiful Victoria Park. Chatsworth Road is within walking distance offering its many local pubs, bars, restaurants and cafes, For all your shopping needs you are within close proximity to Westfield shopping centre opening up its vast array of branded shops, along with eateries and entertainment points. In terms of transport links you are within walking distance of Homerton Overground station and also bus routes giving you access to Hackney central and the City.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This handsomely brick fronted three bedroom Victorian end of terrace with south-facing rear garden is positively abounding with potential waiting for you to put your stamp on it. Nestled in a quiet street just around the corner from Leyton Tube and a host of links to Stratford's myriad attractions within easy reach and in the catchment area of 3 Ofsted 'Outstanding' primary schools, this house is close to Langthorne Park's open green space, quiet gardens and ecology area is six minutes' stroll away any time you've a hankering for natural environs.

It's also home to tennis facilities, a streetball court, climbing wall and outdoor gym. Alternatively, you're a 5 minute easy bike ride or fifteen minute walk from the endlessly explorable Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park for the Velopark, Wetlands Walk and Hackney Marshes.

If you lived here…

You'll be relishing making your new home your own with the designer flourishes you've got in store, the only limit is your imagination. First your twin receptions are laid semi open plan to each other with two period fireplaces just waiting to be restored. It's a dual aspect 235 square foot space with a bay window, plus original mouldings and roses overhead; a brilliant canvas waiting to be brought to life. Continue through and the kitchen's a great size, you've a handy WC tucked away to the right and your eighty square foot dining room to the rear provides your third hosting space and is an inviting prospect all year round.

Throw open the doors here and your south-facing garden's a generous length of patio giving way to thriving plants and shrubs. Some green-fingered know-how and perhaps some landscaping ideas out here will transform this barely-overlooked outside space into an urban solace. Back inside and head up the stairs for your master bedroom. It's a huge 160 square foot double with twin windows framing views of your tree-lined street and another vintage fireplace. Next door and bedroom two's also a solid double with another period hearth, while bedroom three's a very generous single with garden view. Lastly, the bathroom's home to a traditional white suite.

Outside and Leyton tube is five minutes' walk and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in just eleven minutes or Tottenham Court Road in eighteen courtesy of the Central line. Stratford International station is one stop away or a fifteen minute bus ride on the 158 route from the High Street. Here's where you'll also find the legacy of the Olympic Park; the ever-evolving, independent cafes, bars and restaurants of East Village and the gargantuan Westfield Stratford City shopping centre. 350 stores, food outlets, cinema and casino spread over almost two million square feet.

What else?

- Parents will be pleased to know that local schools are excellent and plentiful; you have seventeen primary/secondaries within a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including four deemed 'Outstanding'.
- The property's chain free, so we can get you in with the minimum of hassle.
- You're just around the corner from The Leyton Star, a traditional pub brought splendidly into the 21st century and serving up mouth-watering burgers.

Broomfield is a quiet residential street situated within walking distance of Lea Bridge Road which offers an array of local amenities. There are good transport links with Lea Bridge Station, St James Street Station and Walthamstow Central Tube Station all within easy reach and road links to A12, A406, M11 and M25.

detailedDescription:
An inviting one double bedroom apartment on the first floor of a lovely brick low rise backing onto leafy grounds in Upper Leytonstone. Not only do you have the amenities of Leytonstone High Road within a six minute walk but you're also ideally located for transport and surrounded by bountiful lush greenery.

Epping Forest is just an eight minute stroll away, its wild open greenery the perfect escape from city living. Just a short walk through Epping Forest and you come to Hollow Ponds where we'd encourage you to buy bird food at the kiosk before hiring a row boat with a fluster of feathery friends in tow. Wanstead Flats and Wanstead Park lie to the east, too. Just head through the ancient woodland of Bush Wood for endlessly explorable tranquility.

If you lived here...

You'll be relaxing with friends and family in your 125 square foot lounge with vintage fireplace and original tiled insets, space for dining, invaluable built-in storage and a gorgeous leafy view; you'll forget you're mere moments from the High Street here. Next door and the kitchen's an inviting prospect indeed dressed in on-trend emerald green metro tiles, a flawless contemporary white suite and timber worktops.

Continue through the apartment and the bathroom's a superlative space immaculate in gleaming white tiles, walnut effect fittings and a shower over the tub. Your bedroom's a generous double of 120 square feet with a quartet of windows filling the room with natural light, pristine white walls, a vintage bed surround and soft cream carpet underfoot. Dreamy. Lastly, the property is chain free, so you can move straight in.

Leytonstone tube station is just eight minutes on foot, and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in fourteen minutes, or Tottenham Court Road in twenty three, via the Central line. Leyton Midland overground is a nineteen minute stroll or five minute cycle away for trains on the Gospel Oak to Barking line for the delights of Hampstead Heath and a myriad of other comprehensive transport connections. Drivers can be on the A12 in six minutes and on the North Circular in eleven.

What else?

- For your new local may we recommend the North Star on Browning Road? Something of a hidden gem, it's a buzzing, friendly pub and a mere eight minutes away on foot.
- Even closer to home is vibrant watering hole The Birds. It offers up bottomless brunches and vegan food while tipping its hat to one of Leytonstone's most famous sons, film director Alfred Hitchcock. Book their Aviary Garden for parties of up to thirty people.
- From Leytonstone station you can be whisked to the limitless retail options of Westfield Stratford City in just six minutes.

Being ideally located for Churchfields School this deceptively spacious property offers accommodation that includes three receptions, a well appointed kitchen / diner, utility room and ground floor cloakroom. There is a large, established rear garden with a patio leading to an area laid to lawn with flower, tree and shrub boarders. A block paved driveway provides off street parking for two vehicles. Being offered Chain Free an early viewing is advised to appreciate this fantastic family home.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A two double bedroom flat in a small gated development with communal garden and secure parking located just moments from Leyton tube station.

This ground floor flat is in a perfect location, just behind Leyton Mills shopping park, and only a few minutes walk from the bars, restaurants and cafes on Leyton High Road.

Outside, there is a shared communal garden and BBQ area with bench to enjoy sunny days.

The property, which has double glazed windows throughout, has been recently redecorated and includes new wool carpets in both bedrooms.

The flat has a spacious lounge offering enough space for sofa, storage and dining table for entertaining friends.

The kitchen, which is off the lounge, is fully fitted with built in applicances including a fridge freezer, hob and oven. There is also a freestanding dishwasher.

The bathroom offers a full-sized bath with thermostatic mixer shower over, pedestal basin, toilet and electric towel warmer.

There are two large storage cupboards in the hallway, one housing the washing machine and dryer, the other ideal for other household items and coats.

The flat also has secure private parking.

This is a perfect first time purchase or buy-to-let investment achieving approximately £1400 pcm.

It is offered chain free.

detailedDescription:
***chain free***

Ideal for first-time buyers or investors alike, this one-bedroom ground floor flat is a beauty not to be missed.

Well maintained throughout by the current owner with a recently fitted new boiler and new flooring, the property benefits of an inviting large reception room, a good size bedroom, a modern bathroom and a fully fitted kitchen/ diner. In addition, the large landscaped garden is beautifully maintained and benefits from a side entrance.
The property comes with a nice long lease too!
Location


Higham Hill is conveniently located within easy reach to Blackhorse Road Station and the Victoria Line. For those who love green spaces the Lloyds Park is just a short walk away as well as the excellent local amenities, cafes and restaurants the popular Walthamstow Central area has to offer.

A word from the owner..
There are loads of fabulous restaurants and bars nearby like the Forest Bar + Kitchen & The Collab. Close by there are great little breweries to discover down on Blackhorse lane and if you fancy it Yonder is a great place to go indoor climbing! We have loved living here and watching the area continue to flourish.

Ryan Baker Estate Agents Are Delighted To Offer This Ground Floor Two Double Bedroom Maisonette With Private Garden, Fitted Kitchen And Off Street Parking in An Urban Area Of Hackney/ Walthamstow Borders Surrounded By Open Green Spaces Of Lea Valley.

Harris Street is a tree-lined boulevard with plenty of parking. There are good public transportation connections into the city; Lea Bridge Road station is a short walk away, and bus stations are only a few minutes away. Harris Street is only around Ten minutes away from Walthamstow Central Station, and the station is known to be a major location, with train lines to every location in London. Whatever you need in Walthamstow you will find, A Multicultural Region with shops and people for anyone from every race and religion especially in Walthamstow Market! Harris Street is a street in the Walthamstow Greater London Urban Area that is roughly 168 metres long. Waltham Forest London Council, which provides services like as waste collection and is responsible for the collecting of council tax, is responsible for Harris Street.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A smart, bright and sparkling one bedroom apartment on the second floor of an intriguing, modest designer development right in the heart of our highly sought after Walthamstow Village. This delightful leafy enclave is home to some of the finest independent wining and dining establishments for miles around.

Your striking development features lush communal grounds and, in an all too rare welcome addition in London, private residents' parking. Drivers can be on the North Circular in around ten minutes.

If you lived here…

You'll be enjoying an enviably stylish suite of rooms in the heart of one of our most popular locales. A striking geometric statement wall greets you as you step into your 170 square foot lounge, with light blonde engineered flooring running underfoot, a mix of eye-catching cerulean blue and white finishes and floods of natural light from the large box bay window.

The kitchen's artfully segmented by a series of arches – in here you have a sleek suite of white fitted cabinets, dark glossy countertops and contrasting metro tile splashbacks with a splash of characterful pink above. The hallway offers plenty of handy incidental space for bags and coats, while your bedroom across the way is a sunny substantial double of 150 square feet, with more high contrast walls and blonde flooring. Finally, your bathroom tops off the property perfectly, with aquamarine metro tiling from floor to head height, and a walk-in rainfall shower with secondary handset.

Outside, and with Walthamstow Village on your doorstep you have peaceful, leafy streets, historic architecture and a huge range of diverse bars, restaurants and gastropubs at your fingertips. The Orford Saloon deals in delicious tapas, with a multitude of take-out options from the adjacent deli, The Queens Arms is the quintessential gastropub with fine wines and a delicious Sunday Roast, while Eat17 serves up classic cocktails in a chic environment. With over a dozen more spots to choose from, you're sure to find a favourite.

What else?

- Walthamstow Central is just a five minute walk and will get you directly to Liverpool Street or Oxford Circus in twenty, putting both the City and West End less than a half hour away door to door.
- Among the Village's more esoteric attractions is God's Own Junkyard, a dazzling neon playground that's appeared on the big and small screen several times.
- The landscaped gardens and open green spaces of Lloyd Park are just a half mile away on foot anytime you need to get back to nature. Or if you fancy things a little wilder, Epping Forest and Hollow Ponds are just a little further.

Hall

Lounge/Dining Room (4.36m x 3.60m (14'3" x 11'9"))

Storage

Kitchen (2.77m x 2.11m (9'1" x 6'11"))

Bedroom (3.09m x 4.45m (10'1" x 14'7"))

Bathroom (2.17m x 1.29m (7'1" x 4'2"))

A word from the owner...

"We have thoroughly enjoyed our time at Thomas Lodge. The location is unbeatable, situated just off Orford Road and a minutes walk from the heart of Walthamstow Village and all the boutique shops, pubs and restaurants which it has to offer. A short walk to Walthamstow Central and a 20 min tube ride from there to central London. We couldn't have asked for more.

The flat itself is a great layout, with good sized rooms and plenty of storage. The bathroom is newly refurbished and all floors have either a tiled or wooden finish. It is light and airy and it is very easy to feel right at home here.

The flat comes with an allocated parking space in a gated area. The communal garden has definitely come into its own over the last year and we have loved having evening drinks outside with our neighbours.

We will be sad to go, but hope you enjoy it as much as we have!"

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A freshly converted and well modernised Victorian terraced property set over 2 floors, in a fantastic location close to Walthamstow Village and Walthamstow Central Station.

You’re near to the independent cafes, restaurants and cultural hub of the popular Hoe St area. You’re also close to excellent transport links, walking distance to green space at Thomas Gamuel Park and near enough to Walthamstow Wetlands, the largest urban wetlands in Europe.

Inside, the flat is extended into the loft with large overhead windows and is well proportioned throughout. The conversion has successfully maximised the space and natural light in the property creating a versatile blank canvas with good bones, bay windows, wooden floors, excellent lighting, modern well-fitted kitchen and contemporary bathrooms—all waiting to be made into a cosy and welcoming home.
You’ve got the location, you’ve got the space and no onward chain, which means you could potentially be in here and making it your own pretty quickly. Come and see what you think.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful two bedroom end of terrace property. The property has been completely refurbished throughout and also benefits from a driveway to the rear. You are greeted at the property by a lovely brick built wall which is topped with a high hedge for added privacy. A well maintained fully paved front garden gives access to a double skin porch. The porch is double aspect and has also been fitted with two built in cupboards for added storage. The porch leads into the spacious and bright lounge/diner. The lounge/diner has been fully replastered as well as benefitting from high quality laminate flooring. A ground floor w/c has been added to the lounge to make an additional toilet for the property. The lounge flows effortlessly into the fully fitted kitchen. The kitchen benefits from a series of integrated appliances which will be staying with the property. A fully double glazed opaque patio door leads into the west facing rear garden. The garden benefits from external power points, a garden shed as well as lighting that can be easily turned on or off from an external switch. Back inside the property and up the stairs you are presented with a first floor landing that gives access to both double bedrooms located to the front and the rear of the property. The bedrooms both have access to the first floor bathroom which has been recently updated this year. The property also benefits from fully double glazed windows, Gas central heating from a Vaillant combination boiler as well as being fully alarmed with the addition of a quality CCTV system for added security.

The property is located just opposite the Garnett Way shops so you have everything literally on your door step. The property is also just a stones throw away from the newly refurbished Cheney Row Park which reopened in May 2019. The park benefits from nature-themed play area for children, An outdoor amphitheatre, enhanced natural areas for plants and wildlife as well as a lot more. The property also has direct access to the north circular as well as being within walking distance to Black Horse Road station. Lea Valley is also easily accessible so country walks; bridle paths and cycling tracks are all on your doorstep.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A perfectly formed find, this one bedroom apartment is in the heart of Walthamstow Village on a quiet street moments from all the attractions and amenities of this most sought after area. In a secure purpose built development with gated off street parking, just a gorgeous home in an ideal spot.

Walthamstow Village is the oldest and most beautiful part of town, and you'll be living right at its centre. Your local shop will be the award-winning village store, while you're surrounded by superb foodie pubs and independent shops. Five minutes' wander and you're in the chocolate box churchyard of St Mary's, where you can almost forget you're half an hour from central London.

If you lived here…

You'll walk up to the first floor, step into your hall and turn left into your bedroom. It's 135 square foot of bright space with twin double glazed windows. There's a warm terracotta feature wall and hardwearing carpet underfoot. Next to the bedroom is your bathroom, with modern white suite, shower over the tile-sided tub, and vanity sink. White tiling is set off by vibrant cerulean walls.

The hall then opens onto your lounge and kitchen/diner, with over 200 square feet of elegantly appointed living space. Your kitchen sits neatly to one side, with metro tiled backsplashes in bright blue and plenty of white units. In the living room space the same carpet lies underfoot, and a double window lets in loads of light. There's built-in storage to the corner while elsewhere on site, as noted, you have secure gated parking and drivers can be on the North Circular in less than fifteen minutes.

You'll be around ten minutes on foot from Walthamstow Central station, where the Victoria Line will take you to Kings Cross in just over a quarter of an hour, and the Overground takes the same time to whisk you across the marshes to Liverpool Street. As for green spaces, there's communal lawns at home, and it's just a fifteen minute walk to Hollow Ponds and Leyton Flats, part of Epping Forest and superb for dog walking and dog spotting alike.

What else?

- Your new local is The Castle, a stately and friendly pub with lots of outside space and the best sausage rolls in town.
- There's a long lease on this home, so you can tick that box right away.
- If you need plants or fresh flowers for your new home, pop into Petals In Bloom just around the corner.

Lounge/Kitchen/Diner (4.50m x 4.55m (14'9" x 14'11"))

Hall

Bathroom (2.38m x 1.47m (7'9" x 4'9"))

Bedroom (3.49m x 3.56m (11'5" x 11'8"))

A word from the owner...

"We have loved living so close to the heart of Walthamstow Village, and couldn't have been any luckier with this wonderful location. While the flat is positioned on a quiet, peaceful street, it's less than a minute from a wide variety of pubs, restaurants and independent shops. Over the last year we've especially loved having so much choice on our doorstep, particularly being able to pop for a drink just around the corner on a sunny evening.

It's lovely to be a short walk to Hollow Ponds and Epping Forest when you need some fresh air, but still be less than ten minutes from excellent transport links into Central London, which has made commuting super easy. We'll be really sad to say goodbye after 4 great years, but hope someone new will enjoy living here as much as we have!"

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming three bedroom, two bathroom end terrace home, on a quiet turning in Chingford. With a beautifully converted loft, generous living space throughout and plentiful vintage features complementing modern practicality, this Victorian conversion is a lovely family home ready for new people.

You've got plenty of space to play with here, from the open plan lounge diner and characterful family bathroom to the long stretch of low maintenance garden. If you're settling in for the future you'll be pleased to find potential to extend further subject to permission.

If you lived here

You'll step into your hallway, see the carpeted stairs ahead and turn right into your lounge diner. A super open plan living space of over 250 square foot, it's bathed in light from the box bay with sash windows to the front. Blonde engineered flooring lies underfoot throughout, and a vintage fireplace draws the eye. To the rear there's your ninety five square foot kitchen, with a large number of pine-fronted units and emerald tiled worktops. A door opens onto your long neatly fenced garden, with patio giving on to lush lawn and trees.

Upstairs you'll come first to your spectacular ninety five square foot bathroom, with glossy chessboard tiling underfoot. There's a dedicated shower, a freestanding clawfoot tub, and a lovely stained glass window. Your first bedroom is next, overlooking the garden and offering close to 100 square foot of space. To the front is your second bedroom, almost 160 square foot of relaxing space with a double and single window and carpet underfoot. Your top floor has a bedroom of over 215 square foot, with a large skylight and skylit en suite.

You're a mile on foot from Highams Park station, where the overground will take you to Walthamstow Central for the Victoria Line in as little as five minutes, or to Liverpool Street in twenty five. Drivers will be pleased to find the North Circular is under a mile away. Elsewhere, half an hour's walk takes you to Highams Park itself, where you can enjoy spectacular views across London before tea and cake at Humphry's Cafe. Meanwhile Memorial Park is just moments from your door.

What else?

- Your new local is The Dog & Duck, a friendly pub with the unusual additions of a sourdough saloon and beer garden beach huts.
- Choose from several schools rated 'Good' by Ofsted nearby, including Ainslie Wood Primary, Lime Academy Larkswood, and Chase Lane Primary.
- It's a mile and a half to The Drive In, a fantastic drive in cinema where you can enjoy a movie and a hot dog from the comfort of your car.

Explore our 'Charms of Chingford' pages for everything this picturesque part of East London has to offer.

Previously part of Essex, Chingford became an urban district in 1894, an early sign of what would prove to be increasingly close ties to the capital as improved transport links brought professionals flowing to the suburbs in search of bargains.

The local landscape is mostly sturdy post-war terraces and semi-detacheds, with pockets of more contemporary developments and plenty of parks, not to mention golf, cricket and country clubs.

Modest parades of local shops are scattered about the area, with most social life focused on the stretch of Station Road between Kings Head Hill and Chingford Golf Course.

Bordered by the wild green expanse of Epping Forest, and with Liverpool Street just twenty seven minutes by train, Chingford links Essex and the capital to this day, for the very best of both worlds.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Sensational and unique three bedroom home – chain free: A three storey, three bedroom end terrace which has been enhanced by a fabulous, high-end renovation. Guide £750,000 - £800,000.

The Property

This brick-fronted home is now ready for its new owner. The images in this advertisement are computer generated imagery and represent an accurate likeness and the finish on offer. Both this house and its neighbouring property have now completed the final stages of refurbishment and can now be viewed. The current owners have successfully accentuated the building's inherent Victorian character with an impressive restoration project which is Nordic in style, but never over the top.

Having been the creation of a local interior designer it is crystal clear to see this is something of a unique property. As you enter it is immediately apparent how thoughtful and considerate the design process has been. There is a great feeling of space and light, helped by the high ceilings which are typical of Victorian buildings.

From the concrete style flooring, the crittall kitchen doors and the use of underfloor heating, you can see that no expense has been spared to make this into a comfortable and luxurious property. Plus at over 1230 sq ft there is plenty of space for the kids to run about.

The ground floor kitchen living area comfortably accommodates a large sofa suite and dining table and chairs. With many sky lanterns and two sets of French doors the room is fantastic.

The bespoke birch ply handmade kitchen is something of a wonder. It boasts an impressive level of cupboard and worktop space and with good quality built in appliances, a keen chef would likely find themselves at home here. A good size breakfast bar provides a place for the family to gather or a central hub for nights of entertaining. A family could enjoy their dinners here on a full size dining table and still with plenty of space. The full width rear extension has created a superb kitchen dining living space.

A stunning bathroom completes the ground floor and with the same flooring throughout the various spaces flow beautifully.

A larger than average garden with patio, grass and raised beds does not feel overlooked.

The first floor offers two comfortable double bedrooms. High quality carpet can be felt underfoot and the various use of neutral colour adds to an already sophisticated décor scheme.

Further stairs lead to the third double bedroom with en-suite. The head height is noticeably high and with further Scandinavian touches a feeling of continuity is felt throughout.

In every room the attention to detail and high-quality finish are evident. A new slate roof completes the refurbishment leaving the new owner little to do other that unpack and enjoy.

The Location

There is a noticeably low level of passing traffic making Livingstone Road as superb location to raise a family. Walthamstow Village is within a short walk as is the Bakers Arms area where there are the various places to eat, drink and enjoy.

To be sold chain free. Please call for further information or to arrange a viewing.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful three bedroom mid terrace property. The property has been extended to the rear and is located on the gorgeous tree-lined street of Overton Road. You are greeted at the property by a lovely brick built front wall and Chelsea bow style steel gate. The gate opens onto a well maintained paved patio that leads to the fully double glazed porch. The porch is an adequate size and has enough room to remove coats and shoes. The main front door opens into a spacious and bright entrance hall that flows effortlessly into the first reception room. This room benefits from a sizeable bay window that floods the room with natural light as well as adding more floor area to this already generously sized room. A door from the entrance hall leads into the long extended kitchen and also gives access to the second reception room. A final third reception is located to the rear of the property and gives access to the 80ft rear garden. The garden is a lovely size and is ideal for entertaining in the summer months. Back inside the property and up the stairs you are presented with a spacious first floor landing. The landing firstly gives access to a three piece family bathroom that has been recently updated. There is also two double bedrooms accessible from the landing with the main bedroom located to the front and benefitting from built in wardrobes as well as another sizeable bay window. The final room located on the first floor is the third single bedroom, this room also benefits from a bay window and completes the first floor. Loft access is also available on the landing and has the potential to add both space and value (stpp). The property also benefits from being fully alarmed as well as coming with fully double glazed windows and gas central heating from a Combination boiler.

The property also benefits from being fully alarmed as well as coming with fully double glazed windows and gas central heating from a Combination boiler. The property is also only 0.3 miles to the new Lea Bridge Road station which is a direct line into Stratford. The local bus route is also within one minute walking distance from the property and has buses running to Blackhorse Road Station, Walthamstow Central, Leyton and Stratford. Local amenities such as shops, restaurants and bars can all be found within walking distance. Do not miss out on this opportunity to view this fantastic family home. Call today to avoid certain disappointment.

detailedDescription:
***guide price £425,000 - £450,000***
Situated within moments of Leyton High Road can be found this two bedroom Victorian Abrahams ground floor maisonette.
The excellent space on offer comprises private entrance, reception room, newly fitted modern kitchen, two good size bedrooms, modern shower room and direct access to a private rear garden. The property is presented in good order throughout and is a superb purchase for first time buyers looking for a home ready to move in to.
Leyton has a good supply of small local parks and playing fields, such as Coronation Gardens and Sidmouth Park, and the Leyton Youth Centre. The area is close to Epping Forest and the Hackney Marshes and locals will have direct access to the Olympic Park via a new pedestrian bridge from Ruckholt Road. The Water Works Nature Reserve and the nearby Middlesex Filter Beds have a giant hide for bird watching and there is a visitors’ centre in Lammas Road off Lea Bridge Road.
Leyton is on the Tube’s Central line, with journey times to Bank of 15 minutes, Oxford Circus 23 minutes, and Canary Wharf with a change at Stratford, 17 minutes. Leyton Midland Road is an Overground station on the Gospel Oak to Barking line; the 55 bus goes to Oxford Circus, the 48 to London Bridge and the 56 to Clerkenwell.
Already prospering, the locality looks set to continue to grow in popularity thanks to more coffee shops and restaurants opening up nearby, as well as a new winter sports complex in Stratford to sit alongside its cinemas, theatre, shopping and other activities.
Internal viewing of this fabulous home is recommended.

detailedDescription:
Situated over three floors is this wonderful three bedroom period family home which feels modern, spacious and bright throughout. On the ground floor you will find a large bay fronted lounge/dining room with doors that open on to the modern fitted kitchen. Outside there is a tranquil 40ft rear garden. On the first floor you will find the four piece fitted family bathroom and two double bedrooms, whilst on the second floor there is the large master bedroom and a dressing and shower room. Beyond that as soon as you walk through the door there is a fantastic feeling of home.

There are terrific restaurants and a multi-screen cinema in the scene, only a ten-minute walk away. And of course, don’t forget Walthamstow Village, which is just a hop, skip and a jump away too. If you work in the City then that long commute in and out of London can be a thing of the past, as you are spoilt for choice for stations with walthamstow central and Queens Road stations within reach.

detailedDescription:
Within 400ft of Wanstead's popular High Street, Roca Court is a popular development noted for its striking modern design, manicured frontage and gated underground parking facilities. Being within 0.2 and 0.5 Miles from both Snaresbrook and Wanstead Central Line Stations' and 0.2 Miles from Christchurch Green, the centrality of the development makes it perfect for those wanting to easily access everything this popular East London suburb has to offer.

Located on the ground floor of the development, the apartment is easily accessible once you are through the security entry doors, and once inside the feeling of space and light is immediately noticeable with a wide hallway opening onto a generous lounge/diner with views over the property's private terrace. There is a separate modern kitchen adjacent from the living/dining room keeping cooking smells at bay without hindering easy entertaining. The family bathroom has space for a bath with shower overhead and both bedrooms are a good size with the master bedroom enjoying the use of an en-suite shower room.

Externally the property enjoys a large, private terrace spanning just over 25ft in width at the largest point, with direct access onto the immaculate communal gardens beyond. With both areas enjoying a Westerly aspect the sun can be enjoyed from early afternoon until late evening, making the outside space a fantastic area to host family and friends whilst making the most of the fair weather. There is also secure, allocated underground parking which can be a real rarity for such a central location.

Churchill Estates are pleased to bring to market this beautifully presented three bedroom terraced period property, located within close proximity of the newly pedestrianised Francis Road.

Contemporary fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, utility room to the rear and original outdoor W/C. Your private rear garden spanning in excess of 40ft with an open aspect.

Upstairs of this delightful family home you find two substantial double bedrooms, the main room featuring stunning bay window and fitted wardrobes. This addition was made before the current ownership, meaning that no planning permission is available but provides potential buyers with even more space making this opportunity real value for money.

The location of this property is fantastic being in close proximity to both Leytonstone High Road (0.4 miles) and Leyton Central Line Station (0.5 miles) respectively. Also boasting a short walk to the newly pedestrianised Francis Road and within catchment of both primary and secondary schools nearby. One of the first streets transformed under the innovative local government Healthy Streets initiative, this hub comprises of independent shops, boutiques, restaurants and other popular amenities.

detailedDescription:
An immaculate and elegantly appointed two double bedroom apartment on the second floor of a low rise contemporary development in the heart of leafy Highams Park. Here you have a huge and perfectly zoned open plan lounge/kitchen/diner, a balcony, communal grounds and allocated underground parking.

You're perfectly placed for transport with Highams Park station a mere four minutes on foot to speed you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three. Meanwhile, the bus stop at the end of your street will whisk you to myriad nearby destinations including Chingford, Walthamstow, Wood Street and Leytonstone, courtesy of the 212 and W16 routes.

If you lived here

You'll be enjoying apartment living at its finest with sleek, clean lines at every turn. Let's start in your impeccable south-facing, dual aspect open plan living area. It's a sizeable 280 square feet with light engineered timber flooring underfoot, a constellation of recessed spot lighting overhead and a kitchen area home to seamlessly integrated appliances under cabinet lighting, a wine rack and breakfast bar. Lovely.

Slide open the patio door here for your timber decked balcony, it's a great spot for morning coffee or an evening tipple. Moveable timber shutters here add a delightful design feature that lets you control the light and privacy of your living space as you wish. Elsewhere you have two plushly carpeted double bedrooms of 135 and 115 square feet, both as beautifully attired as the rest of the apartment, while lastly your bathroom's resplendent in its under-lit tub, recessed sink and floating WC.

Outside, and a three minute stroll will bring you to The Broadway, the heart of Highams Park's social hub. A must is mouth-watering Mediterranean restaurant Yaz two minutes from your front door, popular with foodies and Instagrammers alike and serving up food that's genuinely as delicious as it looks. Breeze, The Indian Dining Club and Melting Pot Bistro are also worth a mention here, as well as Highams Lounge which serves up the best Eggs Benedict in town. If it's natural environs you're craving then a seven minute stroll brings you to Vincent Road playground and on to the delights of Highams Park Lake which was formed in the early 19th century by the famous landscape gardener Humphrey Repton, who diverted the River Ching.

What else?

- There's an homage to the aforementioned Humphrey Repton in Highams Park itself in the shape of Humphrey's Cafe, a cosy, dog-friendly community cafe. We'd be remiss not to recommend taking in the spectacular city views from the hill while you're there.
- Parents will be happy to know that you have fifteen primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted, three of which have been deemed 'Outstanding'.
- For your new local may we suggest the Stag & Lantern? It's a cosy micropub serving up the freshest and tastiest ales and ciders. Try Salopian's Oracle Golden Ale, it's more than worthy of the title.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A characterful and delectably dressed three bedroom maisonette with a balcony and private rear garden, sitting on the first and second floors of an ex Warner home in Blackhorse Village. You're in pole position here, nestled within a nine minute walk of both Blackhorse Road and central Walthamstow.

A few minutes walk takes you into the creative hub of Blackhorse Lane, also home to the Walthamstow Beer Mile with a fine choice of breweries, beer gardens and taprooms. Six minutes south takes you to the start of the High Street. Here St James Street overground will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty and you'll find crate St James – a buzzing community of future-forward entrepreneurs.

If you lived here…

You'll be relaxing with friends and family in your gloriously low-maintenance south-facing rear garden. Here an immaculate stretch of Trulawn is bookended by on-trend slate coloured decking with a lush canopy of mature foliage overhead and a gravelled seating area. Head up the outdoor stairs and your balcony awaits – it's a charming spot ideal for a morning cuppa. Open the door here for your dual aspect kitchen/diner. With cherry wood floorboards underfoot, timber worktops, a white metro tile backsplash and interior design flourishes too numerous to mention, this is an inviting prospect indeed.

Continue through and next up is the bathroom, again delectably on-trend in Sacramento green panelling and with a shower over the curved tub. Bedroom one is a generous double while bedroom two's just as impeccable and the ideal size for a child or home working space, as you wish. The storey's completed by your lounge, its lovely leafy street views framed by a twin set of windows. Lastly, head up your skylit stairwell for your 175 square foot loft conversion, a versatile space with tower radiator, Juliet balcony and twin skylights.

Outside and Stoneydown Park is a mere three minute walk away, great for exercising yourself or your four-legged friend. If you're craving wilder natural environs then a seven minute bike ride or fifteen minute walk will see you ready to explore Walthamstow Wetlands, our spectacular and serene 500 acre nature reserve. Rainy day? You can reach your fitness goals at Yonder to try your hand at indoor rock climbing or stay grounded with yoga classes. It's just past Blackhorse Road station.

What else?

- It's just a nine minute stroll to Blackhorse Road station, where the Victoria Line will take you to Kings Cross in under fifteen minutes. If you follow the footpath around the corner to Palmerston Road the W15 bus route will whisk you to Leytonstone, Spitalfields and Hackney.
- At 124 years, the lease is long enough not to cause you any renewal worries.
- Little Diamonds Nursery is just five minutes' walk around the corner so childcare is a cinch if you need it. Their healthy eating plans are well known for setting your little ones in good stead.

"We have loved living in our amazing home for the past five years. It has grown with us and seen us through so many happy times. We have really appreciated how our home has given us flexibility to work from home and relax, all in one space. Our garden is surrounded by trees and is peaceful and quiet, which makes it the perfect space for bird spotting.

The residents of Warner Road are lovely too. Everyone is incredibly friendly and looks out for one another. We will miss the community and the convenience to access both Central London and the nearby green spaces that surround us."

title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
An enchantingly characterful and lovingly developed four bedroom family home, elegantly arranged over three floors with a delightful rural feel and all manner of hidden features and delights, from the skylit second reception to the intriguing studio in your huge, beautifully lush rear garden.

Despite your wonderful location, mere moments from Lloyd Park, you have a rare sense of seclusion here. Set back from the road to the front by a broad grass verge and screening greenery, step out the rear and you'll forget you're in London, with your vast rear garden backing onto nothing but your neighbour's similarly sized outside space, separated by a row of mature trees.

If you lived here…

You'll be enjoying over 1200 square feet of living space, all decked out and developed in pleasing vintage style. Your 150 square foot front reception has leaded windows, richly restored original timber underfoot and a strikingly immaculate vintage hearth and mantel serving as an impressive centrepiece. To the rear, your expertly extended kitchen/diner is a masterpiece of open planning, with terracotta tiles running underfoot throughout and large skylights over the dining area. You have cerulean blue splashbacks, timber worktops and a Dublin sink.

Stretch out in the 160 square foot dining room, awash with natural light, not just from the aforementioned skylights but also the double patio doors and glazed surround all dressed in timber shutters. A vintage ebony wood burner sits in one corner and there's more cerulean blue tiles to hip height. Throw back those patio doors and you can step directly on to your expansive deck, complete with pergola and a scattering of pots it's nonetheless only the start of your endlessly explorable, 120 foot long rear garden, rife with lush greenery and home to that fully powered, insulated 160 square foot studio. A great space ideal for all manner of uses. It even has it's own veranda.

Back inside and upstairs your master bedroom's a respectable double of 140 square feet, with more leaded windows and characterful statement wallpaper opposite the bed. There's another double to the rear, plus a single ideal for a child or home office. Your family bathroom completes the floor with elegant fittings including a classic pedestal sink and tiling from floor to ceiling. Finally your loft conversion offers up bedroom number four, a dual aspect double finished in sunny yellow with an equally cheering en suite shower room.

What else?

- Home to cafes, courts, an outdoor gym and all manner of sports clubs and classes as well as a regular Saturday farmers market, Lloyd Park is one of our proudest landmarks and a great spot to have at your fingertips.
- Local schools are plentiful and excellent. You have twenty one primary/secondaries less than a mile away on foot, all rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.
- For your new local you can't do better than The Dog & Duck, a charming gastropub with delicious sourdough pizzas and a beer garden full of beach huts less than a half a mile away on foot.

detailedDescription:
Stunning, modern two bedroom apartmenta modern, two double bedroom apartment, located just off Leyton High Road.

The Property

Forming part of the major development in the Leyton Orient Football Ground, this two bedroom apartment, with two bathrooms and private balcony is available to view by appointment.

The property consists of two double bedrooms, open plan kitchen and living room, modern bathroom and modern en suite. There is also a spacious balcony with impressive park views.
Full length windows augment the natural light throughout, with comfortably sized living accommodation offering the ideal first time purchase, or attractive rental investment.

The Location

Bloomfield Court is located moments from Leyton High Road and is next to the green open spaces of Coronation Gardens. This area that has become extremely popular due to the trendy restaurants and cafés that have recently opened locally. The shops and amenities of Leyton High Road are also within easy reach. The property is positioned 0.4 miles from Leyton Station (Central Line).

Owners Comments

'The flat has been a wonderful home for me and my partner. It is bright and spacious, looks out over the park and gets sun throughout the day. Being south facing, it's also very warm. We very rarely need to turn the heating on even in the coldest bits of winter. The sound insulation is also great, we never hear a peep from our neighbours. It has been great to see Leyton grow and change over the years, with new shops, restaurants and local facilities opening all the time. With excellent transport links in and out of London, we couldn't have asked for a better place to live.'

detailedDescription:
Open day viewings Saturday 10th July! As the vendors sole agents Lloyds Residential are pleased to present to the market this truly superb semi-detached Edwardian family home with detached garage. The property is within easy walking distance of Chingford station with direct link into Londons' Liverpool Street as well as the wide open spaces of Chingford Plain and Epping Forest. Located on a wide tree lined avenue in one of North Chingfords' most desirable areas with a beautiful south west facing mature garden, viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the charm and character this beautiful home has to offer.

Walking through the front door into the wide entrance hall you are greeted with a sweeping stairway and a taste of the period of this home with it's high ceilings and skirting boards, covings, original restored tiled flooring and bay window with coloured led lights to the side of the property. The bright spacious lounge is immaculately presented and offers a large bay window allowing lots of natural light and a beautiful feature fireplace. The second reception room, dining room, also offers a feature fireplace and doors onto a delightful sun room with french doors onto the garden, velux windows and doorway to the fitted kitchen offering a range of high quality wall and base level units with granite work surfaces. A spacious shower room completes the ground floor layout with hallway complimenting the entrance hall offering matching tiled flooring.

From the first floor landing you enter the main bedroom with large bay window and feature fireplace, second bedroom with views over the garden, third bedroom with feature fireplace then down the hallway to the forth bedroom, fitted family bathroom, separate wc and fifth bedroom/study, again overlooking the lovely garden. The South / West facing garden is beautifully mature with planted borders, large lawn and patio area, ideal for entertaining on sunny summers evenings. The front driveway enables off–street parking.

Gordon Road is just moments from the popular shops, bars and restaurants of Station Road with its twice monthly market. North Chingford is well served with schooling and you will find many highly regarded state and private schools that give broad options for both primary and secondary aged children.

detailedDescription:
An immaculate and delightfully characterful two bedroom Victorian terrace with lush rear garden in our enviable locale of Walthamstow Village. Here you're within easy reach of excellent schools, the buzzing hub and transport links of Walthamstow Central, vast natural escapes and Wood Street's amenities.

Wood Street station is just an eleven minute walk or five minute cycle to whisk you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty. Alternatively, Walthamstow Central is one stop or seventeen minutes' walk in the other direction for direct twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus. Drivers, meanwhile, can be on the North Circular in eight minutes.

If you lived here…

You'll feel right at home from the outset; walk past your inviting picket fence and up the path flanked by the thriving and fragrant greenery of your front garden and on into your striking 135 square foot lounge. With battleship grey walls, a box bay window dressed in plantation shutters, cherry floorboards underfoot and an ebony vintage fireplace centrepiece, this is quite the stately space. Next door and things are more impressive still. Your huge, skylit open plan kitchen/diner comes in at 230 square feet and those glorious exposed brick flourishes lend a distinctly country cottage feel.

Step out here for your breathtaking rear garden. The greenest of fingers have been at work and the result is an explosion of colour and lush verdancy; a bona fide urban retreat. Back inside and the ground floor's completed by a pristine bathroom counting among its charms shuttered views of the garden, a rainfall shower plus secondary handset over the tub, gleaming white metro tiles and a Belfast sink sat atop a taupe cabinet. Lastly, head upstairs for two beautiful 110 square foot double bedrooms.

You're perfectly positioned in Walthamstow Village here, with an enviable range of bars, restaurants and gourmet pubs on your doorstep. Your new local may well be The Castle, it's just five minutes away on foot and serves up Sunday roasts that are out of this world. With a beer garden for the warmer months, you can't really go wrong here. Then there's the elegantly eccentric decor, cosy fires, friendly cats and vegan cuisine at The Nag's Head, fine wine recommendations at Parish Wines, artisanal gins at Mother's Ruin (where Aura Rosa also serves afternoon tea with Guinness cake) and the mouth-watering tapas and deli at The Orford Saloon. And that's all just for starters.

What else?

- Current and prospective parents will be pleased to know you have seventeen primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted, five of which have been deemed 'Outstanding'.
- Next door to Walthamstow Central station you'll find the huge range of shops in the Walthamstow Mall, plus the nine screen Empire cinema entertainment complex. Explore Hoe Street from here for a treasure trove of shops, cafes and restaurants.
- For green and blue space you have Leyton Flats and Hollow Ponds (made famous by local boy Damon Albarn) just eight minutes away on foot or a four minute cycle. Alternatively, London's largest nature reserve, the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands, is a ten minute bus ride on the W12 route from nearby Shernhall Street.

A word from the owners....

"We have lived in this house for 12 years and will miss it so much! Walthamstow is such a wonderful location and community and we are lucky to be right in the middle of the Village, between Wood Street; with its local independent shops, great Artisan Bakery (the chocolate almond croissants!) and the Duke Pub, and Orford Road; with all the attractions of the Village and the craft breweries. The Castle pub is round the corner, great for a drink or for a quick dinner when we can't be bothered to cook. Epping Forest is a stone's throw away for a scenic walk followed by a stop off at the Hitchcock (newly acquired by the team behind The Ivy!) The house has been a very happy home for us, the right balance of space and a cosy sanctuary. Summer evenings in the garden and "front garden cuppas" with the neighbours have been a regular feature. It's such a quiet spot (we even have frogs and a hedgehog in the garden!) and yet so close to everything we could want, as well as public transport links in to central London. We hope whoever moves in next is as happy as we have been here!"

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A classically proportioned and partially extended Victorian end of terrace, already featuring over 1000 square feet of living space yet with plenty of potential to develop further. You also have the welcome inclusion of a bright conservatory, lengthy lounge and low-maintenance yet lush rear garden.

Despite being surrounded by the open green spaces of Highams Park here, the overground station is less than a half mile on foot and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three minutes.

If you lived here...

You'll be enjoying a pleasing mix of character and potential across both storeys. Your open plan through lounge has richly restored original timber floorboards underfoot, there's also some vintage moulding and contemporary recessed spotlights rubbing shoulders overhead. It's all dual aspect and awash with natural light from the handsome bay window to the front and access to the kitchen and conservatory at the rear.

Your kitchen's a nicely sizeable 120 square feet with a handy larder, while your conservatory's a covetable extension indeed; nice and bright, naturally, and perfect for laundry or al fresco dining in all weathers. Step into your forty foot garden and you have an expanse of patio, perfect for a barbecue or scattering of pots, giving way to a canopy of mature foliage beckoning you towards a solid outhouse at the end. Again, some development here could reward you with a flexible home gym or office.

Upstairs and your master bedroom is a colossal 180 square feet, with a wealth of floor to ceiling mirrored fitted storage, vintage timber underfoot and a striking violet statement wall. Bedroom two is a characterful single ideal for a child, while number three is another double, with more artfully arranged storage and a leafy garden view. Finally your bathroom, simply appointed with an elegant pedestal sink and characterful floor tiling.

What else?

- Parents will be pleased to know that you have nineteen primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius alone, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted.
- With the loft space so far unconverted, you have plenty of potential to develop your new home still further, potentially adding your own whole new storey as some of your neighbours have done (subject to the usual permissions).
- The wild green spaces of Walthamstow Forest Park and Epping Forest, as well as the hidden gem of 'The Doughnut', are all within easy reach anytime you fancy a morning jog, evening stroll, or just getting back to nature.

detailedDescription:
A sumptuously extended and immaculately finished four bedroom terraced house, laid out over three floors with a wonderfully converted loft, vast open plan kitchen and dining room, utility room, twin bathrooms, play room and a lush, green rear garden with a beautifully secluded BBQ area at the end.

Whitehall Gardens itself is a pleasantly peaceful turning with very little through traffic and plenty of open green spaces, including the grand Pimp Hall Nature Reserve, within easy reach.

If you lived here...

You and yours will be spreading out in a wealth of space, more than 1300 square feet in all, from the 170 square foot lounge at the front, to the bright skylit playroom to the rear and the artfully arranged kitchen/diner in between. There's plenty of room for the whole family to do their thing or, alternatively, to host the most demanding of gathering. Design & Decor is smart and stylish throughout, with a royal blue statement chimney breast and engineered oak flooring in the lounge and twin skylights over rose red flooring in the second reception room.

From here you can step directly into the garden, bringing the outside in or simply enjoying the natural vista whatever the weather. Your 150 square foot dining room opens directly up in turn, with more blonde engineered underfoot and the kitchen area set off to one side, resplendent in pristine pine cabinetry, dark quartz effect worktops and handy breakfast bar. Your ground floor's completed by an indispensable utility room, just off the kitchen and perfect for laundry.

Upstairs and your first three bedrooms comprise two substantial doubles and a generous single ideal for a child or home office, according to your preference. All three are brightly finished in white and blonde, with hardwood underfoot and leafy green views. Your family bathroom features a large L-shaped tub and smoky grey letterbox mosaics from tub to ceiling. Finally, your loveable loft conversion provides the bright, 160 square foot penthouse suite, including sparkling en suite shower room.

What else?

- It's just a half mile on foot to Chingford overground station, which'll whisk you to Liverpool Street in just twenty seven minutes. Alternatively, Walthamstow Central is just three stops and nine minutes down for a quick hop onto the Victoria line.
- You have six primary/secondary schools less than a mile away on foot, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including the 'Outstanding' St Mary's Catholic Primary, just a half mile on foot.
- Station Road, starting just nine minutes from your front door, is packed with all the day to day amenities you'll need, from shops to supermarkets and cafes.

detailedDescription:
A great find of a ground floor one bedroom apartment, in the heart of Upper Walthamstow. Sitting in a neat brick fronted purpose built development, a short stroll from Wood Street, this is a perfect first home in a super spot, and an excellent blank canvas waiting for someone to make it their own.

In under fifteen minutes on foot you can be exploring the epic expanses of Epping Forest. The same amount of time will take you into the heart of Walthamstow Village, the ancient part of town filled with exciting places to eat, shop and drink. It's bike-friendly too. Plus you're just over a mile from central Walthamstow, where you'll find the nine-screen Empire Cinema, the famous mile-long high street market and much more.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your hallway and find your bathroom to the left, past some handy built-in storage. Part tiled in white with monochrome vinyl flooring underfoot, it has a traditional white suite and plenty of natural light. Next along is your kitchen, with plenty of pine toned units and contrasting black worktop. The sink sits under the window framing a leafy green view and the backsplash is tiled in white.

Your reception is next, offering a generous 170 square foot of space with plenty of room for relaxing and dining alike. There's hardwearing grey carpet underfoot, and bright white walls. Lastly you'll come to your 130 square foot bedroom, with the same decor and secure double glazed windows as throughout.

It's nine minutes on foot to Wood Street station, where regular Overground trains will see you to Liverpool Street in twenty minutes. Four minutes' stroll and you're on bustling Wood Street, where you'll find everything you need from the Co-op to the post office. There's also a wonderful assortment of unique independent shops and eateries, many to be discovered in the indoor market.

What else?

- Make yourself at home at your new local The Duke E17, where you can sip a frozen cocktail in the beer garden or try your hand at drag bingo.
- You've got a long lease on this property, so that's one box ticked.
- If you have a craving for tacos you'll be happy to find Homies on Donkeys in Wood Street Indoor Market, five minutes away.

From the 20 minute tube ride into Oxford Street to the fact that you don't have to be a Russian Oligarch to afford a family home here. For these reasons and more, people have spent the past few years flocking to E17 and surrounding areas.

address: Greville Road, Walthamstow, Waltham Forest E17
detailedDescription:
The Home

Greville Road is a picturesque Victorian terraced home tucked away on a quiet no through road on the edge of Walthamstow Village. It has been lovingly restored and extended by the current owners over the past ten years as they settled into this flourishing area to raise their little ones. It is now coming to the market in prime condition, with its light-filled, architect-designed kitchen extension, immaculately tended leafy garden, and expansive loft extension ready to embrace its new owners.

Every thought has been given to maximising space in order to enhance family life. Like the generous laundry and WC with marble worktops, encaustic hexagonal tiles and brass taps. The kitchen itself, flooded with natural light, is a showcase for the Walthamstow-founded company Plykea, now world-renowned for delivering beautiful and durable handcrafted products. Top of the range units are positioned around a central island with seating for two. These overlook and flow seamlessly onto a glorious mature garden, an absolute oasis in the city.

This home has been beautifully looked after, offering a new family in Walthamstow everything they will need. The double length living room is light, bright and has ample space to spread into. The open-plan kitchen itself has room for lounging on a sofa, as well as dining space for eight. Upper floors are clean, neutral, and ready to move into. There are five very well-proportioned bedrooms, four of which are doubles, one of which is en suite.

The Neighbourhood

Greville Road itself has an amazing community, with street parties, people making friends for life, and coming together when times get tough. There’s even a WhatsApp group for residents of the street, where you can connect, share info, or borrow a pint of milk. Living on the road feels like joining a group of thoughtful, fun, collaborative people who are always there for each other. Once settled into your new home, you'll find you’re perfectly placed for both Village life and accessing the best of what London has to offer further afield.

Designated a Conservation Area in 1967, Walthamstow Village is one of the oldest and most charming neighbourhoods in London, with a wealth of walks and historic landmarks. The Village is centred around Orford Road, a lovely pedestrianised street with lots of independent shops and restaurants with outdoor dining. Renowned for its foodie destinations like Eat 17, Orford Saloon, and Froth & Rind, the area comes alive on a sunny day. And in the evening you’ll find people playing boules while eating pizza and gelato in the nearby square.

If you're after a laid-back East London vibe, explore the breweries and gin palace of Ravenswood Industrial Estate where you'll discover an eclectic mix of indoor / outdoor drinking venues. The relocation here of neon artist Chris Bracey’s massive collection of work, Gods Own Junkyard, has increased the area’s standing as a centre for art and culture.

On a Sunday afternoon, stroll to the William Morris Gallery, situated in the Grade II listed home of this radical Victorian designer, now devoted to exhibiting his life and work as well as ground-breaking contemporary artists like Grayson Perry. Here, people of all ages take part in a variety of workshops and masterclasses exploring ‘Morris’s design processes and the ideas that informed them’.

The Area

Known as London’s Borough of Culture, Waltham Forest maintains its reputation as a place that values community spirit, music and the arts. From street parties and garden parties to music festivals, Walthamstow is bursting with meaningful cultural activities. And with Epping Forest on your doorstep you can even explore ancient woodlands and enjoy boating and picnicking at Hollow Ponds.

London Overground is a 5-minute walk away, with Wood Street Station taking you to Hackney Central in 10 minutes and Liverpool Street in 20. You can also hop onto the Victoria line at Walthamstow Central, which is 2 minutes on the train from Wood Street or a 15-minute stroll through the Village. From there, you'll reach Highbury & Islington in 13 minutes, King's Cross in 15, and Oxford Circus in less than 20.

If you are looking for a choice of outstanding schools, you’ve come to the right place. Check out St Mary’s, Woodside and Walthamstow Girls. Likewise, Henry Maynard is a place where kids get to express themselves as individuals, with an emphasis on art, the environment and music. Leytonstone School, housed in a beautiful Victorian building, is much loved by the residents of Greville Road. And the nearby Frederick Bremmer featured on an acclaimed Channel 4 documentary.

If this sounds like a life you'd enjoy stepping into, don't hesitate to reach out and get a spot at our Viewings Day on the 10th July. Greville Road won't hang around for long and we look forward to welcoming you!

detailedDescription:

Live Life In Harmony

Stonelea Gardens offers the final stylish new 3 bedroom apartment, set in vibrant Leyton, East London. If you love the idea of living in a quiet residential area, but still want to enjoy the excitement and facilities of one of the world’s greatest cities, then Stonelea Gardens brings you the best of both worlds.

Built to exceptionally high standards and all with private outdoor space, these new homes are centred on a specially created village square. This tranquil development overlooks Langthorne Park and is within walking distance of many beautiful green spaces, including the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, whilst being minutes from Leyton Underground.

The choice of a vibrant neighbourhood or a quiet oasis is one you don’t have to make here - you can have both.

What is Shared Ownership?

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful two bedroom signature Warner style ground floor flat. The property is being sold on a complete chain basis. This Warner design benefits from having its own front door, Shared rear garden as well as the famously flexible layout. As you enter the signature original door you are greeted by a spacious entrance hall that benefits from having already primed flooring ready for your carpets or can be easily removed to expose the beautiful original floorboards. The first room located to the front of the property is a double bedroom which is flooded with natural light from newly fitted sash windows. The second bedroom follows on from the first and once again is complimented with another sizeable sash window. The entrance hall then twists and turns down a corridor and then gives access to the fully fitted kitchen. The kitchen gives access out to the shared rear garden and also benefits from integrated appliances. Following on leads to the beautiful four piece family bathroom that is finished with sparkling mosque vintage tiles with the advantage of underfloor heating and the bonus of a Jacuzzi bath. At the rear of the property you will find the generously sized lounge/diner which over looks the gorgeous landscaped rear garden. Kings Group are acting as sole agents on the property so can only be viewed through us. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity and call today!

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An utterly superb one bedroom garden apartment in a gorgeous Victorian conversion, close to St James Street and Blackhorse Road as well as Walthamstow Wetlands. The generous living space has charm and character to spare, including a large kitchen diner. This is an adorable home in a splendid spot.

You'll never want for a relaxing wander, being under twenty minutes on foot or a quick cycle from the glorious serenity of London's largest nature reserve. And when you'd prefer to leave the birds behind you'll be pleased to find the Crate hub on your doorstep, full of independent businesses offering everything from doughnuts to yoga.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your hallway and find your lounge straight ahead. It's over 165 square foot, with a bay window to the front and a fabulous vintage fireplace. Next along the hall is your bedroom, a perfect 100 square foot space with a view to the garden. Handsome floorboards lie underfoot and there's cornicing to the ceiling. The walls are a cool neutral.

Past the built-in storage you'll find your fantastic 135 square foot kitchen diner, wonderful for relaxing or entertaining alike. Outsize grey tiles lie underfoot, and creamy units are topped by warm wood worktops. To the left beside an exposed brick feature wall is the door out to your private garden. Back through the kitchen is your bathroom, part tiled in creamy metro with a turquoise feature wall. There's a shower over the tub and plenty of natural light. Your WC is handily separated with its own window.

You're just a four minute stroll from St James Street station, where the Overground will take you over the picturesque marshes to Liverpool Street in around fifteen minutes. It's also only half a mile to Blackhorse Road for the superfast Victoria Line. If you're staying local, there are a host of delightful cafes and shops in the area, and you're right at the end of the High Street with its famous mile-long market.

What else?

- Your new local is The Untraditional Pub, home of local craft lager heroes Pillars Brewery.
- There's a nice long lease on this property, so no renewal worries.
- A six minute stroll and you can be choosing new wheels or getting your own ones sorted at the friendly and knowledgeable Walthamstow Cycles.

The tube is 10 minutes away and the overground to Liverpool street less than 5 minutes walk. We will really miss having the wetlands and marshes within walking distance and have also loved exploring all the areas by bike."

detailedDescription: *Guide Price £225,000 - £235,000* This well proportioned two bedroom, top floor apartment is in good condition throughout, in the center of town and is offered to the market chain free. Walking in you find a large reception room awash with natural light and bay window, large master bedroom, second bedroom ideal as a guest room or even a work form home office, separate modern kitchen and a modern bathroom with separate shower. This apartment further benefits from new carpets throughout, feature fireplace in the reception room and master bedroom, excellent storage space, full double glazing and gas central heating. The accommodation has been recently decorated in neutral colours and modern fittings with a tiled kitchen and bathroom. South Woodford Central Line Station is a stroll away making commuting a breeze and the property benefits from easy access to A406 and M11. There is also a wealth of local amenities on your doorstep including a Tesco and a Waitrose within walking distance and ideally located for access to Epping Forest. One of the oldest buildings in Woodford, The George Pub, is located on the corner of the High Road, next door to the Odeon Cinema – a listed building. As you walk towards the central line station you will pass a variety of trendy bars, cafes and restaurants.
