detailedDescription:
Location! Location! Location! We are delighted to offer this spacious two double bedroom split level apartment to the market. Situated in the highly sought-after Queenswood Development, known for its stunning communal gardens and immaculate communal areas. The property is in fantastic condition throughout, including two large double bedrooms, ultra-modern bathroom with bath and separate shower, spacious kitchen with ample storage and an impressive double reception room, filled with natural light. Other benefits include garage en bloc, share of freehold and a long lease in excess of 900 years.

The property offers a convenient location within easy reach of a vast range of amenities, excellent schools and transport links. The nearest supermarkets are tesco (0.8 mi) Sainsburys (0.8 mi) The Co-operative (0.9 mi) Morrisons (0.9 mi) with Lidl and Waitrose also within 2 miles. There is also a range of convenient stores within a 5 minute walk (Aldersbrook (Food & Wine) & Spar Store)

In terms of essentials there is chemist within a 14 minute walk (Woodside Pharmacy) Doctors Surgery within a 10 minute walk (Aldersbrook Medical Centre) Petrol Station within a 1 minute drive (Esso) and Hospital within a 4 minute drive (Heronwood and Galleon Unit) There is also a dry cleaners (Clean Vac) within a 1 minute walk and a Post Office (Leytonstone) within a 3 minute drive.

The nearest mainline station is Leytonstone High Road (0.8 mi) within a 3-minute drive and offers National Rail service to London Liverpool Street. If you require the underground, the nearest Tube is Wanstead (0.7mi) (Entrance B) which is can be reach in under 14 minutes by foot. The nearest bus stop is 0.1 miles away on Queenswood Gardens.

The location boast excellent schools rated good & outstanding by Ofsted including Aldersbrook Primary School (0.3 mi), Davies Lane Primary (0.7 mi), Our Lady of Lourdes Primary School (0.8 mi) Buxton Primary & Secondary School (0.8 mi) Wantstead High School (0.9 mi) Connaught School for girls (1 mi) Forest Gate Community School (1 mi) Leystonstone School (1.2 mi) and St. Angela’s Ursuline (1.6 mi)

The nearest airport is London City Airport (4.2 mi) which can be reached in approximately 14 minute(s) drive, The motorway (J4 off the M11) is just under a 6 minute drive away and East India Pier (4.2 mi) which can be reached in approximately 14 minute(s) drive for ferries and boats.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A characterful and perfectly located two double bedroom Victorian end of terrace that's positively brimming with potential. Here you have twin receptions and a rear garden, plus you're in our coveted neighbourhood of Poets Corner, close to both Walthamstow Central and Lloyd Park, for the best of both worlds.

Named after poets including Milton, Aubrey, Howard and yes, Byron, Poets Corner residents enthuse about the close knit and friendly community which has formed among these peaceful streets. There's a Forest Poets group as well as an Art Trail, so you'll never be short of resident-led cultural events.

If you lived here…

You'll love plunging in and making this unique property sing with your own interior design inspiration. Let's start with your lounge – it's a generous 175 square feet with gorgeous timber floorboards running underfoot, a box bay window, ceiling rose overhead and an original fireplace waiting to be restored to its former glory. Next door the dining room's 145 square foot with more of those floorboards and another hearth – this entire space could be knocked through to make a dual aspect through lounge, depending on your vision.

Step through the garden door here and your outside space is a mix of patio and lawn festooned with mature shrubbery. Some green-fingered attention and landscaping will transform this into quite the leafy oasis. Back inside and the ground floor's completed by a bright kitchen, utility area and bathroom with tub and separate shower cubicle. Lastly, back into the dining room and a door separates the storeys – head up the stairs here and both your bedrooms are bright and generous doubles with built-in storage.

It's just a ten minute walk from your street to Walthamstow Central, meaning you can be at Kings Cross in under half an hour door to door. A speedy cycle down the leafy hill of your street will bring you to our main thoroughfare of Hoe Street where you can join the cycle lane and on to the Q2 Cycleway on Selborne Road to speed you safely straight to the City. Eight minutes on foot and you're in the leafy Village surrounded by an incredible choice of artisan independent shops and eateries. Stroll in the other direction for five minutes and you'll find yourself in Walthamstow's much loved gem of Lloyd Park.

What else?

- Papino Italian Street Food is five minutes from your front door, their spicy arancini fried rice balls Italian sausage, nduja spicy salami sauce and heart of melted mozzarella are out of this world.
- Whenever you feel like treating yourself to some popcorn and a blockbuster, the nine screen Empire Cinema is only seven minutes away on foot.
- There are an incredible twenty nine schools rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted within a mile radius of your new home, including six deemed 'Outstanding'.

Dining Room (4.18m x 3.20m (13'8" x 10'5"))

Garden (7m x 4.5m (22'11" x 14'9"))

Storage

A word from the owners...

"We have lived here for 15 years, in what we feel to be the loveliest area of Walthamstow. This is a quiet, peaceful and safe street with the best neighbours you could ask for. We are surrounded by good schools. The beautiful Lloyd Park is less than a five minute walk away. Just as close is the Feel Good Leisure Centre with its swimming pool, gyms, climbing wall, trampoline park, running track and diving boards. To walk into the Village it's five minutes in the other direction, as are the shopping centre, cinema and train stations.

Honestly, there's too much to list that is great about this place. You can cycle for 10 minutes and be at the marshes which join up with the Olympic Park. You can cycle to Epping Forest in the same time or hop on the train and be there just as quickly.

We've put off moving for so long precisely because this has been the best home and location for our family to be - to the point that we've really outgrown the space now that our children are teenagers. We will be so sad to leve but know that whoever chooses to live here will be very lucky."

title: 2 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
A light and bright two bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a neat brick fronted purpose built development, all sat on a quiet turning in Chingford. Overlooking large communal gardens, close to all amenities and green spaces, this will make a great first home with over 600 square foot of space.

There's lots to recommend here, from on street parking to the expanses of Epping Forest under a mile away. Ridgeway Park is only a four minute walk from your door, and twenty five minutes on foot takes you to Highams Park. There you'll be able to take in spectacular views of the city from the hill, before stopping for tea and cake at Humphry's Cafe.

If you lived here

You'll step into your welcoming carpeted hallway and find your WC straight ahead. Next to that is your part-tiled bathroom, with traditional white suite, mirror cabinet, and shower over the tub. To the left is your first bedroom. It's just under eighty square feet, with biscuit coloured fitted carpet underfoot and lots of natural light.

Your main bedroom is next along, over 120 square foot of space, again with fitted carpet. Then you'll come to your lounge diner, a super 160 square foot space with wall-sized window and soft carpet underfoot. A door to the right opens onto your seventy five square foot kitchen where there's tiling underfoot, a wealth of white units with contrasting black worktops, and a double window.

It's a little over a mile to Chingford Overground, where you can jump on a train and be in Liverpool Street in twenty minutes. If you're driving, it's around four miles to the North Circular. When you're staying local you're handy for north and south Chingford, where you'll find everything from the Co-op to the chippy within twelve minutes' walk.

What else?

- Your new local is the Dovecote, where you can enjoy a brilliant range of drinks in the splendid beer garden.
- There's a long lease here, so no renewal worries.
- There's more green space to explore, with the pretty Pimp Hall Park and nature reserve close by in Friday Hill

address: Warwick Terrace, Lea Bridge Road, London E17
detailedDescription:
A bright one bedroom apartment positively abounding in potential on the top floor of a purpose-built development on Lea Bridge Road. With gorgeous views over the city (you can see Canary Wharf!) and located right by Walthamstow's most sought-after neighbourhoods, this apartment is quite a find.

You're in an enviable sweet spot here with Epping Forest mere moments away and Wood Street station's twenty minute runs to Liverpool Street just half a mile away on foot. Walthamstow Village is just as close; its leafy streets, historic architecture and award-winning wining and dining establishments all within the easiest reach.

If you lived here…

You'll be enjoying a bird's eye view across London, nestling in a home that's just awaiting your interior design flourishes to make it sing. Your lounge is a bright and welcoming space of 135 square feet with sleekly engineered hardwood underfoot, space for dining or home working according to your preference and direct access to your balcony, lengthy, segmented and ideal for a scattering of colourful pots. It's a great spot to admire that vista with a coffee in the morning.

Back inside and the kitchen's smartly finished with a pristine white suite of cabinets and granite effect worktops, while your bedroom's a generous double of over 140 square feet with twin windows overlooking the balcony. Lastly, a long lease means you won't have the hassle of renewing, there's a wealth of storage in the hallway and that secure entryphone system's great for peace of mind.

Leyton Flats and Hollow Ponds are just a five minute stroll away. Take a morning jog, evening stroll or hire a row boat and explore the waterways in the company of feathery friends. It's one of the most relaxing ways we know to spend a summer afternoon. Hungry? We have to recommend Bom Pecado, a Portuguese eaterie belying its humble exterior on your very doorstep. Bom Pecado translates as 'Good Sin' and it's aptly named; their chickpea soup, chorizo bread and custard tarts will have you coming back for more.

What else?

- With on site bike storage, two-wheeled enthusiasts are well catered for here. The C23 cycle route starts from the Bickley Road part of Lea Bridge Road to join the Q2 at Millfields Park and speed you straight to the City.
- Leyton Leisure Centre is just twelve minutes' walk for a gym, swimming pools and fitness classes.
- One of our borough's most famous sons is honoured at the recently refurbished Hitchcock Hotel. Just a five minute cycle away, it's the perfect spot to watch the sun go down over the forest.

Storage

detailedDescription:
Fantastic two bedroom, two bathroom ground floor flat with own rear garden and superb room proportions and no onward chain.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website

Located in a prime sought after position for an easy reach to Highams Park station, road link of the A406, local bus routes and close proximity to the borders of Walthamstow this property is an ideal location for the commuter. Highams Park also offers a main Tesco, various shops and eateries and well as Highams Park lake and plenty of forest land.

This modern build was constructed 6 years ago and we are offering for sale the largest of the units in the block. This property is also the only one with sole access to the spacious rear garden with patios and lawn.

Accessing via a secure entrance, the main door leads into the hallway with storage cupboard.

The large spacious open plan living/kitchen/dining offers plenty of natural light with a bay window to front and patio doors to rear as well as wood flooring. There are a range of fitted white gloss units, integrated oven and hob as well as washing machine and dishwasher. There is also a centre island doubling as work top space and breakfast bar. There is plenty of space for living room furniture and large dining table.

The master bedroom to the front is carpeted with a modern en-suite shower room. The generous large second double bedroom is an L-shaped, carpeted and with patio doors onto the garden.

There is lastly a separate modern bathroom suite.

This is a superb property with enviable room proportions and would make an ideal first time buy with double glazing and gas central heating.

This property is situated in Waltham Forest. It is newly refurbished and can be used as either 3/4 bedrooms. The large extension to the rear gives space for larger families to enjoy this mid terraced Edwardian family home.

The home is also a great opportunity for an investor as rental returns in the region of £2000pcm and just a 10 minutes walk to Stratford Westfield Shopping Centre. The closest stations consist of Maryland Station, and Leytonstone High Road Station both within 0.7 miles. The closest stations consist of Maryland Station, and Leytonstone High Road Station both within 0.7 miles.

The property benefits from two reception rooms, one of which could be used as a ground floor bedroom. There is a single story rear extension which creates a spacious open plan kitchen diner with a range of eye and base level matching units along with a ground floor family bathroom which includes a low level WC, bath with fixed shower attachment and pedestal sink. title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A sumptuously bright three bedroom apartment, recently refurbished and developed to an exacting standard across the top two storeys of a substantial Victorian terrace. You have twin bathrooms and over 900 square feet of living space, all enviably located on a street in the heart of our borough.

You're in a covetable sweet spot here, surrounded by so much that makes Walthamstow so special; wonderful green spaces, excellent schools, tremendous bars and restaurants (including the forthcoming SoHo Theatre Walthamstow) and superb transport links.

If you lived here

You'll be luxuriating in the all the love and care lavished upon the property by the previous owners, with the expertly realised Dormer loft conversion and associated works a little over a year old and the designer kitchen fitted barely months ago. Highlights are numerous but let's start in your 250 square foot reception room, with a designer Starkey brass chandelier overhead and blonde engineered hardwood underfoot, all awash with natural light from the huge bay window and secondary sash.

Next door your first bedroom's an elegantly appointed 130 square foot double, while next door your kitchen gleams in a pristine white suite backed with a flawless white metro tiled splashback and topped with matching marbled work surfaces. The first of your twin bathrooms completes this storey, with some lovely original stained glass over the door and a dedicated corner rainfall shower cubicle. Up the elegant open plan staircase for two more bedrooms, each awash with light thanks to large velux skylights, as well as your second bathroom, a spotless vision in royal blue and white.

Outside and, as noted you have Walthamstow's finest at your fingertips. Walthamstow Central station is less than five minutes on foot and will get you directly to Liverpool Street or Oxford Circus in twenty minutes via the overground and Victoria line respectively (we're at the top of the line here so you'll always get a seat). So not only do you have the City and West End less than half an hour away door to door, but you also have the Empire Cinema entertainment complex (nine screens and half a dozen adjacent restaurants) and the Walthamstow Mall next to the station and right on your doorstep.

What else?

- You have no fewer than twenty nine primary/secondary schools less than a mile away on foot, all rated Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Greenleaf Primary is less than ten minutes' walk.
- There're lots of extras included in the sale, from the wall-mounted TV in the lounge to the solar panels on the roof, saving you money and reducing your carbon footprint.
- Walthamstow Village is just a half mile on foot, for a wonderfully diverse range of independent high end wining and dining establishments. From sumptuous gastropubs to cool cocktail bars, cosy taprooms to luscious restaurants, you're sure to find a favourite.

I feel so lucky to have had this flat and am sure the new owners will feel so too."

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A perfectly pristine one bedroom apartment on the first floor of a period terrace on a tree-lined street in our Coppermill Lane neighbourhood. You have a skylit kitchen/diner, large lounge and the open spaces of Lea Valley Park and Walthamstow Wetlands within easy reach.

Not only that, you're a mere four minute walk from St James Street station and our thriving social hub of Crate St James, where an amazing array of entrepreneurs will tempt your taste buds, provide beauty therapy, trim your beard, provide eco-sustainable solutions and plenty more besides.

If you lived here...

You'll love filling your new home with your own interior design flourishes - it's the perfect blank canvas. The lounge comes in at a huge 155 square feet with a triple bank of windows offering up lush views of your leafy street and filling the space with nourishing natural light. Flawless engineered hardwood flows beneath your feet and there's enough space here for zoning if you need a home working space or extra dining area, as you wish.

Continue through and your bedroom's a generous double with pristine walls and a sash window, while pad across your carpeted hallway to your gorgeous 110 square foot kitchen/diner; it's an exceptional space. Skylit, a constellation of recessed spot lighting overhead, solid timber worktops and a gleaming battleship grey backsplash make it a fine space for hosting. Lastly, to the rear and your bathroom's just as impeccable – dual aspect with a double length shower cubicle and striking black heated towel rail.

Outside and it's worth noting that the surrounding streets of your new home are perfect for cyclists, with the Q2 cycleway accessible from Glenthorne Road (literally around the corner) to safely whizz you to Hackney and the City beyond. St James Street station is four minutes' walk and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty. Alternatively, Blackhorse Road station is just over half a mile on foot and will get you straight to Oxford Circus just as quickly. Walthamstow High Street starts just next door to St James Street station and is home to Europe's longest street market. At the other end you'll find the Mall and Empire cinema plus the many exemplary foodie options of both Hoe Street and the quieter, more esoteric Village.

What else?

- Anytime you fancy firing for those Fitbit goals, Walthamstow Leisure Centre is just a thirteen minute walk away with gym, racquet courts and fitness studio. If weight training is more your thing then Instagram hit Dench Fitness Gym is a six minute stroll away with both indoor and outdoor facilities.
- A long lease means you'll have no renewal hassles; great for peace of mind.
- For your new local may we recommend The Coppermill? It's a great little pub, something of a local institution, and just six minutes away on foot.

There are fantastic green spaces virtually on the doorstep, tennis courts at St James park, Walthamstow Marshes, the Reservoirs and River Lee just down Copper Mill Lane.

The addition of the kitchen skylight has made all rooms in the flat feel light and airy, and the lounge kitchen and bathroom are extremely spacious."

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A brilliantly bright, colourful and characterful two bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a spacious Victorian conversion, with the generous room sizes of the period and plenty of vintage features throughout. You're nicely set back from the road at the front and have a private garden to the rear.

You're also handily located here, with all the many and varied amenities and attractions of Stratford just a fifteen minute stroll away, and the speedy connections of Leyton Central line station just five minutes on foot.

If you lived here...

You'll be enjoying the vintage proportions and original features along with a striking colour scheme throughout. Your front reception comes in at 140 square foot, with broad blonde engineered hardwood underfoot, ornately moulded cornicing over head a cerulean blue statement chimney breast, all awash with light from the large bay window. Next door your first bedroom's plushly carpeted and features its own signature touch with a burnt orange wall.

Moving further in, your kitchen's a bright, simple affair with eggshell blue metro tiled backsplashes and two rows of fitted cream cabinets (home to among other things, a built-in wine fridge) and featuring timber work surfaces. Bedroom two's another double with a Lincoln green backdrop and garden view, while your bathroom's fully tiled from floor to ceiling and features a dedicated corner shower cubicle.

Outside, and East Village is just a half mile on foot. 'London's Coolest Postcode' is the former Olympic Athletes' Village, reimagined and home to a vast array of independent bars, restaurants and cafes as well as everything from gyms to produce suppliers to yoga studios. There's also a wealth of open green spaces, public spaces and pop up events to explore and enjoy, not to mention all the other post-2012 legacy delights of the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.

What else?

- Leyton tube station is five minutes' walk, and will whisk you directly to Liverpool Street in thirteen, putting the City well under a half hour away door to door. Heading to the West End? Tottenham Court Road is just nine minutes further.
- Don't forget your private rear garden; it's an immaculate length of lawn flanked by timber fencing and home to mature greenery and a handy shed.
- For your new local we have to recommend The Leyton Technical, a much loved institution and one of the most sumptuously appointed gastropubs you're likely to see. It's less than a half mile on foot.

"We have absolutely loved living in this flat for the last 4 years! The beautiful south facing garden is great for plants and BBQs, getting sun for almost all of the day. The Leyton Star pub on the corner of the street is great with friendly people and lovely burgers, and there are also many other pubs/restaurants/cafes within a short walking distance in either the East Village, Leyton or Leytonstone. We have loved having both the Olympic Park and the Wanstead Flats in short walking distance, as well as Hackney Marshes and Victoria Park a bit further away for a longer stroll."

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Tucked away on a quiet residential street, this beautiful home is situated on the ground floor of this low-rise, contemporary, and innovative development designed by award winning architects, Gort Scott. The building itself was shortlisted for numerous architecture awards, and with a community feel, it is a very positive place to own your first home!

The apartment itself benefits from being tucked away on the quiet side of the building and at the end of the row, with a fabulous private decked terrace and garden to enjoy bbq’s on a warm summer’s evening or sit and have brunch in the sun. There is also large communal gardens which get the sun for most of the day, so a great place to grow your own vegetables or have a chat with your neighbours.

This newly decorated home is designed with modern living in mind, it features an open-plan living area which is a great social space for entertaining, a good sized double bedroom with a built in, full height wardrobe giving ample storage and stunning floor to ceiling windows throughout for maximum natural light, so working from home is a pleasure. The apartment features a modern fitted bathroom with a walk-in shower, vanity drawers and towel rail. This well designed home is very energy efficient with modern insulation keeping running costs low so central heating use is kept to a minimum. Other features include a fully fitted modern kitchen with soft closing hinges, cooker, hob, fridge freezer, integrated full-sized dishwasher, lots of storage and wooden floors throughout.

The apartment is positioned close to all the great things Walthamstow has to offer, with the beautiful Lloyd Park a stones throw away, along with breweries, coffee shops, food markets and the Empire cinema all within close walking distance. If you crave outdoors then Walthamstow wetlands and Epping forest are also close by for long walks in nature. With the Victoria Line at Walthamstow Central and Blackhorse Road both a 10 min walk away you can also be in central London very easily.

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

Wonderlease are delighted to present to the market for sale this charming two bedroom flat within a purpose built block in Walthamstow. This property includes a generous lay out of accomodation featuring two double bedrooms, spacious light and airy reception room, fitted kitchen and modern family bathroom. The property also benefits from ample storage including a separate storage room located on the ground floor.

Ideally located for commuters and the fantastic local amenities of Walthamstow, Stocksfield Road is 0.1 miles away from Wood Street Overground Station which will take you Liverpool Street Station within 18 Minutes. The property is also easily accesible to the famous Walthamstow Village which boasts its generous selection of pubs, cafes, restaurants and boutiques.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Viewings Saturday 10th July - By Appointment Only

This beautiful 3 double bedroom Victorian house is set on a quiet cul-de-sac with a pocket park maintained by local residents. The house boasts 3-metre-high ceilings to the ground floor and lots of original features which have been tastefully renovated.

It is located on the Walthamstow / Leyton borders within walking distance to Walthamstow Underground Station (Victorian Line), Leyton Midland Overground Station and bus links into the City at the end of the street via Lea bridge Rd.

The home enjoys a large open plan living area, downstairs w/c, cloak room, a spacious kitchen diner and access to a large cellar. The first floor has a large airy landing, with 3 double bedrooms and an airing cupboard. The family bathroom has stunning honed marble tiles with underfloor heating and a separate Italian style shower enclosure.

The beautiful house is ready for a family to move into and also offers up the possibility of extending the side return and full double loft conversion for a further 2 double en-suite bedrooms (STPP).
Out and about


Gnarly Vines - Natural wine shop & bar in Bakers Arms, Walthamstow
Brooks Farm and Jack Cornwell Park-a Park and a farm less than 30 seconds away! Great for the kids.
Francis Road - Tons of independent shops, studios, restaurants and cafes. Good vibes.
Host - Mixed use space for hire; workshops, events and photography studio.
Perky Blenders - Premium coffee roasters and a space to chat and meet friends.
Chatsworth Road - A short walk across Hackney marshes, Chatsworth Road has an abundance of cafes, pubs, restaurants and a fantastic Sunday market.
Hare and Hounds - lovely pub with great burgers, live music, comedy and an all-weather beer garden.
Leyton Jubilee Park - Great facilities for sports and recreation and a natural meadow during the summer. Grab a coffee from the cafe or an ice lolly on a hot summer’s day.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This charming four bedroom terraced home, offering bright and airy living on a sought after residential turning in Leytonstone, is ideally situated within good access of Leytonstone Central Line tube station, yet only a short stroll away from the popular pedestrianised Francis Road, which hosts a variety of independent eateries and boutique shopping.

Comprising: This spacious home invites you in via gated front garden and gleaming entrance hallway with solid wood parquet flooring, which will first lead you into the large bay fronted through-lounge. Complete with wooden shutter blinds to the bay, feature fireplace and fitted carpets, this reception room creates the perfect space to relax and entertain family and friends.

Just along from the through-lounge is the roomy kitchen / diner, which has been adorned with sleek fitted wall and base units, wooden work surface, integrated oven & hob and feature fireplace to the dining area, a great spot within this home to cook up and serve your favourite dishes. The dining area also leads out into the garden, providing easy access when dining alfresco.

Upstairs and onto the first floor you will locate a great size bay fronted main bedroom, complete with chic fitted wardrobes, two further good size bedrooms and a fourth bedroom, great for use as a home office / nursery. There is also an attractive bathroom suite locate to the first floor, a serene space to unwind after a long day.

Externally: This property boasts access into an easy to maintain, mainly decked, garden with shrub borders.

In Addition:

- Cellar with plug points

- Fully insulated and boarded loft, great for storage

- Potential to convert loft space subject to relevant planning permission

- Great access to Leytonstone High Road Rail station

- Good access to main shopping areas in Leytonstone & Leyton

- Close to local amenities & eateries

- Road links incl. A12, A406 & M11

- Transport links into Westfield Stratford & East Village

- 19 Schools & Colleges rated either 'Outstanding' or 'Good' by Ofsted located within a mile radius

Freehold

Gated front garden

Bright & airy hallway

Bay fronted main bedroom

Two further good-size bedrooms

Fourth bedroom ideal as a home office / nursery

Fitted carpets

Wood flooring

Double glazing

Gas central heating

EPC Rating D

Note from Owner: "We had seen over 60 houses before we viewed this one and the moment we stepped over the threshold we were home. We had 9 happy years growing our family here before we moved abroad. This is a really neighbourly street - we got to know everyone during a rain-soaked Jubilee celebration. Perfectly located for Leytonstone High Rd, Francis Rd and the 399 bus offers a door to door ride to Westfield & the Olympic Park."

Viewing by appointment via Theydons

The popular development of KIngswood Court gives access to local amenities including shops, bank, post office and gp surgeries. Outside the development there is a Bus Stop which takes you to Walthamstow Central for the market, mall or Victoria line.
Kingwood Court was constructed by McCarthy & Stone (Developments) Ltd and comprises 44 properties arranged over 3 floors each served by lift. detailedDescription:
Close to both South Woodford Station and Snaresbrook Central Line stations' (0.4 and 0.5 Miles respectively) as well as both George Lane shops and Wanstead High Street, both with an eclectic mix of bars, bistros and shops, this property is close to all local amenities. A few hundred yards away there is also a small parade including a corner shop and fantastic local restaurants, including the Ark fish restaurant and ever popular Sakura sushi and buns.

The property itself sits on a deep plot with an impressive gated frontage providing parking for several cars. The double height bay with sash windows, exposed brick frontage and ornate double entrance door all creating a memorable first impression. Once inside the high ceilings, naturally bright rooms and grand proportions cannot fail to impress, with the double reception room spanning just under 30 feet and currently housing a good sized sofa suite and large library area. Behind the reception there is a generous separate utility room with adjoining W.C providing plenty of space for washer/dryer, large double butler sink and a range of cabinets. The direct side access to the utility makes the space ideal for the convenient removal of household waste and ideal boot room for muddy boots or pets. The kitchen diner to the rear also provides plenty of storage as well as space for a six seater dining table, however there is further potential to increase the floor space and re-design the kitchen by way of rear extension if desired (stpc). There is also a handy cellar accessible from this floor.

To the first floor there are three double bedrooms, the largest enjoying the wide bay frontage and rear bedroom having the advantage of an adjoining dressing room. The family bathroom also has plenty of room to house a roll top bath and separate shower. The loft has been converted to provide a master bedroom with bespoke cabinetry providing plenty of storage space and modern en-suite shower room. The rear West facing garden is equally as spacious and impressive as the house measuring approximately 123 feet in length and enjoying the afternoon sun until late evening. With a large patio area accessible immediately from the kitchen/diner and leading down to a beautifully maintained lawn and large outbuilding the garden is practical and easy to maintain but also provides a new owner the option to further landscape to their own requirements given the generous size and favourable facing.

Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful two bedroom flat. The apartment is situated on the first floor of a gated security office controlled complex. The apartment complex itself is in immaculate condition. The apartment includes access to private residents only gymnasium, as well as a concierge office at the entrance. This apartment benefits from a spacious open plan kitchen and living area which has a fully fitted kitchen, with built oven and cooker. To compliment this open plan living, the property also benefits from French doors leading into the balcony that overlooks in to the ever so green tranquil communal gardens. This apartment also benefits from having two double bedrooms and a family bathroom including a bath and a shower attachment. The property is fully double glazed and has gas central heating. The property is situated a stone's throw away from Wood Street Station, and the very popular Wood Street shopping parade which consists of shops pubs, restaurants as well as an indoor Georgian market. This is an ideal opportunity for a first time buyer to get on the ladder or for an investor looking for a property with a good rental yield.

detailedDescription:
Well-presented and spacious first-floor Victorian conversion. Featuring original period features, two well proportioned double bedrooms, and a large reception room.
The property is being sold with no onward chain, with a share of freehold and the opportunity to convert the large loft space. The freehold also means there is no ground rent or service charges to pay.
The property features double glazed sash windows throughout, central heating and very affordable permit parking.
Located just a short walk from the green open spaces of Wanstead Flats and the Olympic Park. The property is also a short twenty-minute stroll or a seven-minute cycle from Westfield Stratford City, with its plethora of shops and restaurants.
The Rookwood Village pub is only at the end of the road, opening up in July 2020 with craft beers, interactive darts and ping pong.
The property boasts excellent transport links with Leyton Central Line Station a 12 minutes walk away and Maryland Crossrail station 10 minutes away, taking just 10 minutes to Liverpool Street station or 21 minutes to Paddington. When Crossrail opens in 2022, it will also allow direct travel further afield to Essex in the east and Berkshire in the west.

detailedDescription:
***guide price £675,000 - £700,000***
This superbly presented three bedroom two bathroom Victorian terraced house has been recently refurbished and is located on St Marys Road, one of Leytons premium streets because of its close proximity to Leyton High Road, Francis Road and Leyton Central Line Tube station.
The spacious accommodation comprises of three good sized bedrooms, two reception rooms, two bathrooms and a stunning kitchen.
The property has been extensively refurbished throughout to include high quality wood effect flooring downstairs and a mix of wood flooring and carpet upstairs, the colour scheme is bright and modern but the finishing touches are what really make this property, for example the radiators in the lounge are stunning, the fully fitted modern kitchen has top of the range appliances, hi white gloss units and granite work tops, both bathrooms have a full size shower cubicle with the beautifull main bathroom also offering a very attractive bath.
St Marys Road is exceptionally well located and is just a minutes walk to the popular Francis Road, which is home to such eateries as Marmelo Kitchen with its unique menu and dining arrangements, The Albert and Francis Cafe which offers a delightful selection including Tea, Coffee, Cakes, sandwiches and the Yard Arm which specialises in craft wine, beer and other delicacies. There are also other attractions such as Coronation Gardens and Sidmouth Park.
Leyton Central Line station is just a few minutes away, allowing fantastic access to Central London, Stratford International station, Westfield Shopping Center, East Village and Docklands.
Perfect for the City commuter!

detailedDescription:
A sleekly appointed and expertly arranged two bedroom apartment, laid out over two storeys of a Victorian terrace, just moments from our main thoroughfare of Lea Bridge Road. You have almost 700 square feet of living space over both floors, twin bathrooms and an ingeniously developed, bright and skylit loft.

Located between Walthamstow and Leyton, here the best of both boroughs is within walking distance. Closer still is Leyton Jubilee Park, less than a half mile away on foot, with the vast natural openness of Hackney Marshes and the Middlesex Filter Beds Nature Reserve beyond.

If you lived here...

You'll be luxuriating in a handsome suite of rooms, with your 180 square foot front reception a particular highlight – perfect for hosting with that large bay window flooding the soft cream walls with light, it's also an ideal breakfast spot. Next door bedroom two's a solid double finished in more tranquil tones and with a leafy green view.

Your kitchen's neatly finished with a generous set of smart cream fitted cabinets home to a full complement of integrated appliances with smoky cream floor tiling running underfoot. Elsewhere, the first of your two bathrooms is tiled from floor to ceiling in elegant smoky grey with a dedicated shower cubicle. Upstairs, your second bedroom comes in at over 100 square feet, dual aspect and skylit, with an especially striking en suite, with its own skylight and timeless Lincoln green metro tiles.

Outside Lea Bridge station is just fifteen minutes on foot and is your gateway to London, with the vast onward connections of Stratford just one stop and ten minutes away. From here you have all sorts of underground and overground and destinations, not to mention 'London's Coolest Postcode' of East Village, all the post-2012 legacy delights of the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, as well as the shopping and leisure colossus of Westfield. You can be strolling the broad promenades just a half hour after stepping out your front door.

What else?

- For your new local you can't do better than The Hare & Hounds, a wonderful gastropub just five minutes walk away where the menu is as delectable as the decor.
- At a huge 995 years, the lease won't cause you any renewal worries whatsoever.
- Cyclists have a still more transport options within easy reach, Leyton Central line station, Walthamstow Central for the Victoria line and St James Street for the overground are all around five to ten minutes away on two wheels.

Lounge/Dining Room (4.27m x 3.99m (14'0" x 13'1"))

Bedroom (2.55m x 3.35m (8'4" x 10'11"))

Kitchen (1.70m x 3.39m (5'6" x 11'1"))

Bathroom (0.95m x 3.24m (3'1" x 10'7"))

Bedroom (2.33m x 4.66m (7'7" x 15'3"))

Storage

Eaves Storage

A word from the owner...

"A modern and excellently presented two bedroom two bathroom apartment, set over two storeys of a Victorian conversion. Just minutes from the Lea Bridge Road and close to the shops and amenities of Chatsworth Road.
This property has been recently, lovingly renovated and benefits from a new en suite loft extension with a new roof and dormer, brand new double glazing throughout the property, and a new heating system. Light and airy throughout, this is a charming home in a vibrant part of East London.
You have great local schools and parks on your doorstep, with Jubilee Park just 5 minutes' walk from the front door, and Hackney and Walthamstow Marshes minutes away by car. You're also in a great spot for transport links with a number of bus routes right outside taking you into the city, the Central Line located within a mile, as well as Overground stations nearby, and National Rail Stations. Resident parking zones are in operation (Zone gs) to
ensure that if you have a car, you can secure a spot close to your new home."

This wonderful period terrace property boasts huge curb appeal and is located on a quiet tree lined street, which has an incredible sense of community. On the first floor you'll find three well-proportioned bedrooms, a fitted bathroom and access to the loft where many along the street have converted the space in to two further bedrooms and an additional bathroom.

This enviable location has a great community feel and is a short walk from The Village. It is in a perfect position to enjoy a wide selection of eateries, pubs, and independent shops. The transport links are excellent being a short 12 minute tree lined walk to Walthamstow Central Station with regular busses on the Lea Bridge Road that whisk you to the Olympic Park or Westfield Shopping Centre.

address: Albion Terrace, Sewardstone Road, London E4
detailedDescription:
*guide price £375,000 - £400,000* viewing Saturday 10th July* call now*
A beautifully presented, two double bedroom period home with garden and access to excellent local schooling.

A pleasantly spacious, two double bedroom, period family home set just moments from Epping Forest and excellent local schooling.
Set behind a picket fence enclose front garden, the first impression on entering the property is just how much space there is. The through reception room measures in excess of 22' and provides bright and airy accommodation ideal for families and entertaining. Moving through, the kitchen is fully fitted with wall and base units, and has door out to a sunny 36' rear garden with a perfect Westerly aspect.
Finally, a utility area offers flexibility for washing machine etc and the three piece bathroom suite is modern and benefits from a window giving excellent ventilation.
Upstairs, each of the bedrooms is a comfortable double (master with feature fireplace and views across green belt).
Albion Terrace is a small terrace of Victorian cottages set on Sewardstone Road that runs North/South from Chingford, out to the M25 (approx 4 miles) and historic Waltham Abbey. Locally there are several highly regarded local schools including outstanding Yardley Lane and the popular Chingford Foundation and Heathcote.
Station Road is the local high street, here you will find a broad mix of independent and national brands, coffee shops and a twice monthly local market. Additionally, Chingford Station (tfl 5) gives access to the City and West End in less than 30 minutes, making the work commute a breeze.

This is a fantastic opportunity to own a rare to the market extended five bedroom Victorian mid-terraced house on the sought-after Scotts Road, Leyton

You will be immediately impressed as you approach the property with its re-pointed brickwork and appreciate its many period features

Upon entering the ground floor you will enjoy a spacious through lounge and large kitchen/diner which measures an impressive 18'8 x 10'3! The kitchen benefits from underfloor heating and bi fold doors that lead directly onto the sunny rear garden which is a perfect size for entertaining guests.

The first floor features two double bedrooms, a single bedroom/office room and a four piece bathroom suite with utility room.

The loft extension has been done a to a high standard which was a bespoke project to ensure the extension felt part of the house and gives a sense of space that parades throughout the whole property. It features an additional two bedrooms and a three piece shower suite.

The property is offered to the market with no onward chain

Location
Located within short walking distance to the ever popular Francis Road which continues to grow with a fantastic selection of artistic independent shops, bars and cafes. Stratford City and Westfield shopping centre is also only a few stops on the tube or short drive away. The property has access to great transport links with Leyton Midland Road (London Overground) being just 0.2 miles away. Leyton Station on the central line is also just under 0.7 miles away which has direct access into the City of London. Walthamstow (Victoria line) is also just a short bus ride away.

detailedDescription:
Located on Bushwood, Leytonstone's most desirable road, this stylish split level, top floor studio flat provides easy access to the green spaces of Epping Forest, while its close proximity to both Leytonstone tube and High Road Overground station give convenient access for those wishing to commute.

Located on Bushwood, Leytonstone's most desirable road, this stylish split level, top floor studio flat provides easy access to the green spaces of Epping Forest, while its close proximity to both Leytonstone tube and High Road Overground station give convenient access for those wishing to commute.

As you approach the property housing this fantastic top floor studio, you'll note a large driveway providing off-street parking for residents, as well as the vibrant green door welcoming you into the communal entranceway.

Heading up the internal shared stairs, enter your beautifully presented studio flat through your front door and you'll find yourself in your spacious kitchen/diner. Not only is this room generously sized, but it's been furnished with a spectacular range of lower and wall-mounted units, providing ample storage for your pots, crocks and food items. The light colouring of the units, tiling and décor is offset by the sprawling black worktops and lovely wooden-style laminate flooring for a fresh yet homely atmosphere. There's a fitted oven, hob and cooker hood, and plenty of space for a good-sized dining table and chairs.

A fantastic additional feature to this area is the quirky and incredibly convenient additional space built into the side wall and entered by way of a small step. This cute little cubby-hole is the ideal area to use for a dressing table or small office space – a brilliant addition to an already perfectly serviceable studio.

With the kitchen/diner built on the higher level of this split studio, you enter the main living/sleeping area by heading down an attractive set of small, curved steps – the banisters separating the areas are another lovely feature here, helping to create a divider between this otherwise open-plan studio.

The light, bright décor and wooden-style flooring continue into the living and bedroom area, with dual aspect windows helping to add to the fresh and airy vibe. There's plenty of room for a comfy double bed and a good-sized lounge suite – the current owners have chosen a corner sofa to best make use of the size and shape of this gorgeous room. The addition of a large fitted sliding wardrobe/cupboard will prove super-handy for storing away your clothes and other belongings.

Just behind the small flight of stairs leading back up into the kitchen, you'll note the door that takes you into the beautiful bathroom. Bright, modern and fresh, this monochrome masterpiece is the ideal place to relax after a busy day, with room for a small storage unit and your wash basket, plus a handy towel rail over the radiator.

While the interior of this sophisticated studio flat is impressive in itself, one of the big benefits of making it your new home is the huge communal back garden. A large lawn with several seating options set up for you to enjoy, the established hedges and shrubbery give this a real country feel despite its location in the London suburbs! A small pathway at the rear of the garden takes you to a more private little bench surrounded by trees and shrubs – a perfect spot for some quiet contemplation or sitting in the sun with a good book.

This gorgeous studio flat is also a stone's throw away from Bushwood's gorgeous green spaces which lie literally opposite the property, and the natural expanses of Wanstead Flats and parkland a little further beyond. For those day-to-day essentials, you can walk to the busy high road and surrounding area in 5-10 minutes, where you can access an Argos, Matalan, Post Office, a gym, a McDonald's and both a Tesco superstore and an Express. Popular and friendly local pubs like The Birds and The North Star are also a short stroll away, and there are plenty of fabulous restaurants and takeaways to suit any culinary tastes. The Leytonstone Ex-serviceman's Club is a hidden gem, hosting live music events throughout the year.

Owners Comments... 'This is a lovely, light flat across the road from Epping Forest and a five-minute walk from the cafes and shops of Leytonstone High Road. The neighbours have always been friendly and I found it a very peaceful place to live. I was always discovering new delights, including The North Star pub, which is like stepping back in time and is just around the corner'.

Located to the right of the hall is the good size bedroom complete with wood laminate flooring and built-in wardrobes, perfect for neatly storing away all of your clothing and accessories. Then to the left of the hall is the attractive bathroom suite.

Working your way along the hall you will next arrive at the sleek fitted kitchen, which has been finished to include integrated appliances including oven & hob, chic tiled surround and under unit lighting, creating a lovely space to cook up your signature dishes.

Lastly located at the end of the hall is the spacious living / dining area, a great space to sit back and catch up with family and friends.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £850,000 to £900,000.
Superb four bedroom, two bathroom extended semi with garage, backing onto forest.

To book a viewing online please visit our website

Located in the heart of Upper Walthamstow on a residential no through road within 0.5 miles of Wood Street mainline station and the trendy bars and cafes on Wood Street itself, this property is well positioned for transport links by train or road links via the A406 or the A12. The property also has a fantastic benefit of backing onto the forest with direct gated access at the rear of the garden.

This well maintained family home has been extended at the rear behind the garage and into the loft space and has the potential to extend to the side on dual level (subject to usual consents).

Ground Floor

The ground floor accommodation commences with an entrance porch to hallway with stairs to first floor and understairs storage.
The front reception room offers a separate lounge with bay window and carpet to floor.
There is a second reception room with bay to rear with double doors to the garden, feature fireplace and wood flooring ideal for a dining room.
The extended kitchen diner has a modern contemporary white gloss units, wooden work tops, fitted oven and hob, tiled flooring, double doors to garden and door to garage.

First Floor

The first floor has a good size double bedroom to the front with bay window, a second good size double bedroom with bay window to rear, a third single bedroom with bay window, all with carpet to floor.
The family bathroom has a bath and sink, tiling to walls and window to rear. There is a separate WC with window to side.
The first floor landing has stairs leading to the second floor.

Second Floor

The second floor houses a loft conversion with a landing with window, a generous double bedroom with skylight window to front, dormer window to rear and eaves storage and carpet to floor.
There is a second shower room accessed from the landing with shower cubicle, sink and WC, tiled walls and window.

Rear Garden

The fabulous landscaped rear garden offers a an array of features and is sectioned with a raised decked area with sunken pond, lawn with raised beds, ample growing areas, flower and shrub borders and rear access onto the forest.

Front Garden

The front garden is sectioned into a small garden section with plants and shrubs and a paved driveway.

Garage

The double length garage to side has double doors to front, power and light and rear door to the kitchen.

detailedDescription:
A Chain free sale. A delightful, well looked-after modern three double bedroom, two-bathroom town house with two outdoor spaces in which to relax and enjoy your surroundings. Situated within a quiet mews it’s easy to forget you are only moments from Walthamstow Village, and a short walk to both Queens Road and Walthamstow Central stations. EPC grade B rating an impressive energy efficient house. Just add solar panels and have a completely carbon neutral home.

The front of the property is accessed via a private driveway and a well cared for gardens. This property is being sold without parking but there is a shared space within the mews which has a large secure cycle rack, stylish lighting and parking bays for guests and deliveries.

The house has a fully fitted kitchen with high-spec integrated appliances at the front, and an open-plan living area to the rear. The lounge diner area has wooden flooring, and expansive bifold doors delivering a seamless flow out to the rear garden - a space perfect for entertaining. Sitting off the main entrance hallway there is also a sizeable downstairs toilet.

The upper two floors house the bedrooms and bathrooms. On the first floor are two bright, generously proportioned double bedrooms and the main family bathroom. Whilst on the second floor you will find a separate shower room and the spacious master bedroom complete with large sliding doors leading onto a private roof terrace.

This house is perfectly located to access vibrant Walthamstow Village, meaning that many of the popular eateries of Orford Road (Orford Saloon, Queens Arms, Parish Wines, Village Kitchen and Eat 17) are within a 10 minute walk. It’s also brilliantly located for the more culturally enriched Hoe Street, where there is a superb selection of eateries, and drinking spots.

Please note that this property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with Traditional auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer-friendly method of purchase. We do not require the buyer to exchange contracts immediately, but grant 28 days to achieve exchange of contracts from the date the buyer's solicitor is in receipt of the draft contracts and a further 28 days thereafter to complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 3.6% (inclusive of VAT) subject to a minimum of £6,000 (inclusive of VAT) which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to sign an Acknowledgment of Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Legal Pack which can be downloaded for free from the auction section of our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by Douglas Allen powered by iam-sold Ltd.

detailedDescription:
It’s very rare to view apartments that immediately feel like a home. Offered with “Share of Freehold” viewings are highly recommended for home hunters looking to secure a mid/long term home.!.

A visually stunning Boutique Development of 9 Architecturally designed 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments, located in the heart of the popular E10 postcode and only a 5 minute walk to Leyton shops and underground.

As part of the design development process every detail has been creatively designed with you as the new home owners in mind. Once you are happy with how you have positioned your personal furniture, specifications include architecturally designed, unique black brickwork with contrasting large glass panels allowing home owners to enjoy the natural elements to be part of your everyday living.

The visually stunning communal courtyard allows residents to create a real community living experience, video entry system for added security, bespoke communal lighting offers a balanced and well thought out creative ambiance for those summer and winter evenings, going green easy to use bicycle racks, high quality “Otis” engineered lift and lots of terraces, balconies and central courtyard for all residents to enjoy.

Internally each apartment is unique with well thought out living spaces and linear shaped rooms which is always an Architectural design challenge. Extra height ceilings compliment the floor to ceiling glass panelled windows which really allow the owners to feel the space each apartment have to offer. With glass bifold doors, skylights, engineered oak flooring in main living spaces, lush carpets in the bedrooms and ceramic flooring in the bathrooms the layers of different materials really come together and complement each space...

Further benefits include underfloor heating, quartz worktops providing a quality stone finish to the fully fitted kitchens, integrated smeg appliances including washing machine, dishwasher & double height fridge freezer. Each bathroom and en-suite include quality fixtures & fittings, power shower and floor to ceiling tiles with ample storage space. Rest assured the finish is exceptional, with attention to detail considered at every stage with you “the end user” as the Architects main design brief.

Well-proportioned in size each of the apartments feels spacious with well thought out design and incorporate additional private outdoor spaces, whether a balcony or terrace, as well as access to a delightful communal garden to the rear which caters for a real community vibe where residents can interact and really get to know each other as a new lifestyle concept usually seen in London’s affluent locations such as Knighstbridge or Kensington and the busy financial district like Liverpool Street or Canary Wharf.

Without doubt this is set to become one of the classiest local developments in the E10 postcode and one of the very best new build developments we have seen in Leyton for a while.

Living Here...

The location of this unique development is convenience itself. The many bars, eateries, and other independent businesses on Francis Road and the High Road are a short stroll away and offer the perfect excuse to indulge in some great food and wine. Why not nip into Yardarm for a bottle of wine for that night in, or maybe to Marmelo for dinner. If it’s just a meet up with friends, then the Coach & Horses is your local, with the Technical and Leyton Star also close by. All serve a mean pint and equally delicious food.

Hopping on to the bus or tube is very easy. Weather your travelling to the City or Westfield, where you can hit a shop or two for retail therapy, catch a film at the cinema, or take the plunge in the Olympic Pool. If football’s your thing, then the Os and the Hammers are both close by, whilst Leyton Cricket Ground is around the corner if your prefer your sports at a more leisurely pace.

Want to go further afield? The excellent local transport links mean you are just a short journey from central London (which is also very convenient for the daily commute). So whatever you are planning, be it fun or work, we think Leyton is the place for you.

Help to buy government backed scheme available, offered with Share of Freehold viewings are highly recommended and this opportunity really suits home owner occupiers looking for a long term home.

Dimensions:

– Kitchen/Living/Dining: 8.22m x 3.73m
– Bedroom 1: 4.64m x 3.00m
– Bedroom 2: 3.54m x 2.56m
– Bathroom: 2.13m x 1.97m

detailedDescription:
4 bedroom family home!

Kings of Chingford are delighted to offer to the market this immaculately presented four bedroom terraced family home.

The ground floor boasts and open plan living/dining room leading to the adjoining conservatory. The kitchen has been finished with cream base and eye level units, black metro tile splash backs and roll top work surfaces.

To the first floor you have two superb size double bedrooms and a spacious single. The bathroom is separate from the toilet and has been finished with a freestanding roll top bath and modern white hand basin.

To the second floor this property benefits from excellent size loft conversion with Juliette balcony and ensuite complete with corner shower enclosure.

To the front you have a well maintained walled garden space. To the rear you have a lovely private, partially paved, partially laid to lawn garden with rear access and a garage and additional parking space.

This capacious property is ideal for families, situated in a convenient location just a short walk to local amenities and a 10 min drive to Highams Park train station.

Call our office now to arrange your viewing and avoid disappointment.

detailedDescription:
A big, bold, brick-fronted, family home shaped opportunity—packed with original features, character and potential, in one of the most sought after addresses in the buzzing community of Walthamstow, just a short walk from Central Station.

Right on your imposing, charcoal doorstep, you’ll have a delicious variety of independent cafes, shops and restaurants in the cultural hub of Walthamstow Village. But no-through traffic on Howard Road means you’ll also feel gently removed from all the hubbub.
Inside the classic exterior the reception rooms are large and filled with natural light from the wooden sash windows, the original fireplaces pulling the focus in each room. The kitchen is light and open, designed for big cooking, big dining and big dancing. French doors lead out to the 40 ft rear garden, rich with established shrubs, and where you'll also find rear access provision for off street parking.

The bedrooms are roomy doubles, full of light with original features, the largest has the luxury of a separate dressing room and an ensuite bathroom. Both the bathrooms are modern and well-fitted.
This family home combines the classic and the contemporary with the potential to extend to the rear and into the loft space STPP. A lovely space waiting to be transformed into a Walthamstow showstopper—close to schools, museums, sports, culture and acres of local green spaces. How would you enhance this home? Come and take a look.

In The Owners Words...

We will miss this beautiful house filled with space and light. We initially chose it so we could hold little concerts and art exhibitions here and we’ll miss being part of the wonderfully creative E17. Our friends and family are upset that we are selling the home they also felt was theirs and we are only parting with what would have been our forever home because we are leaving London. It is a peaceful house in a street so quiet that you can sleep with the windows open, wake up to birdsong and watch the birds fledge from the kitchen window. We will miss our neighbours and feeling part of the Hilltop community that exemplifies the friendliness and helpfulness of a genuine neighbourhood. We are only the second family to have lived here and whoever lives here next will be very lucky.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An exceptionally spacious and brilliantly located first floor flat on Francis Road.

Stretching to over 1000 square feet, this property is larger than most flats in the area. To the front is a well proportioned, bay windowed lounge reception room, with plenty of space to both dine and relax. Next to it is the smallest of the bedrooms, which is a single, but would also make a fantastic home office or study.

Behind the reception room, off the landing, is the man bedroom. A solid double, it is rear aspect and has room for free standing storage in the alcoves of the chimney breast.

The rear half of the property contains the kitchen, bathroom and final bedroom. The kitchen is galley in layout, with fitted units ranged in parallel along two ways, whilst the bathroom is fully tiled and features a three piece suite. Rounding things off is that final bedroom.

Living Here...

We seriously think Francis Road and it’s surrounding streets are the epicentre of all things E10. What else could it be, when literally everything you need is on your doorstep? Yardarm is the place to go for a bottle of wine or some delicious charcuterie (Dan and Eliza are always happy to help with recommendations). Aimee at Phlox Books is an encyclopaedia of literary knowledge (pun intended!) and the coffee in there is top notch too, as it is at Strange Brew. If the house needs brightening up, then Helen at Edie Rose is the perfect person to help with all things floral, whilst Lucie and Tiff at Venner always have the perfect thing, whether for yourself or as a gift . And that’s before we even mention the wonderful Sunday roasts at the Coach & Horses and Leyton Technical, or the proximity of Sidmouth Park and Coronation Gardens if you fancy a stroll, plus of course the convenience of Leyton Central line station just around the corner when work beckons. What more could you possibly ask for....?

detailedDescription:
Offered chain free, this beautifully presented four bedroom terraced home, which has been recently refurbished to a high standard to accommodate bright and airy living, is superbly situated within walking distance of Leytonstone High Road, yet within good access of both Leyton & Leytonstone Central Line tube stations.

Comprising: This elegant property welcomes you in via enclosed storm porch, leading you into the bright entrance hallway and then further into the spacious bay fronted through-lounge. Adorned with wood flooring and striking exposed brick chimney with feature alcove, this living area is the perfect space to sit back, relax and enjoy the company of family and friends.

Just along from the through-lounge is the bright and airy kitchen / diner, which has been completed to include sleek fitted wall and base units, integrated appliances and chic tiled surround, a beautiful room to spend your time cooking up your signature dishes. The dining area is a great extension of the fitted kitchen and lends itself into the rear garden via double doors, helping to invite the outside in and creates an ideal space to host dinner parties and Summer BBQ's.

Upstairs and onto the first floor you will locate a great size main bedroom to the front of the property, which also has a charming exposed brick-work chimney and feature alcove. Then moving along the first floor you will also find a good size second bedroom and stunning bathroom suite with superb walk-in shower.

Up and into the second floor loft conversion you will firstly arrive at a good size third bedroom with three skylights to the ceiling, helping to fill the space with an abundance of light. There is also a fourth bedroom to the loft conversion, great for use as a home office and then lastly there is a convenient shower room suite.

Externally: This property hosts an easy to maintain garden with laid to lawn and patio seating areas, a lovely outdoor space to enjoy the warmer months.

In Addition:

- Great access to Leytonstone High Road Rail station

- Transport links into Stratford City, Westfield & East Village

- Road links incl. A12, A406 & M11

- 17 Schools and Colleges rated either 'Outstanding or 'Good' by Ofsted located within a mile radius

detailedDescription:
Super-stylish, 2 bedroom, ground floor flat in the heart of Leyton Village. A home full of character with a private entrance and rear garden studio.

There’s a buzz of community in this historical corner of east London, you’re close to independent cafes, shops and restaurants. A short walk from Leyton tube Station (Central Line), Leyton Midland Road Station (London Overground), and Walthamstow Village is an 8 minute cycle.

These properties were designed by local developer jg Abraham & Co during the Victorian era, and were famous for their thoughtful design.
Inside, the reception room has a homey feel, featuring an original fireplace, bay window and stripped floors which run throughout.
In the centre of the plan is a dual-aspect kitchen, simply designed with clean lines, and filled with natural light. The bedrooms are doubles, one currently used as a study. And a clever bathroom space.
In keeping with the Abraham design the garden is long, 95 ft, the space inspires creative possibilities for growing, dining and ooh the Easter egg hunts! This is a charmer of a home, bursting with character, and close to some of the most expansive green spaces in London.
Ready to take a look?

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A bright and sizeable two double bedroom apartment on the first floor of low rise mid century corner block with outside space. Here you're perfectly perched between the many charms of Wanstead High Street, the vast green escape of Leyton Flats and Eagle Pond, and the transport links of Snaresbrook tube.

Snaresbrook tube station is literally on your doorstep to whisk you directly to Liverpool Street in a mere sixteen minutes, or Tottenham Court Road in twenty five, putting both the City and the West End within half an hour door-to-door. The myriad attractions of Westfield Stratford City shopping city are yours in ten minutes.

If you lived here…

You'll love having everything you need right on your doorstep; you're right in the bustling heart of our ever-popular East London Village here. On the same block alone you'll find a handy newsagent and Lillies of Wanstead to infuse your apartment with perfume and colour whenever the mood strikes. Michelin starred Provender is a fantastic contemporary brasserie, while Bare Brew is an independent coffee shop offering a mouth-watering brunch. Further on and The Duke (winner of a TimeOut favourite pub award) is one of several exciting options on Nightingale Lane and renowned for its annual street party and summer barbecues.

Inside and your immaculate lounge is a huge 210 square feet with gorgeously tranquil green views courtesy of a quintet of windows. Sleekly engineered floorboards flow underfoot, an original tiled fireplace surround is a fine feature and there's plenty of space for dining. You'll find your kitchen sitting opposite; ideal for entertaining. On-trend terracotta hued floor tiling is a feature you may well want to keep, depending on your interior design vision, and you've a white suite of cabinets.

This space is bookended by your two generous double bedrooms. Both come with built-in storage and a wealth of potential; the only limit is your imagination. The bathroom's a bright, appealing space in white and cream with a shower over the tub and floating sink, while lastly your outside space sits to the front. Beautiful bare brick adorned by a riot of colour from thriving pots make this an ideal spot for morning coffee and provides a charming vista from both bedrooms.

What else?

- Local schools are chiefly excellent, with seven primary/secondaries rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted in a one mile radius, including the 'Outstanding' Wanstead Church School, just four minutes' walk.
- Local bus routes from the High Street will whisk you across London day and night with the N55 ferrying you to the newly refurbished Hitchcock Hotel, Leyton, Lea Bridge station, Clapton, Hackney Central station, Hoxton, Old Street and Oxford Street. Handy.
- Bombetta is an Italian restaurant just across the road serving hearty portions of authentic Puglian cuisine. Try the spicy sausage bombetta with courgette fries. This superlative eaterie is sure to become a favourite.

Bedroom (3.44m x 4.04m (11'3" x 13'3"))

A word from the owner....

"We have lived in Wanstead since August 1999 and it's a wonderful place. It has interesting shops, a variety of restaurants and pubs and a monthly farmers market. A village feel yet there is a tube station on your doorstep. Safe and convenient and a blessing after a tough day at work or evening out especially if it's raining and no umbrella! Wanstead is thriving. It's on the fringe of Epping Forest, Eagle Pond & park areas provide lovely walks. Modern but with a real community spirit."

Guide Price £415,000 - £435,000. This beautifully bright, split level three bedroom flat for sale in Leytonstone is usefully located near the popular Francis Road area and an easy walk to Leytonstone Overground and Leyton Underground stations. In addition to the fantastic potential this property offers, it's also vacant and chain-free, assisting a faster purchase process.

This fabulous flat is situated on the first floor – simply enter the wrought-iron fenced area separating the building from the pavement, head up the external stairs, and the entrance to the flat leads directly into your spacious kitchen via a secure, gated front door.

Not only is this kitchen a very generous size but it also benefits from a fantastically functional layout too – offering a wide range of both base and wall-mounted units and plenty of workspace. The white units are overlaid with contrasting black countertops and the light décor is smartly set-off by the black tiled splashback surrounds, which are as stylish as they are practical. The kitchen comes complete with fridge freezer, integral oven, hob and cooker hood.

As you exit the kitchen to explore the rest of the flat, you'll see the small flight of steps up to the hallway, and to your right, one small step leading into the good-sized family bathroom. Neutrally but tastefully furnished and finished, it's a lovely, light and airy space to relax and unwind in the bath after a busy day. For a quick freshen up, there's also a roomy separate shower unit along with the usual (and essential!) WC and sink. The heated towel rail is a handy addition, as is the built-in shelving ledge at the end of the bath – ideal for all your toiletries.

Heading out of the bathroom and up the small flight of steps, follow the substantially sized hallway towards the first of your three bedrooms – this area is so light and bright for an internal hall that it almost has the feel of a lavish Spanish villa, a vibe helped along by the cool stone flooring.

As you enter this lower-floor bedroom it's easy to imagine what you could do with this brilliant blank canvas – and with its location between the reception room and kitchen, you could even re-purpose it for use as a large dining room, or perhaps even a playroom, media room or office. Bright and airy like the rest of the property, it offers total versatility which is such a bonus when claiming your new space.

Back into the hallway and following it down to the end of the property, you'll note the staircase to your left and the incredibly well-lit reception/living room ahead. With four (yes, you read that right) windows across two aspects, it's such a beautiful space, simply bathed in natural light and with a large enough footprint to accommodate a sprawling sofa, comfy chairs, your entertainment and display units and even a small dining table. Just move in and make your mark!

The stairs up to the second floor of this sizeable flat turn at a mid-level landing complete with window, and lead to the other two bedrooms off the top landing. To the right is the smaller of these two rooms, but don't let that fool you – it's still roomy enough for a double bed and all your furniture. Also, as with the rest of the bare floors throughout the main rooms in the property, if you wanted to forgo a carpet, you could sand and stain the floorboards for a smart, classic and cosy feel to balance out the bright and airy atmosphere.

The final and largest of the three bedrooms in this flat can be found right next door, and mirroring the layout of the reception room below, it also benefits from four windows – one to the side aspect and three to the rear. The slightly angled ceiling creates a lovely framing effect around this trio, giving this room an extra touch of character.

What this flat boasts in light and space on the inside is easily matched in terms of its location – with its close proximity to the up and coming Francis Road area, you're just a few moments away from all the shops, facilities and amenities you could wish for. Check out one of the area's best-loved pubs, the Heathcoate & Star or grab a coffee from the Unity Café – both of which lie within an easy stroll.

This flat is also close to some great local schools, including Newport Primary School, Connaught School for Girls and Norlington School and Sixth Form, and is ideal for commuters with both overground and underground stations in walking distance, plus a range of local bus routes.

Leytonstone High Road is also almost on your doorstep, a local leisure centre is nearby and you have a choice of wonderful natural spaces to explore in the area, such as Hackney Marshes and Wanstead Flats.

detailedDescription:
“Blackhorse Road” is amongst London's fastest-evolving areas for 2021.

Waltham Forest council’s master plan sets to bring thousands of new homes, creative studios, shops and workspace to the borough. The primary focus has been practically in Blackhorse Road, with huge home builders such as Barratt Homes, Taylor Wimpy, Telford Homes and Legal & General all staking their claim in the area building impressive developments and with some offering breathtaking views over the wetlands.

Blackhorse Road is changing, swiftly and for the better, with 2,500 new homes with new workspaces and studios for creatives but not to forget the abundance of outdoor space and nature on doorstep!

This exciting opportunity to live parallel to the waterside and commute into central London all within 15 minutes has become a major hot spot for young professionals and families.
