title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated in the sought after Ennerdale Court, a well presented retirement complex situated just 0.4 miles from Wanstead High Street, this one bedroom apartment is exclusively available for residents aged 55 and over. Surrounded by beautiful, well-maintained communal gardens with seating areas, both communal and visitors parking and within proximity of many bus routes, it is clear why the development proves so popular with residents. The property is fully managed and benefits from an on-site manager with an emergency 24-hour Careline System for out of hour assistance, communal lounge and a guest suite which is perfect for visiting family members.

Situated on the ground floor, the apartment benefits from direct access onto the communal gardens onto a small patio area leading from the via the naturally bright and contemporary lounge/diner. The modern adjoining kitchen also benefits from an additional window allowing natural light and providing ventilation when in use. Like the living room and entrance hall the wooden floor continues into the spacious double bedroom, which not only looks good but is easy to maintain, and there is plenty of room for a triple wardrobe and additional storage if desired. The bathroom benefits from a large, easy access shower cubicle with modern white suite and mirrored cabinet over sink. Additional benefits include a large storage cupboard in the hallway and no onward chain.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A smart one bedroom ground floor period conversion with garden mere moments from the green expanse of Wanstead Flats. This is a dream location for anyone craving easy access to natural environs, plus the amenities and transport links of of Leytonstone High Road are both within a six minute walk.

Leytonstone High Road overground station is served by the Gospel Oak to Barking line (look out for tbc here, a delicatessen serving up mouthwatering toasted sandwiches). A touch further, twelve minutes away, is Leytonstone tube station which will get you directly to Liverpool Street in fourteen minutes and Tottenham Court Road in twenty three via the Central line.

If you lived here…

You'll be relaxing in your large, south-facing 140 square foot lounge with a bay window framing leafy street views, the high ceilings of the period and an elegant mantelpiece over a brick fireplace which could easily be restored to its former glory. From here you access your bedroom, a solid double of over 100 square feet with more green views and a versatile canvas for your interior design flourishes.

Through the hallway and your generous eat-in kitchen awaits with another beautiful bay window, gleaming white tiled backsplash and charming chessboard flourishes on the cabinets. Your bathroom sits next door with a shower over the tub, traditional white suite and walnut effect flooring underfoot. Lastly, step out here for your lengthy rear garden. A mix of patio and Trulawn, the dimensions are unusual but present landscaping opportunities; the timber frame already in place would be a dream draped with flowering climbing plants. With green fingers this could be transformed into quite the leafy solace or be kept low-maintenance, just as you like.

Outside, Leytonstone High Road offers an ever-expanding choice of restaurants including Exceline East African restaurant (based in local son Alfred Hitchcock's former abode) nine minutes away, and Sardinian-inspired eaterie Mora two minutes further on. Looking for a new local? We can heartily recommend the wood-panelled Leytonstone Tavern. Lovingly restored by local lad Ronnie and proudly serving up exceptional food, it's a mere seven minute stroll away.

What else?

- You've a wide range of independent eating and drinking establishments nestled under the arches just half a mile away on Winchelsea Road including The Wanstead Tap, Burgess & Hall Wines and Arch Rivals. Newcomer The Rookwood Village is well worth a visit, too.
- Drivers can be on the A12 in four minutes and the North Circular in ten. Then it's just another three minutes, traffic permitting, to be on the M11 for Stansted Airport.
- From Leytonstone station you're a mere two stops or a five minute ride to Stratford for the huge Westfield Stratford City shopping centre and the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, for whenever you feel like revisiting that Olympic spirit.

Like much of East London, Leytonstone has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 15 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in less than 25.

The High Road has plenty of shops, cafes, bakeries and boutiques within easy reach. You also have the impressive bustle of one of the largest shopping centres in Europe - Westfield Stratford, just down the road.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. There's a strong sense of community in this creative and evolving area.

title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful five bedroom mid terrace property. The property has been fully refurbished throughout and is located in the gorgeous tree-lined street of Bromley Road. You are greeted at the property by a lovely brick built front wall and wrought iron style steel gate. The gate opens onto a well maintained paved patio that leads to the fully double glazed porch. The porch has been finished with black double glazing as well as silver hinges to mirror the rest of the property. As you step into the porch there is ample room to remove coats and shoes before making you way passed the solid oak front door and entering the spacious and bright entrance hall. The entrance hall has been finished with engineered oak flooring as well as a bespoke vertical radiator. There is also access to the alarm panel as well as the CCTV in the entrance hall. The first room accessible from the entrance hall is the large through lounge. This room benefits from a bay window that floods the room with natural light as well as providing more floor area to this already generous room. The lounge also comes with six built in blue tooth speakers which are ideal to use for surround sound and entertaining. The next room available along the entrance hall is the fully tiled ground floor w/c. The entrance hall then opens into the beautiful and bright kitchen/diner. The space is ideal for entertaining and is flooded with natural light from the rear French patio doors as well as the rear double glazed windows. The dining area is a great space and flows effortlessly into the kitchen. The kitchen has also been finished to a very high standard and comes with fully integrated appliances as well as a unique and bespoke extractor hood. The utility room is also accessible from the dining area and also benefits from a skylight so natural light is available when you are washing and ironing.

Back into the entrance hall and up the stairs to the first floor you are presented with a bright and spacious first floor landing. Three double bedrooms are accessible from the landing as well as a fully tiled three piece family shower room. The landing also gives access to a second staircase that leads to the second floor. A double rear dormer conversion has been done at the property and allows for another two double bedrooms as well as a spacious three piece bathroom that is finished with a free standing bath and beautiful suite. The property also benefits from front and rear gardens and with the rear garden being south/west facing, you have the opportunity to soak up the summer sun throughout the day.

The property is located in between both Leyton Midland Road and Walthamstow Central stations so transport links are easily accessible. The local bus route is also within one minute walking distance from the property and has buses running to Blackhorse Road Station, Walthamstow Central, Leyton and Stratford. Lea Bridge Road amenities are within walking distance so you are spoilt for choice for shops, bars and restaurants. The property also benefits from being within walking distance to the new Lea Bridge Road station which has direct access into Stratford. The local landmarks like Westfield shopping centre, Epping forest and the Olympic park are all very close and easily accessible.

detailedDescription:
Situated on a peaceful residential cul de sac with close proximity to the green open space of Lloyd Park is this modern three bedroom terraced house. With an abundance of space on the ground floor and spacious bedrooms this is a great home for all the family. Comprising a good sized fitted kitchen/dining room, ground floor cloakroom and a lounge that opens directly on to the large 58ft rear garden that features a lovely decked area. detailedDescription:
A charming and beautifully appointed three bedroom Victorian mid terrace with a delectably segmented open plan twin reception and exquisite, low-maintenance rear garden. Our lively Wood Street neighbourhood is just eight minutes away on foot and you have a wealth of pleasant green spaces within easy reach.

It's all located in our friendly, leafy neighbourhood of Chapel End, named after the fifteenth century chapel founded by Sir William Tyrwhitt. A nine minute stroll will see you at the Hobson Wood entrance to lush Lloyd Park anytime you want to unwind in nature.

If you lived here

You'll be stretching out in your huge, artfully segmented 260 square foot twin reception. Dual aspect with a classic bay window to the fore and a glorious ebony vintage fireplace, handsome timber floorboards guide you under the arch through to the dining area. It's a gorgeous spot for entertaining with impressive views over the garden. Step out here (both your front and back doors were installed this year and are fensa registered) for a garden shed and pleasing mix of gravel flanked by raised beds and climbing roses adorning a trellis, all leading to a raised timber decking area.

Back inside and your kitchen enjoys elegant light grey units, a glossy white metro tile backsplash, oak countertops and a full complement of integrated appliances, while head upstairs for two immaculate and generous double bedrooms plus a single ideal for a child or home working space, all with plush carpets and chic plantation shutters over the windows. Lastly, your bathroom's resplendent in slate grey tiling with an oversized rainfall shower over the tub and contemporary fixtures and fittings.

Outside take the aforementioned eight minute stroll to Wood Street to find a huge range of independent shops, cafes and bars. Enjoy a leisurely brunch at buzzing cafe Dudley's, try the Caribbean cuisine at Indie Roots (their seafood and jerk is out of this world), experience the to-die-for croissants at The Choclatine bakery or wander through the thriving vintage market. Wood Street station is sixteen minutes away on foot and four trains an hour will whisk you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty. Heading to the West End? Just ride one stop and you're in Walthamstow Central, with direct twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus via the Victoria line.

What else?

- Chapel End has a fine choice of quality schools, with twenty three primary/secondaries within a one mile radius rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. Not only that, Brokky's Crofte playground is just at the end of your street.
- Reach those fitness goals at the Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre. It's a thirteen minute stroll away and features two pools, an athletics track, climbing wall, health suite and much, much more.
- You have a great choice of local wining and dining spots; The Dog & Duck has a fine line in sourdough pizzas and beach huts in the beer garden, all just over five minutes on foot. Venture a little further for the pride of Walthamstow's gastropub fleet, The Bell.

A word from the owner....
"I fell in love with this house the moment I walked in the door six years ago and will be devastated to be leaving it and the local area. We could not wish for a friendlier neighbourhood, with plenty of local events and businesses cropping up all the time.
The house is light, bright and airy with original features and has a cosy feel for winter nights in. We’ve really made this place feel like home over the years and have replaced all of the windows and doors and fully refurbished the kitchen and bathroom.
The garden has been host to all sorts of sunlit breakfasts and bbqs with friends and family over the years, and has even become an outdoor gym space during lockdown.
The house is ideally situated between Wood Street, Walthamstow and Highams Park – all within walking distance to the hub of shops, restaurants, wine bars, cafes, Lloyd Park and various transport links. It is within walking distance to the Overground to Liverpool Street, as well as the trusty Victoria line. The North Circular, M25 and M11 are all within close proximity. Epping Forest is a 5 minute walk away and ideal if you want to
escape the bustling city for a walk or run.
It has been incredible to see the area grow over the past few years and we are keen to pass on our home to someone who will love it as much as we do."

detailedDescription:
If you are unable to buy a property outright on the open market, then Shared Ownership could be the ideal solution for you. It is a part-buy, part-rent scheme, which enables purchasers to buy an initial share of usually between 25% and 75% the value of the property and pay a subsidised rent on the remainder. A service charge may also be payable to cover the cost of communal maintenance. Shared Ownership properties are designed as a stepping stone to completely owning your own home, allowing you to buy as much as you can afford when you can afford it.

A resale is a Shared Ownership property that the current owner bought new from us or as a resale. Buying a resale property makes you an owner-occupier because you are buying at least the current owner's share on the existing lease. The great thing about choosing to buy a re-sale shared ownership property is that it gives you the opportunity to speak to the previous owner and to find out more about the area.

detailedDescription:
“Blackhorse Road” is amongst London's fastest-evolving areas for 2021.

Waltham Forest council’s master plan sets to bring thousands of new homes, creative studios, shops and workspace to the borough. The primary focus has been practically in Blackhorse Road, with huge home builders such as Barratt Homes, Taylor Wimpy, Telford Homes and Legal & General all stacking their claim in the area building impressive developments and with some offering breathtaking views over the wetlands.

Blackhorse Road is changing, swiftly and for the better, with 2,500 new homes with new workspaces and studios for creatives but not to forget the abundance of outdoor space and nature on doorstep!

This exciting opportunity to live parallel to the waterside and commute into central London all within 15 minutes has become a major hot spot for young professionals and families.

Call now to arrange a viewing or register your interest for more information.

detailedDescription:
A practical and beautiful two bedroom ground floor garden apartment, moments from Lloyd Park. Under the brick arch and through your own front door you'll find generous living spaces in excellent decorative order throughout, all in a perfect position and ready for new people to make their own.

Everyone in Walthamstow is familiar with its wonderful wealth of Warner properties, the neat red brick homes that are part of the fabric of the area. Built by Thomas Warner as social housing between 1880 and 1910, they were constructed in abundance, yet each one is completely unique with its own character and quirks. The dedicated entrances and shared gardens offer an ideal combination of privacy and community.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your long hallway and turn left into your reception. Lit by a bay window to the front and with honey pine stripped boards underfoot, it's a good 135 square foot of space. A rich red feature wall with finished fireplace gives a pop of colour. Next off the hallway is your first bedroom, over 110 square foot with a view to the garden. Around the corner there's your bathroom, with hardy grey tiling underfoot and white tiling to the walls, set off by a lively light blue paint job. There's plenty of natural light, along with a traditional white suite with shower over the tub.

Then you'll come to your ninety square foot kitchen/diner, with the same tiling underfoot as in the bathroom, a wealth of pine-toned units and smart black worktops. Step out from here to find your garden, with pristine paving giving way to neat lawn framed by bedding. Back inside at the end of the hall is your second bedroom of 115 square foot. Twin double glazed windows look out over the garden, and there's more of that gorgeous original flooring underfoot. There's built-in shelving and clothing rail to one side of the vibrant green chimney breast.

You're sitting on a peaceful street at the quietest corner of Lloyd Park, the gorgeous greenery and multiple amenities less than five minutes' stroll away. You're within easy reach of everything else our borough has to offer too, being just over a mile from Walthamstow Central. Drivers will be pleased to find it's only half a mile to the North Circular. If you're wandering of a weekend, it's thirteen minutes to bustling Bell Corner and the serene Village is just beyond for a great range of bars and restaurants.

What else?

- Your new local is The Dog & Duck, a gorgeous pub with its own sourdough saloon and large beer garden complete with cosy beach huts.
- Eight minutes' walk from you is Spa Experience Waltham Forest, where you can indulge in the ultimate self-care session.
- A choice of buses will take you from the Brettenham Road stop a few steps from your door to Walthamstow Wetlands, the amazing natural haven you'll never tire of exploring, in just over half an hour.

"We have absolutely loved our time in this place. It was our first home and the place our child took his first steps and spoke his first words.
Everything is on the doorstep; gym, swimming pool, pub, Walthamstow fc, William Morris Gallery, cafes etc. But having Lloyd Park next to you takes some beating. It's a beautiful space, complete with weekly market and great annual events.
Our street has a vibrant and active WhatsApp group where we get to know each other better, and help each other out. And Walthamstow itself has a great community feel. It's a fantastic place to live."

detailedDescription:
This two bedroom first floor conversion flat is the ideal purchase for a first-time buyer or a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include a long lease over 140 years with no service charge or ground rent payable, is being sold on a chain free basis and is situated in the heart of Walthamstow and in walking distance to Walthamstow Central and the Village.

This two bedroom first floor conversion flat is the ideal purchase for a first-time buyer or a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include a long lease over 140 years with no service charge or ground rent payable, is being sold on a chain free basis and is situated in the heart of Walthamstow and in walking distance to Walthamstow Central and the Village.

The property comprises of a reception room located to the front which is spacious enough to accommodate dining and entertaining friends and family. The reception room is flooded with natural light due to the bay window to the front and offers more usable space. The two bedrooms are both well proportioned and are perfectly positioned next to the reception room allowing you to change the layout, giving you the flexibility to create the home that suits your needs (subject to the freeholders permission).

Doing so does not mean losing bedroom space as you also have further potential to unearth with the loft allowing you to add a dormer and either a third bedroom and en suite bathroom or if you need more living space on the lower level, you can re add the second bedroom and en suite in the loft (STPP). To the rear of the property is the kitchen which again allows for space for a breakfast bar and includes part integrated appliances. Completing this charming home is the three piece family bathroom suite which includes tiled flooring and part tiled walls.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated in the heart of Walthamstow. Walthamstow village is a stone's throw away whilst Walthamstow Central is under a 7 minute walk away allowing for stress free commute into work. Walthamstow Village and Hoe Street offer an abundance of local amenities on your doorstep including a selection of bars, restaurants and coffee shops.

As for schools in the area you are truly spoilt for choice including Walthamstow Schools For Girls, Our Lady and St. Georges Catholic Primary Academy, Henry Maynard Primary School and many more to choose from.

We have pleasure in offering for sale this exceptional five bedroom, three storey Victorian terrace house ideally located on this popular road, a short walk to Lloyd Park, the William Morris Gallery or to Walthamstow’s excellent transport links. Comprising two good sized reception rooms, a spacious fitted kitchen, a first floor family shower room and three well-proportioned bedrooms. On the second floor you'll find two further bedrooms and a fitted bathroom. Outside a tranquil 40ft garden features.

The property is ideally located within the catchment areas of several schools with fantastic Ofsted reports making this a great family home and both Walthamstow Central and Blackhorse Road Underground stations are within a 10-15 minute walk.

title: Land for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning barn style house which was completed in 2020. Set in a semi rural spot yet close to many fantastic amenities.

Location

E4 is a popular spot if your criteria extends to requiring a house in a town location yet close to the forest, needing a swift link to the city and in an area where the amenities and facilities are a plenty.

On Station Road in North Chingford (approx. 2.7 miles) you will find day to day amenities including a choice of café's, bars, banks, shops and restaurants.

Epping Forest is on your doorstep and so perfect for a range of outdoor pursuits. There is also a visitor centre and Museum called the Queen Elizabeth Hunting Lodge; here you can explore the Tudor history of Epping Forest, built in 1543 for King Henry VIII.

For the motorist there is easy access to both the M25 and M11. Chingford railway station (approx 2.7 miles) provides the commuter a wonderful connection to Liverpool Street and Victoria tube line via the Walthamstow stop.

Distances (all approximate)

M25 Junction 26 - 2.5 miles
M11 Junction 5 - 6.7 miles

Description

Set behind secure gates and in a beautiful open setting is this stunning barn style newly built house.

The accommodation comprises an entrance hallway including a WC and good sized storage cupboard, a bright front reception room which could easily double up as a third bedroom or study and a fantastic open plan kitchen and family room. The kitchen is finished and designed by urban myth and includes smeg appliances. The family space is an open and social setting where natural light pours in through bi-fold doors inviting the outside in.

To the first floor is the main bedroom which features an impressive gallery window and en suite shower room. There is a further bedroom with eaves storage and a family bathroom.

Exterior.

The property is accessed via secure electric gates from Sewardstone Road. To the front of the house there is a private driveway with parking for at least four cars and side access to the rear of the property.

At the rear is a good sized patio and garden which is laid to lawn.

Square Footage: 1102 sq ft
features: ['Newly built in 2020', 'Private and secure development set behind gates', 'Next to the Farmhouse Restaurant', 'Ample off street parking for at least four cars', 'Epping Forest nearby']
title: 2 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Must See!

A bright and spacious two bedroom ground floor maisonette set within an end of terrace Victorian property, with a private garden available to buy now on Richmond Road, E11. The property features high ceilings throughout with two double bedrooms, a reception room, kitchen, bathroom and a private rear garden. In addition the front garden is demised on the lease to the property.

Location

Located on Richmond Road, E11 and approx. A ten minute walk to Leyton Underground Station this property is ideal for commuting to and from central London. You are also a short walk away from Leyton Midland Overground Station easing access to the North East of London.

You will benefit from being moments away from the ever so popular and trendy Francis Road where you have amazing café’s, bookshops, pubs and some great spots for a weekend brunch.

Close by you have amazing cafes, restaurants, pubs and parks including the newly opened Unity Café on the corner of Richmond Road, The Wild Goose Bakery, The Red Lion, Heathcote & Star, Filly Brook and The Birds, as well as an increasingly interesting range of shops and businesses, from books to yoga, and flowers to gifts. Not to mention the great primary and secondary schools in the area which makes it ideal for any family.

detailedDescription: Available to market chain free is this spacious two bedroom duplex apartment. Forming a part of the ever popular Trent Court development, the property offers, on the ground floor, a very generous open plan reception room and kitchen, upstairs there are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom equipped with both a bath and a walk-in-shower. Further benefits include a communal garden, offstreet parking and a garage en-bloc. Trent Court is ideally located for access to all of the shops, bars and restaurants of Wanstead High Street and also to both Snaresbrook and Wanstead Underground Stations with direct access to The City and The West End.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An immaculate and gloriously appointed two double bedroom duplex apartment spread over the third and fourth floors of this landmark development on the site of the iconic Walthamstow Dog Track. Here you have an en suite to the master bedroom, a wealth of storage, balcony and covered off street parking.

And those aren't the only on-site facilities to get excited about, you've also got a convenience store, private gym and communal grounds. If you fancy more wide open natural environs then the green spaces of Lloyd Park are a mere fifteen minute walk or four minute cycle away and home to cafes, courts, the famous William Morris gallery, farmers market and a range of sports clubs and classes.

If you lived here

You'll be enjoying the legacy of your purpose-built designer home on a daily basis, you've a brilliant view of the legendary Tote board from your front door. Step through here and your first bedroom's on the left, it's an eighty square foot double with views over the grounds and hard-wearing cream carpet underfoot. Next your bathroom's a gorgeous gleaming contemporary space with a shower over the tub, recessed vessel sink and heated towel rail. Your master bedroom completes the storey, it's filled with natural light from those floor to ceiling windows and has its own impeccable shower room with a floating sink.

Head up the stairs now to land in your showstopping 210 square foot kitchen/diner with sleekly engineered broad timber floorboards, glossy grey cabinets to hip height and seamlessly integrated appliances. The whole space opens out to your huge 130 square foot balcony, resplendent in exposed brick and perfect for enjoying a morning cup of coffee. Back inside and the smooth lines continue into your 145 square foot lounge, a welcoming space enjoying cerulean blue walls and a constellation of recessed spot lights overhead.

Highams Park station is sixteen minutes on foot (or a six minute cycle) on the handy footpath which runs alongside Parmiter's School Sports Ground, and will whisk you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty six. Don't feel like walking? The bus stop around the corner offers nine bus routes to whisk you to both Walthamstow Central station for direct, twenty minute runs to the City and West End, and Stratford for a comprehensive range of transport connections as well as the shopping colossus that is Westfield Stratford City.

What else?

- Parents will be pleased to know that within a one mile radius alone you have twenty one schools/colleges rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted, two of which have been given the accolade 'Outstanding'.
- At 121 years your lease won't cause you any renewal worries, plus the property comes chain free so you can move in at your earliest convenience.
- The Walthamstow Stadium Residents/Community Association is a tight-knit group with its own Facebook group and website, organising seasonal events including a jumble trail, Easter egg hunt, Halloween events and summer parties.

Hall

Bedroom (2.71m x 3.08m (8'10" x 10'1" ))

Bathroom (2.13m x 2.10m (6'11" x 6'10" ))

Bedroom (3.63m x 3.39m (11'10" x 11'1" ))

Ensuite (1.07m x 2.35m (3'6" x 7'8" ))

Lounge (4.82m x 2.92m (15'9" x 9'6" ))

Kitchen/ Diner (4.82m x 4.28m (15'9" x 14'0" ))

Balcony (4.88m x 2.68m (16'0" x 8'9" ))

A word from the owner....

"We've loved this apartment from the moment we moved in. The local area is fantastic and being a stone's throw away from both Walthamstow and Highams Park really gives a lot of choice for pubs, bars and restaurants. Plus, when we don't want to venture far at all a relaxing glass of something cold and some nibbles on the sun trap of a roof terrace is the best way to end an evening."

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
2 bedroom apartment now available for £124,375 for a 25% share with Shared Ownership in Walthamstow!

Available to purchase with Shared Ownership, buyers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

2 bedroom 4th floor apartment offering 72 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our show home.

£124,375 for a 25% share of £497,500 and a deposit as low as £6,219 and a minimum income of £66,710.

The Chain
Walthamstow is seeing an unprecedented rate of growth and investment into the town centre and surrounding areas. Waltham Forest's residents and businesses stand to benefit significantly from the economic growth taking place across London. The boroughs well-connected location in the east of London, the cultural heart of the capital, along with its unique identity founded in cultural heritage, its burgeoning arts and creative industries, and abundant green spaces all contribute towards the urban vibrancy that makes Waltham Forest a special place to live. In relative terms, Waltham Forest is now growing faster than any other borough in London. In the last five years the number of jobs in the borough has increased by 30 per cent (the highest in London) and the number of businesses by 40 per cent (the sixth highest increase in London). This in part is due to the significant effect of investment in Olympic legacy projects but also in the overall growth in London and the movement of the capitals economic activity eastwards.

Walthamstow Connections
The Chain is perfectly positioned, close to three train stations with excellent transport links. More green space to walk, run, or cycle than any other part of London. Located near South Grove, The Chain is just a 10 minute walk to Walthamstow Central where you'll find shops, bars and restaurants as well as your favourite retailers within The Mall shopping centre. Walthamstow Leisure centre is an 8 minute walk from The Chain, or just a 3 minute bus journey and offers a 68-station gym, 6 Badminton courts, 2 Squash courts, an Ofsted registered crèche, 5-a-side red-crumb football pitch, a studio and gymnasium.

What is Shared Ownership?
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don't own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

What is Shared Ownership?
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don't own. Single applications are able to apply but may need to increase their deposit contribution to meet shared ownership affordability requirements.

detailedDescription:
L&Q at Blackhorse View

Shared Ownership homes launching soon

1 bedroom apartments available from £86,250 for a 25% share

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder. The minimum
share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

Blackhorse View
Offering a stepping stone to home ownership in Walthamstow the first collection of 1 bedroom Shared Ownership apartments at Blackhorse View are launching soon.

In a superb Zone 3 location opposite Blackhorse Road station, Blackhorse View is a brand new development of 350 new homes in the thriving creative and cultural hub of Walthamstow in East London, London Borough of Culture 2019 - part of a £200m transformation of the area.

Register your interest today!

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An immaculate and utterly covetable one bedroom ground floor apartment, set within a Victorian end terrace with gorgeous green views over St James Park. Expertly converted with a clean and contemporary aesthetic, this is a wonderful find with excellent connections despite the leafy, secluded location.

Not only are you within half an hour of the City door-to-door (more of that later), but a secure bike hanger has recently been added right outside your new home. Perfect for making the most of the Q2 Cycleway that can be joined in three minutes from just outside the Mall on Selborne Road, to speed you straight to the capital. Walthamstow Cycles is just as close and you can count on Tony for an excellent service any time your two-wheeled steed needs some attention.

If you lived here…

You'll love having the lush grounds of St James Park as your back garden, the mature lime trees adorning its perimeter now a century old. Inside and the lounge is the heart of your home, it's a wonderfully sizeable space of 200 square feet with twin windows filling the space with swathes of light, those lime trees dancing in the breeze beyond and a gorgeous contemporary fireplace serving as a fine focal point.

Through to the fore of the property and your bedroom's an exceptionally generous 170 square foot double enjoying a bay window overlooking Clacton Road, cosy cream carpet underfoot and an on-trend wall-papered statement wall. Elsewhere the bathroom's resplendent in large format sandstone with beautiful bespoke touches in the form of a floating artfully distressed timber cabinet and vessel sink. Lastly, your eat-in kitchen sits semi open to the lounge and is home to a gleaming canary yellow metro tiled backsplash, a flawless white suite of cabinets and a characterful oversized chalk board.

Outside, St James Street station is eight minutes' walk and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty. Alternatively, Blackhorse Road station is fifteen minutes on foot and will get you straight to Kings Cross just as quickly. You'll find the vibrant crate St James here with a wide range of independent bars, cafes and small businesses - its current offerings include a sensational vegan fast food stall, an eco start-up and a beauty therapist. Walthamstow High Street starts just next door to St James Street station and is home to Europe's longest street market, with the regular Sunday Social stalls in particular being great for fresh produce.

What else?

- You're within easy reach of the boundless expanse of London's largest nature reserve, the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands, starting a mere eight minutes on foot from your front door any time you fancy a respite from city living.
- Firing for those Fitbit goals? Walthamstow Leisure Centre has you covered and is just a nine minute walk away with gym, racquet courts and fitness studio.
- If you've a hankering for some post work-out healthy food then Iyo Sushi (named after a city in Japan) is a nine minute stroll away. Or sit back and let them deliver to your door.

Hall

Storage

A word from the owner..."We have loved living in our flat over the past 4 years and the location has been ideal for raising our dog, with the park across the road and Walthamstow Marshes a short walk away.
There are plenty of walking and cycling routes nearby, and if you own a car you'll never have issues with parking as the road is so quiet, plus there's an ev charging point 20m away!
The flat itself is deceptively roomy with no wasted space and plenty of natural light. We kept the unique features such as the blackboard wall from the previous owner, the feature fireplace alcove, and the ornate Victorian columns on the bedroom bay window looking out towards the park.
The area has a local community feel and we have made great friends - our neighbours above (plus their cute dog, Bagel) are great fun and work in the Creative sector and there are lots of young families living on the street.
There are many activities going on in the local area with fitness classes in the park, a community gardening group who look after the rain gardens at either end of the road, and a new foodie scene with new bakeries, restaurants and bars opening up locally over the past few years.
It really is an area that you don't actually need to leave, and we will miss the view of the park when sitting on the sofa!"

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A sleek and spacious three bedroom home spread across three floors of a low rise development sat on a residential, no through road. Not only do you have a private, south-facing garden and covered, off-street parking, but all the shops, bars and amenities of Leytonstone High Road are right on your doorstep.

Just a seven minute stroll will see you at Leytonstone High Road overground station for the Gospel Oak to Barking line. From here, Blackhorse Road station is just a seven minute ride away, for West End access via the Victoria line. Leytonstone station is thirteen minutes on foot and will get you directly to The City and West End via the Central line. Drivers, meanwhile can be on the North Circular in just twelve minutes and are also well positioned for the A12 to Canary Wharf and the M11 to Essex and Stansted Airport.

If you lived here

You'll be expertly realising your interior design ambitions on all three storeys and across 1000 square foot of space in this recently renovated and perfectly located home. Best of all it's chain free so you can move in straight away. On the ground floor your kitchen/diner comes in at over 150 square feet, the culinary space stocked with integrated appliances and space for an American-style fridge/freezer. Bright and replete with natural light, it all overlooks and opens out to your fifty five foot south-facing garden; a lovely year-round solace.

Back inside and head up the stairs (past a handy WC on your right) for your 155 square foot lounge and your first bedroom, a generous double of 125 square feet. Sleek light grey flooring flows underfoot and walls are pristine in white; an ideal blank canvas. Up to the second floor and another generous double bedroom plus a single ideal for a child or home working space await, as well as the bathroom which comes with a shower over the tub and traditional suite. Lastly, you can access your sizeable loft with a drop down ladder with its own light. Great for storage.

Our popular social hub of Francis Road is a mere six minutes away on foot. Part-pedestrianised, it's the heart of an increasingly sought-after neighbourhood bursting with independent artisan shops, cafes and bars. Head north for our upcoming Grove Green Road area home to the Heathcote & Star, Filly Brook and Solvay Society Taproom. For your new local we'd be remiss not to point you in the direction of Leytonstone Tavern, it's a craft neighbourhood pub and dining room and the head chef has won awards for his succulent Sunday roasts. Just nine minutes' walk.

What else?

- Parents will be pleased to know you have eighteen schools and colleges within a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Newport School is half a mile away on foot.
- Leytonstone Leisure Centre is a four minute jaunt around the corner, with two pools, gymnasium, creche, sports hall and sauna.
- If an invigorating stroll or afternoon picnic is on the cards then a mere thirteen minute walk will deliver you to the vast open green space of Wanstead Flats, the former hunting grounds of Henry VIII.

Like much of East London, Leytonstone has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 15 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in less than 25.

The High Road has plenty of shops, cafes, bakeries and boutiques within easy reach. You also have the impressive bustle of one of the largest shopping centres in Europe - Westfield Stratford, just down the road.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. There's a strong sense of community in this creative and evolving area.

title: 4 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
A handsomely appointed, pleasantly bright and impressively spacious three bedroom Victorian terrace. The generous proportions of the period are already complemented by a vast cellar and substantial rear extension, and with the loft space untouched you have still more potential for development.

Your location is just as exciting, you're sat in our sought after Bushwood neighborhood, a mere five minutes' walk from the ancient woodlands that give the area its name and with Leytonstone tube station just as close.

If you lived here

You'll be stretching out in a shade under 1300 square feet of living space ñ and that's not even including your damp proofed cellar, divided into four distinct spaces and ideal for everything from rec rooms to home working space or simple storage. Your through lounge is a tremendous twenty seven feet long and softly finished in smooth cream with ornate original cornicing overhead.

Head through a gloriously bright lightwell for the ground floor bathroom and dedicated dining room, 150 square feet and just as softly finished. Your kitchen completes the ground floor, a spacious affair with glossy black metro tile splashbacks and fitted pine cabinets, leading out to your zero maintenance courtyard, a BBQ-perfect expanse of patio, barely overlooked.

Up the strikingly carpeted stairs and your master bedroom's a mighty 170 square feet with soft plush carpet underfoot and twin windows bathing the space in light. Both remaining bedrooms are generous doubles of around 100 square feet apiece, while your family bathroom's smartly finished in white and slate grey. Finally, as noted, you have the untouched loft space to develop, as some of your neighbours have done (subject to the usual permissions).

What else?

- There are sixteen primary/secondary schools less than a mile away on foot, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Davies Lane primary is just a ten minute stroll away.
- Leytonstone tube station is just five minutes' walk. From here it's just fourteen minutes direct to Liverpool Street, and twenty three to Tottenham Court Road, putting both the City and West End less than a half hour away door to door.
- The Red Lion, a longstanding Leytonstone landmark and one of the most sumptuous gastropubs for miles around, is just a five minute walk and sure to become a favourite.

detailedDescription:
Modern, purpose built flat with private balcony, a station nearby and everything you need on your doorstep—or your rooftop—with access to well kept gardens and views over the city.
Your local station’s Lea Bridge, one stop to Tottenham Hale and the Victoria line or Stratford for links to the city and Westfield for shopping, with green spaces of Hackney and Walthamstow Marshes within walking distance.
This is a 4th floor property, just 2 years old.
You walk in and it’s all clean lines and confidence.
The open plan reception room is light with wood floors, modern fitted kitchen, a dining space and a cosy lounge area leading onto the private balcony, which gives the property an extra dimension. A space to grow plants, yes, but also to sit on warm summer evenings.
The double bedroom is light and roomy with plenty of fitted storage, the bathroom is contemporary, well lit and fully tiled.
Beyond the property you’ll have full use of the roof gardens, a zen escape where yoga classes take place high above the hubbub of the city, This would be an exciting opportunity for a first time buyer looking to get their feet onto the property ladder.

Living Here...

Here’s a flavour of what's on offer in this fantastic part of E10. The wide open spaces of both Hackney and Walthamstow marshes are within walking distance if you need a breath of fresh air. However, if you're more of a socialiser than a rambler, take a gentle stroll to The Hare & Hounds on Lea Bridge Road, for a pint and a bite to eat. Alternatively, head along Argyll Way and check out the Lighthaus café – it serves brilliant food and the people there are lovely.

If you need to burn off excess energy, you’ve got Walthamstow Leisure Centre in one direction, and Lea Valley ice centre in the other – perfect.

When the weekend ends and works beckons, the commute is made that little easier by the numerous buses speeding along Lea Bridge Road into the City. Alternatively, Stratford (both for the commute via the Central Line and shopping at Westfield) and Tottenham Hale for the Victoria line are both one stop from Lea Bridge station.

In The Owners Words...

"The flat has been a great home for us over the last two years and we're sure it will also be a great home for you! It's a generous size for a one bedroom and we've found the kitchen/living room to be a nice social space to cook in and chat on an evening - we've also found we have a lot more storage space compared to similar new build flats! The neighbours are all really friendly here and there's a nice community feel to the
development.
The station at Lea Bridge is only a 1 minute walk away from the building, from which if you head 5 minutes either way you reach a major tube line. South = Stratford (Central/Jubilee) and North = Tottenham Hale (Victoria).
As for the area, we're going to really miss living so close to Walthamstow and Hackney Marshes - which were an absolute life-saver during the lockdowns! There's so many great walks around the marshes or along the River Lea to keep you entertained. Also worth mentioning are Millfields Park and Chatsworth Road, which are a 20 minute walk (or 6 minute cycle), where you can find a some nice shops and restaurants and a lovely food market on
Sundays."

detailedDescription: *Guide Price £775,000 - £800,000* This charming four bedroom, Victorian family home offers a wealth of period features balanced with a contemporary finish for modern family living. The property is ideally nestled on a quiet, residential street and yet is within walking distance of the Woodford High Road, Broadway amenities and underground station. The ground floor comprises of a bright and airy hallway leading onto the through lounge awash with natural light and oozing features from the bay window and period fireplace to the high ceilings. Further down the hallway leads to a guest W⁄C and the extended modern kitchen with space for dining, underfloor heating and a back room ideal to capture the summer afternoons or have kids play whilst making dinner. Double doors lead to the sun trap garden with back patio area ideal for entertaining and side return perfect for storage. The first floor offers three double bedrooms with the master bedroom spanning the width of the house as well as benefiting from a built in wardrobe and a family bathroom with underfloor heating. The second floor is home to a fourth bedroom awash with light and an en-suite shower room. With Woodford Central Line Station only a short walk away and parents being well catered for with outstanding schools close by as well as the beautiful area with forests, lakes, country parks and open green spaces this really is a charming home ready for its next family.

re/max are happy to introduce this 2 bedroom ground floor apartment with shared rear garden, being offered for sale with a share of freehold, located just moments away from local shops, public transport links and more.
The property


Located on the ground floor within this semi-detached conversion is this spacious 2 double bedroom apartment which has the huge benefit of the share of freehold and the added benefit of a shared rear garden.

In the hallway are good size storage cupboards, allowing you to keep the main spaces neat and tidy. The hallway connects to both bedrooms, the bathroom and the reception with acesss to the garden as well as the kitchen that also leads into the garden.

1 of the bedrooms is facing the front aspect with large double glazed bay windows and a decorative feature fireplace. The other bedroom is with rear aspect facing double glazed window. Both rooms have lots of natural light, painted walls and laminate wood flooring.

Further into the property you have the bathroom consisting of a 3 piece suite, including a bath with shower attachment. The walls and floor are tiled, and there is a frosted double glazed window to the side aspect.

The reception has painted walls and laminate wood effect flooring, has a double glazed window to the side aspect and provides access to the garden as well through access to the kitchen space.

The kitchen, situated within the rear extension of the property, has laminate wood effect flooring and a fully fitted kitchen with wall and base units with tiled splashback, a front aspect double glazed window as well as double glazed double doors taking you into the garden which has patio, pathway and large lawn space with wooden panel fencing around.
Location


The property is on the doorstep of Chingford Mount high street where you have a variety of different cafes, restaurants and other eateries as well as a huge choice of different other shops including florists, a gym, supermarkets and more.

A couple of minutes away is Memorial Park which consists of a large outdoor space, tennis courts, childrens play areas and offers free car parking.

A great location for those using public trasnport, just seconds away is the nearest bus stops from which you can connect to your desired location including Walthamstow Central Underground Station which is on the Victoria Line as well as London Overground.

The location is also great for road users as there are major road links nearby such as A406, M25, M11, A10, A12 and others.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A lovingly appointed two bedroom ex-Warner apartment, expertly developed, arranged over two stories and nicely set back from one of the sought after, leafy streets that surround our borough's green gem of Lloyd Park. Design & Decor is smart and bright throughout, with plenty of natural light.

In keeping with the property's Warner roots, you have a private section of rear garden, accessed via a set of internal stairs. A lush length of lawn bookended by twin decks, it's the perfect leafy solace.

If you lived here…

You'll be enjoying all the love and care that have gone into this painstakingly developed, classic property. The staircase to your loft sweeps elegantly above your first floor landing, where blonde engineered hardwood flows underfoot into your 150 square foot front reception, lit by a trio of double glazed windows. Next door's your first bedroom, a decent double with garden view.

Your kitchen's another highlight, with flawless white fitted cabinets home to a full suite of integrated appliances and timber worktops, there's also a wealth of space for dining. Next door the family bathroom's an ingeniously arranged affair with subtly separated WC, a shower over the tub and clean white lines throughout. Head upstairs and you have the glorious penthouse master bedroom; 170 square feet of space basking under twin skylights plus a second window to the rear.

Outside and the landscaped gardens and open green spaces of Lloyd Park are right on your doorstep – less than five minutes walk for morning jogs, evening strolls, cafes, courts and a huge range of sports clubs and classes. There's also a thriving Saturday farmers market and of course the famous William Morris Gallery. When you need to venture further afield, Walthamstow Central station is around a twenty minute walk and will get you directly to Liverpool Street and Oxford Circus just as quickly.

What else?

- Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre, a multi-million pound sports facility with Olympic pool, cutting edge gym, health suite, courts, climbing wall, trampoline park and more is just ten minutes away on foot.
- The famous Walthamstow Village is well worth the twenty minute walk. Among these peaceful streets you'll find the most diverse, critically acclaimed range of wining and dining establishments for miles around.
- Your new local is one of our finest gastropubs, The Bell. Bright, airy and serving up delicious food and drink, it's just a half mile on foot and sure to become a favourite.

From the critically acclaimed bars and restaurants of Walthamstow Village, to the wide green spaces of Lloyd Park and Hollow Ponds.

From the 20 minute tube ride into Oxford Street to the fact that you don't have to be a Russian Oligarch to afford a family home here. For these reasons and more, people have spent the past few years flocking to E17 and surrounding areas.

The second floor features a large fully fitted kitchen with plenty of countertop space and a generously sized lounge with private balcony overlooking the communal grounds. As you venture upstairs you will find a sizable main bedroom that stretches the width of the property, a family bathroom with shower over bath as well as two further double bedrooms. Living Here...

This enviable location boasts a number of things to do and see with Epping Forest within walking distance as well as a whole host of shops, cafes and restaurants to enjoy. Highams Park Train station is also just a short stroll away and will get you in to Liverpool Street in around 20 minutes.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented and capacious two bedroom garden flat in Leyton.

This amazing home offers over 1200 square feet in which to relax, with generously proportioned rooms throughout. Both bedrooms are substantial doubles, the larger one additionally benefitting from the bay to the front. Both have beautiful engineered wood flooring underfoot, as well as acres of space for wardrobes and storage.

But it’s the stunning open plan kitchen/diner/lounge to the rear that is the real star (and hub) of this wonderful flat. Configured in a T shape, and with two walls occupied by bi-fold doors, this is a room as light and bright as it is practical. The kitchen has sleek, modern fitted units and work surfaces, huge island unit and integrated appliances, whilst the individual lounge and dining areas offer the space and versatility to relax or entertain.

Outside, there is a sizeable private rear garden, complete with decked and paved patio areas, meaning even more space to relax once summer returns.

Oh, and there’s also a basement too, in case you need even more space!

A truly wonderful garden flat and fantastic home...

Living Here...

Perfectly positioned between Walthamstow, Leyton and Leytonstone, this locale gives you everything you need on your doorstep, including fantastic transport links into the City. Both Leyton Midland and Leytonstone stations are all within walking distance, as are Hollow Ponds and Abbotts Park (game of tennis anyone?). And you certainly won't be lost for places to take friends and family for days (and evenings) out and about, with the delights of both Francis Road (Yardarm, Marmelo etc), the High Road (Perky Blenders, Pepper’s Ghost, William IVth) and Walthamstow Village (too many to mention!) just a gentle stroll away....

In This Area...

Leyton is home to the only shop that can be seen from space. Ok, that's not entirely true, but the carnival shop on the High Road is definitely bright. There's no way you'll miss this multi coloured wonder, it looks like it's made of Lego. The shop sits opposite Coronation Gardens, a beautiful park with a little maze, pond and fountain. The High Road is also home to the Leyton Technical, a lovely pub that occupies the ground floor of the old town hall. It has good beer, good food, and the longest walk to the toilet you'll ever find. If you like beer, Leyton is the place for you, as both Brodie's Beers and Signature Brew (voted UK Brewery Business of the Year 2018) are based in E10. Sidmouth Park, just behind the carnival shop, is a hit with kids as there's loads of stuff to play on. If you are hungry or thirsty, wander to Francis Road and you'll find a bucket load of nice cafes, including Yardarm, Marmelo Kitchen, and Albert & Francis, as well as an increasingly interesting range of shops and businesses, from books to yoga, and flowers to gifts. There’s even a friendly estate agency there...

detailedDescription:
Mid terrace, ground floor flat with 2 bedrooms, a large private garden and no chain: Close to Leyton station, the High Road and nearby parks.

Inside, the reception room has a bay window and enough space for a dining area.
The double bedrooms are light, with windows looking out to the garden, and the kitchen is a comfortable size to work in and well designed with modern fittings.
The south facing rear garden has space to entertain, established trees and a garden shed for storage.

Step into this ground floor flat and you’ll see a solid layout with bags of potential both inside and outside the property; and a location where everything’s on your doorstep including greenspaces to explore.

What would you bring to this property?

In The Owners Words...

'This lovely flat was initially a great first home for us in London where we thoroughly enjoyed the property with it's quiet south facing garden and easy access to the city and local green space. It then became a brilliant rental property when we left London for family reasons and has never had a void period in the last 4 years. Unfortunately the time has come that we need to sell to allow us to buy our long term family property where we have chosen to settle up North.'

detailedDescription:
Chain free, stunning four bedroom, two bathroom terraced house in highly sought after road close to wood street station.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website
3d Virtual Tour available.

Having been the subject of considerable improvement by the current vendor this superbly presented property ticks all the boxes for an ideal family home. This spacious four bedroom house has been tastefully modernised and extended.

The property has accommodation comprising of an entrance porch leading into the hallway with door into the spacious through lounge with wood flooring, bay window and exposed brick feature walls. Leading off the lounge is a guest WC.

To the rear a stunning kitchen with wood flooring, exposed brick feature walls, designer radiators, industrial style exposed steel beams, bi fold doors, fitted white gloss units, and centre island incorporating the sink unit.

To the first floor is a full width master bedroom with a range of fitted wardrobes and carpeting to floor, a further smaller double bedroom with carpeting to floor and a large family bathroom with three piece suite and tiled flooring and splash backs.

To the second floor a dual loft conversion with a large double bedroom with dormer window to rear and skylight window to front, eaves storage and carpeting to floor, leading off is a modern style contemporary en-suite shower room with skylight window. There is a separate smaller double bedroom with carpeting to floor.

Externally the rear garden is paved for low maintenance.

Location

Conveniently positioned to be within a short walk of the trendy Wood Street area with its array of shops and eateries as well as being within 0.3 miles of Wood Street mainline station and 0.8 miles of Walthamstow Central station and its abundance of local facilities. Also within a short walk to the Village.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
An enviably located three double bedroom modern end of terrace on a quiet street in our leafy locale of Chapel End. With a generous semi open plan reception and exquisite gardens front and back, here you're well-placed for natural open spaces as well as the transport links and amenities of Wood Street.

Take the nine minute stroll to Wood Street to find a huge array of independent shops, cafes and bars. Try go-to spot Dudley's for delicious coffee and toasted banana bread with butter that's out of this world. There's also a thriving vintage market and Wood Street station will get you to Liverpool Street in twenty minutes. Drivers, meanwhile, can be on the North Circular in three minutes.

If you lived here…

You'll instantly love the handsome brick frontage and thriving rose garden of your new abode; quite some kerb appeal. Design & Decor may warrant your own interior flourishes here and there, but this is a home abounding in potential with wonderful fundamentals. Your lounge area comes in at a spacious 200 square feet with engineered timber floorboards underfoot and a modern bay window ushering in natural light while framing that delectable floral view.

Continue through the innovative broken plan layout and your dining area opens out to your beautifully landscaped rear garden via sliding patio doors; this is quite the urban solace with a low-maintenance patio home to expertly curated plants from around the world, a pond and timber sun deck. Divine. You've a handy WC out here, meanwhile head back inside for a sizeable kitchen and on up the stairs for three immaculate double bedrooms, the largest of which comes in at over 140 square feet. Lastly, your bathroom's dual aspect and dressed in sandstone with a dedicated shower cubicle.

Epping Forest is a mere fifteen minute walk or six minute cycle. Head to The Doughnut just past the entrance, it's a hidden gem of a park beautiful in buttercups and perfect for relaxing or exercising. Beyond it lies the The Gypsy Stone which marks the spot where renowned evangelist Rodney 'Gypsy' Smith mbe was born in a Romani tent in 1860. In the other direction Lloyd Park is even closer, just half a mile away on foot for manicured gardens, a moat and enough open green space to realise the most ambitious of fitness goals.

What else?

- For your new local, you can't do better than The Dog & Duck, a wonderful family friendly gourmet pub with brilliant beer garden, just four minutes around the corner. You'll find a bus stop here too which is handy for ferrying you to a wealth of destinations including Walthamstow Central and Stratford for the colossal Westfield Stratford city shopping centre.
- Parents will be pleased to discover that you have twenty two schools, primary and secondary, all just a mile or less away. Seventeen are rated 'Good' and five deemed 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.
- Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre is just thirteen minutes' stroll and home to health and fitness facilities which include two pools, an athletics track, climbing wall and health suite.

Transport links are extremely good, with easy access to the centre of London and motorway access to Stansted Airport."

detailedDescription:
Are you looking for a period two bedroom flat in Leytonstone with a garden? If so, this could be the place for you. This superb two bedroom ground floor flat with a large private garden set within a double fronted Victorian terrace which has been tastefully and carefully restored is available to buy now on Forest Drive East, Leytonstone. The property features an open plan living and kitchen area, two bedrooms, bathroom and a spacious private garden; ideal for entertaining on those warm summer days. The property has been newly renovated to a high standard and is move in ready. Perfectly placed for all the area has to offer too.

Internal Area Approx. 466 Sq Ft (43.3 Sq M).

Location

Located on a quite road in Leytonstone and approximately a ten minute walk to Leytonstone Underground Station this property is ideal for commuting to and from central London. Close by you have amazing cafes, restaurants, pubs and parks including the newly opened Unity Café on the corner of Richmond Road, The Wild Goose Bakery, The Red Lion, Heathcote & Star, Filly Brook and The Birds, as well as an increasingly interesting range of shops and businesses, from books to yoga, and flowers to gifts. Not to mention the great primary and secondary schools in the area which makes it ideal for any family.

You will benefit from being a short walk away from the ever so popular and trendy Francis Road where you have amazing café’s, bookshops, pubs and some great spots for a weekend brunch.

detailedDescription:
A smartly appointed one bedroom apartment, on the ground floor of a brick-fronted end of terrace on a peaceful no through road in Blackhorse Village. You have the transport links of Blackhorse Road station, the amenities of Walthamstow High Street and wild natural environs just a short walk away.

You're a fourteen minute walk from Walthamstow Wetlands, one of the largest urban nature wetland reserves in Europe. It's a peaceful and serene 500 acre sanctuary teeming with wildlife and the perfect detox from city life.

If you lived here

The heart of your new home is sure to be your 140 square foot lounge, with all other rooms leading off. You can even step directly outside for your courtyard garden, a barely overlooked twenty five feet of chevron-tiled patio surrounding lush grass, plus welcome storage in the form of a handy shed. Complete with mature foliage overhead, it's a gloriously low-maintenance outside solace.

Back inside and your bathroom comes with a shower over the tub, your bedroom's a solid double of ninety square feet and you have still more storage in the hallway. Finally your kitchen's particularly resplendent in its gleaming mini metro tiled backsplash, stately Viridian green suite of cabinets with copper handles, extended ceramic sink and on-trend terracotta floor tiles.

Blackhorse Road station is eight minutes' walk and will whisk you to Kings Cross in less than fifteen via the Victoria line (we're practically at the top of the line here so you'll always get a seat). Drivers can be on the North Circular in seven minutes or speeding out of London on the M11 in thirteen. Two-wheeled enthusiasts are also well-catered for here with a secure bike hanger just around the corner on Ickworth Park road. The 'Mini Holland' scheme makes this the ideal neighbourhood for cyclists, with excellent air quality and the Q2 Cycleway accessible at the bottom of the road at Blackhorse Lane, to whizz you all the way to the City.

What else?

- You're half a mile from what's being increasingly referred to as 'The Walthamstow Beer Mile' here, with Truman's Social Club, Exale, Signature Brew, The Brewer's Bar and Wild Card Brewery Lockwood all within easy reach off Blackhorse Lane.
- Less than half a mile away sits St James Street station for rapid runs to Liverpool Street. Here's also where you'll find crate St James, a business community enjoying a plethora of pop-ups including a beauty therapist, tech developer, vintage outlet and vegan street food stall.
- While we're talking about crate, a special mention must be made for Crosstown, its incredible hand-crafted doughnuts, ice cream and cookies will have you in comfort food heaven in no time, and they'll deliver straight to your door.

We have refurbished the kitchen during lockdown with a lot of bespoke features such as bookshelves and wine rack, and this has been a focal point."

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
A lovingly developed and impressively spacious three bedroom family terrace with loft room, with commanding views across the City from the generous, flexible loft room and an endlessly explorable, sixty five foot long rear garden. All enviably sat barely three minutes walk from the vast greenery of Epping Forest.

Design & Decor may need some updating here and there, but with such strong fundamentals including almost 1200 square feet of living space and that huge rear garden, this is a rare find of a perfect future home.

If you lived here…

First on the agenda will be your twenty five foot long through lounge, coming in at over 500 square feet. Dual aspect with a bay window at the front and patio doors and glazed surround at the rear, there's no shortage of natural light. Bright and spacious, it's an ideal blank canvas. Next door your kitchen's eleven foot deep, a simple affair with pine cabinets and another access point for the garden. And what a garden it is, a raised patio descends to a vast stretch of lawn extending to the horizon, barely overlooked and backing onto nothing but open sky. From decks to pergolas, the possibilities out here are just as endless.

Upstairs your first floor offers up a pair of substantial double bedrooms of over 120 square feet apiece, plus a generous single ideal for a child or home office, your bathroom's fully tiled while head up the lovable open plan timber staircase for the loft room. Very much the jewel in the crown, here you have over 200 square feet of space, a wealth of storage and those tremendous views over the immediate greenery of Hale End allotments and the delights of Walthamstow laid out before you.

Wood Street station is close at hand, just fifteen minutes on foot or five by bike for direct twenty minute runs to Liverpool Street. Alternatively Walthamstow Central is just one stop away for fast swaps to the Victoria line, or a quick trip to the Empire Cinema or Walthamstow Mall, both right next door. Wood Street itself is well worth a bit of exploration, less than a half mile away on foot it's home to an increasing range of amenities, from shops and supermarkets to independent cafes, restaurants and bars.

What else?

- There are five schools deemed 'Outstanding' by Ofsted less than a mile away on foot, with a further fourteen rated 'Good' just as close. The 'Outstanding' Thorpe Hall Primary is just five minutes walk.
- With the vast green expanse of Epping Forest on your doorstep you'll never want for an escape from city life, but if you prefer your natural space a little more manicured, be sure to visit the landscaped gardens of Lloyd Park, just twenty minutes walk and well worth it for the weekly market alone.
- The award-winning independent bakery My Gammies is just a few front doors away, for a whole host of homemade, natural treats.

The neighbours are friendly and helpful and the area is close to schools, public transport and the shopping areas of Walthamstow and Highams Park."

An impressive, six bedroom, three bathroom family home, set behind gates in a prestigious North Chingford location. Rear garden in excess of 80' with detached gym/summer house to rear. Excellent access to highly regarded local schools, transport and Epping Forest.

Located in a prime North Chingford setting, Butler & Stag are delighted to offer this impressive, six bedroom family home, set behind gates and with access to some outstanding schools.

Including the gym, the property offers over 3000 sq ft of accommodation across three floors with a bay fronted reception room, open plan living/dining room to the rear along with a fitted kitchen/breakfast room, study/office and ground floor cloakroom with shower.

On the first floor, four well proportioned double bedrooms and family bathroom and on the second floor, a further two bedrooms (one with en-suite facilities).

To the front of the property as you pull off of the Ridgeway, electronic gates give access to a block paved driveway with ample parking, at the rear the 80'+ garden has a Westerly aspect, is laid with an established lawn and has several outbuildings, including the Gym which has versatility to be used as a home office or garden entertaining space.

The Ridgeway is a prime North Chingford thoroughfare that is well sited for access to local parkland, the open spaces of Epping Forest and shops and tfl 5 transport on popular Station Road.
Many families are drawn to the area for the highly sought after local schooling with many prized State and Private schools within the local area.

detailedDescription:
A smart and spacious two bedroom apartment on the second floor of a contemporary development nestled in our sought-after Nightingale Estate. Here you're blessed with a beautiful communal garden and as well as being within easy reach of the plentiful green spaces, high street and transport links of Wanstead.

Snaresbrook tube station is half a mile on foot and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in sixteen minutes, or Tottenham Court Road in twenty five. Drivers, meanwhile, have off street parking and can be on the North Circular in less than ten minutes.

If you lived here

You'll be welcoming guests into your expansive 255 square foot dual aspect lounge with sleekly engineered timber laminate underfoot, farrow and ball ammonite walls and an absolute wealth of space in which to dine and recline. Your quadruple set of windows frame glorious views over the leafy grounds and the statuesque red brick Victorian architecture beyond.

Next door and the kitchen comes with more green views, a gleaming white tiled backsplash and elegant suite of cream cabinets, while your bathroom's a gorgeous contemporary space in light pewter with a shower over the tub. Your master bedroom's a generous double of over 105 square feet with a luxury statement wall and built-in storage, and bedroom two's a versatile seventy square feet. Lastly, your communal garden's lush lawn and mature foliage are wonderfully tranquil, set as you are on a no through road with minimal traffic.

Outside, Wanstead High Street is less than a half mile on foot. The bustling heart of this popular East London village, it's home to a wide range of independent cafes, gourmet pubs and independent produce suppliers including a butchers and fishmongers. Bare Brew was set up by Gemma and Lisa and serves up incredible brunches in a dog-friendly environment, while award-winning Sumo Fresh's Gindara grilled black cod inside out roll is out of this world. Closer to home and on your very street you can support local entrepreneur Akansha by indulging in her mouth-watering range of homemade sweet treats in The Better Batter Bakery.

What else?

- Parents will be pleased to know you have eleven primary/secondary schools just in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted, five of which have been deemed 'Outstanding'.
- For your new local we have to recommend The Duke for its delicious food, a wide range of events, real ales and fine wines. Just a seven minute walk away. Don't miss the other nightlife options on Nightingale Lane either. It's a great spot to have around the corner.
- Leyton Flats and Eagle Pond are an eleven minute jaunt for fresh air, picnics and reaching fitness goals. You can also hop onto the W12 bus route here to be whisked to the myriad delights of Walthamstow in mere minutes.

detailedDescription:
Coachmakers Yard
Set in the popular East London location of Walthamstow (Zone 3), Coachmakers Yard is our newest development launching this summer, boasting a stylish collection of 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments available through Shared Ownership.

Nestled in the heart of a newly developed area just off Blackhorse Lane you'll find Coachmakers Yard, boasting fantastic commuter connections, vast open spaces and a thriving urban community. Enjoy a stunning interior specification with underfloor heating and state-of-the-art Smeg kitchen appliances as standard.

1 Bed Apartment

Price Breakdown
Market value £355,000
Share 25%
Share Price £88,750
Minimum Deposit Required £8,875
Estimated Monthly Mortgage £400
Estimated Monthly Rent £619
Estimated Monthly Service Charge £135
Total Monthly Outgoings £1,145
Total household income of £41,256

What is Shared Ownership?
Shared Ownership is a government backed scheme allowing you to buy a share in a property from 25% to 75% of the full market value and pay a subsidised rent on the remainder. Because you only have to put down a deposit on the share you buy, you won't need to save as much for a deposit as you would if you were buying outright.

Popular Walthamstow is home to the longest outdoor market in Europe- Walthamstow Market, Empire cinema, The Mall - with lots of household names to explore, and an array of popular bars and restaurants.
Walthamstow Wetlands, Europe’s largest urban wetland and nature reserve, is a stone’s throw away with 13 pathways through the 251-acre site enabling locals to view and cycle through its 10 reservoirs and offer the opportunity to spot a variety of wildlife and endangered bird species.
