Not to mention, Tottenham Hale Retail Park isn’t too far away (only 8 minutes by bus), where you’ll find familiar high-street names and popular home, retail and food chain restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Coachmakers Yard
Set in the popular East London location of Walthamstow (Zone 3), Coachmakers Yard is our newest development launching this summer, boasting a stylish collection of 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments available through Shared Ownership.

Nestled in the heart of a newly developed area just off Blackhorse Lane you'll find Coachmakers Yard, boasting fantastic commuter connections, vast open spaces and a thriving urban community. Enjoy a stunning interior specification with underfloor heating and state-of-the-art Smeg kitchen appliances as standard.

What is Shared Ownership?
Shared Ownership is a government backed scheme allowing you to buy a share in a property from 25% to 75% of the full market value and pay a subsidised rent on the remainder. Because you only have to put down a deposit on the share you buy, you won't need to save as much for a deposit as you would if you were buying outright.

address: Crosbie House, Prospect Hill, Walthamstow, London E17
detailedDescription:
This is a wonderful two bedroom split level flat brand new to the market ideally located for Walthamstow Central Station and minutes away from the popular Village. Situated on the ground floor, this sunny flat is bright and airy with views over the huge communal garden. The property has a unique vintage charm and has been decorated and maintained by the current vendors, all the rooms are of good size, two bedrooms with a lovely spacious lounge and a fitted kitchen/diner.

Round the corner is Walthamstow Village where you have a great choice of places to eat and drink as well as the many shops and boutiques. You are also just a short walk to the Wild Card Brewery, God's Own Junkyard and Wood Street with its quirky vintage market and overground train into Liverpool Street (15 mins via Hackney). Walthamstow Central is 10 minutes’ walk away via The Scene; Walthamstow's multi-screen cinema and restaurant complex and E17's famous street market.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A bright and serene one bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a low rise development with utterly exquisite front and rear gardens. Here you're sat on a tranquil, tree-lined street that's nonetheless right in the beating heart of Walthamstow, moments away from The Village and excellent transport links.

The comprehensive transport connections of Walthamstow Central station (and its accompanying hub of myriad bus routes) are just a five minute walk around the corner, for direct twenty minute runs to Liverpool Street and Oxford Circus. So you have both the City and West End well under a half hour away door-to-door.

If you lived here…

You'll love living in this perfectly positioned sweet spot, on a leafy street with the solace of two private green spaces of your very own and yet the pulsating life and culture of our borough within five minutes' walk. Your interior is just as alluring. Let's start with your huge 170 square foot lounge; its plush cream carpet, pristine white walls, generous dining area and gorgeous green views making it a tempting prospect indeed.

Next door the kitchen is immaculate in gleaming white metro tiles and timber worktops, and looks out over your rear south-west facing garden. It's a glorious sunspot benefiting from afternoon and evening light with a lush lawn, lovingly-tended bed and a canopy of foliage. Perfect. Back inside and the bathroom enjoys a similar impeccable aesthetic to the kitchen while lastly, your bedroom's a brilliantly sizeable 155 square feet with more plush carpet and a wealth of built-in storage.

Outside and your new neighbourhood is abuzz with artisan shops, cafes, restaurants and bars with one of the biggest attractions being Hoe Street, a cosmopolitan thoroughfare home to a huge array of restaurants. SoDo on Hatherley Mews is one of the most celebrated, with its unchallenged reputation as the best purveyors of sourdough pizzas, and award-winning The Collab's We Serve Humans food is out of this world. Meanwhile, the nearby Village is incredibly picturesque and just around the corner. You must take a stroll down leafy Orford Road for yet more high end establishments to suit every palate.

What else?

- You have bicycle storage both within the grounds and in a secure hanger on your street. Perfect for joining the Q2 Cycleway from outside the Mall at Selborne Road, to whizz your way straight to the City.
- Drivers are well-catered for too, with on street parking and easy access to the North Circular in seven minutes and the M11 in under ten.
- If it's natural environs you're craving then you're spoilt for choice here with Walthamstow Wetlands and Epping Forest both easily reachable. Closer to home, Lloyd Park is a favourite among locals with landscaped gardens, a lake, Saturday farmers' market and the William Morris Gallery.

Bathroom

Bedroom (3.73m x 3.80m (12'2" x 12'5"))

Reception Room (3.25m x 4.77m (10'7" x 15'7"))

Kitchen (3.25m x 2.04m (10'7" x 6'8"))

Garden (12.5m (41'0"))

A word from the owner.....

"West Avenue Road has been a wonderful first home. I have loved spending time in the flat and have really enjoyed making the most of its private garden, a sunny oasis of calm and birds despite being a stone's throw away from the Village, High Street and station. The flat is brilliantly located for getting into central London, the City and enjoying Walthamstow, with Lloyd Park and the Village a short walk away. The flat is roomy, with excellent storage and even a private shed which is perfect for bikes and a bbq, which can be enjoyed in the garden."

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Churchill Estates are pleased to bring to market a conveniently located and immaculately presented two bedroom ground floor maisonette situated in a private cul-de-sac just off Hermon Hill. Being sold with added benefit of no chain, the property comes complete with double glazing throughout and comprises a sizeable living area, separate fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, two good size bedrooms and a contemporary fully tiled shower room. Further benefits include a long lease in excess of 900 years, large communal garden shared between only four flats, entry to the flat through your own private front door and two parking spaces in the form of a private resident's car park. Ideally positioned within close proximity to both Snaresbrook (0. 8 miles) and South Woodford Station (0.7 miles) along with the popular and highly regarded Wanstead High Street, offering an array of shops, bars and eateries. address: South Birkbeck Road, Leytonstone, London E11
detailedDescription:
Situated in E11 but conveniently close to Leyton Tube Station, this beautifully presented three bedroom house has been replastered and painted throughout, with a new windows and boiler fitted in 2020. In addition to its stunning decor, this gorgeous family home also has a south facing garden which backs onto lovely Langthorne Park.

Situated in E11 but conveniently close to Leyton Tube Station, this beautifully presented three bedroom house has been replastered and painted throughout, with a new windows and boiler fitted in 2020. In addition to its stunning decor, this gorgeous family home also has a south facing garden which backs onto lovely Langthorne Park.

Location is everything, and this three bedroom property puts you right in the heart of the vibrant local community of Leyton High Road, offers great commuting opportunities and also gives you access to nearby Olympic Park. More on the local area soon, but first, let's explore the house itself...

As you approach the property, you'll see it offers both on-street parking and a gated driveway for additional security, along with a well-maintained facade. Upon entering, you'll pass through a small hallway, separated from the vast ground floor by a fully glazed door.

As you pass though into the main living area, it's hard to say what will grab your attention first, as it has so many show-stopping qualities. The incredible open-plan design of the living area and dining room offers such an impressive sense of space that you could choose almost any configuration and size or style of furniture – even the staircase leading up from the lounge adds to the airy feel. The beautiful front aspect bay window (with its stylish wooden shutters) lets in a huge amount of light – which is only added to by the French doors that lead out to the garden at the rear of the living area.

Gorgeous engineered wooden floorboards running through the space adds a classic touch to the otherwise contemporary decor, which is light, bright and accented with grey, ultra-modern radiators. Storage will never be an issue either, with an array of cleverly concealed cupboards built-in under the stairs which also offers some shelving as you enter into the dining area.

At the rear of the lounge and to the left - where the room narrows to enter the dining room section - step through the double doors and into the garden, via the spacious side-return. As you enter the main garden area there's a flagstone patio, plus an external brick-built storage cupboard for stowing away your gardening tools and kids' toys. This leads onto a large grassed area, with borders and fencing either side. Private and a real south-facing sun trap, this garden has plenty of potential and space for grown-up seating, some children's play equipment and a barbecue – whatever you feel best suits your outdoor lifestyle!

Back into the lounge and to the left, walk through into the dining space with its continued wooden flooring. Bathed in light from the large side window and the natural rays seeping in from the kitchen, there's enough room here for a large table and chairs for mealtimes with family and friends, or you could even convert this into a play area or office space. Further storage and shelving ensure your space remains uncluttered and the light decor and grey radiator theme is carried on into this area.

To the rear of the dining space you'll see the archway into the kitchen – which has been designed to utilise every available inch. The practical layout is helped along by a number of lower and wall-mounted cupboards and a considerable amount of workspace. The style is a return to the more traditional here, with neutral and beige wall tiles, light floor tiling and wooden cupboard fronts, lifted into a slightly more modern feel by the grey speckled worktops.

Heading back towards the front of the property, you'll see that the stairs have recently been treated to plush new grey carpeting, which continues throughout the bedrooms and landing areas. Up ahead and to the left as you arrive on the first landing you'll see the family bathroom, which may be small in size but includes underfloor heating and packs a real punch in the style stakes! Recently refurbished from scratch, this bathroom is bright and slick, with a modern suite and over-bath rain shower. Light white/grey tiling and some smart storage under the sink and above the WC make the most of this wonderfully executed room.

To the left of the bathroom lying to the rear of the house is one of three fantastic bedrooms. Decorated in the same cool, cotemporary style, it can accommodate a single or small double bed, or could easily be repurposed into a nursery or office.

Back down the landing you'll see another small flight of stairs leading to the upper level of this spacious house and up ahead past the large landing, you'll enter the master bedroom, with dual, front-aspect windows with wooden shutters and a view onto the lovely street. A grand space with lots of natural light, you can relax here after a busy day with the option to populate the space with any furniture you desire.

As you leave this room, immediately to your left you'll see the third bedroom. Another good sized space, this room could be used as a guest room, kid's or teenager's room. The rear window and light decor is warmed up by the cosy carpet, another wonderful space ready to move right into.

While this house is pretty much perfect on the inside and out, you'll also benefit from that great location we mentioned. For a quick drink, stroll to one of your well-loved local pubs, such as the Birkbeck Tavern or Leyton Star or for your shopping needs, you can visit local retail outlets such as tk Maxx, Currys and B&Q, as well as a nearby asda supermarket. Being so close to Leyton High Road, there's a vast array of places to eat and drink nearby, with global cuisine, hearty gastro pubs and chic bars all within easy reach.

This three bedroom house really does have everything – you can head off into nature, hang-out with friends or simply enjoy the peace and tranquility of this genuinely beautiful property.

What the seller says…
This has been our home for 17 years and we have now decided to move out of London but have loved our time here. The property is close to local shops and underground, which take about 20 minutes into the City. We have a park to the rear of our garden. We have recently carried out some refurbishment but the property has potential as neighbouring properties have extended to the rear and the loft space'.

detailedDescription:
***£725,000 - £750,000***
A superb brand new development situated on South Birkbeck Road. This 3 bedroom detached family home benefits from a high quality finish throughout, to include underfloor heating and a private garden. The property also benefits from having a great views from the first floor overlooking Langthorne Park.

The property offers an open planed lounge, ground floor WC and a modern Lerner kitchen that comprises of all brand new appliances. Situated on the first floor there are three good size bedrooms including a master bedroom with en-suite toilet and family bathroom.

This contemporary family home has been meticulously designed to utilise every inch of space whilst retaining a flexible layout to suit every families need.

The development is perfectly located for a work⁄life balance with great transport links and an endless choice of fantastic amenities to include green spaces to visit on your weekends. Located just a short walk from Leyton & Leyton Midland stations there are also fantastic bus and cycle routes to reach further afield. title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A simply charming two bedroom apartment, situated on the upper ground floor of an elegant townhouse on Orford Road.

This beautifully presented home has windows on three sides, ensuring it is light filled throughout the day, as well as having plenty of incredibly handy storage for all the necessities of modern life. The reception room (like the rest of the flat) has a high ceiling, which with the light that pours in from the front aspect bay window accentuates the feeling of space. There is ample room here to both relax and dine, meaning this is somewhere that will be in constant use. Directly behind it, off the hallway, is the family bathroom. It features a three piece suite, including a shower over the tub, as well as sleek and stylish tiled walls and flooring.

The two double bedrooms are both well proportioned, with the main one positioned mid-point and the other at the rear. Finally there is the kitchen, which is again at the rear of the property. It has modern fitted units and work surfaces arranged along two walls, with tiled splashbacks.

As we said at the very start, simply charming...

Living Here...

It's pretty hard to imagine a location more “central Village” than being on Orford Road. Everything you need is on your doorstep. Need a pint of milk? Then wander along to the award winning Spar (bet you end up coming out with more than a pint though!) Fancy meeting up with mates for something to eat? Try Eat 17, or The Kitchen, or one of the many other restaurants and gastro pubs. Forgoing food and just meeting for a drink? Take your pick – there’s The Queens, The Castle, Wildcard, Mother’s Ruin…ok, so you get the picture. And that’s without heading in the other direction from your front door and hitting Hoe Street, where there is always something to see, do or enjoy.

When it’s time to head to the office, fortunately that’s made just that bit easier by the proximity of Walthamstow Central Station, meaning you can hit the snooze button on the alarm just one more time…

In The Owners Words...

We have lived here since 2004 and enjoyed seeing the village transform into a hub where the community bonds together and neighbours rarely move which gives a village feeling. Our son has benefitted from being at the very popular Henry Maynard Primary School. After school many families meet at Wingfield Park to play and chat which is great for networking in a new community. We have also enjoyed being in the position to get to Oxford Circus in under 30 minutes, Epping Forest in 15 minutes and the village cafes and pubs in 2 minutes.

detailedDescription:

The property is set back from Coolgardie Avenue with gated access to the side leading to a garage.
Internally the property enjoys a wide bay lounge to the front with double doors leading to a spacious family living dining room and a modern fitted kitchen. On the first floor there are 3 good size bedrooms, superb family bathroom and steps leading up to a well fitted, tranquil and bright loft room. The rear garden layout is an absolute delight! Comprising a patio area for entertaining, lawn expanse and to the rear, accessed under a pergola is a raised decked area overlooking a garden pond - ideal for relaxing after a hard day's work and catching the early evening sunshine, shielded with an abundance of fragrant flowers and shrub borders - Perfect!

detailedDescription:
Offered chain free, this fabulously spacious and unique five bedroom double fronted end of terrace home with stunning live/work studio and beautiful private roof terrace is conveniently situated within easy walking distance of Leytonstone Central Line tube station, offering easy access into the City & West End. A wonderful variety of trees and foliage provide a natural green canopy separating this impressive property from the road, which is only a short stroll away from Leytonstone's main shopping area, hosting an array of popular eateries and bars and the vast open fields of Wanstead Flats nearby bring even more nature within easy reach.

Comprising: This intriguing home welcomes you in via a bright and airy hallway leading you to the first of two reception rooms, all enriched with timber flooring. The impeccable space enjoys views through the impressive double aspect sash windows surrounded by trees, making the room perfect for relaxing. At the end of the hallway is a convenient ground floor utility / WC whilst a doorway and stairs provide easy access to the powered cellar with extra utilities and ample storage. Located to the right of the hallway is the second reception room bathed in natural light from a third bay window, an ideal entertaining space to host family and friends for dinner parties, as it lends itself into the stylish fitted kitchen.

Complete with fitted wall and base units, natural oak work surface and modern range cooker, this kitchen will fast become the heart of your home providing a cosy hub all year round with its underfloor heating. Full-height tri-fold sliding doors lead seamlessly out into the rear garden helping to invite the outside in and provide a great feature when dining alfresco in the secluded landscaped garden with timber planter and climbing foliage. A beautiful wrought iron spiral staircase connects the ground floor garden to the roof terrace and is just one of the wonderful vintage features found throughout the property.

On the first floor you will locate a stunning double aspect main bedroom, which has been adorned with a beautiful roll top bath for ultimate relaxation. The second bedroom is located to the rear of the property which has access, via floor-to-ceiling glazed door, to the large private roof terrace, a serene space ideal for catching the sun. There is another good size third bedroom with access to spacious loft storage, and there's a fourth bedroom ideal for use as a home office or nursery. Lastly you will find an attractive walk-in rainfall shower room.

The front garden boasts Acacia, Eucalyptus, Magnolia, Plum and Cherry trees with a separate entrance and path leading to the self-contained studio. Inside, the 225 square foot approx. Double-height modern studio has been finished to a high standard to include a newly installed fitted kitchen with integrated oven, hob and fridge freezer, a mezzanine floor bedroom, exposed timber beams, Velux windows, wood burner, shower room, WC and storage area.

The studio, which has its own entrance door and patio doors to the rear garden, could be utilised as a separate lodging, a live/work space or to accommodate an extra family member or guests.

In Addition:

- Short stroll to the vast open fields of Wanstead Flats

- Good access to Leytonstone High Road Rail station

- Road links incl. A12, A406 & M11

- Transport links into Stratford Westfield & East Village

- 17 Schools & Colleges rated either 'Outstanding' or 'Good' by Ofsted located within a mile radius

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
1 bedroom apartment available for £95,625 with Shared Ownership in Walthamstow!

Reserve this one bedroom apartment before 31 July to receive a bespoke interior design package worth up to £3,000*

Available to purchase with Shared Ownership, buyers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

1 bedroom 7th floor apartment offering 50 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.

£95,625 for a 25% share of £382,500 and a deposit as low as £4,781 and a minimum income of £50,530.

The Chain
Walthamstow is seeing an unprecedented rate of growth and investment into the town centre and surrounding areas. Waltham Forest's residents and businesses stand to benefit significantly from the economic growth taking place across London. The boroughs well-connected location in the east of London, the cultural heart of the capital, along with its unique identity founded in cultural heritage, its burgeoning arts and creative industries, and abundant green spaces all contribute towards the urban vibrancy that makes Waltham Forest a special place to live. In relative terms, Waltham Forest is now growing faster than any other borough in London. In the last five years the number of jobs in the borough has increased by 30 per cent (the highest in London) and the number of businesses by 40 per cent (the sixth highest increase in London). This in part is due to the significant effect of investment in Olympic legacy projects but also in the overall growth in London and the movement of the capitals economic activity eastwards.

Walthamstow Connections
The Chain is perfectly positioned, close to three train stations with excellent transport links. More green space to walk, run, or cycle than any other part of London. Located near South Grove, The Chain is just a 10 minute walk to Walthamstow Central where you'll find shops, bars and restaurants as well as your favourite retailers within The Mall shopping centre. Walthamstow Leisure centre is an 8 minute walk from The Chain, or just a 3 minute bus journey and offers a 68-station gym, 6 Badminton courts, 2 Squash courts, an Ofsted registered crèche, 5-a-side red-crumb football pitch, a studio and gymnasium.

What is Shared Ownership?
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don't own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An elegantly presented four bedroom terrace, extended over three floors and flawlessly finished throughout. You have a capacious 330 square foot front lounge, an equally generous kitchen/diner, underfloor heating and a pristine, private rear garden. It's all just a third of a mile from Wood Street.

Equally ideal for a family or couple, this impressive property is available chain free

If you lived here

You'll be luxuriating in your twenty six feet long through lounge. It's a splendid space with lovingly restored original timber floorboards underfoot, an ornate vintage ebony hearth and mantelpiece and many other period touches like dado rails and overhead cornicing. There's plenty of room for the most ambitious hosts, or for the whole family to just spread out doing their own thing.

Move towards the rear, and your 260 square foot kitchen/diner is every bit as impressive with oversized sandstone tiling underfoot, metro tile splashbacks and timber worktops. Hanging copper shaded lighting illuminates the large central breakfast bar and Dublin sink, and you can throw the whole space open to the garden, a mix of patio and zero-maintenance tru lawn with a handy shed.

Upstairs, and the front bedroom is a solid double of 130 square feet, while to the rear you have a generous single of 95 square feet, both finished to the same high standard. The family bathroom's especially impressive, with a freestanding clawfoot tub, vintage fittings and rainfall shower. On the second floor you have bedrooms three or four, plus the second bathroom - a sleek grey affair with oversized shower cubicle.

What else?

- You have twenty primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including the 'Outstanding' Woodside Primary Academy and Whitefield Schools, both arounda third of a mile on foot
- Drivers can be on the North Circular in around five minutes.
- You're fortunate enough to have one of the borough's newest, most comprehensive fitness centres on your doorstep. Waltham Forest Feelgood Centre, with swimming pools, gym, athletics track, climbing wall, extreme playground, sports hall, health suite and fitness classes, is just around the corner.

A word from the owner....

"Starting our family in this house couldn’t have been more of a joy. Situated so close to so many brilliant parks and the beautiful Epping Forest not to mention the vibrant and accessible community of Walthamstow."

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A substantial, grand and particularly generous five bedroom Edwardian end of terrace, artfully expanded to include two loft bedrooms and extended to the rear so you can stretch out in the skylit kitchen/diner. You also have twin bathrooms, dual receptions and a beautiful suntrap of a rear garden.

You're sat on a peaceful, tree-lined street here, but nonetheless just a couple of moments around the corner from our main thoroughfare of Forest Road, with landmarks like Lloyd Park, Bell Corner and Walthamstow Village all within easy reach.

If you lived here…

You'll be stretching out in an elegantly arranged suite of rooms, combining the generous proportions of the period with the recent expertly executed extensions and totalling almost 1400 square feet. Your broad, welcoming hallway is immediately impressive, with smart engineered hardwood underfoot and your first reception on the left, a bow windowed 150 square feet with striking statement chimney breast and carpet underfoot.

Next door, your second reception's a still more spacious 180 square feet, easily zoneable and with double internal doors opening the whole space up to your extended kitchen/diner. In here you have dove grey hardwood effect vinyl underfoot, twin skylights and a wealth of recessed spotlights overhead, timber counters and a charming rustic backsplash. Your ground floor shower room's down here too – a lifesaver on busy mornings, with a designer rainfall shower and marbled grey tiling from floor to ceiling.

Head out into the garden for your suntrap of a rear courtyard, with beds down either side, flanked by timber fencing and overseen by mature greenery, before ending in a stretch of lawn and handy shed. It all makes for the perfect spot for al fresco dining with a huge amount of potential for the green-fingered. Sit back, relax and take a breath of fresh air along with a break from city life.

Back inside and upstairs you have two double bedrooms (your master's a particularly impressive 150 square feet, with its own bow window) plus a single ideal for a child or home office. The family bathroom's roomy and stylish, while up in the lovingly developed loft you have another pair of double bedrooms, artfully overlapping to make the most of the space, with twin skylights to the front and leafy green garden views to the rear.

Outside and everything that makes our borough so special is laid out at your fingertips – the landscaped gardens and open green spaces of Lloyd Park are just a five minute walk, perfect for morning jogs and evening strolls and home to a wide range of sports clubs and classes. Here's also where you'll find the William Morris Gallery dedicated to the work of one of our most famous sons and the ideal spot to pick up unique adornments for your new home. Even better, the renowned destination of Walthamstow Village is just a half mile on foot, for a huge range of the most highly regarded bars, restaurants and gastropubs for miles around.

What else?

- The comprehensive transport hub of Walthamstow Central is less than fifteen minutes' stroll away, for regular, direct twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus and Liverpool Street.
- Our schools are excellent, you have twenty four primary/secondaries less than a mile away on foot, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted with six deemed 'Outstanding'.
- You're lucky enough to have the Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre just five minutes' walk away, with its multi-million pound range of sports facilities including an Olympic pool, gym, courts, running tracks, climbing wall, health suite, trampoline park and more.

detailedDescription:
Being sold with No Onward Chain, Churchill Estates are delighted to bring to market this wonderfully unique two double bedroom, Grade II Listed Terraced House.

Upon entry you are welcomed by a generously sized entrance hall boasting two large storage cupboards. To your right you find a well-equipped fully fitted kitchen with modern integrated appliances. Onwards you have a substantial living area, flooded with natural light through an ornate floor to ceiling original sash window and patio door leading out to a well maintained South West facing communal garden.

The upstairs comprises of two comfortable double bedrooms with breathtakingly high ceilings, a fully tiled family bathroom and the loft space ideal for additional storage. Further benefits include gas central heating, private front garden and two allocated parking spaces.

Not only that but you are within walking distance to both Snaresbrook and South Woodford Central Line Station's and Wanstead High Street with an array of amenities ranging from local bakeries, bars and boutique shops.

For more information or to arrange an appointment to view, please contact the office at your earliest convenience to avoid disappointment.

The property, located on the top floor of a period building, is within walking distance of Leyton Midland Road, Walthamstow Central and Walthamstow Queens Road stations, as well as Leyton underground and Leytonstone underground stations. Local bus routes are minutes away serving Stratford, Walthamstow and Central London. Local amenities are within walking distance in Lea Bridge Road including shops, restaurants and pubs. The property also benefits from being within walking distance to the new Lea Bridge Road station which has direct access into Stratford. The local landmarks like Westfield shopping centre, Epping forest and the Olympic park are all very close and easily accessible.

The buyer will require a deposit to obtain a mortgage for this property.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A true Walthamstow classic in an area close to transport links, 10 acres of green space at Lloyd Park, and not far from the restaurants and cultural hub of the Village. This freshly refurbished two storey home has 3 bedrooms, 2 reception rooms and a large south-facing garden.

Step into one of the original terraced Warner homes, famous during the Victorian era for the quality of their design and workmanship.

As you enter the first reception room, you get an instant hit of the full length of the property through to the garden, from where the natural light floods through the french doors into the large contemporary kitchen. A space for epic gatherings extending out to a dining space overlooking the garden.

Every area of the home has a strong line and purpose, with the bonus of an indoor dining area away from the kitchen, creating a versatile layout with loads of potential to adapt to your homelife.

Upstairs the family bathroom is modern and light with plenty of storage. And the size of the double bedroom is amplified by a modern mirrored wardrobe space.
A lovely open family home, steeped in history and surrounded by green space and plenty of local schools.

In The Owners Words...

“This has been our family home for over 20 years, having brought up 2 children who are now adults. We have always enjoyed our home and will miss it greatly when we move, especially the lovely neighbours and the large South facing garden and beyond, which at times can feel like you are in the countryside, especially in the summer. The home has always felt very light and spacious and the Kitchen, large and great for entertaining. There are great transport links nearby to both underground train stations, plenty or buses and nearby conveniences. Walthamstow marshes is only minutes away and great for long walks as is Lloyds Park which is also great for children of all ages. Another great thing is that Stratford's Olympic park is only a few miles away by bus, tube or car or if like me you like to ride a bike there are loads of cycle ways that take you to the park."

detailedDescription:
Viewings - Saturday 19th June - By Appointment Only

A lovely mid-terrace Victorian house situated on a quiet and popular residential street in Leyton.

This pretty Victorian house is ideal for young families as it is in the catchment for Riverley and Willowbrook Primary Schools, which are both rated 'Outstanding' by Ofsted. The extensive green spaces of Leyton Jubilee Park are a short stroll away. There are useful bus links at the end of the road and Lea Bridge Road Overground Station is a 10-minute walk; linking you directly to the city. Trendy Chatsworth Road in Clapton and the River Lea are also nearby, offering opportunities for weekend activities.

This Victorian house has a lovely front garden and upon entering there is a large open plan sitting room, dining room and kitchen. The space is bright and spacious with engineered wooden flooring throughout. The kitchen has lots of storage and preparation space and there are doors that open onto a large 45 ft private south-west facing garden.

Out and about
Chatsworth Road - A short walk across Hackney marshes, Chatsworth Road has an abundance of cafes, pubs, restaurants and a fantastic Sunday market.
Leyton Jubilee Park - Great facilities for sports and recreation and a natural meadow during the summer. Grab a coffee from the cafe or an ice lolly on a hot summer’s day.
Hare and Hounds - lovely pub with great burgers, live music, comedy and an all-weather beer garden.
Turning Earth E10 - Artist led space running ceramics courses and studios for ceramicists.
Walthamstow Market - Europe's largest street market. The place to pick up a bargain!
Walthamstow Wetlands Nature Reserve - Area of protected wetlands, great for a walk and to visit the Engine House Cafe.

title: 3 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A lovely first floor Victorian flat in the heart of Walthamstow Village.

This is a beautifully presented two-bedroom flat situated on what is considered to be the best street in the village. There is a wealth of cafes, independent shops, restaurants and pubs on your doorstep making this an exciting place to live. There are excellent transport links including Walthamstow Central (Victoria Line) and useful bus links a short walk away on Hoe Street.

Upon entering there is a wide and welcoming hallway leading on to a dual-aspect open plan kitchen, dining room and sitting room. This is a lovely space; cleverly zoned with engineered wooden flooring and beautiful original windows. The kitchen is fully integrated with plenty of preparation space.

There are two bedrooms; one double and a large single and a large modern bathroom with a bath and a shower. There is a lovely 65 ft private garden which is perfect for relaxing in the spring and summer months.

Out and about
Spar - The ultimate local shop offering an amazing array of artisan products and home to stone baked take away pizza.
The Castle - Family friendly, traditional pub serving local ales, fine wines and fantastic food. There is a fire when it’s cold and a beer garden for long summer evenings.
Ravenswood Industrial Estate - Home to Gods Own Junkyard, Mothers Ruin and The Wild Card Brewery.
Froth and Rind – a lovely cafe with excellent coffee
Parish Wines - A new forward-thinking wine café-bar and shop in Walthamstow Village E17. Closely-curated wine selection, quality coffee & provisions.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful one bedroom maisonette within a smart and secure gated development in our sought after Bushwood area. Moments from Wanstead Flats and a short walk from Leytonstone Station, this bright apartment offers generous living space and plenty of storage, for neat apartment living in a superb spot.

You'll be moving into a friendly community among tree-lined streets, in an area named after the ancient woodlands it borders. With the vast expanse of Wanstead Flats moments from your door, you'll feel as close to nature as you can while still being a stone's throw from the city. Leytonstone is under a fifteen minute walk from you and is replete with independent shops, pubs and eateries, and you're a similar distance from the foodie haven of Winchelsea Arches.

If you lived here

You'll step through your porch and make your way up the newly carpeted stairs to your welcoming hallway. Ahead is your bedroom, a calming 115 square foot space. The walls are a soft neutral shade and there's cornicing to the ceiling. Next along is your bright lounge diner, which gives you a generous 150 square foot to arrange as you like for relaxing and entertaining. Pine toned engineered flooring lies underfoot, and there's an elegant cabinet unit along one wall.

Your eighty five square foot kitchen is just off the right of the space, with brand new stylish vinyl tiling underfoot. There's plenty of neat white units, a cheerful red feature wall, and room for a breakfast table. Back through the hall, bookended by large storage spaces, you'll find your bathroom. Part tiled in calming creamy shades, it has a modern white suite including concealed cistern toilet, and shower over the tub.

You're barely a moment from Wanstead Flats, giving you more than 300 acres to explore any time. It's an easy thirteen minute stroll to Leytonstone Station, where the Central Line will take you to Stratford for shopping at Westfield in seven minutes and Liverpool Street in under twenty. There's an ubitricity charging station five minutes around the corner if you drive electric, and it's just a couple of miles to the North Circular and the M11, so getting around or out of town is simple.

What else?

- Your new local is The Rookwood Village, where you can try your hand at interactive darts before enjoying a freshly made burger.
- Don't miss the Leytonstone Festival, an annual feast of arts and music that puts the spotlight on the area and brings new worlds to your neighbourhood.

Hall

Bathroom (1.71m x 2.86m (5'7" x 9'4" ))

Kitchen (2.13m x 3.93m (6'11" x 12'10" ))

Storage

Lounge/ Diner (3.07m x 4.58m (10'0" x 15'0" ))

A word from the owner....

"We moved in as first time buyers two years ago and have absolutely loved living here, both in Leytonstone and in our lovely flat. Our home is so bright and spacious and there's such a wonderful community in the Close. We are spoilt with green spaces - Wanstead Flats is on our doorstep and we've enjoyed many runs around Wanstead Park and cycles through Leyton Flats and up to Epping Forest. We're always ready to enjoy one of the many amazing local pubs, whether it's a delicious roast at the Leytonstone Tavern or sipping a pint in the huge Holly Tree beer garden. And if it's just a lazy Sunday for us, then a trip to the Wild Goose Bakery for some fresh coffee and sourdough is always a must! Being so well connected with the Central Line and Overground has also been ideal. We will really miss living in Cookes Close."

** guide price £440,000 - £460,000** Allen Davies are proud to offer for sale this lovely two double bedroom converstion located in the prestigious bushwood area, close to leytonstone high road and epping forest. The property has been well maintained by the current owners, A generous reception rooms, spacious kitchen/diner and a family bathroom. The second bedroom is located in the loft converstion. This one offers great access to wanstead and forest gate, also with the A12 and the A406 being within easy reach getting further afield is made much easier. Locally you have various options for eating out, leytonstone high road offers an array of pubs and eataries, you will be spoiled for choice, our favourites are the red lion, la bella vita and the north star, with it's lovely thai menu. Leytonstone High Road is a hub of activity, as well as great places to eat and drink there are plenty of shops from large national retailers to quirky independent traders making this an interesting place to live. If open grassland is required, you are a stones through from wanstead flats and the start of epping forest with a boating lake at hollow ponds to throw in the mix. This one won't hang around, it's a great flat in a great location.

*viewing day 19 th June between 1PM- 2PM*
Audrey Yombo Real Estate is delighted to present to the market this well presented four-bedroom Mid terrace Victorian House, situated in the popular Barclays Estate.
On the ground floor of this beautiful home, you are greeted with a wide, bright hallway as you enter the property which leads into a large through lounge perfect as a separate entertainment room. The ground floor has an unlimited amount of space with a large kitchen dinner, housing a downstairs a separate lounge area, leading to a conservatory. For growing family, this space is perfect as it serves multiple purposes.
On the first floor you have three bedrooms, a family bathroom. The master bedroom is situated on the third floor with its own en-suite and built-in wardrobe space.
This stunning large home is situated within walking distance to the popular Barclay primary schools, it is 5 minutes- walk to Leyton Midland Overground Station with Leytonstone Station being a 20 Minutes’ walk which services the Central Line to Liverpool Street.

Leyton High road offers a lot of shops and Amenities all within walking distance, with Abbots Park a 5 minutes’ walk from the property .
By bus you have Walthamstow Central Station which is 15 minutes away and services the Victoria Line to Brixton. There you also have access to the overground train to Liverpool Street. Stratford Westfield is a half an hour bus ride.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price - £550,000-£575,000. This delightful three-bed mid terrace house is ideally located less than twenty minutes from Leyton tube station and is perfect for those looking for a welcoming community and or wishing to commute into the city. Wanstead Flats are less than a ten minute walk away and close access to a busy, vibrant High Street ensures every need is catered for.

Guide Price - £550,000-£575,000. This delightful three-bed mid terrace house is ideally located less than twenty minutes from Leyton tube station and is perfect for those looking for a welcoming community and or wishing to commute into the city. Wanstead Flats are less than a ten minute walk away and close access to a busy, vibrant High Street ensures every need is catered for.

Entering the property straight into the hallway with its white walls, high ceilings and lovely wooden flooring, the classy feel of the house is established literally as soon as you cross the threshold. Immediately to your right is the reception room, a generously sized through-lounge with a gorgeous street facing bay window. The window allows the space to be flooded with natural light, its spaciousness emphasised by the high ceilings. There's more than enough space in this room for both a comfortable suite and a dining table, so you can optimise this central social hub however you choose.

At the back left hand side of the lounge is the door to the kitchen – a truly modern and chic space. White kitchen units line the entire right side of the room, incorporating the oven and sink and overlaid with an exquisite white-marble styled countertop. White tiling lines the wall between the countertop and overhead cabinets, and to the left side, there are further handy units and a beautiful overhead, glass-fronted cabinet. There's also room here for a coffee table, a lovely space for breakfast or a natter over a glass of wine. The kitchen opens into the utility room, which in turn looks over the garden, allowing in additional sunlight to add to the bright and clean feel of this functional and beautiful room.

The utility room, also painted white with white tiling, provides ample space for extra facilities, and has a further handy countertop on the right-hand side. The back door opens out onto the garden which has been aesthetically designed with a grey tile patio and lawn area lined on either side with flower beds. These have red wooden panelling which matches the stylish red fencing that provides privacy in the space. Towards the back of the garden there is another patio space that houses a shed, allowing for some useful exterior storage. Decently sized, this garden is an excellent area to catch a bit of sun, with ample space for a coffee table, garden bench or a playhouse for the kids.

Back inside and to the entrance hallway, directly in front of you is a carpeted staircase that brings you to the first floor landing. Directly ahead is a single bedroom, with a window overlooking the garden. A cosy space, this room could also easily function as a study, or a child's bedroom or nursery. The wooden flooring and white walls bring a sense of continuity of the simple elegance of the house.

To the right of the stairs is the family bathroom. The three-piece suite here includes an over-bath shower, sink and WC. Its walls are tiled in a neutral light beige, and its flooring is of a grey stone marble effect.

To the left of the bathroom are a few steps up to the spacious landing offering access to the other two bedrooms. On your left is the second bedroom, overlooking the lovely rear garden. With room for a double bed, desk/dressing table and large wardrobe, there's plenty of opportunity with this room which could function as a guest bedroom, teen's hang-out or indeed, a spacious office.

The landing itself opens up past this room, providing space for further storage – the current occupants use this space for a desk. Then there's the entrance to the main bedroom: A generously sized double, with two almost floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the street. This spacious room could easily fit dressers and bedside tables, or any array of furniture, plus it comes complete with a full wall of fitted wardrobes. A wonderful room to make your own, this bedroom could be your welcome retreat come the end of the day, with the gorgeous natural light and the cosy feel of the stunning wooden floors.

Not only is this house impressive in its interior, but it also benefits from a dreamy location. Leytonstone High Road is a short walk away, offering a Tesco express, a Post Office and all manner of takeaways and places to eat and drink – all your daily needs are easily met. A whole host of local pubs and restaurants are almost on your doorstep, including Leytonstone Tavern on the high street, a popular local's favourite. More tucked away and towards Wanstead Flats is the Lord Rookwood pub, for those seeking out a comfy local.

The easy access this wonderful three bed mid terrace property offers to Wanstead Flats can't be overlooked; fun picnic days with family or friends are ready and waiting, or longer hikes for those wanting to get lost in nature. Public transport is another blessing in this locality, with both tube and bus routes allowing for quick commutes into London Central. This house truly offers all you could need – with its ideal postcode and beautiful interior, this could well be your ideal new home.

address: Rowden Park Gardens, Chingford, London E4
detailedDescription:
FastMove are proud to present this wonderful family home located in this popular residential location. The property is close to a number of local amenities including large Supermarkets and Chingford Mount Shopping Centre.

Furthermore, the property is surrounded by a number of reputable schools which are well rated by Ofsted, making this the perfect property for the young or growing family.

The property is incredibly well served with the local mainline station connecting with Liverpool St., London, Walthamstow Central and the Victoria line only a short distance away, making this the ideal spot for the commuter.

The property briefly comprises of an Entrance Hallway, Lounge/Diner, Three Bedrooms and Family Bathroom
Entrance hall

The property has a warm and welcoming Hallway, the perfect place for coats and shoes. The Hallway benefits from a wall mounted radiator and tiled laminate flooring. A staircase rises to the first-floor landing and internal door leads to the Lounge and Kitchen.
Lounge/dining room


The property boasts a bright and airy open plan reception room. However, this could easily split into two to create a more intimate feel.
Lounge area


The Lounge area allows plenty of space for a number of pieces of furniture, the perfect place to sit back and relax. To the rear aspect a set of D/G patio doors lead to the rear garden and offer excellent level of natural light. The Lounge area also benefits from a wall mounted radiator and stylish coving to the ceiling.
Dining area


Running open plan with the Lounge is the Dining area which allows plenty of space for a Dining table and chairs, perfect to entertain family and friends. To the front aspect is a large D/G bay window which adds to the excellent levels of light the property offers. The Dining area is also complimented by a wall mounted electric fire with marble heard and stone surround giving the room a focal point and cosy feel. There is also a wall mounted radiator and stylish coving to the ceiling.
Kitchen

The Kitchen has an array of modern wall and base units fitted adding plenty of storage with complementary work-surfaces. The Kitchen benefits from a Washing Machine, free standing Oven with overhead Extractor, single sink and drainer, and space for a Fridge/Freezer. There is a D/G window and door which leads to the rear garden and the Kitchen is decorated with tiles to the walls and floor.
First floor landing

From the landing internal doors lead to all three Bedrooms and the Family Shower Room.
Principal bedroom

A spacious Principal Bedroom with fitted wardrobes down one aspect. However there is still plenty of space for a double bed and free-standing furniture. The Bedroom benefits from a D/G window and wall mounted radiator.
Bedroom two

A very generously sized second double Bedroom which again benefits from fitted wardrobes and also a fitted desk and drawers. The room still offers plenty of space for a double bed and free-standing furniture. Benefiting from a wall mounted radiator and D/G window.
Bedroom three

A generous sized third Bedroom with plenty of space for a bed and free-standing furniture. There is a wall mounted radiator and D/G window.
Family shower room

Another spacious and beautifully presented room is the family Shower Room which is fitted with a high quality three-piece suite fitted comprising of a separate shower cubicle with twin wall mounted shower heads (one rainfall), low flush Duravit WC, and Roca wash hand basin built onto a useful vanity unit. The Bathroom is also complimented by a tall standing heated towel rail, twin frosted D/G window, extractor fan, spotlights set into the ceiling and the room is decorated with tiles to the walls and floor which has underfloor heating.
Exterior

To the front of the property a low standing private gate leads into the front garden which is low maintenance and surrounded by a low standing wall.

To the rear of the property is a spacious and enclosed rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn, perfect for the Summer months. However there are also stylish patio areas, one situated at the top of the garden and the other at the bottom, perfect for garden furniture and the BBQ months. At the bottom of the garden is also a useful outbuilding which is incredibly versatile and benefits from power and light. The rear garden is also complimented with mature shrubbery and plantation, an outside tap and outside lighting.

Would you like a free valuation of your property?

We are a Nationwide Estate Agency who work on a No Upfront Fee, No Sale No Fee Basis and only charge £800 on completion, irrespective of value.

We are open 7 days a week from 8am - 9pm and are rated 5 stars on Trust Pilot for the excellent levels of service we offer our customers.

If you would like a Free Valuation please do not hesitate to contact us today and we will be delighted to help.

title: 3 bed town house for sale

detailedDescription:
A delightfully bright ground floor one bedroom apartment in a pleasing modern brick development close to Leytonstone. Sat among communal gardens in a quiet spot, within easy reach of the city centre and Epping Forest alike, this cheerful and practical home will make the perfect first London pad.

As well as the pretty communal garden, you'll find the gold dust addition of private parking with this apartment. Drivers will be happy to find it's just over three miles to the M11, so getting out of town is as easy as it can be. Eleven minutes on foot and you're in Leyton Flats, perfect for whenever you want to get back to nature. There's dog spotting and birdwatching opportunities galore, and you can even hire a row boat to really get to know Hollow Ponds.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your hallway and find your bedroom to the left. It's 120 square foot of bright space, with cool white walls and grained engineered flooring underfoot. Your double glazed window is filled with greenery that's perfect to wake up to. At the end of the hall is your super kitchen diner and reception, offering 275 square foot to spread out in. There's more engineered flooring underfoot.

Your tiled kitchen hugs one end of the room, with a wealth of white units and plenty of contrasting grey worksurfaces. From the other end of the space comes a flood of light through the wall-filling window, and direct access to the communal gardens. Back through the hallway there's your bathroom, fully tiled in pale blue. You have a modern white suite with vanity sink, and shower over the tub.

You're thirteen minutes on foot from Leytonstone Station, where the Central Line will take you to Stratford for shopping at Westfield in seven minutes or to Liverpool Street in around a quarter of an hour. All the amenities and attractions of Leytonstone and Leyton are a short stroll; less than a mile away sit the serene surroundings of Walthamstow Village, where ancient architecture meets modern dining. Orford Road offers everything from natural wines and charcuterie to fresh traditional fish 'n' chips.

What else?

- Your new local is The Birds, a friendly pub celebrating the works of local luminary Alfred Hitchcock and offering a brilliant selection of food and craft beers.
- London's most Instagrammable spot, God's Own Junkyard, is a twenty minute stroll away, so you can get the perfect neon selfie before treating yourself to cake and tea.
- A day at the beach is within easy reach, with Leyton Midland Road station just half a mile down the road, and regular trains via Barking to Southend-on-Sea.

Bedroom (3.56m x 3.14m (11'8" x 10'3"))

Bathroom

Kitchen/Reception Room (3.43m x 7.41m (11'3" x 24'3"))

A word from the owner...

"I loved living here for the past 9 years. There is a great community spirit and the area is peaceful but it offers so much. I enjoy hearing the birds singing throughout the day and the Flat is only a short walk from the Hallow Ponds which is great for walking. Wanstead, South Woodford and Walthamstow Village are all very close and they offer a great choice for food and shopping."

detailedDescription:
This stylish one bedroom apartment is set on the second floor of a lovely modern built development in the heart of Walthamstow Central. A fantastic location for all the great local amenities Walthamstow has to offer such as Walthamstow's famous open-air market and the Empire Cinema, restaurants and the shops of Walthamstow Mall.

Offering a large open plan reception room with a contemporary fitted kitchen and a double bedroom. There is also a fitted bathroom and ample storage. This development is well maintained with elevators to all floors and has secure entry phone system.

Walthamstow central station is just a short walk away offering Victoria Line and Overground services. Walthamstow village is nearby and home to a variety of trendy restaurants, cafes and shops making this the perfect destination.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This unique semi detached house is one not to be missed, boasting outstanding features including a gated entrance, private drive for 2/3 cars, usable double garage, conservatory and a partially converted loft room.

Having been lovingly maintained by the current Vendors, this beautifully presented family home has been enjoyed and well looked after and it shows.

Built circa 1930's and arranged over approx. 1615 sq ft internally, the property consists of an entrance hallway, ground floor W.C, through lounge, fitted kitchen, utility room and a modern conservatory with direct access to the well maintained private rear garden.

To the first floor there is a landing, four bedrooms, 3 piece bathroom suite with separate shower and access to the partially converted loft room.

Externally:
Gated entrance, paved drive with space for 2/3 cars, usable double garage with access from the front and rear of the property and approx. 50ft rear garden with patio area.

Situated in a quiet residential area of Chingford this family home is within easy reach of the town centre “Chingford Mount” and set within an excellent catchment area for local schools.

The property also benefits from good transport links including various local bus routes and convenient road links to the A406 and M11.

These particulars have been prepared under instruction from the seller and are intended as a general guide. All measurements are approximate and Abidins have not carried out any form of survey and have not tested any of the equipment, appliances or services mentioned. Photographs have been taken using a wide angled lens and are for general information; it cannot be inferred items shown are included in the sale. Prospective buyers must conduct their own enquiries and seek advice through their appointed legal representative and surveyor.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Four bedrooms, two reception rooms and a first floor bathroom. This property is ideal for a growing family and is positioned in a highly sought after turning in Central Walthamstow/Village borders. Further benefits include a spacious fitted kitchen/diner, a ground floor shower room, rear garden and early viewing is strongly advised.

Ideally located on the edge of the ever popular Walthamstow Village area giving fantastic access to the vast array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and places of historical interest the Village has to offer. Within easy reach of Walthamstow Central offering the Victoria Line, Overground to Liverpool street plus buses.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A smart and characterfully appointed one bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a modest, distributed development with pleasantly leafy, green and gated communal gardens. It's all peacefully located on a quiet no through road within easy walking distance of bustling Walthamstow High Street.

The development has off-street parking and drivers can be on the North Circular in around ten minutes.

If you lived here…

You'll step through your dedicated front door and find your lounge on the left, a handsome 150 square feet with pale blonde hardwood underfoot and a leafy green view of the grounds. Next door's your kitchen, an artfully arranged affair with charming rustic backsplash and turquoise worktops with an integrated oven and induction hob.

There's a wealth of integrated storage here, a welcome addition to any London apartment, plus pine cabinets and hardwearing cork flooring underfoot. Elsewhere your bedroom's a picturesque, 130 square foot double, finished in eye-catching yellow and with more sleek hardwood underfoot. Finally your bathroom, finished in its own aquamarine hue with more cork flooring and a shower over the tub.

Outside and you're surrounded by open green spaces – St James Park, Low Hall Sports Ground and the Low Hall Nature Reserve are right around the corner. Venture further afield and the vast blue and green space of the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands (London's largest nature reserve) is just five minutes by bike or a little under a mile on foot. It's all well worth the stroll; you'll forget you're in London.

What else?

- St James Street station, and its direct twenty minute overground runs to Liverpool Street, is just a half mile on foot.
- You have one of Walthamstow's most characterful wining and dining establishments right around the corner. Supperclub.tube is based in the basement of the Walthamstow Pumphouse Museum. Here you can enjoy lovingly crafted south American cuisine in the unique environment of a 1967 Victoria line tube carriage.
- You'll find more gastronomical options at crate St James, a collection of cafes, burger joints and breweries just your side of St James Street station. There're also yoga studios, hairdressers and more.

A word from the owner...

"I bought the flat in 2016 and am now moving on having started a family. I've absolutely loved living there. It's peaceful and quiet and close to loads of green space. Being able to walk or cycle to Walthamstow Wetlands and Hackney Marshes was a godsend in lockdown! The grounds are really well maintained and i've spent many happy hours in the communal garden. In non lockdown times, it's also been well placed for access to local shops, pubs and eateries. I've really enjoyed being near St James Street, Walthamstow Market and Lea Bridge Road. The parking space is really handy too!"

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
We are proud to bring to the market this incredibly spacious 5/6 bedroom semi-detached house with off street parking and in the heart of North Chingford, with the vast open spaces of Epping Forest to hand.
The property


The main property is accessed via the porch, fantastic for storing shoes, coats, buggies etc. From which you enter into the hallway whereby you can access the always convenient ground floor WC, the large reception room, a large dining room, kids playroom leading on to the modern kitchen.

To the 1st floor of the property are 4 bedrooms as well as the main family bathroom. All of the bedrooms have painted walls, carpet flooring and double glazed windows, 2 to the front aspect and 2 to the rear aspect, 1 of which being a bay window providing additional natural light and floorspace.

The property offers yet more surprises as you walk up to a converted loft room recently completed, so natural, you would feel it was an original part of the house and this offers a further two spacious bedrooms and a beautiful shower room. These rooms could serve as additional bedrooms or as study/office.
Location


The property is situated in the much sought after area of Chingford E4 within a few minutes walk from Chingford station, serviced by the Overground, from where you can quickly and easily connect to London Liverpool St. Station and many more of Londons major underground stations. Great for commuters!

If you are a road user, not only will you benefit from the properties off street parking, you will also find it quick and easy to connect to major roads such as A406 North Circular, M11, M25, A10, A12 and others, making journeys to and from destinations that much better.

Station Road is home to many mouth-watering cafes, restaurants, take-aways and other eateries. There is also a great variety of other retailers available such as a bicycle shop, supermarkets, off licenses, barbers, beauticians, salons and more!

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming and spacious two bedroom apartment on the top floor of a low rise development just moments from the heart of the highly sought-after Walthamstow Village. You have a huge, light-filled dual aspect reception, residents' parking and leafy birds-eye views throughout. Quite a find indeed.

You're exceptionally well served for local schools, with twenty one less than a mile away on foot, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including the 'Outstanding' St Mary's CofE Primary, Barclay Primary and Woodside Primary Academy.

If you lived here

You'll be entertaining in your large 225 square foot reception, dual aspect with sleekly engineered hardwood underfoot, pristine white walls, a constellation of recessed spotlights overhead and plenty of space for dining. Next, head into the kitchen to be greeted by an elegant white suite, a sparkling mosaic tiled backsplash as well as tranquil, leafy views through those double glazed windows.

Back to the hallway and on your left is your bathroom - an inviting affair dressed in sandstone tiles with a shower over the tub, pedestal sink and heated towel rail. Both bedrooms are immaculate and south-facing, the master a generous double coming in at 110 square feet. Finally, you have allocated residential parking outside and drivers can be on the North Circular in eight minutes.

Outside and not only do you have the amenities of Lea Bridge Road literally around the corner, but Walthamstow Village is just six minutes' walk. Part-pedestrianised streets, peaceful greenery and historic architecture combine with a great choice of award-winning bars, gourmet pubs and restaurants. From the enticing elixirs of Parish Wines to the craft ales at the Wildcard Brewery Barrel Store, there's a whole host of intriguingly esoteric eating and dining options to suit every mood and occasion just moments away.
What else


- Walthamstow Central station is just a seventeen minute stroll, for direct, twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus and Liverpool Street. Alternatively, nine bus routes will speed you to myriad destinations from Lea Bridge Road.
- The wide open environs of Epping Forest and Hollow Ponds, perfect for long walks and boat hire, are less than half a mile away on foot.
- You're just two minutes' walk from Uffizi, a mouth-watering and quirky traditional Italian restaurant with an amazing interior featuring life-size replicas of Renaissance artwork.

"Our first home in London, we loved the proximity to the village for the pubs and shops it was also great to be close to multiple tube and rail stations for our commute into the city. We love the light filled living space and the fact you can see the London skyline on a clear day. Since then we have leased the property to many happy tenants!"

detailedDescription:
A substantial and stylish two bedroom 1930s end-of-terrace. The generous period proportions have been artfully expanded with a skylit rear reception and there's scope for more development still. The day to day amenities of Chingford Mount are gathered just a third of a mile around the corner.

If you lived here

You'll be luxuriating in your expansive, open plan ground floor, totalling almost 500 square feet and made up of three distinct spaces with clear sightlines from front to back. To the fore you have your first reception, a sumptuous statement chimney breast oversees things, while dove grey engineered hardwood runs underfoot and an ornate original ceiling rose sits overhead. Subtly segmented next door is your kitchen/diner, with a discrete but comprehensive suite of dove grey fitted cabinets and complementary backsplash.

Your expertly extended second lounge is next, open plan once again and awash with natural light thanks to a pair of large skylights and a full rear wall of bi folding concertina doors, bringing the outside in. Out here, a generous patio gives way to a lush lengthy lawn, barely overlooked and ending in a second patio, perfect for BBQs and home to a handy shed. Upstairs, both your bedrooms are substantial doubles, with the master an especially impressive 200 square feet. Finally your family bathroom's immaculately tiled from floor to ceiling and features a large L-shaped tub.

Outside, and you're handily sat between the open green spaces of Chase Lane Park and Memorial Park, each just a few minutes on foot. The former features a lake, pavilion and playground. Venture a little further and you come to the banks of The River lea and the vast open water of William Girling Reservoir beyond. Closer to home are the multiple shops, cafes and supermarkets of Chingford Mount, offering all your day to day needs right on your doorstep.

What else?

- The Old Hall Tavern is a great new local, with a range of real ales, fine wines and delicious food. Less than a half mile on foot.
- You have your own double driveway, and you can be on the North Circular in just over five minutes. Alternatively, drive to Highams Park overground just as quickly for direct twenty four minute runs to Liverpool Street.
- Less than a half mile on foot from your new home you have seven primary/secondary schools, all rated 'Good' by Ofsted.

"This has been a great first home for us; it’s been the perfect location for local amenities and an abundance of parks within a short walking distance. Off road parking on the drive for two cars is a bonus. Getting into London for work or days out is simple with a short train ride from Highams Park. The house comes to life in the summer with the bifold doors bringing the garden into the house, perfect for family BBQs. We are going to miss our friendly neighbours but have made amazing memories in this house."

address: High Road Leyton, Leyton, London E10
detailedDescription:
A bijou one bedroom flat on Leyton High Road.

Situated within walking distance of Leyton Central line station, this property does need some internal modernisation, but would otherwise make a great investment purchase. It sits on the first floor of the building and comprises an open plan kitchen/lounge, double bedroom and bathroom.

Living Here...

This flat is located a stone’s throw from Francis Road. We think it’s the best street in E10 (and not just because that's where our office is). The range of independent shops and businesses here is fantastic. Grab a latte whilst perusing the shelves at Phlox Books, or nip into Venner to pick up something for the home. All things floral are the domain of Edie Rose, whilst Yardarm is the place to go for that bottle of wne for a quiet night in. On the High Road itself check out the Leyton Technical, Leyton Star or Coach & Horses, all great for socialising with friends into the wee small hours. If all that sounds too much, perhaps book a class at Pause Yoga, or head literally across the road to the cricket ground to relax in a deckchair to the sound of leather on willow...

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price: £375,000-£400,000. A split level, three bedroom flat on Leigh Road.

Offering over 900 square feet of internal space, this property is as spacious as many houses. On the first floor you’ll find two solid double bedrooms, the three piece family bathroom and the kitchen. The second floor houses the final double bedroom, together with the full width reception room. Both are well proportioned.

The property is presented in good condition throughout, and would make a great investment or first time purchase.

Living Here...

This property is situated close to both Abbotts Park and the cricket ground and thus only a short walk from Leyton Midland station (and not too far from Leyton underground station either). It also sits on the edge of what is one of the most popular areas in Leyton, namely Francis Road. It’s an amazing street, and not just because that’s where our office is! There’s the Yardarm restaurant (the original shop next door is still our favourite place for a latte and chocolate brownie), Phlox Books creating a literary (and caffeine!) buzz, Edie Rose’s floristry heaven, and Pause Yoga studio offering an oasis of calm in a frantic world. And if you can’t be bothered to take that shortest of short stroll to Francis Road, then why not just head down to Perky Blenders at Project 660 on the High Road, grab an espresso to go and plonk yourself on a bench in Abbotts Park, and watch more energetic people run around the tennis courts. Seriously, we absolutely love this part of East London (and we haven’t even mentioned the great pubs yet), and we’re convinced you will too…

detailedDescription:
75% Sold | Viewings Available

From the Shared Ownership Collection at Motion look out across the green expanse of the Lea Valley and towards one of the world’s most exciting cities . Across 17 floors of The Tower which elegantly twists as it rises, you’ll find a stunning collection of two & three bedroom apartments set around a beautifully landscaped resident’s courtyard, the perfect place to relax or meet friends.

Motion is positioned to take advantage of the Mini-Holland cycle paths and pedestrianised routes, along with the newly rebuilt Lea Bridge Overground station. With Stratford, Westfields and the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park just one stop away, and the City within easy commuting reach, life in Motion is ready to spread throughout the capital.

Motion is a collaboration between Peabody and Hill.

Please note all properties in Block J are sold as seen.

What is Shared Ownership?

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

About Motion So

Across 17 floors of The Tower which elegantly twists as it rises, you’ll find a stunning collection of two & three bedroom apartments set around a beautifully landscaped resident’s courtyard, the perfect place to relax or meet friends.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a beautiful end-of-terrace period property situated on a quiet residential street in Leyton.

This pretty Victorian house is ideal for young families as it is in the catchment for Riverley and Willowbrook Primary Schools, which are both rated 'Outstanding' by Ofsted. The extensive green spaces of Leyton Jubilee Park are a short stroll away. There are useful bus links at the end of the road and Lea Bridge Road Overground Station is a 10 minute walk; linking you directly to the city. Trendy Chatsworth Road in Clapton and the Lea River are also nearby, offering opportunities for weekend activities.

This extremely bright and spacious property has an impressive through sitting room / dining room with open access to the kitchen, making it ideal for family living. There is a generous ground floor living space and lots of natural light from the bay windows. The kitchen is fully fitted and practical, with lots of storage.

To the upstairs of the property there are two bright and airy double bedrooms with high ceilings and a bay window in the main bedroom. There is also a single room, ideal as a nursery or home office. The family sized bathroom is luxurious, light and sleek.

The garden gets lots of sun due to being end of terrace and is perfect for summer evenings. There is also a large lawn and a shed.

This property has the potential for a kitchen extension and a loft extension STPP. The immediate area is currently benefiting from some major redevelopment including the Council's East Valley plan which is set to improve the area over the next couple of years.

Out and about
Chatsworth Road - A short walk across Hackney marshes, Chatsworth Road has an abundance of cafes, pubs, restaurants and a fantastic Sunday market.
Leyton Jubilee Park - Great facilities for sports and recreation and a natural meadow during the summer. Grab a coffee from the cafe or an ice lolly on a hot summers day.
Hare and Hounds - lovely pub with great burgers, live music, comedy and an all weather beer garden.
Turning Earth E10 - Artist led space running ceramics courses and studios for ceramicists.
Walthamstow Market - Europe's largest street market. The place to pick up a bargain!
Walthamstow Wetlands Nature Reserve - Area of protected wetlands, great for a walk and to visit the Engine House cafe.

detailedDescription:
Making an ideal first time or buy to let purchase is this one bedroom purpose built ground floor flat being sold with no onward chain. The accommodation comprises of a spacious lounge opening up onto a small patio area, double bedroom. Fully fitted kitchen and three piece bathroom suite. There is also a gated allocated parking space, cycle locker and communal gardens.

Communal Entrance
