detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this large five bedroom mid terrace property. The property has been heavily extended and is being sold on a chain free basis. The property has been refurbished through out and comes with front and rear gardens. You are greeted at the property by a fully double glazed porch. The porch gives access to the large entrance hall. The first reception room is located to front of the property and benefits from a bay window to allow more space and light into the room. The second reception room leads on from the first and benefits from a large skylight to flood the room with natural light. A large kitchen/diner is located to the rear of the property and also gives access to a ground floor fully tiled three piece bathroom suite. A brand new mega flow heating system has also been installed on the ground floor and is accessible from the ground floor bathroom. A fully double glazed patio leads out into the rear garden which is fully paved and easy to maintain. The first floor of the property consists of two double bedrooms, a single bedroom and another three piece bathroom suite. Access to the loft extension is available from the first floor landing and comprises of a further two double bedrooms and a final third fully tiled bathroom. The property is situated in a prime location with being an easy five minute walk to both Walthamstow Central as well as the famous Walthamstow market. The property is also located close to Green leaf school and Lloyd park so access to the tennis courts, bridle paths and the William Morris gallery are all just a stones throw away.

detailedDescription:
A fantastic three bedroom, two bathroom apartment, in a Victorian end terrace at the very heart of Walthamstow. On a quiet street less than ten minutes on foot from the station, this thoughtfully arranged property offers the best of both worlds. It's just waiting for a new family to make it their own.

This apartment offers a pristine blank canvas and a fine opportunity to put your own stamp on things. The real star is the beautifully converted twin skylit loft space, making for perfect guest accommodation, large study or a master suite. The en suite bathroom is pristine and offers one of two dedicated showers.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your hallway and up the stairs, finding your seventy square foot kitchen at the top. It has cheerful egg-yolk yellow walls, plenty of white cupboard space and a gas hob. A door from here leads to your first bedroom of almost the same size, with two windows and built-in storage. On the other side of the kitchen is your bathroom, with corner dedicated shower. It's fully tiled in white marble effect, with a modern white suite and sink vanity unit.

Then there's your second bedroom, 110 square foot with recessed lighting and light pine-coloured engineered flooring underfoot. Your 160 square foot reception room is next door, with twin double-glazed windows and the same easy-maintenance flooring. Up the second set of stairs you'll find your superbly converted loft suite, with 190 square foot of bedroom or work space, eaves storage and an en suite with shower.

All the amenities and attractions of Walthamstow are close at hand here, with the bustling cafes and shops of Hoe Street on your doorstep. The underground is a six minute walk away, taking you to Kings Cross on the Victoria Line in around a quarter of an hour. The Village is barely moments from your home, so you can always enjoy a peaceful wander of its picturesque streets with a stop at one of its wonderful pubs or eateries.

What else?

- Your new local is the elegant corner pub The Queens Arms, with its super secret beer garden and succulent Sunday roasts.
- Some say Rhythm Kitchen serves the best jerk in East London, and with the Caribbean restaurant a mere three minutes on foot from your door, there's only one way to find out.
- Schools rated 'Outstanding' nearby include South Grove, Walthamstow School for Girls and Greenleaf Primary.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Greenleaves can be found on Farm End which is a part of the hamlet of Sewardstonebury, a highly sought after area within North Chingford which contains some of the areas finest properties. An idyllic and private no through turning situated directly off Bury Road which backs onto Epping Forest.

Detached with 5 beds and 3 bathrooms, this imposing property sits on a plot of approximately an acre (stls) and already offers ample space for a young family to grow into. However, (subject to appropriate permission) there is genuine scope to significantly increase the square footage of this home to suit your requirements. There is already off street parking for up to half a dozen vehicles and the sizeable South West facing garden offers amazing space to utilise however you see fit.

Importantly just 0.7miles from the property is Chingford Station. The station is located on Station road which also offers an excellent range of shops, restaurants and bars. Regular Overground train services from this station into London Liverpool Street take around 25 minutes and this line also connects to the underground. Other transport is close at hand with the M25 approx a 10 minute drive away and Stanstead Airport approx 30 minutes drive.

Please speak to the sales team to arrange your viewing appointment.

title: 5 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A Victorian family classic, enviably located halfway between the open green spaces of Lloyd Park and the ever popular Walthamstow Beer Mile of Blackhorse Lane. Laid out across three floors with an expertly conceived loft room including en suite, you also have a lovingly landscaped garden to the rear.

The Lockwood Way entrance to the blue and green wonderland of the city's largest nature reserve, Walthamstow Wetlands, is just a half mile on foot. With 500 acres of wild blue and green space, free to enter all year round, you'll forget you're in London.

If you lived here

You'll be stretching out in over 1000 square feet of living space, starting with a pair of spacious twin receptions featuring original cornicing overhead. Your welcoming front lounge totals almost 180 square feet in its own right, with plenty of natural light thanks to that classic box bay window. Past the staircase and reception room two is also generous, 140 square feet and with direct access to your garden

Out here you have an elegant, expertly landscaped space with a raised deck leading down to a mix of chalk white gravel and beds, surrounded by timber fencing and ending in a patio. Back inside and the ground floor's completed by your kitchen and the first of your two bathrooms with tub and dedicated shower cubicle. Upstairs, both bedrooms are solid doubles, while your loft conversion offers the skylit master bedroom and handy en suite.

Outside, the open green spaces and landscaped gardens of Lloyd Park are just a fifteen minute stroll., home to cafes, courts, a wide range of sports clubs and classes including the ever popular Yoga Me Happy and a thriving Saturday Market, great for fresh produce. Blackhorse Lane, just a few minutes walk in the other direction, is fast finding renown as the Walthamstow Beer Mile, with an increasing range of Tap Rooms, including the huge Truman's Social Club and its colossal beer garden.

What else?

- Blackhorse Road tube is just a fifteen minute walk and will get you straight to Kings Cross in a similar time via the speedy Victoria line, putting the heart of London just a half hour away door to door. Plus we're at the top of the line here so you'll always get a seat.
- The much loved and well reviewed La Villa Pizzeria restaurant is practically next door.
- Parents will be pleased to know you have seventeen primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius alone, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Eden Girl's School is just a half mile on foot.

"This is a family oriented area with close links to the A406. Good schools within the area.

A stones throw to William Morris Museum, Lloyd Park and a 10mins walk to Walthamstow market which boasts high end restaurants and cafeteria’s. Down the road we have Walthamstow Marches which has access for fishing and wildlife attractions.

We are minutes away from our local amenities like the Co-op which is open until 10pm at night as well as the off licence, the Chinese restaurant and fish and chip shop and Pizza shop and Indian takeaway, also cafe's and 2 doctors surgery's.

My neighbours are very friendly Sara has 3 children ranging from 8yrs- 19years. The Bulgarian family are very pleasant couple and very accommodating."

detailedDescription:
This three bedroom semi detached property is the perfect family home which was built in 2015. This means the property was developed with modern living in mind and is wheel chair accessible allowing for larger than usual hallways and doors giving you more living space. Further benefits of the property include two bathrooms, off street parking, and is situated in a private gated development.

This three bedroom semi detached property is the perfect family home which was built in 2015. This means the property was developed with modern living in mind and is wheel chair accessible allowing for larger than usual hallways and doors giving you more living space. Further benefits of the property include two bathrooms, off street parking, and is situated in a private gated development.

The ground floor of the property is made up of a large entrance hall with the kitchen situated on the right hand side. The kitchen is tastefully decorated and includes fully integrated appliances including a fridge and freezer, dish washer, hob and oven. The reception room is to the rear of the property and is spacious enough to include dining. French doors from the reception room give access to the garden which has been paved over and requires minimal up keep. Completing the ground floor is the W/C located just off the entrance hall.

The first floor of the property comprises of two double bedrooms, both of which include large windows which flood the rooms with natural light. Completing the first floor is the three piece family bathroom suite decorated in keeping with the rest of the house. The second floor of the property includes the master bedroom which is the total floor space of the property and has windows on either side of the room, allowing for natural light to flood the room. The property was originally built over three floors meaning excellent head height is provided even on the second floor. A three piece en suite bathroom is located just off the master bedroom which completes this dream home.

In terms of locality you are ideally situated right between Walthamstow central and Blackhorse Road station, both of which are 0.5 miles away (8 minute walk). Both stations are on the Victoria Line providing quick and easy links into London. St. James Street station and Queens Road station are also within a 2 minute walk away due to being right in the heart of Walthmatsow and between all the stations.

In terms of schools you are truly spoilt for choice including Mission Grove Primary School, Stoneydown Park Primary School, Walthamstow School For Girls, Greenleaf Primary school and many many more.

detailedDescription:
A lovingly preserved and artfully extended Walthamstow classic. This three bedroom first floor Warner apartment features the iconic turn of the century design conceived by Sir Thomas Courtenay Warner, with dedicated front door, handsome brick frontage and shared rear garden, plus converted loft.

The open green spaces and landscaped gardens of Lloyd Park are just a three minute walk away, home to cafes, courts, an outdoor gym and skatepark. Not to mention a wide range of sports clubs and classes, thriving farmers market and the famous William Morris Gallery.

If you lived here…

You'll enter under that signature arch and head up your stairs for your gloriously bright, 170 square foot lounge. Resplendent in rich dark hardwood flooring illuminated by a triple window set and with a strikingly ornate gun metal mantelpiece taking centre stage. Next door bedroom one's a generous double of 110 square feet, with more hardwood floor and garden view. It's currently in use as the ideal home working space.

Bedroom two's a similarly styled, equally spacious double with leafy treetop views, while the first floor's completed by your family bathroom, handsomely decked out in floor to ceiling large format sandstone, and your elegant kitchen finished in slate and cream. Upstairs your penthouse master is a dual aspect, 150 square feet, with skylight at one end and Juliet balcony at the other, with a designer en suite shower room, also skylit and tiled in distressed slate from floor to ceiling.

Outside, Walthamstow Central station is just fifteen minutes on foot for direct and will get you straight to Kings Cross just as quickly via the Victoria line, putting the heart of London just a half hour away door to door. We're also at the top of the lie here so you'll always get a seat. Heading to the City? Liverpool Street is just twenty minutes away via the overground. Next door to the station you'll also find plenty more worth the brief stroll, from the Empire Cinema entertainment complex, to the Walthamstow Mall and Europe's longest street market.

What else?

- The pride of Walthamstow's a gastropub fleet, The Bell, is just half a mile away on foot. Serving up delicious food in sumptuous surroundings it's sure to become a favourite.
- Parents will be pleased to know you have more than twenty five primary/secondary schools less than a mile on foot, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including five deemed 'Outstanding'.
- Did we mention your garden? It's a genuine urban paradise, a lengthy mix of lush lawn and bespoke raised decking.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £545,000 to £565,000.
Three bedroom terraced house with loft room on quite residential turning.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website

Located off Fulbourne Road on a quiet residential turning but conveniently positioned within 0.8 miles to Wood Street station and local facilities as well as being a short drive to the A406.

This brick fronted Victorian terraced house makes an ideal family home and has accommodation comprising of an entrance porch leading into the spacious through lounge with bay window and tiled flooring. Leading to the rear is a fitted kitchen with gloss units and tiled flooring with integrated oven and hob. There is access through to lean to with central heating and double glazing with door to the garden. The downstairs bathroom has a three piece suite.

To the first floor there is a full width double master bedroom, a further double bedroom and a good size single bedroom. The first floor landing has a fixed stair case leading up the very handy loft room with skylight window.

The rear garden is paved for low maintenance with storage shed to rear.

The property has plenty of scope to make it your own and develop the loft into a former 4th bedroom.

detailedDescription:
***3 bedroom end of terrace house***

Kings of Chingford are delighted to offer to the market this nicely presented three bedroom end of terrace family home.

Located on the ever sought after Russell Road, a peaceful residential road in south Chingford, just a 5 min drive to the local amenities on Old Church Road.

Arranged over two floors, the ground floor is comprised of an open plan living/dining room providing you with a superb bright and airy reception space. The kitchen has been finished with light wood base and eye level units, roll top work surfaces and tiled splash backs.

To the first floor you have two double bedrooms, with the master benefiting from a bay window and built in storage. Bedroom three is a spacious single. The family bathroom is fully tiled and finished with a modern white three piece suite. The WC is separate.

To the front of the property you have a paved drive with space for at least 2 vehicles. To the rear you have an extensive, partially paved, partially laid to lawn, private garden and a lean to which is currently being used a utility room.

With lots of potential to extend STPP this property really must be seen to be fully appreciated. Call our office now to arrange your viewing and avoid disappointment.

Positioned on Harrow Road road opposite the stunning Wanstead Flats but with Leytonstone Station, High Road and Forest Gate Station just a short walk away, the location does not fail to impress. The pretty exposed brick frontage, bay window and white picket fence add a sense of character and charm and once inside the once inside the well-presented and naturally bright accommodation be fully appreciated.

Currently set out as a three bed with the front reception being utilised as a double bedroom, the front reception leads into the dining room through glass double doors. The kitchen to the rear is a good size but has the potential to be made larger by way of a rear extension (stpc) but is currently served by a lean to acting as a handy utility/storage room.

The first floor accommodation comprises of two generous double bedrooms, the principle with two large windows enjoying views of Wanstead Flats and the rear bedroom enjoying enough room for a double bed, wardrobe and work/office area. There is also a first floor bathroom with a traditional white bathroom suite. The garden to the rear enjoys a South/Westerly aspect and is currently very low maintenance with the majority being laid to hard-standing with surrounding flower beds to the side and very rear of the garden and storage area.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An absolutely adorable two bedroom Victorian mid terrace cottage in leafy Wanstead, close to both Epping Forest and Snaresbrook station. In excellent decorative order throughout, with perfectly balanced and generous living space inside and out, this is a gorgeous home ready for new people to love.

You're in a superb spot just six minutes from Wanstead High Street, surrounded by everything you need from handy amenities to glorious green spaces. You'll never want for fresh bread, a super Sunday roast, or a place to stretch your legs. It's just a couple of minutes from your door to either the picturesque Christ Church Gardens or Memorial Green, and only eight minutes to Leyton Flats.

If you lived here

You'll walk through your delectable, neat front garden and step straight into your lounge/diner, a splendid and serene space of 270 square foot, with carpeted stairs to the rear and bay window to the front. Grained engineered flooring leads your eye all the way to the back of the property. Past the stairs you'll come to your country style kitchen, with two-toned dove grey and white units, plus a ceramic butler sink.

To the rear you'll find your naturally lit bathroom, with dark grey tiling underfoot and bright white walls. There's a traditional white suite and shower over the tub. Back through the kitchen is the door to your charming secluded garden, with rounded paving giving way to tidy lawn. Upstairs sit your two bedrooms. The first is over 85 square feet and overlooks the garden. The second to the front is a generous 140 square foot, with twin triple glazed windows. It's a peaceful space, with soft neutral carpet underfoot.

Snaresbrook station is just eight minutes on foot for the Central Line so you can be at Liverpool Street in twenty minutes, less than half an hour door to door. Meanwhile it's a mile and a half to the North Circular, and drivers of electric vehicles will be pleased to find a charging station moments from the front door. If you're staying local you can stroll a mile across Leyton Flats to meet your feathered neighbours around Hollow Ponds, from parakeets to woodpeckers, and even take a row boat for a spin.

What else?

- Your new local is The Cuckfield, a former 19th century coaching inn with mouthwatering seasonal menus.
- You're three minutes from The Orange Tree, expert interior designers who'll help you make your new home just as you want it.
- If you're craving cake, you'll want to pay a visit to the Belgique cafe, where they can create anything from classic patisserie to gluten and egg free delights (not to mention 'surprise crocodile bread').

A word from the owner..

"We have loved living in Wanstead, the community here is fantastic. There is a monthly street market along the high street just a 5 minute walk away and regular antique and craft fairs in the church hall in the park just behind the house. This park is also host to an annual music festival. There is a great selection of local shops, pubs and restaurants and an excellent choice of schools. It's only a 20-minute commute into London Liverpool Street and the house is situated a 5 minute walk away from both Snaresbrook and Wanstead tube stations. It’s also in close proximity to the forest and lake for great walks and jogs, so you've got the best of both worlds. We've put a lot of love into the house and garden and have made several improvements such as adding new triple glazed windows, updating the kitchen, redecorating both bedrooms and adding a new lush turf to the back garden and new shrubs to the front. As a pretty period property, Louise Cottages also has a great open plan living space downstairs, adding space and light to our cosy cottage. We will really miss living here and our lovely neighbours very much and we hope you will enjoy your time here as much as we have.”

detailedDescription:
A bright and perfectly placed two bedroom apartment on the second floor of a low rise, contemporary development in Blackhorse Village. Here you have generous room sizes, leafy communal grounds plus the green space of Stoneydown Park, and Blackhorse Road Victoria line station just five minutes away.

The creative social hub of Blackhorse Workshop is round the corner, and the 'Walthamstow Beer Mile' with Truman's Social Club, Exale, The Brewer's Bar and Wild Card Brewery Lockwood is just half a mile away on foot.

If you lived here…

You'll love living in Blackhorse Village's leafy, residential network of streets - it's an area on the up with 2500 new homes planned, all set to further welcome a new generation of designers, artists and start-up entrepreneurs. The 'Mini Holland' scheme makes it the ideal neighbourhood for pedestrians and cyclists alike, plus the air quality here is excellent.

Inside and your lounge/diner comes in at a sizeable 195 square feet with sleekly engineered light hardwood underfoot and pristine white walls. It's laid open plan to a kitchen resplendent in a burgundy backsplash and the entire space is dual aspect. Your bathroom's handily tucked away here and home to a rainfall shower, mirrored cabinet and heated towel rail. Lastly, your master bedroom's a generous 140 square foot double with a wealth of natural light courtesy of those huge windows, while bedroom two's eighty five square feet and just as immaculate.

Blackhorse Road station is just five minutes and foot and will whisk you directly to Central London in fifteen minutes. Alternatively, ride one stop in the other direction and you're in Walthamstow Central, for Europe's longest street market, the Walthamstow Mall and nine screen Empire cinema entertainment complex. Here's also where you'll find Hoe Street; its surrounding turnings home to an array of cafes and restaurants. We'd be remiss not to recommend The Collab, it's an award-winning craft beer and burger bar bringing you local Signature Brew beverages and We Serve Humans food.

What else?

- Our local gem of Lloyd Park is fifteen minutes on foot, its open green spaces home to cafes, courts and an outdoor gym. If you prefer your nature wilder then London's largest nature reserve, the Walthamstow Wetlands, is even closer.
- You have twenty primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius alone, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and four of which have been given the accolade 'Outstanding'.
- Walthamstow Village is a mere eight minute walk from Walthamstow Central, its part-pedestrianised leafy streets, historic architecture and gastronomical delights making it a popular destination in its own right.

A word from the owner....
"I have lived here for 19 years and i have had great time owning the property. This is because of the property is located in a wonderful quiet and peaceful area. Furthermore, the property is really close to blackhorse road station (underground train station) which connects to the Victoria line and allows for travelling around London easily which is ideal for students travelling to schools and universities, and for workers to travelling to the city centre etc. Moreover, the property is also close to buses and allows for easy travelling. Another local amenity is Tesco Express which is located in the same block as the property. There are numerous shops on forest road such as barbers, pharmacy, car repair shop, etc. This provides a huge benefit and convenience for vital needs and for it to be within seconds away is a huge benefit and an advantage. Another important amenity of the property is stoneydown park (park) which is located just a minute walks away from the property. The park is an excellent place for walking, exercising and riding and most importantly a peaceful area for spending time. There are numerous primary and secondary schools which are close to the property, which is ideal for families with children and would make it very convenient knowing the school is a couple of minutes away."

detailedDescription:
A pleasantly spacious and neatly appointed one bedroom apartment. You're on the ground floor of a modest, distributed development sat amongst communal grounds on a peaceful no through road just a short walk from bustling Wanstead High Street, the leafy green heart of this popular East London village.

Eagle Pond's tranquil blue waters are your gateway to the wild wide open greenery of Epping Forest, all just a half mile on foot anytime you want to lose yourself in nature.

If you lived here

You'll be enjoying tranquil summer evenings in your substantial communal gardens, with plenty of space for solitude or getting to know your neighbours as you prefer. Inside, your dedicated reception room is a welcoming 160 square feet, and plushly appointed with soft grey carpets and walls.

To the rear your bedroom's a similarly stylish double, with plenty of floor to ceiling fitted storage. Elsewhere and your kitchen has a pleasing, rustic feel with blonde hardwood style flooring and mottled tiling splashback. Your bathroom's just as smart, with more blonde hardwood and pristine tiling from floor to ceiling, while finally there's a wealth of fitted storage in the hallway.

Outside it's just ten minutes on foot to Wanstead High Street. Flanked by open green spaces, here you'll find a fine a choice of independent bars, restaurants and gastropubs (the Sunday Roast at the recently refurbished The Bull is especially unmissable) as well as all manner of artisanal produce suppliers including a dedicated butchers and fishmonger. There's even a traditional East End Pie & Mash shop.

What else?

- Snaresbrook zone 4 tube station is just ten minutes walk and will get you directly to the City and the West End via the Central line.
- If you fancy a change from Wanstead High Street, South Woodford's social hub of George Lane is less than fifteen minutes on foot, for a further choice of bars and restaurants as well as the Odeon Cinema.
- You have private off street parking and drivers can be on the North Circular in less than ten minutes.

detailedDescription:
“A roomy, well planned home in the heart of Walthamstow Village”

A modern first floor property with it’s own private entrance, and just a short walk from Walthamstow Central Station. The quiet property is detached creating a tranquil space for home working and boasts a long lease.

Inside, the home feels bright and modern. The open plan kitchen diner is ideal for entertaining and laid out in a way that means everyone can be together to relax and cook simultaneously. There is also a separate storage space that doubles as a utility room – very handy!

The well sized lengthy living space is long and roomy enough for a proper dining area slightly apart from the kitchen, where natural light pours in from the south facing windows. The living space can be neatly divided with furniture creating a lounge space big enough for home workouts or working as well as evenings watching TV.

The open plan kitchen space has bistro tiling and surface space that also creates a subtle and clever room divide.

A big main double bedroom features a traditional bay window making for a striking space to live and sleep. The bathroom’s fresh and modern with a walk-in shower. The second double bedroom would also work well as a private office space.

Living Here...

Just a short walk to Walthamstow Central Station and Grosvenor Park, and close to everything that’s going on in the Village, with its fantastic places to eat & drink, meet friends, go shopping and be inspired.

In The Owners Words...

"This flat has brought me so many happy memories over the last six years. You really are in the heart of the village, able to get coffee in seconds from Hucks or a pint from the Castle in minutes. The village has so much to offer and you feel close to everything else happening in Walthamstow. People always comment on how well laid out the flat is, and the evening light in particularly creates a spacious and striking space. It’s a brilliant entertaining flat with the big open plan room which you can use for cooking and entertaining as well as quiet nights. Before the pandemic I rented out the second double bedroom which I now use as an at home office which has been a complete godsend. The property is housed on a quiet street, with lovely neighbours. Being a detached property with its own private entrance, it means the space is very quiet and free from disturbance of those around. The entrance also gives an reassurance from a security perspective. I can walk to the tube in just ten minutes, and it’s then only 20 minutes to Oxford Circus, 12 minutes to Kings Cross or 25 to Liverpool Street.

The freeholders are very easy to interact with, responsive and very reasonable. There is no service charge and the ground rent covers the insurance only so is only around £10 a month.

detailedDescription:
A lovingly finished, generously proportioned two bedroom, third floor Walthamstow apartment, with plenty of light and pleasant rooftop views. You have so much that makes our wonderful borough so special within easy reach, from The Village to the comprehensive transport links of Walthamstow Central.

Two wheeled enthusiasts will be pleased to discover that the great natural expanse of Walthamstow Wetlands - at 500 acres London's largest nature reserve - is less than ten minutes cycle away. The perfect escape from City life.

If you lived here…

You'll be welcoming friends and family into your impressively expansive kitchen/reception. Coming in at over 250 square feet, dual aspect and awash with natural light from a triple set of sash windows, it's the perfect hosting spot. The culinary fixtures are tucked away in a roomy nook, with pristine white cabinets, contrasting dark countertops and matching metro tile splashbacks.

Light blonde engineered hardwood flows underfoot throughout, into the hallway and both bedrooms, each a substantial double with its own pastel finish and more rooftop views. Your bathroom's especially eye catching, sparklingly decked out in aquamarine letterbox tiles from floor to ceiling, a matching tub surround and designer rainfall shower with secondary handset.

Our sought after leafy enclave of Walthamstow Village is just a ten minute walk and well worth the stroll. You won't find a finer, more diverse range of independent bars, restaurants and gastropubs for miles around. From the cocktail cool of Eat17, to the artisanal gins of Mother's Ruin, the fine vintages at Parrish Wines to the craft beers and real ales at The Queens Arms and The Castle, you're sure to find a favourite.

What else?

- Walthamstow Central station is a fifteen minute walk away and will whisk you to Kings Cross just as quickly, putting the heart of London just a half hour away door to door.
- With over 120 years left on the lease, you won't have any renewal worries. There's also a secure entryphone system for extra peace of mind.
- Thomas Gamuel Park is a mere three minutes around the corner, perfect for a quick morning jog or exercising furry friends.

"The flat is really bright and airy, with big windows and high ceilings. It is really quiet and peaceful and the neighbourhood is friendly and I feel safe walking back home even late in the evening.

It's a short walk away from the Village where there are lots of lovely pubs, restaurants and coffee shops, and I like getting the organic box of local fruit and vegetables from Hornbeam which is just down the road, and Gnarly Vines, a lovely wine shop nearby which sells a delicious fresh sourdough bread daily too!

Public transport is very convenient with the Bakers Arms bus stop two minutes walk away, two overground stations and the Victoria underground line.

I enjoy going to the William Morris Gallery, which has also a really nice coffee shop in the back, and wander around Lloyd Park.

The flat is also a short cycle away from Walthamstow Wetlands, a really peaceful nature reserve, which is ideal for a relaxing walk away from the buzz of the City."

detailedDescription:
Offered chain free and in need of modernisation, this spacious two bedroom terraced house is superbly situated on a highly sought after residential turning within good access of Leyton & Leytonstone Central Line tube stations and main shopping areas, yet only a short stroll away from the popular pedestrianised Francis Road, which offers an array of fabulous independent eateries, bars and boutique shopping.

Comprising: This ideally situated property brimming with potential welcomes you in via gated front garden and path leading to your own front door and entrance hallway, which goes onto guide you seamlessly into the bay fronted living / dining area, a great space to transform into an elegant entertaining space to host family and friends.

Just along from the living / dining area is the bright and airy kitchen, complete with fitted wall and base units and access into a small lobby area hosting a convenient storage cupboard and door leading into the rear garden. This lobby also has access into the downstairs shower room and seperate WC.

Upstairs and onto the first floor you will locate two good size bedrooms.

Externally: This property offers a 32ft approx. Mainly laid to lawn rear garden, a lovely outdoor space to work with in creating your own tranquil oasis to enjoy during the warmer months.

In Addition:

- Great access to local amenities & eateries

- Road links incl. A12, A406 & M11

- Good access to High Road Leyton

- Transport links into Stratford Westfield & Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park

- 20 Schools & Colleges rated either 'Outstanding' or 'Good' by Ofsted located within a mile radius

detailedDescription:
First Floor - Two Well Proportioned Bedrooms - Open Plan Kitchen/Lounge/Dining Area - Modern Kitchen With Integrated Appliances - Garage - A Short Walk To Snaresbrook And Wanstead Underground Stations - Easy Access To The A12 - In Close Proximity To Wanstead High Street

Durden & Hunt welcome to the market this well presented two bedroom apartment located in Wanstead. This attractive first floor property boasts an open plan lounge/kitchen/dining area, which benefits from a large amount of natural light. Additionally, there are two well proportioned bedrooms and a bathroom.

The property is in an ideal location, being a short walk to Snaresbrook and Wanstead Underground Stations, which are on the Central Line, and provide direct access to Central London and The West End. Furthermore, Wanstead High Street is a stones throw away, with its array of shops, restaurants and bars.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Superbly situated within the highly sought-after Bushwood area, E11. This beautifully presented two-bedroom ground-floor flat, with its own well maintained back garden, is conveniently located just a short stroll away from High Road Leytonstone, with its wide array of restaurants, pubs and shops. The vast open green spaces of Wanstead Flats are also located close-by, along with Leytonstone Tube station, providing great access into the City & West End.

Comprising: This charming property welcomes you in via a Victorian-style tiled path to the communal door and hall, leading to your own front door and straight into the bright bay-fronted living / dining area. It features wooden shutters, wood flooring and bespoke storage with shelving to the chimney recesses. Just along from the living / dining area is the good-size main bedroom with fitted wardrobes, then it's onto the heart of every home, the kitchen.

This home's kitchen is complete with fitted wall and base units, chic tiled surround and integrated oven and hob, the perfect space to create all of your favourite meals. There is also access into the rear garden via the kitchen, ideal for when dining alfresco.

Moving towards the back of the property you next find the sleek shower room suite and then then the second bedroom, which looks out over the garden.

Externally: This property boasts its own well maintained garden with shed, a lovely outdoor space to enjoy the warmer months with family and friends.

In Addition:

- Long Lease and Share of Freehold

- Great access to the vast open fields of Wanstead Flats and the beautiful Hollow Ponds and Epping Forest

- Road links incl. A12, A406 & M11

- Good access to popular Wanstead High Street

- 15 Schools and Colleges rated either 'Outstanding or 'Good' by Ofsted located within a mile radius

Main bedroom incl. Fitted wardrobes

Second bedroom

Wood flooring

Gas central heating

Double glazing

EPC Rating D

Note from Owner: "We have loved living here. Bushwood is a beautiful and friendly neighbourhood and it really is the perfect location. It is only a few minutes from the Tube and all the shops and pubs of Leytonstone, while also being moments from the beautiful open spaces of Epping Forest. Our list of favourite pubs is too long to fit in here, but we especially love our local, the Birds, for its great beer selection (and a two-minute walk home!) and the Leytonstone Tavern for its seriously good burgers.

We'd also recommend the newly renovated Hitchcock Hotel near Hollow Ponds, which has been taken over by former Ivy chefs. There's always something new opening nearby and you're really spoilt for choice about where to eat and what to do."

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A warm, welcoming and characterful two bedroom apartment on the first floor of a handsome brick fronted Victorian conversion. You're sat just off Lea Bridge Road and its range of daily amenities here, halfway between Leytonstone and Walthamstow with the best of both areas within walking distance.

Leyton Midland Road station is just a half mile on foot for the Gospel Oak to Barking line. You can also jump on the Victoria line at Blackhorse Road, just two stops and four minutes up the tracks.

If you lived here…

You'll be bathing in natural light in your bright and beautiful, 180 square foot front reception. Currently in use as a third bedroom, twin street facing windows illuminate the blonde engineered hardwood underfoot to make for a fine hosting space. Next door's your first bedroom proper, a 110 square foot double with garden view and more blonde hardwood flooring.

Moving further in, your bathroom's pristinely tiled from floor to ceiling, and your kitchen's a neatly arranged affair in cream and grey. Bedroom two's a generous single, with nicely framed treetop views it'll make the perfect home working space. Another place to let your imagination loose is the untouched loft space. Subject to the usual permissions you could potentially add your own whole new storey here, as some of your neighbours have done.

Outside, and a twenty minute walk down Lea Bridge Road with its plentiful shops, supermarkets and cafes, will get you to Lea Bridge Road station, your gateway to Stratford, just one stop and seven minutes away for a huge range of onward overground and underground destinations, plus the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and the shopping colossus of Westfield.

What else?

- The renowned Walthamstow Village, with an impressive range of over a dozen diverse, independent restaurants and gastropubs, is just fifteen minutes stroll. Well worth the walk to make your own judgement in the fiercely contested 'Best Sunday Roast Around' category.
- Leyton Green Park's pleasantly arranged open green spaces are just three minutes around the corner, perfect for a morning jog or exercising furry friends.
- The apartment is offered chain free, so we can get you in with the minimum of hassle.

Lounge (4.64m x 3.55m (15'2" x 11'7"))

Bedroom (2.87m x 3.35m (9'4" x 10'11"))

Bathroom (1.92m x 1.57m (6'3" x 5'1"))

Kitchen (1.87m x 1.93m (6'1" x 6'3"))

Bedroom (2.78m x 2.22m (9'1" x 7'3"))

Explore our 'Locals Leyton' pages for everything this uniquely placed district has in store.

Like much of East London, Leyton has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 12 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in 20.

With the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park just across the A12 you have all manner of shops and amenities within easy reach.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. Placed in something of a sweet spot between location and affordability, there are still bargains to be had.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully bright, handsomely appointed and impressively deep two bedroom first floor apartment in our much loved Warner style with dedicated front door. Sat on the end of the terrace with all the benefits of bring effectively semi detached, you're just a short stroll from Lea Bridge Road station.

Special mention must be made of your shared rear garden, a lush, thriving paradise equalling the entire depth of the property itself and especially secluded thanks to your corner plot location. A scattering of pots together with a riot of screening greenery provides privacy and colour alike.

If you lived here…

You'll be enjoying all the benefits of Sir Thomas Courtenay Warner's turn of the century vision for housing. From the handsome brick frontage to the rock solid construction, these are still some of the most sought-after properties around. Your front reception totals an impressive 175 square feet, a bright immaculate space you'll be proud to welcome guests into, with original floorboards underfoot and a striking ebony hearth taking centre stage.

Next door's your first bedroom, a solid double finished in tranquil pastel green with blonde engineered hardwood underfoot, here's also where you get your first glimpse of that amazing garden. Your kitchen sports timber worktops and matching accents, with slate grey effect tiling underfoot, your bathroom's pristine in white tiling and your second bedroom displays your gorgeous garden in all its glory courtesy of the rear bay window.

Your quiet residential street is just a few minutes' walk from the bustling thoroughfare of Lea Bridge Road, so all your day-to-day needs are right on your doorstep. Lea Bridge station is less than half a mile on foot and just one stop and seven minutes away from Stratford and its comprehensive range of underground and overground connections. Alternatively, you can be strolling the wide promenades of Westfield Stratford City less than thirty minutes after stepping out your front door.

What else?

- You have five 'Outstanding' Ofsted rated primary/secondary schools less than a mile away on foot, and a further thirteen deemed 'Good' and just as close.
- For your new local you can't do better than The Hare & Hounds, a glorious gastropub where the decor is as sumptuous as the menu. It's less than five minutes on foot.
- If you have a hankering to get back to nature, Leyton Jubilee Park is just a few minutes around the corner, or if you fancy venturing further afield you can be at Hackney Marshes in around twenty minutes.

Reception Room (5.11m x 3.20m (16'9" x 10'5"))

Bedroom (3.00m x 3.21m (9'10" x 10'6"))

Kitchen (2.16m x 2.23m (7'1" x 7'3"))

Garden (12m (39'4"))

Bathroom

Bedroom (2.51m x 2.54m (8'2" x 8'3"))

A word from the owner.......
"We have lived here for eight happy years and our home has seen us through being a newly-wed couple to a family of five. We have seen the neighbourhood thrive and develop in that time and will miss the community spirit of these streets. Having access to Jubilee Park has been a real bonus where we have made many friends who are also neighbours. If we didn't need more space we would not be leaving. There's nowhere else in London we would rather be. We can't step out our front door without striking up friendly conversation with neighbours. Our children as well as ourselves have developed a lot of solid friendships, which have been encouraged by street parties organised by the community. We have found the area to be perfect for our needs and really well connected being close to Clapton for independent shopping, and also Stratford which has everything you could ever need. Being on the doorstep of the marshes and the Olympic Park has been a lifeline during the lockdowns with the expansive green space. We regularly go to Hare and Hounds pub which is a great community asset for birthday parties, a casual drink, or even their live music or comedy events (pre-Covid!) as well as Lighthaus cafe for some delicious food. Meanwhile the station at Lea Bridge has provided great commuter connections for getting on Central and Victoria lines."

detailedDescription:
Offered chain free, this well-designed one bedroom first floor flat hosting bright & airy open-plan living and off street parking space, is ideally situated within easy access of Leytonstone Central Line tube station & main shopping area, which offers an array of popular cafes, restaurants and bars. Leytonstone High Road station is also a short stroll away.

Internally: This ideally located property invites you in via secure entry phone system, communal hall and stairs leading you to your own front door and entrance hallway, with convenient storage cupboards. From the hallway, you will first locate the good size bedroom, complete with fitted wardrobes, great for neatly storing away all of your clothing and accessories. Next up is the roomy shower room suite and then its onto the spacious open-plan living area.

detailedDescription:
Key features

- 4 bedrooms
- 2 bathrooms
- Close to shops & other amenities
- Public transport links nearby
- Moments away from major road links
- Front & rear gardens
- Double glazing throughout
- Gas central heating
- Good condition throughout

re/max are pleased to bring to the market this spacious 4 bedroom end of terrace house with 2 bathrooms located on Hall Lane, close to shops, public transport and more.

The property benefits from gas central heating and double glazing throughout.
The property


On approach to the property through the welcoming front garden space, you enter through the porch space, a great space for keeping shoes, umbrellas etc out of the way.

To the ground floor you have the kitchen with fitted wall & base units, integrated sink, fridge freezer, gas hob and oven. From the kitchen you have access to the rear garden. Also to the ground floor is a good size open plan reception and dining area, benefiting from lots of natural light from the bay window to the front aspect and the double doors to the rear that also lead to the large rear garden.

To the 1st floor of this home you will find the main bathroom with 3 piece suite, 1 single bedroom to the front as well as 2 large double bedrooms, 1 to the rear and the other to the front which benefits from additional floor space due to the bay window.

On the 2nd floor of the property in the fully extended loft space is an additional double bedroom with 3 piece en-suite, velux roof windows to the front aspect and dormer extension to the rear aspect which overlooks the rear of the property.
Location


Situated on Hall Lane in Chingford E4 you are across the road from Corktree Retail Park where you can shop at Currys, Sports Direct, Halfords, Decathlon and more.

If commuting you are seconds from the nearest bus stop where you can jump on a bus which can, within approx. 15 minutes, connect you toWalthamstow Central serviced by the Victoria Line.

If you drive you are just moments away from the A406 North Circular from which you can connect to other major roads such as A10, A12, M11, M25 and more.

For those with young children, a short walk away is Chase Lane Primary School (Oftsed rated good) as well as Ainslie Wood Primary School (Oftsed rated good). For the older children is South Chingford Foundation School (Ofsted rated good).

The area features 2 main high streets (Station Road & Chingford Mount) where there are many different shops, cafes, restaurants, barbers and other amenities.

The local area benefits from plenty of park space from parks such as Chase Lane Park (featuring a skate park and play area), Memorial Park (featuring tennis courts and outdoor exercise facilities) & Ridgeway Park (featuring tennis & basketball courts as well asfully operational miniature steam & electric trains).

Other features of the area include nearby golf courses, Queen Elizabeths Hunting Lodge and Epping Forest, approximately 5,900 acres of woodland which is great hiking, cycling, mountain biking, horse riding and much more.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully bright, smart and stylish two bedroom, first floor apartment, enviably located mere moments from the heart of our highly sought-after Walthamstow Village neighbourhood. You also have a lovely roof terrace with views over the Village's peaceful, part-pedestrianised streets.

The Village isn't the only local landmark at your fingertips – Walthamstow Central Station, with its direct twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus and Liverpool Street – is just a half mile on foot.

If you lived here...

You'll be relaxing amongst some truly inventive Design & Decor – the rear bedroom has been turned to use as an open plan kitchen/diner, artfully segmented by a timber-topped breakfast bar/chef's island with sink, hob and chrome fittings. From here you can step out directly onto your ninety square foot, fully decked roof terrace – perfect for a morning coffee or evening glass of wine while looking out over the Village.

Elsewhere the front lounge is currently in use as your master bedroom, 130 square feet with blonde engineered hardwood running underfoot, out into the lengthy hallway and into your bathroom with floor to ceiling sandstone tiling and dedicated shower cubicle. Finally, bedroom two is a generous double of seventy square feet.

Justly renowned, Walthamstow Village is a genuine oasis of calm in the heart of East London and home to a cornucopia of independent restaurants, bars and gastropubs. Fine wines, classic cocktails, craft beers, real ales, artisianal gins – there's something for every palate just around the corner. Not to mention a thriving Farmers market every Saturday – great for fresh produce.

The property is situated in Nash House just off Prospect Hill, via a secure video entry system. The development itself is well maintained and looked after by the freeholders. The property is accessed via the communal gardens which gives people the outside space that they desire in today's world. The communal gardens is where the storage shed is housed and is for sole use to this particular flat.

The property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway giving access to all rooms along with storage in plenty. Directly ahead of you is the bedroom which is incredibly well proportioned and allows for ample space for wardrobes and cabinets. Next is the reception room which offers room for dining giving the ideal space to entertain friends and family. The kitchen includes integrated appliances, but should you prefer a more open feel to the property you can easily remove the wall in between the kitchen and reception room (subject to the freeholders permission) giving a more natural and open flow to the flat. Completing this charming ground floor flat is the three piece family bathroom suite with a shower attachment.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated in the heart of Walthamstow with Hoe Street and the High Street offering an abundance of local amenities including a selection of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An astonishingly spacious and perfectly placed gem of a five bedroom family home. Laid out across three floors with twin bathrooms, private rear garden and cellar, this substantial Victorian terrace is just moments from Leyton tube, Hackney Marshes and all the Olympic legacy delights of Stratford.

With the generous proportions of the period plus that comprehensively converted loft, you have a huge amount of space to make your own, plus plenty of original features you'll want to keep.

If you lived here

You'll have well over 1600 square feet of perfectly located living space to call your own, with your huge bay fronted through lounge and lengthy kitchen/diner (complete with its own bay) providing a wealth of sociable space for welcoming friends and family. Design & Decor may require some personalisation here and there, but fundamentals are strong with blonde hardwood running underfoot in the dual aspect lounge and timeless parquet flooring in the kitchen/diner.

Your rear garden's an expansive, zero-maintenance courtyard, ready and waiting for some imaginative green fingered touches; a scattering of pots, a raised deck, a kitchen garden or pergola. The only limit is your imagination. Head upstairs to find three substantial double bedrooms ranging from 100 to 180 square feet, plushly carpeted, characterfully finished and perfect for families of all sizes. Your first bathroom's spacious too, with a large, L-shaped tub.

Finally, your loft conversion offers a 200 square foot penthouse master bedroom, dual aspect with plenty of natural light and rooftops views, as well as plenty of under eaves storage so you'll have no trouble finding a place for everything. Here's also where you'll find your second bathroom, smartly finished with oversized rainfall shower, and bedroom number five, yet another double and the ideal home working space.

Outside, and among the many sought-after destinations on your doorstep is East Village, the former Olympic Athletes' village reimagined as 'London's Coolest Postcode'. A little over ten minutes' walk, here you'll find a wide range of independent shops and traders, wining and dining establishments, gyms and fitness studios plus regular pop-ups and events like outdoor film screenings. Great for exploring of a weekend.

Even closer to home, you're right in the heart of Leyton here with the tube just three minutes on foot. From here the speedy Central line will get you straight to Liverpool Street in eleven minutes, putting the City around a quarter of an hour away door to door. For the West End, Tottenham Court Road is just nine minutes further. And of course all the shopping and leisure delights of Stratford's Westfield are just one stop away.

What else?

- Parents will be pleased to know you have twenty primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, six deemed 'Outstanding' and fourteen rated 'Good' by Ofsted.
- Your 100 square foot cellar is yet more space to play with, we've seen spaces like this used for everything from simple storage to home gyms or underground bars.
- For your new local, be sure to visit The Leyton Technical, a strikingly appointed and much loved gastropub with delicious food. Just a third of a mile on foot.

With the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park just across the A12 you have all manner of shops and amenities within easy reach.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. Placed in something of a sweet spot between location and affordability, there are still bargains to be had.

address: The Drive, North Chingford, London E4
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £1,500,000 - £1,750,000. This exceptional 5 bedroom detached Art Deco Style home is packed with original features and is located in one of North Chingford sought after roads. Offers 3100 sq ft of accomadtion over 3 floors. Short walk to Epping Forest, Chingford Train Station and Station Road shops and amenities.

Guide Price £1,500,000 - £1,750,000

This unique 5 bedroom Art Deco-style family home, dating back to 1934, is located in The Drive – one of North Chingford's premier residential roads. Walking up the drive you really appreciate its charm. Double-fronted bay windows add to the grand appearance and kerb appeal, and upon entering you will find the property has been well maintained throughout by its current owners, who have owned the property for some time.

Spread over approx. 3,100 sq ft and arranged over three floors, this elegant home offers a stunning entrance hall, 19ft wide lounge, study, dining room, and a fitted kitchen diner that leads to a utility room and separate ground floor W.C.. There remain many original features, such as a novel servant-call bell system, and the wonderment continues upstairs with a turning staircase and exceptional landing with attractive bay feature window. On the first floor is a family bathroom and 4 bedrooms, of which the master bedroom benefits from a dressing room and en suite bathroom. Set on the top floor is a fifth bedroom with ample storage.

The front garden offers a paved driveway with off-street parking for a number of cars. The rear garden has been landscaped over the years with paved terrace for outside seating and dining, and the flower and shrubs help create a tranquil environment. The property also benefits from having a garage, and an outhouse that is currently being used as a gym.

Positioned a few minutes from Station Road, there is an excellent range of shops and restaurants nearby, along with many excellent local private and state schools. Epping Forest and Chingford Plains are also on the door step, for enjoyable forest walks and many outdoor activities. Chingford Main Line Station is a short walk away, providing excellent commuter links – approx. 20 minutes to Liverpool Street, or approx. 25 minutes to Oxford Circus via Walthamstow Central.

This three bedroom first floor split level maisonette offers a stunning amount of living accommodation for the listed price. Further benefits include the property having its own front door, being situated over two floors, includes two reception rooms and is being sold on a chain free basis.

Up entering the property, you are welcomed by an unusually large entrance hallway with the potential to create more living space but as it is, it is ideal for storage. The second reception room includes the bay window as well, ensuring maximum light floods the room and gives more usable space.

The kitchen is next and is spacious enough to accommodate dining whilst including part integrated appliances. Completing the ground floor is the W/C located next to the stairs and is ideal upon guests visiting. The first floor of the property comprises of three sizeable bedrooms again with the master bedroom including the bay window giving more light and space. The three piece family bathroom suite which has tastefully decorated rounds off this charming home. Further potential can be unearthed by converting the loft to make a fourth bedroom and en suite bathroom adding further space and value (STPP).

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated on Billet Road which offers an abundance of local amenities as does Chingford Road which is a stone's throw away. The three piece family bathroom suite and double bedroom with fitted wardrobes complete this charming property.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated a stone's throw away from Blackhorse Lane an ever changing and ever popular area. There is an abundance of local amenities that can be found on Blackhorse Lane such as a selection of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. Blackhorse Road station itself is 0.6 miles away (6 minute walk) giving access to the Victoria Line.

When it comes to schools you are truly spoilt for choice including Hillyfield Primary School, Whittingham Primary School, The Winns Primary School and many more to choose from.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This two-bedroom Victorian conversion occupies the upper level of a terraced house on a quiet residential street close to Wanstead Flats and the bustle of the High Road Leytonstone. The location has a strong sense of community and is within walking distance of Leytonstone's thriving food and drink scene, as well as just five minutes' walk from Leytonstone High Road Overground station and ten from Leytonstone tube - ideal for a swift journey into Central London.

Beyond its front door from the communal hall on the ground floor, the apartment retains the original staircase that leads to the upstairs living area, where open bannisters and a skylight that floods the hallway with natural light combine to create an airy feeling. The space is thoughtfully designed with a natural sense of flow aided by the neutral palette of grey and white paintwork paired with greyed-oak engineered flooring that runs throughout. The owners' accessorising with pops of colour demonstrates the versatility of the decor.

Off the half-landing is a good-sized master bedroom with a view over gardens, along with a contemporary slate-tiled shower room that includes a stunning walk-in rain shower behind floor-to-ceiling glass. On the upper level are a big dining kitchen, second bedroom and living room.

At the centre of the apartment, the kitchen is perfect for casual breakfasts or sociable dinners. There's plenty of space for friends to gather around the dining table amid a sleek combination of white high-gloss units, wood-veneer worktops and integrated appliances.

Meanwhile, the living room looks out over the street through a square bay with double-glazed windows in the style of the original sashes. The standout feature is the stunning cast iron fireplace that brings the room to life against a grey-painted chimney breast. The second bedroom is currently used as a baby's room, but would also make an excellent home office.

A note from the owner

"Our big kitchen has become the centre point of our house where we eat, talk and dance every day."

The neighbourhood

Norman Road is well placed to enjoy all that Leyton and Leytonstone have to offer and is less than 10 minutes walk from Francis Road, High Road Leytonstone and beautiful Wanstead Flats, with Hackney Marshes, Hollow Pond, Epping Forest and Queen Elizabeth Park a short cycle or bus ride. Leytonstone Leisure Centre is a two-minute walk away, with a swimming pool and state-of-the-art gym.

In the last few years, the local food and drink scene has exploded. Perky Blenders does legendary coffees; Wild Goose is a favourite for pastries & cake; San Marino Cafe boasts the best breakfasts in town, and the Heathcote and Star pub is a weekend haven with its huge beer garden and wonderful roasts.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This impressive four bedroom house has been extended and split over three floors. The ground floor offers a bay fronted sitting room and a second large reception room, currently being used as an open plan lounge/dining room. There is a modern fitted kitchen and a utility room that opens on to the fantastic rear garden. The first floor comprises a fitted three piece shower room, a further separate shower room and three well-proportioned bedrooms. The second floor boasts the master suite complete with en-suite shower room. The property boasts high ceilings and wonderful large bay windows. Throughout this house it feels spacious and bright. If all this wasn't enough, the property also comes with a garage and is being offered with no onward chain.

Pentire Road is wonderfully placed for Epping Forest (with an entrance just meters away from the property) so bike rides, jogging and seasonal walks can be taken amidst all the different colours that mother nature has to offer. Transport links are plentiful with Wood Street and Highams Park along with South Woodford all connecting you to various parts of the city in a matter of minutes. This is a fantastic family friendly part of Upper Walthamstow.

detailedDescription:
This delightful one bedroom ground floor garden apartment is ideally placed within a small purpose built development overlooking the River Lea and boasts 465 sq. Ft. Of accommodation.

Available to the market chain free, the property comprises semi open plan kitchen/reception room, private garden, bedroom, ample storage, bathroom, allocated off street parking and a river tow-path with stunning views across Walthamstow marshes.

Riverside Close is a private residential development located moments from the many bars, restaurants and coffee houses of Chatsworth Road whilst the wide-open spaces of Millfields park and Springfield park are also located close by. Transport links include, Clapton Station (Overground just three stops to Liverpool Street) and a variety of bus routes into The City and West End.

detailedDescription:
This spacious and well presented mid terrace family house, situated in this popular location, being comfortably accessible to both Wood Street & Walthamstow Central Stations, shopping facilities, schools and buses.

This three bedroom family home offers a good size front reception room followed by a lounge/diner which leads through to a well fitted kitchen, modern ground floor bathroom and useful enclosed side return which gives access out to the easily managed paved rear garden .To the first floor there are three bedrooms and having both double glazing and gas central heating to the living accommodation the property is the perfect buy to let investment whilst still offering potential to extend fully into the loft to provide further bedrooms and bathroom if desired.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £440,000 to £450,000
immaculately presented two bedroom house with off street parking.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website

Located off Billet Road within easy access to the local co-op, local schools, bus routes as well as being within a short drive to the A406 and within 1.4 miles of Blackhorse Road station.

The property has been very well maintained by the current vendor and offers a ready to move into home. The property ideally suits a first time buyer or down size but has potential to extend to rear and into the loft space, as the adjacent properties either side have done so.

The accommodation comprises of an entrance porch to the hall, with stairs to first floor and door into the lounge. The lounge has wood flooring and window to front. Leading off to the rear is the kitchen with fitted units, integrated oven and hob, space for appliances, recess under the stairs for fridge freezer, space for dining table, door to the garden and the door to the bathroom. The bathroom is a good size with a three piece suite, window to rear and tiling to walls and floor.

To the first floor there are two very generous double bedrooms wood flooring. The landing offers loft access.

The property has neutral decor throughout with double glazing and gas central heating.

Externally the frontage is paved for off street parking. The rear garden is low maintenance with majority paved and small lawn.

detailedDescription:
This three bedroom mid terrace house is the prefect family home that offers a very practical layout and can be moved into immediately due to the excellent condition throughout. Further benefits include a kitchen extended to the rear creating space for dining, two bathrooms and a summer house.

This three bedroom mid terrace house is the perfect family home that offers a very practical layout and can be moved into immediately due to the excellent condition throughout. Further benefits include a kitchen extended to the rear creating space for dining, two bathrooms and a summer house.

The ground floor of the property consists of a porch which is ideal for storage, followed by a large entrance hall. The reception room is located to the front of the property and includes the bay window which allows for extra light and space. Double doors give access to the kitchen\diner which benefits from being extended and includes a sky light. A utility room and three piece family bathroom complete the ground floor of the property. The garden can be accessed via the kitchen/diner and is mainly paved over creating a low maintenance garden. A summer house is located at the bottom of the garden which has full electrics installed and can be used as a guest room or a place to unwind after a hard days work.

The first floor of the property consists of three very good sized bedrooms all of which are flooded with natural light with the master bedroom including built in wardrobes. A three piece family bathroom suite completes the first floor of this dream property. Loft access can be found via the first floor landing which is ideal for storage space. Further space and value can be added by converting the loft into a fourth bedroom and en suite (STPP).

In terms of locality you are ideally situated within a mile to Walthamstow Central and half a mile away from Wood Street station. Wood Street itself is a stones throw away where you will find an abundance of local amenities on offer including plenty of bars, restaurants, shops and the indoor Georgian market, often described as the gem of Wood Street.

You are truly spoilt for choice when it comes to schools including Frederick Bremmer School, Thorpe Hall Primary School, Woodside Primary Academy and many many more.

detailedDescription:
A fabulous opportunity to purchase a most unusual Reader built 3 bed family home offered with corner plot and scope to extend (stp). The property has the benefit of detached garage plus office, kitchen plus utility room, ground floor cloakroom/wc and large paved frontage. Please call us for details.
Rarely available to the market, a most unusual three bed "Reader" built 3 bed family home in central location close to all amenities including shops, schools and transport facilities.
The property has been under the same ownership for a number of years and offers good size family accommodation throughout.
A bright entrance hall with original hardwood flooring leads to all ground floor accommodation comprising through lounge with feature fireplace, a modern fitted kitchen and sep. Utility room which leads directly to the rear garden. Also to the ground floor is a useful cloakroom/wc accessed via the entrance hall.
To the first floor there are three generous bedrooms and a good size family bathroom/wc. There is also access to the large loft space.
The property has the benefit of replacement double glazing (with bespoke stained glass insets) and gas central heating.
The detached garage at the side of the property is accessed via own drive with ample parking. The garage has power and light and to the rear of the garage there is a sep. Door to office space.
The rear garden is mainly laid to lawn with various secluded seating areas and decking area both to the rear of the property and at the rear of the garden.
Overall a lovely family home which offers ample potential (stp).

Viewing Details: Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, enhanced comprehensive photography and open-door viewings.
Please do not hesitate to contact our expert letting team to make appropriate arrangements.

detailedDescription:
A jaw droppingly vast and luxuriously appointed five bedroom Edwardian in our increasingly popular sweet spot of Chingford. The original architecture has been lovingly developed and extended to provide a vast amount of plush living space over three floors, while retaining plenty of vintage charm.

You're surrounded by the leafy green spaces of Chingford here, with plenty of parks and sports grounds within easy reach. At the same time drivers (you have a driveway with space for two cars) can be on the North Circular in less than five minutes, putting central London at your fingertips.

If you lived here

You'll be luxuriating in a shade under 2500 square feet of living space across three characterful storeys, with your open plan ground floor an immediate show stopper. Sixty feet in length, flooded with natural light and with clear sightlines from front to back it's an impressive architectural achievement that will never cease to amaze. Rich dark engineered oak runs underfoot throughout the lounge area, with original ornate ceiling roses overhead and twin ebony hearths recalling the property's vintage roots.

Other accoutrements are kept to a minimum to maximise the sense of space, venture (yes, it's that spacious) into the kitchen area and centre stage is taken by a substantial chef's island with integrated hob and marbled work surfaces under suspended lighting and an oversized skylight. One wall of sleek cabinets, integrated appliances and work surfaces gives way to gorgeous exposed brick in the rear sitting area, with another large skylight and dual aspect floor to ceiling doors opening out onto the garden.

Out here you have a large, BBQ-perfect patio leading to a lengthy expanse of zero maintenance Tru lawn, all surrounded by high timber fences for privacy. Back inside and your ground floor's completed by the first of your three bathrooms, a sparkling shower room, while upstairs you have three substantial double bedrooms, plus a generous single ideal for a child or home working space, as well as your immaculate family bathroom.

Head up the skylit staircase into the loft conversion and you have what can only be described as a boutique penthouse suite. The master bedroom up here is a gargantuan 350 square feet, artfully integrated into the eaves with a wealth of storage, twin skylights and a Juliet balcony to the rear with impressive leafy treetop views. Next door you have a 110 square foot Manhattan-style dressing room, skylit with immaculate floor to ceiling storage. Finally your third bathroom is every bit as generous, also skylit and with a separate tub and dedicated designer rainfall shower cubicle.

Outside, and Highams Park station is just a fifteen minute walk or five minute cycle ride. From here you can get directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three minutes with four trains an hour. Alternatively, Walthamstow Central is just one stop and five minutes away for quick swaps to the Victoria line, the Empire Cinema Entertainment Complex, Walthamstow Mall and the famous Village. Staying closer to home you have a fine choice of shops, supermarkets and other day to day to essentials on the main thoroughfare of Chingford Road, just a a few minutes away at the end of your street.

What else?

- Whatever your health and fitness goals, you'll be happy to have The Bannatyne Health Club less than five minutes walk from your front door, with swimming pool, cutting edge gym equipment, sauna, steam room and spa pool plus a wide range of classes.
- The property is presented chain free, so we can get you in with the absolute minimum of hassle.
- The Highams Park itself is well worth a visit, less than ten minutes drive for the cafes, playgrounds and famous lake.

Explore our 'Charms of Chingford' pages for everything this picturesque part of East London has to offer.

Previously part of Essex, Chingford became an urban district in 1894, an early sign of what would prove to be increasingly close ties to the capital as improved transport links brought professionals flowing to the suburbs in search of bargains.

The local landscape is mostly sturdy post-war terraces and semi-detacheds, with pockets of more contemporary developments and plenty of parks, not to mention golf, cricket and country clubs.

Modest parades of local shops are scattered about the area, with most social life focused on the stretch of Station Road between Kings Head Hill and Chingford Golf Course.

Bordered by the wild green expanse of Epping Forest, and with Liverpool Street just twenty seven minutes by train, Chingford links Essex and the capital to this day, for the very best of both worlds.

detailedDescription:
A bright and characterful four bedroom family home located in our historic neighbourhood of Bakers Arms, named for the local almshouses dating back to the 1800s. Equidistant between Leyton and Walthamstow, you have the best of both worlds. Inside, there's twin bathrooms and a wealth of sociable space.

You're sat on a quiet, residential street here, but nonetheless just a couple of minutes' walk from where Walthamstow's Hoe Street joins High Road Leyton, for a whole host of day-to-day amenities and bus routes.

If you lived here

You'll be stretching out in over 1000 square feet of living space, artfully arranged over three floors with a vast kitchen/diner and secluded courtyard garden to the rear – zero maintenance Trulawn surrounded by high timber fencing. Your first hosting space is the 110 square foot lounge, with richly restored original timber floorboards underfoot and an ornate ceiling rose overhead, there's also eye-catching vintage tiling to the fore of the hearth.

Next door your elegantly extended kitchen/diner's a still more spacious 250 square foot plus. Pale blonde engineered hardwood runs under a large skylight and natural light fills the space, illuminating the complementary pine cabinets and metro tile splashbacks. Upstairs your first bathroom is pristine white with aqua blue trim and a rainfall shower over the tub. Your master bedroom's a generous 140 square foot single while bedroom two is a substantial single ideal for a child or home office. Your loft offers two more bedrooms, a skylit double and another single, plus a smart, metro tiled shower room.

Outside, and Walthamstow Central station is around a fifteen minute stroll (or five minute bike ride) away for fast, direct runs to the City and West End via the overground and Victoria line respectively. Even closer to home is Leyton Midland Road overground, just half a mile on foot for the Gospel Oak to Barking line. Finally, Leytonstone tube is twenty five minutes on foot for the Central line and a whole host of bus routes can be picked up just two minutes from your front door.

What else?

- Nearby schools are plentiful and chiefly excellent. Less than a mile from your new home are thirty two primary/secondaries rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted, including the 'Outstanding' Barclay Primary just twelve minutes' walk.
- Whatever your fitness goals, Leyton Leisure Centre has you covered with swimming pools, gym and a wide variety of classes. All less than a five minute walk away.
- If you're looking to escape to some natural green space, both Leyton Manor Park and Abbotts Park are less than half a mile on foot, while venture further afield and you can be at Epping Forest and Hollow Ponds in around twenty minutes.
