detailedDescription:
1 bedroom apartment now available for £92,500 with Shared Ownership in Walthamstow!

Reserve this one bedroom apartment before 31 July to receive a bespoke interior design package worth up to £3,000*

Available to purchase with Shared Ownership, buyers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

1 bedroom ground floor apartment offering 56 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.

£92,500 for a 25% share of £370,000 and a deposit as low as £4,625 and a minimum income of £50,342.

The Chain
Walthamstow is seeing an unprecedented rate of growth and investment into the town centre and surrounding areas. Waltham Forest's residents and businesses stand to benefit significantly from the economic growth taking place across London. The boroughs well-connected location in the east of London, the cultural heart of the capital, along with its unique identity founded in cultural heritage, its burgeoning arts and creative industries, and abundant green spaces all contribute towards the urban vibrancy that makes Waltham Forest a special place to live. In relative terms, Waltham Forest is now growing faster than any other borough in London. In the last five years the number of jobs in the borough has increased by 30 per cent (the highest in London) and the number of businesses by 40 per cent (the sixth highest increase in London). This in part is due to the significant effect of investment in Olympic legacy projects but also in the overall growth in London and the movement of the capitals economic activity eastwards.

Walthamstow Connections
The Chain is perfectly positioned, close to three train stations with excellent transport links. More green space to walk, run, or cycle than any other part of London. Located near South Grove, The Chain is just a 10 minute walk to Walthamstow Central where you'll find shops, bars and restaurants as well as your favourite retailers within The Mall shopping centre. Walthamstow Leisure centre is an 8 minute walk from The Chain, or just a 3 minute bus journey and offers a 68-station gym, 6 Badminton courts, 2 Squash courts, an Ofsted registered crèche, 5-a-side red-crumb football pitch, a studio and gymnasium.

What is Shared Ownership?
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don't own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

The Chain
Walthamstow is seeing an unprecedented rate of growth and investment into the town centre and surrounding areas. Waltham Forest's residents and businesses stand to benefit significantly from the economic growth taking place across London. The boroughs well-connected location in the east of London, the cultural heart of the capital, along with its unique identity founded in cultural heritage, its burgeoning arts and creative industries, and abundant green spaces all contribute towards the urban vibrancy that makes Waltham Forest a special place to live. In relative terms, Waltham Forest is now growing faster than any other borough in London. In the last five years the number of jobs in the borough has increased by 30 per cent (the highest in London) and the number of businesses by 40 per cent (the sixth highest increase in London). This in part is due to the significant effect of investment in Olympic legacy projects but also in the overall growth in London and the movement of the capitals economic activity eastwards.

Walthamstow Connections
The Chain is perfectly positioned, close to three train stations with excellent transport links. More green space to walk, run, or cycle than any other part of London. Located near South Grove, The Chain is just a 10 minute walk to Walthamstow Central where you'll find shops, bars and restaurants as well as your favourite retailers within The Mall shopping centre. Walthamstow Leisure centre is an 8 minute walk from The Chain, or just a 3 minute bus journey and offers a 68-station gym, 6 Badminton courts, 2 Squash courts, an Ofsted registered crèche, 5-a-side red-crumb football pitch, a studio and gymnasium.

What is Shared Ownership?
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don't own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

Leytonstone Central Line tube station and main shopping area is located within good access, along with the open green spaces of Epping Forest, Hollow Ponds and Wanstead Flats.

Once here, stairs will take you up to the first floor landing, with the first room approached being the good size bedroom, which has been adorned with wood laminate flooring and convenient storage cupboard.

Working your way along the landing you will next arrive at the attractive shower room suite and then its onto the perfect space to entertain family and friends, the spacious open-plan living / kitchen & dining area. This bright and airy space provides this home with a beautiful area to sit back, relax and cook up all of your favourite home cooked meals for your nearest and dearest. The kitchen area is also complete with fitted wall and base units and integrated oven & hob. There is also a lovely window seat occupying the living area window.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An impeccably arranged and eminently generous two bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a pristine brick fronted Victorian conversion, with so much that makes our borough so special at your fingertips. You have a wealth of vintage features throughout and an artfully landscaped private rear garden.

To take just one example of the many local highlights mere moments way, a three minute stroll will see you to Lloyd Park, its open green spaces and landscaped gardens home to cafes, courts, babbling brooks, an outdoor gym and all manner of sports clubs and classes including the ever popular Yoga Me Happy.

If you lived here...

You'll be enjoying the generous proportions of the period, almost 650 square feet of living space in all, as well as the lovingly preserved vintage features from the ornate mouldings on the classic brick frontage to the richly restored original floorboards running underfoot throughout. Your front lounge comes in at around 180 square feet, with plantation shutters on the bay window and an ornate hearth and mantel taking centre stage.

Elsewhere, your master bedroom's a substantial double with garden view, your family bathroom's bright and spacious with rustic tiling underfoot, and bedroom two's a generous single, currently in use as a second reception but equally ideal as a child's room or home office. Your kitchen's smartly decked out with cream units and there's plenty of storage in the hall. Finally, your garden's a real highlight. A striking mural oversees your raised deck, which gives way to a secluded length of lawn ending in a bespoke seating area and timber fencing.

Outside and the very best our borough has to offer is all at your fingertips. As well as the aforementioned green gem of Lloyd Park, you have the leafy oasis of Walthamstow Village less than a half mile away on foot, for a huge range of luxurious, independent bars, restaurants and gastropubs. There's also a thriving farmer's market. Walthamstow Central station is just ten minutes walk and will get you direct to Liverpool Street or Oxford Circus in twenty.

What else?

- Bustling Bell Corner is just a few steps away for a wealth of day to day amenities and one of our finest gastropubs, The Bell. Bright, spacious and sumptuous it's bound to become a favourite.
- London's largest nature reserve, the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands, is well with the 30 minute walk or seven minute cycle anytime you want to get lost in nature.
- Whatever your sport of choice the nearby Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre has you covered, here you'll find swimming pools, athletics track, racquet courts, gym, climbing wall and trampoline park. All less than ten minutes walk.

A word from the owner.....

"We moved across from West London to Walthamstow and were made to feel very much at home thanks to the great community feel. We have been super fortunate to get to know our neighbours and it made us feel a part of the Hilltop community. That is why we are not moving far away so that we can still be part of this great community.
Being situated in the epicentre of Walthamstow, we really like the area where there are plenty of great local shops and diverse food spots from all over the world.
Minutes away we have the Lloyd Park which has a lovely Saturday food market and lots of different activities to do. Walthamstow Wetlands is only a stone's throw away for nice walks and picnics as well as Epping Forest which is not far either!"

detailedDescription:
** guide price £450,000 - £475,000 ** Allen Davies are pleased to offer for sale this two double bedroom house located minutes walk to francis road which offers a selection of great eateries and independent shopping, with it's village feel and friendly vibe. This one offers a cosy lounge leading to a kitchen/diner with a ground floor bathroom. On the first floor there are the all important two double bedrooms, one of which is being used as a home office. An outside space with a private rear garden is a must and this one is very well kept and not overlooked at the rear due to the church behind. With yardarm and marmelo only a few minutes walk away you are also perfectly positioned to the northcote, the heathcote & star and filly brook pubs, plus the recently opened unity cafe, which has gone down a storm. You are also on the doorstep of great local schools. Further afield you have the olympic village, with superb leisure facilities, hollow ponds and epping forest all in walking distance. With a superb location this one won't hang around, for a viewing please get in touch at the office on .

title: 2 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
* four bedroom, detached chalet bungalow * approximatley 0.7 acres * close to golf/equstrian facilties * north chingford tfl 5 less than two miles * heated outdoor pool * click for video walkthrough *

Available to view now, Butler and Stag are delighted to offer this exceptional detached Chalet Bungalow, set in a semi rural location, yet with excellent shopping/transport and leisure facilities nearby.
Willow Tree Lodge is a charming, secluded family residence that has been well enjoyed by the same family for over 30 years.
Offering over 3000 sq ft of flexible living space, the accommodation comprises of a lounge, dining room, kitchen/breakfast room, utility, shower room, two double bedrooms and garage. The ground floor is completed with a glazed conservatory that has been sited to make the most of afternoon sun.
On the first floor you will find a further two double bedrooms Each with an en-suite and one with walk in dressing room.
Externally the property is set behind gates and sits centrally on a plot of approximately 0.7 acres that allows for a sizeable carriage driveway, outdoor heated swimming pool, sun terrace, landscaped grounds and an outbuilding that was historically used as a stables.
Mill lane is a private turning of just three detached homes and is approximately 2.5 miles from Station Road, North Chingford, with its wide selection of independent shops, bars and restaurants.
North Chingford Overground (tfl 5) gives access to the City and West End (Liverpool Street 28 minutes).
The local area is highly regarded for it’s access to outdoor activities, with several riding schools, two gold clubs, forest cycle trails and sailing/diving facilities nearby. Schools are well catered for, there are many outstanding state and private primary and secondary schools.

title: 4 bed property for sale

address: High Road Leyton, Leyton, London E10
detailedDescription:
It’s very rare to view apartments that immediately feel like a home. Offered with “Share of Freehold” viewings are highly recommended for home hunters looking to secure a mid/long term home.!.

A visually stunning Boutique Development of 9 Architecturally designed 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments, located in the heart of the popular E10 postcode and only a 5 minute walk to Leyton shops and underground.

As part of the design development process every detail has been creatively designed with you as the new home owners in mind. Once you are happy with how you have positioned your personal furniture, specifications include architecturally designed, unique black brickwork with contrasting large glass panels allowing home owners to enjoy the natural elements to be part of your everyday living.

The visually stunning communal courtyard allows residents to create a real community living experience, video entry system for added security, bespoke communal lighting offers a balanced and well thought out creative ambiance for those summer and winter evenings, going green easy to use bicycle racks, high quality “Otis” engineered lift and lots of terraces, balconies and central courtyard for all residents to enjoy.

Internally each apartment is unique with well thought out living spaces and linear shaped rooms which is always an Architectural design challenge. Extra height ceilings compliment the floor to ceiling glass panelled windows which really allow the owners to feel the space each apartment have to offer. With glass bifold doors, skylights, engineered oak flooring in main living spaces, lush carpets in the bedrooms and ceramic flooring in the bathrooms the layers of different materials really come together and complement each space...

Further benefits include underfloor heating, quartz worktops providing a quality stone finish to the fully fitted kitchens, integrated smeg appliances including washing machine, dishwasher & double height fridge freezer. Each bathroom and en-suite include quality fixtures & fittings, power shower and floor to ceiling tiles with ample storage space. Rest assured the finish is exceptional, with attention to detail considered at every stage with you “the end user” as the Architects main design brief.

Well-proportioned in size each of the apartments feels spacious with well thought out design and incorporate additional private outdoor spaces, whether a balcony or terrace, as well as access to a delightful communal garden to the rear which caters for a real community vibe where residents can interact and really get to know each other as a new lifestyle concept usually seen in London’s affluent locations such as Knighstbridge or Kensington and the busy financial district like Liverpool Street or Canary Wharf.

Without doubt this is set to become one of the classiest local developments in the E10 postcode and one of the very best new build developments we have seen in Leyton for a while.

Living Here...

The location of this unique development is convenience itself. The many bars, eateries, and other independent businesses on Francis Road and the High Road are a short stroll away and offer the perfect excuse to indulge in some great food and wine. Why not nip into Yardarm for a bottle of wine for that night in, or maybe to Marmelo for dinner. If it’s just a meet up with friends, then the Coach & Horses is your local, with the Technical and Leyton Star also close by. All serve a mean pint and equally delicious food.

Hopping on to the bus or tube is very easy. Weather your travelling to the City or Westfield, where you can hit a shop or two for retail therapy, catch a film at the cinema, or take the plunge in the Olympic Pool. If football’s your thing, then the Os and the Hammers are both close by, whilst Leyton Cricket Ground is around the corner if your prefer your sports at a more leisurely pace.

Want to go further afield? The excellent local transport links mean you are just a short journey from central London (which is also very convenient for the daily commute). So whatever you are planning, be it fun or work, we think Leyton is the place for you.

Help to buy government backed scheme available, offered with Share of Freehold viewings are highly recommended and this opportunity really suits home owner occupiers looking for a long term home.

– Bedroom 2: 4.24m x 2.10m

– Secured Porch: 3.38m x 1.01m
– Private Garden: 7.62m x 1.60m
– Interior Area: 62.2 sq m | 669 sq ft
– Exterior Area: 14.5 sq m | 156 sq ft

Internals:

General Finishes:

– Engineered oak flooring with underfloor heating
– Matt emulsion paint to walls and ceilings
– Solid core doors with painted veneer facings and Allgood ironmongery
– Schneider flat plate metal switches and sockets
– Low energy LED recessed downlights throughout
– Video entryphone system

Living/Dining Room

– TV socket set cabled to enable Sky (subject to subscription), terrestrial digital TV and DAB radio
– BT phone sockets
– Dimmer lighting control

Kitchen

– High Gloss designer kitchen units with concealed handles
– High resistant quartz worktop with recessed drainer
– Glass splashback to underside of all wall units
– Recessed LED task lighting
– Stainless steel 11/2 bowl sink with tap
– Integrated smeg appliances to include:
– 4 ring induction hob
– Cooker hood
– Electric oven
– Full height fridge and freezer
– Dishwasher
– Washer and dryer

Bathroom & Cloakroom

– Large format ceramic floor and wall tiling
– Underfloor heating
– Bespoke laminated vanity unit with mirrored doors
– Shaver socket
– Hansgrohe basin mixers, thermostatic bath filler and shower mixer, and hand shower sets in chrome finish
– Duravit wall hung and wash hand basins and toilets with soft
– closing seats and concealed cisterns
– Kaldewei steel bath
– Heated towel rails

Externals:

Façade
– Staffordshire Blue bricks (ground & first floors)
– Powder coated aluminium rainscreen cladding (second floor)
– Double glazed windows, rooflights, terrace doors and bi-fold doors with powder coated and thermally-broken aluminium frames
– Aluminium faced powder coated main entrance doors

Communal Area:

– Footpath in block paving
– Shade resistant lawn with bollard lighting and concrete benches
– Ivy screens and Sycamore trees
– Sedum green roofs
– Otis passenger lift (8p, 630kg) with stainless steel doors and vinyl coated steel finishes internally
– Secured cycle store and communal bin store

Private Areas:

– Ground floor private gardens in granite flags
– Ground floor private cycle parking stands

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Larkshall Road, Highams Park, London. E4
detailedDescription:
Occupying a really convenient position this large family house, dating from the 1930s pre war period, improved and re-modelled interior in past years, is only a short walk of Highams Park Village Centre with its wide range of facilities, Tesco store, excellent schooling, and a brilliant mainline service to London Liverpool St., (about 20 minutes). The house is set back from Larkshall Road with the advantage of off street hard standing and the inside includes a nice bay fronted lounge, hall, open plan kitchen dining room, which then leads on to a Conservatory Sun room with access to the garden. The first floor benefits from 3 bedrooms, a modern bathroom, and stairs rising from the landing to a loft room space, which in the past has served as a useful home office. To the rear, a nicely enclosed rear garden completes the picture!

Entrance
The property is set back from Larkshall Road and approached behind wrought iron double gates and across a brick pavia drive leading to:

Entrance Porch (2' 0" x 6' 0" or 0.61m x 1.83m)
Panel door with leaded light style inset side and top casements opening to:

Reception Hall (14' 08" x 5' 10" or 4.47m x 1.78m)
Of good size with an easy rise stairs to first floor accommodation, large radiator to one side, laminate style flooring, dado rail, ceiling coving, useful stairway storage/cloaks space, panel doors provide access to the lounge and kitchen dining room.

Lounge (13' 09" Max x 13' 0" or 4.19m Max x 3.96m)
A comfortable size with a nice wide bay to the front elevation adding extra depth. Double glazed leaded light style replacement windows, radiator, high skirting, power points, ceiling coving, attractive "Focal point Fireplace" (not live).

Kitchen Dining Room
A nice big open plan family space combining kitchen dining living areas together with open double door leading on to the conservatory.

Kitchen Area (11' 0" x 7' 04" or 3.35m x 2.24m)
Well fitted and equipped with a range of custom units in a matching design include a run of wall cupboards with glazed display cabinets, beneath there is a return worktop surface providing plenty of working surface, bowl & 1/4 sink unit with chrome mixer tap, plumbing/provision for automatic washing machine, integrated slimline dishwasher, 4-burner gas hob, oven beneath and concealed electric extractor fan above, recess space for a fridge freezer, part tiled surrounds, power points, tiled flooring, wall mounted Vaillant gas boiler serving central heating and domestic hot water, double glazed replacement window with an attractive and colourful view on to the rear garden, to one side a return breakfast bar divide with cupboards and drawers beneath. Opens up to:

Dining Area (12' 02" x 11' 06" or 3.71m x 3.51m)
Tiled flooring, radiator, dado rail and picture rail, a fireplace (not live) with an ornate over mantel, power points, double glazed double doors open up on to:

Conservatory (8' 09" x 9' 03" or 2.67m x 2.82m)
A lovely addition to the house offering extra living space, with tiled floor, radiator to one side, power points, pitched correx style ceiling, double glazed casement surrounding and double glazed double doors open up to the patio garden.

First Floor Accommodation

Landing (10' 0" x 6' 0" Max or 3.05m x 1.83m Max)
A good size having each bedroom leading off together with the bathroom and panel door giving access to the stairs rising to the loft room. There is a useful bulkhead storage/linen cupboard, dado rail, ceiling coving.

Bedroom 1 (14' 04" Max x 11' 09" or 4.37m Max x 3.58m)
Double glazed leaded light style replacement windows to the front elevation, radiator, dado rail, power points, fitted floor to ceiling wardrobe units providing ample storage space, laminate style flooring.

Bedroom 2 (12' 0" x 13' 0" Max or 3.66m x 3.96m Max)
Double glazed replacement window to the rear elevation, radiator beneath, arrangement of custom fitted floor to ceiling wardrobe units, useful stairway storage cupboard, power points.

Bedroom 3 (8' 08" x 7' 02" or 2.64m x 2.18m)
Leaded light double glazed replacement windows to the Oriel style bay to the front elevation, radiator to one side, power points, picture rail.

Bathroom (7' 0" x 7' 09" or 2.13m x 2.36m)
A modern suite in white comprising a panel enclosed bath, chrome mixer tap with hand held shower attachment, vanity wash hand basin with storage cabinet beneath, close coupled wc, ceramic tiled walls, ceiling downlighter, independent shower cubicle with chrome fittings, radiator, double glazed replacement window to the rear elevation.

Loft Room (8' 0" x 15' 08" or 2.44m x 4.78m)
Includes areas of restricted ceiling height
A versatile space used as a home office and ideal for that purpose, having Velux style roof windows to the front and rear elevation, power points, radiator.

Outside
Rear Garden
Of good size and is arranged attractively with a pavia style patio terrace, where there is an exterior water tap and light connected, pathway to one side separating a well stock shrub bed with a synthetic lawn to the other. This then leads to the rear boundary where there is a further pavia style patio, hardstanding suitable for a shed or greenhouse and again more attractive shrub beds.

Front garden
Set behind wrought iron double gates and provides an off street parking space.

detailedDescription:
Book a viewing please quote ref- KH0185.

With two front doors, one being for the shop front, the other leading to the back of the shop and the stairs to first floor.

Ground floor- Entrance hall leading to side access of the shop and stairs leading to first floor. At the front of the property, there is still a shop front opening, leading to another large room currently used as a bedroom. Behind that is a small kitchen with a further good size room beyond that. Giving access to the rear garden, with a lean-to and a downstairs toilet and a good size garden area.

First floor- Good size kitchen, family bathroom, a good size double bedroom and a large living room facing the front of the property. The first floor landong provides access to the loft with enough space for a further bedroom or 2 and a bathroom.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This well presented and spacious three bedroom house for sale in Leytonstone is conveniently situated just a five minute walk from Leytonstone High Road Overground Station, while just a little further away at around 10 minutes walking time is Leytonstone Tube Station.

Guide Price £650,000 - £700,000. This well presented and spacious three bedroom house for sale in Leytonstone is conveniently situated just a five minute walk from Leytonstone High Road Overground Station, while just a little further away at around 10 minutes walking time is Leytonstone Tube Station.

Boasting three double bedrooms, beautiful wooden floorboards throughout and a mature rear garden, this house is for sale chain-free.

As you approach the property you will note the nice bright façade, and the small walled front garden and gate that creates a sense of privacy from the street itself. Entering the property, you are greeted by the hallway which leads via two different doors on the right-hand side to the magnificent through-lounge.

One thing's for certain – space will never be an issue in this place! This sprawling living room offers an area for everything that you may want to furnish your reception with. There iss room for a sizeable sofa or suite, a coffee table and a dining table; your media and entertainment units plus shelving and display areas (should you so wish). This lovely lounge is brightly lit, thanks to the light decor and dual aspect windows: A large bay to the front and a smaller window overlooking the rear garden to the back. The simplicity of this sizeable room is perfectly complemented by the character offered by the feature fireplace and dark wooden flooring. Very versatile, you can reconfigure and re-orientate this room however you see fit if you fancy shaking things up a little.

Back out into the hallway and following through to the rear of the property you'll enter the hub of the home – a sensational kitchen and diner. Another amazing space, the white gloss units offers ample storage and the integrated appliances including a five ring hob, double oven, washing machine and dishwasher mean it's ready to move right into. The plain white walls, tiling and units are offset by the warm wooden floors and high-quality wooden worktops, and the gorgeous butler sink adds another touch of charm to this fantastically functional space. You'll also note a door to the cellar leading from the kitchen, so there's lots of additional storage for those bits and pieces you don't need on a day-to-day basis or the ability to convert to a basement area in the future. Not only does this fantastic family kitchen offer room for a good sized dining table for those social mealtimes, but as with the living area it's also kept wonderfully bright by the large window overlooking the garden side return, and the double French doors leading out onto decking and the magnificent, mature garden.

Decking leading to a high quality laid lawn with established borders, shrubbery and high fencing on all sides, this really is a heavenly haven for enjoying the warmer weather and sunny skies. For those with kids in tow, there's plenty of room for little ones to play, while for the grown-ups there's plenty of space for a barbecue and table and chairs. Measuring 25 feet, it could be a gardener's delight, or simply a relaxing space to unwind.

Heading back through the house to the hallway, do a quick about-turn and head up the stairs to the first floor. Straight up ahead along the landing is the rear double bedroom – the mid-sized of the three. Ideal as a child/teen's room or a guest bedroom, it overlooks the lovely garden and is another beautifully bright space once again offset with the dark wooden flooring. A chimney breast with recesses either side has room for a wardrobe or large unit to be tucked away in the far left recess and allowing the rest of the space to be taken by a comfy bed and any other furniture you fancy.

Directly next door to the rear bedroom is the magnificently modern family bathroom – yet another airy and light space. With a contemporary 3 piece bathroom suite and additional over-bath shower, it also features a wall-inset toilet flush, hidden storage and attractive tiling to the walls and floor.

Back into the landing and up a small flight of stairs, the smallest of the three double bedrooms lies to your left. The great design of this property ensures lots of light permeates into this room too with charming floorboards and ample space to work perfectly as a nursery, spare bedroom or home office.

Finally, at the end of the landing is the largest bedroom to the front aspect, with large double windows, another single window and sophisticated decor – the ideal master bedroom! The recess to the right of the chimney breast has been conveniently fitted with a mirror-fronted double wardrobe and the other recess offers the ideal space to tuck away another unit or wardrobe for your glad-rags! Even with a a king-sized bed, you'll still find plenty of free space for a dressing table, TV unit, comfy chair and any other extras you'd like to add.

This three bedroom house is on the market comes complete with the essential creature comforts of double glazing and central heating throughout.

While the interior of your new home is important to you, location really is everything – and with this property, you really do get everything! Situated just off the A12 for easy car commutes, and near a tube and overground station for those who prefer not to drive, you're also in close proximity good primary and secondary schools including Davies Lane Primary School, Connaught School for Girls and Norlington School and Sixth Form.

This three bedroom house also puts you right on the doorstep of everything that Leytonstone High Road has too offer, such as, gym, leisure centre, Tesco Express and a post office for starters The popular local pub, the Northcote and Heathcote and Star is also a short walk away, along with many of this popular and thriving area's fantastic cafés, bars and restaurants. It is a distance by car or public transport to the amenities of Startford including Westfield Shopping Centre. For lovers of the great outdoors, you can easily pay a visit to Queen Elizabeth Park, Wanstead Flats, Leyton Flats or Hackney Marshes for some exercise and fresh air.

To arrange a viewing for this property, please contact our friendly and helpful sales team.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Century 21 Walthamstow are delighted to offer this most splendid 5 bedroom family home to any fortunate buyer seeking to dwell within the peace, tranquillity, and safety of Cooper Avenue.

All the requirements of a growing family are elegantly provided by this generous offering.

Convenience, efficiency, abundance, and privacy for all occupants who will benefit from the vast number of rooms, spaces and kitchens in the interior, and the space in the garden which is rather lengthy. Only you will likely benefit from more than one kitchen in this profitable coincidence.

Hygiene and conditioning have been upheld rather well. A suitable environment for children is being provided in comparison to older, degraded, pest infested alternative structures on the market in the other exteriors of Walthamstow which offer rather less in immaculacy.

With a utility room in the rear garden and many rooms throughout, pandemic stay-at-home workers who live in this property can convert some of the many spaces into offices while commutes are restricted. Take a coffee break in kitchen 1, or will it be kitchen 2?

Situated not far from bus stops, A406 north circular road and Blackhorse Road station, there are many amenities such as parks, schools and nurseries nearby. Walthamstow is also famous for its markets.
Minimalist layout of entry


Simplicity and ease of maintenance of exterior means you will enjoy this living space without having many repairs and costs to maintain the basic brickwork and rendering. A potential space in the front for gardening is available. Perhaps you might plant some exotic trees as is the case with a few neighbours!
Two receptions of equal size


Ample room has been set forth in the two receptions beside the ground floor hallway, fantastic for dining and nursery space. Separated by doors between the kitchens, these receptions can be protected from the smell of food if you prefer to not allow the smell of food to spread. Absolutely no problem!
Provision of kitchens


As per the council’s planning permission your family members will be able to utilise two cooking areas providing little need for schedules and tastes to clash. Multiple cooking surfaces, cupboard collections and spaces for utensils mean there will be very little by way of limits here. The variety of conveniences and occasions this will bring is only limited by your very imagination.

Convenient W.C. With walk in shower is set beside the larger kitchen of the two.
The lawn garden


Sunlight remarkably lights up the interior via an open garden. So peaceful in the neighbourhood, that there was little need for any brutal fencing, leaving room for attracting natural light for the plants and for your family should they reside here.
The roomy first floor


The vast majority of sleeping space is provided by the first 3 of the 5 bedrooms on the second floor. The first 2 bedrooms are well spacious with ample room for double beds; with the 3rd room better suited for young kids or as an office. These rooms are set beside a bathroom, the second place for bathing thus far. Be sure to note that there are two additional bedrooms waiting for you on the floor above!
Extras on the second floor


Illuminated by the summer sunshine casting its rays through the sky-light and large windows, there will be many bright experiences up on the top floor. A fantastic view of Walthamstow is provided by all rooms up there, quite an unexpected perspective of the town and other regions of London that can be taken for granted when you can only live at one of the more dense, low elevated alternatives.

The third bathroom is situated between 2 immaculately decorated bedrooms. These final bedrooms could also be used as offices.
Availability


The availability of this property can be obtained by getting in touch with Century 21 in Walthamstow. Send us your questions and one of our members of the Walthamstow community will have short chat with you to tell you more about the place.

detailedDescription: Located on the edge of Epping Forest stands this impressive four bedroom family home with views over the surrounding woodland. Walking in from the quiet, secluded close you’re welcomed into the spacious entrance hall leading to a large through lounge offering plenty of natural light and a feature fireplace. A modern kitchen with space for dining is nestled just off the dining area with a breakfast bar and views out onto the woodland. Door from the dining room lead out onto a raised patio area, ideal for entertaining, with steps leading down to the lawn and annexe which offers a large room ideal for study, office, gym or bedroom with its own kitchen and bathroom. The first floor offers a spacious master bedroom, two further guest rooms and a large modern bathroom with a shower and his & hers sinks. The top floor is home to an impressive room with build in storage space and wonderful views out over the Woodland. This attractive property is ideal for families as it is set in a private cul-de-sac off Woodford New Road and offers not only close proximity to many popular schools but also Woodford, South Woodford and Highams Park’s amenities.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A lusciously appointed, five bedroom 1930s family terrace, extensively developed over three floors with an endless rear garden and private garage/workshop ideal for all manner of uses. Staggeringly spacious at just a shade under 1750 square feet, this is a real find for even the most demanding of families.

You have a large driveway to the front, with space for two cars, and drivers can be on the North Circular in less than five minutes, central Walthamstow in less then ten and Epping Forest in around five.

If you lived hereö

You'll be enjoying the vast 1930s proportions of the period, with your through lounge alone coming in at an impressive 250 square feet, bright and airy with glossy space grey tiling underfoot. The expertly extended kitchen/diner is more colossal still, over 300 square feet with striking crimson cabinets, a beautiful breakfast bar taking centre stage and a double width stainless steel chefs oven with matching splashback. Wonderfully skylit with tower radiators and air con, it all makes for a superb space for hosting and family time alike.

Step out into your garden via the bright, handy utility room and you have a vast expanse of zero-maintenance Trulawn stretching away into the distance. At around three times the depth of the property itself, flanked by pathways and timber fencing, it's an incredible amount of outside space for a London property, ending in that handy garage (accessible from the rear) and backing onto open green playing fields. Back inside and the first of your two bathrooms completes the ground floor.

The generous proportions continue upstairs, with your master bedroom coming in at 150 square feet with another beautiful bow window filling the space with light. Rich dark hardwood runs underfoot and you've a wealth of fitted storage. Bedroom two's another substantial double, while bedroom three is a generous single, ideal for a child, home office or dressing room depending on your needs. The family bathroom's immaculate in floor to ceiling smoky grey tiling with a rainfall shower over the L-shaped tub. Finally, the loft conversion provides two further double bedrooms and a spare, skylit WC.

What else?

- Highams Park overground station is just a half mile on foot and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three minutes. Heading to the West End? It's just two stops and five minutes to Walthamstow Central for a fast swap to the Victoria line.
- With that generous driveway you may wish to turn your 730 square foot garage workshop to some other purpose. It's ideal for use as a home studio, working space or guest accommodation.
- Parents will be pleased to know you have twenty one primary/secondary schools less than a mile away, all rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.

Fronting Handsworth Avenue, a tree-lined roadway close to the centre of the Village, this distinctive brick former Victorian property has been thoughtfully converted and now we are delighted to offer within, a superb 1 bedroom apartment representing an ideal First Purchase or possibly Buy To Let Opportunity! The flat is only a short walk of a variety of shopping facilities, including a Tesco store and mainline station serving London Liverpool St., Walthamstow Central and the Victoria line. Within close distance are some superb forest walks across Highams Park's open parkland and former boating lake. The property features an entrance hall, neatly fitted modern kitchen, open plan to a bay fronted lounge with an attractive aspect to the front. There is a double bedroom with ensuite shower room, and off the entrance hall is a cloakroom wc. Communal gardens surround the complex and we understand the flat has a designated parking space.

detailedDescription:
Positioned just a short walk from Snaresbrook, Wanstead and Leytonstone Stations, Petty Son and Prestwich are proud to offer for sale this luxurious, two bedroom, purpose built apartment, which benefits from a generous kitchen/breakfast room and sitting room with a balcony.

This two bedroom apartment is perfectly located for commuters, being within close proximity of the A12 and within a short walk of Wanstead (0.6 miles) Snaresbrook (0.6 miles) and Leytonstone (0.7 miles) stations. Epping Forest is within a few feet of the property and as well as providing beautiful views from the bedroom windows, it is the perfect place to go for a run, bike ride or walk on a sunny day.

The property is situated on the top floor in a very well maintained block and has secure underground parking. Internally, the layout works well, with both bedrooms and bathroom located to the rear which overlooks the gardens, leaving the living, entertaining and dining space towards the front. The décor throughout is bright and contemporary with dark wooden floors and white walls in the hallway, and light grey in the main bedroom and living area.

The master bedroom is a fantastic size and has a generous amount of fitted wardrobe space, whilst the single bedroom can accommodate a study area as well as a single bed. The slick contemporary bathroom can easily accommodate a large shower as well as a great deal of storage, while the impressive kitchen is any cook enthusiasts' dream, with a large amount of preparation space and a handy breakfast bar.

address: West End Avenue, Leyton, London E10
detailedDescription:
Stunning 3-bedroom family home. Recently refurbished with a brilliant downstairs finish. Including new Kitchen, 2 bathrooms, garden and 2 reception rooms.

Upon entering through your porch leave your shoes and coats to the side and enter into your modern hallway. Brand new flooring greets you as you walk past your staircase. To the left is your first of 2 reception rooms. The perfect living space to unwind.

Just off of the first reception room is where you find the second, separated by sliding doors and currently being utilized as a separate dining room.

The real eye catcher here has to be the kitchen, this was part of an extension that the owners did 3 years ago and came complete with a modern, fully integrated kitchen. Sleek design throughout this space. With the extra addition of a downstairs bathroom complete with shower. Towards the back of the kitchen is where you will find your access to your garden. Perfect for those summer days.

Upstairs is where you will find 2 very good-sized bedrooms with the master and second room adjacent to each other. The master includes plenty of built-in storage with views into your garden. A third smaller room is also up here, the owners have cleverly included a sofa bed in here so that it can easily double up as a home office is needed.

Completing the upstairs is your family bathroom, complete with bathtub and access into your loft.

West End Avenue can be found just a short walk from Whipps Cross hospital and plenty of open green spaces such as Hollow ponds and Epping forest, making this a great location for families. Both Wood street station and Walthamstow central are a short walk away along with plenty of supermarkets, bars and restaurants.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A smart, spacious and highly specced two bedroom apartment on the third floor of a sleek designer development. You have twin bathrooms, private balcony plus a wealth of storage and sociable space. You're in the heart of Highams Park here, with green spaces, amenities and transport links on your doorstep.

Designed to maximise natural light, and with a secure entryphone system for peace of mind, this is a thoughtfully conceived development in a best of both worlds location.

If you lived here...

Your first stop will undoubtedly be your bright and expansive, dual aspect, 300 square foot kitchen/lounge. Awash with natural light from oversized sliding glazed doors leading to the balcony, the whole space is handsomely decked out with blonde hardwood, pristine white walls and suspended copper accented light fittings. The kitchen units are arranged neatly along one wall, also bright in white, and home to a full range of integrated appliances. A superb living space with lovely views.

Your balcony is around sixty square foot, decked and sheltered so you can enjoy it in all weathers. Elsewhere, your master bedroom's a substantial double with a floor to ceiling window for lashings of natural light and a sleek en suite shower room. Bedroom two is another double, a shade under 100 square feet with its own floor to ceiling window. Finally your second bathroom's a family affair with large format smoky sand tiling from tub to ceiling.

Outside, Highams Park overground is a mere five minutes on foot and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three, putting the City within a half hour door to door. Heading to the West End? Walthamstow Central is just two stops and five minutes down for a quick swap to the speedy Victoria line. Here's also where you'll find Europe's longest street market, London's largest nature reserve (the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands) and all the delights of Walthamstow Village.

What else?

- The Highams Park itself, landscaped in the 1800s by Humphry Renton, is just a fifteen minute walk. Stroll round the lake, take a jog, have a picnic or just sample the coffee at Humphry's Cafe.
- For your new local, the grandiose Royal Oak Pub, Dining Room and Guesthouse is well worth the ten minute walk, serving up delicious food in equally sumptuous surroundings.
- Parents will be pleased to know you have thirteen primary/secondary schools less than a mile away on foot, all rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.

Hall

Rich with open green spaces, transport links and excellent schools, Highams Park is sat in an increasingly popular sweet spot between Walthamstow and Chingford.

Taking its name from the 18th century manor house, the grounds of which now form one of the area's star attractions - Highams Park itself. Known locally as 'The Highams Park' the park features a lake created by landscape gardener Humphrey Repton in the late 1800s.

Highams Park overground station is in zone 4 and will whisk you directly to Liverpool Street and is also just moments from Walthamstow Central for a whole host of other amenities and connections

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious two bedroom duplex apartment laid out over the second and third floors of a modest, attractive low rise development next to the tranquil green space of Memorial Green and just moments from Wanstead High Street, the bustling heart of this highly sought-after East London village.

Coming in at just a shade under 800 square feet, this is an unusually generous example of London apartment living, and with the friendly village neighbourhood of Wanstead and its open green spaces so close at hand, you'll forget you're in London.

If you lived here...

You'll be stretching out in your immense lounge/kitchen, taking up almost the entire storey at over 300 square feet it's got a real studio feel with glossy blonde hardwood underfoot and designer rack lighting overhead. Wall-width windows frame leafy views and let natural light come flooding in, while the adjacent, artfully separated kitchen area is fully decked out in on-trend battleship grey cabinets, topped with contrasting cream work surfaces and home to a full complement of integrated appliances.

Upstairs (past some very handy fitted storage in the hallway) and your master bedroom's a substantial 160 square foot double with rooftop views from that semi-bay window, and hard wearing carpet underfoot. Bedroom two's a generous single, currently in use as a second reception but equally ideal for a child's room or home working space. Your bathroom is, in keeping with the generous proportions elsewhere, surprisingly spacious, pristine and white and complete with tub and separate shower cubicle.

Outside and it's readily apparent why Wanstead is so popular with families and City workers alike. The bustling High Street, just a couple of minutes on foot, is home to a diverse range of independent cafes, sumptuous gastropubs and fresh produce suppliers from an artisanal butchers to a specialist fishmonger. Snaresbrook tube station is less than five minutes away on foot and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in just sixteen via the Central line.

What else?

- The wild greenery of Epping Forest and tranquil blue waters of Eagle Pond are just a third of a mile on foot anytime you want to get back to nature.
- For your new local why not venture off the beaten track somewhat to Nightingale Lane? Just the other side of the High Street, it's home to a trio of award winning gastropubs.
- Local schools are impressive, you have eleven less than a mile away, four of which are deemed 'Outstanding' by Ofsted with the remainder rated 'Good'.

detailedDescription:
Three bedroom terraced house recently extended and modernised with off street parking.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website at

Located in the heart of Chingford leading off from Chingford Mount Road and its abundance of local shops and eateries within a short walk, as well as local schools, parks and Epping Forest.

The property has been the subject of considerable improvement during the vendors ownership, including a new double storey rear extension. The property also has scope to extend into the loft space.

The accommodation comprises of a newly paved driveway to the front, providing off street parking for two cars. The entrance hall has wood flooring and a modern style ground floor wc. There is a separate lounge to the front with wood flooring and a bay window. Then adjacent is a very handy utility room and storage. At the rear is a superb kitchen diner with bi-fold patio doors to rear, wood-effect tiled flooring with underfloor heating, modern wall and base units, centre island with wooden work top, as well as integrated appliances and space for a range cooker.

To the first floor there is the original master bedroom with bay window, carpeted and with fitted wardrobes. There is also access to a walk in room which could be created as an ensuite shower room or walk in wardrobe. The original second bedroom has been extended to now offer a large double bedroom, again carpeted with built in storage. The third bedroom has a corner facing bay window and carpet. The family bathroom has also been extended to the rear and offers a beautiful contemporary bathroom with original wood flooring, freestanding bath, walk in shower, sink and WC.

Externally the good size rear garden has a patio, lawn, path to the rear and flower beds.

This property is an ideal first time buy or step up the property ladder.

Auction closing date is Thursday 26th May 2022 at 12pm Please note that this property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with Traditional auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer-friendly method of purchase. We do not require the buyer to exchange contracts immediately, but grant 28 days to achieve exchange of contracts from the date the buyer's solicitor is in receipt of the draft contracts and a further 28 days thereafter to complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 3.6% (inclusive of VAT) subject to a minimum of £6,000 (inclusive of VAT) which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to sign an Acknowledgment of Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Legal Pack which can be downloaded for free from the auction section of our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by Douglas Allen powered by iam-sold Ltd.

address: Forest Drive West, Upper Leytonstone E11
detailedDescription:
Offered chain free, this beautifully spacious three bedroom first floor flat with own 41ft approx. Rear garden is superbly situated within the sought after Upper Leytonstone area, ideally located within good access of Leytonstone Central Line tube station and main shopping area, which offers an array of popular eateries, bars and Tesco superstore. The beautiful Hollow Ponds and Epping Forest are also within close proximity.

Comprising: This unique first floor flat invites you in via communal door and hallway to your front door. To the front of the property is the spacious bay fronted living area, a charming space to sit back and relax watching your favourite TV series.

Also to the front of this property is the roomy main bedroom with fitted wardrobes, along with the main bedroom and living area the third bedroom can also be found to the front of the property and could also be used as a office / nursery, depending on your lifestyle needs.

Working your way towards the rear of the property you will next approach the bright and airy fitted kitchen / diner. Complete with fitted wall & base units and integrated appliances including, oven & hob, washing machine & dishwasher, this space creates the perfect atmosphere to cook up and serve all of your favourite home cooked meals to family and friends.

Next up you will locate the good size second bedroom, also with fitted wardrobes and then lastly is the bathroom suite with fitted storage units.

Access into the rear garden can be found via the landing.

Externally: This property boasts its own 41ft approx. Rear garden with laid to lawn and hard standing seating areas, a glorious outdoor space to enjoy spending your time during the warmer months. There is also a shed located to the garden.

In Addition:

- Walking distance of Leyton Midland Road Rail station

- Transport links into Westfield Stratford

- Good access to Leyton Leisure Centre

- Short stroll to Abbotts Park

- Great access to road links incl A12, A406 & M11

- 23 Schools & Colleges rated either 'Outstanding' or 'Good' by Ofsted located within a mile radius

Leasehold

Main and second bedroom incl. Fitted wardrobes

Third bedroom

Access to garden via stairs

Fitted carpets

Gas central heating

Sash windows

EPC Rating C

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this one bedroom top floor purpose built flat. The property is being sold on a chain free basis and we are sole agents so the property can only be viewed through us. The property comprises a large lounge that leads into a fully fitted kitchen. A large double bedroom and a family bathroom complete the flat. The property benefits from allocated parking and access to the well maintained communal gardens. The property also comes with fully double glazed windows as well as a phone entry security system for added security and peace of mind. The property is situated just off of Higham Hill road and has easy access to both Hillyfield Primary Academy and Whittingham Community Primary School as well as the local shops, pub and restaurants on Higham Hill road itself. A short half a mile walk and you will be on the Victoria line via Blackhorse Road as well as half a mile in the other direction and you will have access to Lea Valley Park with access to the lakes, bicycle tracks and bridle paths. Do not miss the opportunity to view this fantastic property.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This two bedroom ground floor Victorian conversion flat is the ideal purchase for a first-time buyer or a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include sole use to a rear garden, two double bedrooms, and is being sold on a chain free basis along with the share of freehold.

This two bedroom ground floor Victorian conversion flat is the ideal purchase for a first-time buyer or a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include sole use to a rear garden, two double bedrooms, and is being sold on a chain free basis along with the share of freehold.

When entering the property, you are welcomed with a bright and spacious reception room which includes the bay window allowing the room to be flooded with natural light and giving more usable space. Located just behind is the sizeable second bedroom which is one of the two double bedrooms. The kitchen diner is situated just behind and includes integrated appliances whilst offering the ideal space to entertain friends and family, and again includes a bay window to the side giving more space and natural light.

The three piece family bathroom suite and master bedroom located to the rear complete this charming property. The garden is accessed via the kitchen and is great place to unwind during the summer days. The garden includes a patio area to the front and is mainly laid to lawn to the rear.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated a stone's throw away from both Forest Road and Wood Street which both offer an abundance of local amenities including a selection of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. Wood Street even has a charming indoor Georgian market giving you a flavor of the local area.

Wood Street station is within a 15 minute walk (0.7 miles away) giving access to the overground. Walthamstow Central is a 22 minute walk away (1.1 miles away) giving access to the Victoria line.

When it comes to schools you are truly spoilt for choice including Frederick Bremer School, Thorpe Hall Primary School, Whitefield Academy Trust, and many more to chose from.

detailedDescription:
**** Guide Price £275,000 - £ 290,000 ****

A bright, south-facing and well maintained one bedroom flat set on the top floor of a 3-storey development with balcony views overlooking King George and William Girling reservoirs. The flat’s position lends itself to viewing a beautiful skyline and stunning sunsets in the evening. Situated in the desirable area of leafy North Chingford.

The property consists of an open plan kitchen and living space, large double bedroom, wide hallway with good-sized contemporary bathroom and two storage cupboards.

The fitted kitchen has an integrated dishwasher, washing machine and a large fridge freezer, as well as a recently purchased AEG induction hob and oven.

The flat has a combi boiler as well as a Google Nest thermostat along with Nest smoke and co detectors. Being on the top floor, it is quiet and energy-efficient with double glazed windows and aluminium frames.

Next to the living space, there is a clear door looking out over the balcony. The bedroom also has a window on to the balcony, and the shape of the bedroom lends itself perfectly to a desk/office space if required.

The hallway leads to a large bathroom with a small sun tunnel allowing natural light throughout the day.

Coming into the building there is a two-door secure entry system with video. The flat benefits from its own allocated parking space in secure parking, as well as secure cycle storage. The flat can be accessed by the lift or stairs.

Situated on Kings Head Hill, it is placed just a stones’ throw away from small shops and a small Waitrose will be opening at the end of the road in June 2021. Station Road is just ten minutes walk with a wide range of independent cafes and restaurants. Chingford Station which is a fifteen-minute walk from the property has reliable connections to Liverpool Street (28 minutes) and Walthamstow (10 minutes) for the Victoria line. There are also bus stops outside of the flat with buses to Chingford station, Walthamstow and Enfield.

Directly behind the building, you can walk into Epping forest, for walks and picnics with beautiful views over the reservoirs and at points right across London. Also nearby is Chingford golf club and slightly further afield is the popular Connaught waters. Nearby parks including Mansfield park which has fantastic views, and Ridgeway park which has an outdoor gym, bandstand and miniature railway. The Lea Valley path (which connects to Walthamstow and Tottenham) for relaxed walks or cycles along the canal is just a five-minute drive or a cycle away.

detailedDescription:
Spacious two double bedroom first floor flat in highly sought after pocket.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website

Located in the highly sought after Highams Park area within 0.4 miles of the station and local Tesco and shops/eateries, as well as Highams Park lake and Epping Forest.

This purpose built flat is positioned on a quiet residential street and makes an ideal first time buy.

Entering via a communal secure street entrance with stairs leading to the first floor. The property has spacious accommodation with a good size lounge diner, a separate fitted kitchen with space for appliances and built in storage cupboard. There is a master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a further double bedroom with fitted wardrobes. There is a two piece tiled bathroom with separate WC. The hallway also has two storage cupboards.
The property has double glazing and gas central heating.

Externally there are lawned front gardens and to the rear the communal space with a garage en bloc.

Lease Information

The lease remaining is 945 years and the ground rent is £15 per annum. The annual service charge is £2000.

detailedDescription:
***guide price £315,000 - £350,000***
A well maintained ground floor two bedroom purpose built modern apartment located in the highly sought after and popular Upper Leytonstone area.
The property would suit the first time buyer looking for ample space within this private block and would make an excellent first time purchase with nearby amenities on hand.
The property is accessed via communal entrance and comprises reception room, fitted kitchen, two bedrooms, bathroom, communal gardens to rear.
In the heart of one of London’s Olympic boroughs, Waltham Forest, Leytonstone showcases a strong mix of chain stores and small, family-run shops with a flurry of historic pubs and modern bars. Aptly bridging the Essex borders of Epping and Woodford with the City’s Liverpool Street and Tower Bridge, this small-knit, traditionally working class area is still revelling from ‘Olympic effect’, and has finally earned its place as an ‘up-and-coming’ hotspot.
Benefiting from a 10 minute walk to Leytonstone Central tube station, this property is also very well served by local bus links making a commute into the city very easy.
Internal viewing recommended.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A fabulous two bedroom apartment in a stylish and practical purpose built development, set in glorious communal gardens minutes from Highams Park and Epping Forest. With generous living space finished to a superb standard with a private balcony, this is just an impeccable home in a great spot.

All the advantages of living in a modern and secure purpose built development will be yours to enjoy here. Drivers will be delighted to have their own dedicated parking space, with the North Circular only a couple of miles away. If you're ready to relax you'll find the communal gardens are pristine, with lots of space to stroll and places to sit.

If you lived here

You'll step into your hallway, note the built-in storage to your right, and find your first bedroom straight ahead. It's 155 square foot with a floor to ceiling window, soft carpet underfoot, and cool neutral walls. Your en suite is to the left, with a dedicated shower cubicle, modern white WC and sink, and outsize tiling underfoot. Along the hall you'll find your bathroom on the right, with the same high quality finish and serene shades as the first, but this time with a tub to relax in. Your second bedroom is opposite, with almost 160 square foot to offer.

At the end of the hall is your spectacular lounge and kitchen/diner, a splendid 285 square foot space illuminated by a vast wall of floor to ceiling windows. Soft carpet lies underfoot. Your glossy white kitchen hugs one wall, with pale tiling underfoot, and elegant dove grey backsplashes complementing the darker grey worktops. Step out from here onto your seventy square foot glass-fronted balcony, where you can take in the incredible views with a morning coffee or evening drink.

It's just four minutes on foot to Highams Park Overground, where regular trains will take you to Walthamstow Central in just five minutes for the Victoria Line, or direct to Liverpool Street in twenty three. If you're staying local it's under a fifteen minute walk to Highams Park itself, where you can enjoy a stroll around the lake, grab coffee and cake at Humphry's Cafe, and take in spectacular views of the city from the hill. It's just fifteen minutes to the public open space of Epping Forest too.

What else?

- Your new local is the brilliant Stag & Lantern micropub, home of carefully curated cask ales and a friendly and knowledgeable welcome.
- There's a nice long lease on this property, so that's that box ticked.
- If you need bits and bobs for your new home you'll be pleased to find ikea Tottenham is just over three miles away, or as little as twelve minutes in the car.

Highams Park is a great location, being close to central London but also with a village feel. We are just a few minutes walk from cafes, restaurants, gyms and a large park space. It’s a very desirable area, and we will definitely be staying close by!"

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A sleek and beautifully bright two double bedroom first floor apartment perfectly located on Leyton's sought-after, thriving social hub of Francis Road. Here you have generous room sizes, leafy views, and an even bigger range of shops and amenities just four minutes away on bustling Leyton High Road.

Leyton Midland Road overground station is just a nine minute stroll away and just one stop and thirteen minutes from Walthamstow Central, for direct twenty minute runs to Oxford Circus and Liverpool Street. Alternatively, Leyton tube station is a fourteen minute stroll and will also speed you directly to The City and West End via the Central line.

If you lived here

You'll love eating in as much as dining out with your dining area delectably placed to overlook your charming, pedestrianised and tree-lined street. It's an idyllic spot to watch the world go by. The whole lounge/diner is full of natural light courtesy of that box bay window, you've a constellation of recessed spot lighting overhead and smart engineered light grey hardwood flowing underfoot. At 210 square feet, it's a huge space to relax and entertain alike.

Next door, bedroom one is a generous double of 110 square feet dressed in a neutral palette, while your bathroom gleams in floor to ceiling cream tiles with a shower over the tub, traditional white suite and mirrored cabinet. The kitchen's another pristine white space and bedroom two's a ninety square foot double with gorgeous leafy views. Lastly, the apartment comes chain free, which means we can move you in with minimal hassle.

Outside and you're fortuitous enough to have our treasured destination of Francis Road on your very doorstep. Part-pedestrianised and the heart of an increasingly sought-after neighbourhood, your new locale is full of independent artisan shops, cafes and bars. Be sure to check out Yardarm, Marmelo Kitchen, Albert & Francis and gourmet pub the Northcote Arms. Another popular local offering is Heathcote & Star on Grove Green Road – an area very much on the up. A new cafe will soon be opening up opposite here soon as well as elegant craft beer hang out Filly Brook's futuristic new beer garden. Pay a visit to Solvay Society's new taproom in the arches, too.

What else?

- Parents will be happy to know you have twenty two primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted and including the 'Outstanding' Newport Primary, just three minutes' walk.
- Hop on a train from Leyton Midland Road and you can be in Southend-on-Sea in less than ninety minutes, anytime you want to dip your toes in the sea.
- Fancy getting some fresh air closer to home? Leyton Jubilee Park is a fifteen minute stroll away and perfect for picnics or reaching Fitbit goals. If it's a full afternoon exploring you're seeking then head to the bottom of Marsh Lane to Hackney Marshes and on to Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.

Explore our 'Locals Leyton' pages for everything this uniquely placed district has in store.

Like much of East London, Leyton has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 12 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in 20.

With the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park just across the A12 you have all manner of shops and amenities within easy reach.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. Placed in something of a sweet spot between location and affordability, there are still bargains to be had.

address: Woodland Road, North Chingford, London E4
detailedDescription:
This 3 bedroom period property is full of features and huge amount of potential. Located in a desirable residential road close to Chingford Station, excellent schools and Epping Forest. No chain

Located on Woodland Road is this eye catching three bedroom Victorian property which is very bright and airy is in need of modernisation. Its full potential and is a perfect purchase for a buyer to put there own stamp onto this excellent period home. This Victorian house offers spacious accomadtion is full of period features, including high ceiling, fireplaces and detailed coving. The property offers so much character, walking up the pave you can really appreciate the charm as you will see an eye catching square bay window.

This brick fronted house has a large through lounge which can be split into 2 reception rooms. There is a good size 19ft kitchen leading to a summer room and ground floor W.C.
Set on the top floor there is 3 bedrooms and family bathroom.

Woodland Road is a quiet peaceful no through road with open green spaces and Epping Forest close by yet within walking distance to an array of coffee shops, restaurants, bars and shops.
Chingford station is only a short walk away and will get you directly into Liverpool Street in a mere twenty five minutes. If its good schools you are looking for there is an excellent choice of local schools, with many primary/secondary's close by.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A dazzlingly bright three bedroom home with plenty of vintage features and a wealth of reception space, gorgeous kitchen, rear garden with sizeable shed and two bathrooms. Here you're close to schools from nursery through to sixth form age, local amenities and have easy access to the North Circular.

With Wood Street overground station also less than a mile away on foot, you can jump on a train to London Liverpool street for a direct twenty minute run, or change at Walthamstow Central for the speedy Victoria line.

If you lived here

You'll delight in having friends and family over with the plentiful kitchen and reception space on offer, and a forty foot garden to boot. The 150 square foot kitchen adjoins a reception room offering an additional 140 square feet, all tastefully decorated in white with ash-finished engineered floors throughout. Your newly refurbished kitchen features white metro tiling and white units, plus there's an additional 180 square foot reception at the front of the house perfect for cosy evenings at home. What's more, the immaculate downstairs bathroom with its rainfall shower over the tub means the hectic morning rush will be a thing of the past.

The practical use of space, and tasteful white and grey Design & Decor continues upstairs, with a light and spacious main bedroom that comes in at over 150 square feet with natural wood flooring. With the second bedroom coming in at 120 square foot (with a vintage fireplace easily restored to its former glory), and the third at seventy you'll have plenty of room for everyone. The second bathroom upstairs enjoys a shower over the tub, a heated towel rail, grey geometric tile design and a handy separate WC.

Nearby schools include Thorpe Hall Primary and Frederick Bremer Secondary, both rated 'Good' by Ofsted at their last inspections. The well-regarded Sir George Monoux Sixth Form College is ideal for those aged sixteen and over, where alumni include acclaimed choreographer Sir Matthew Bourne. There's also an excellent choice of nurseries nearby for early years.

What else?

- Just a few minutes' walk away you'll find the lrt sports ground, home to Clapton fc, a community team with a cult following. Arsenal's Youth Academy is just up the road too, offering summer schools for talented kids.
- The property is offered chain free for maximum convenience.
- In no time at all, you could be treading in the footsteps of Henry VIII as you take a stroll in Epping Forest, a beautiful wild forest which was one of the Tudor king's favourite places to hunt.

detailedDescription:
Trotters Estates Are please to offer, as the vendors sole agents, this charming ground floor maisonette.

Comprising of a spacious lounge on looking to the secluded communal gardens of Julia court, the master bedroom, double in size is on looking to the private rear garden, bedroom two is positioned to the front aspect of the property. Furthermore, you have a fully fitted kitchen and bathroom. The maisonette comes with a 999-year lease (commencing 1957) So no cause for concern there.

This two-bedroom property is situated a short walk from Walthamstow village, Orford Road where you can enjoy an array of cafes, restaurants, and award-winning public houses. Or in the opposite direction you have numerous transport links, the Empire cinema and the famous 1-mile-long high street and street market.

A word from the Vendor: The first time we saw Julia Court and thought what a tranquil and relaxing place to live. For over 20 years, it has been a joy to study, work and stay. With quick transport routes into Central London and easy drives outside, the Location works for Business or Leisure activities.

We shall miss the area. However, retirement overseas means saying goodbye.

detailedDescription:
A superb newly refurbished three bedroom flat arranged over the first and second floor of this well kept purpose built block with access to communal gardens, private storage and off street parking. Ellen Miller House is located within close proximity to several schools and local amenities with Walthamstow Market and Mall being within walking distance.

The property benefits from a spacious lounge with a private balcony overlooking Shernhall Street and a modern fully fitted kitchen. The second floor offers three large bedrooms and a family bathroom. This property has been renovated to a great standard, with a neutral colour palette to allow you to put your own personal touch decoratively.

Walthamstow Central is just a one stop away on the train and offers Victoria line and Overground services, as well as the night Tube at the weekends. The entire Village areas is a designated Conversation zone, and features many sites of Historical interest including St Marys Church and Vestry House Museum . The flat is offered on a chain free basis with 91 years lease remaining.

detailedDescription:
An exquisite, three bedroom one and a half bathroom family home, Thoughtfully updated to offer bright, open plan living.
Excellent access to local schools and parks.

Available to view now, Butler & Stag are delighted to offer this stunning, three bedroom family home set close to popular Chingford Hatch.

The current home owners have extensively modernised their home during their time here, this includes the extension of the kitchen area and addition of Bi-Folding doors to create a fantastic living/entertaining space that leads out directly to the sunny, tiered rear garden.

Downstairs The reception room is bright with a front facing aspect and hardwood flooring, moving through you will find a newly fitted guest WC and then on to the stunning open plan kitchen/living area with central island, quality high gloss wall and base units, integrated appliances and seating/living area.

Upstairs, three bedrooms (two double, one baby) provide comfortable accommodation, the family bathroom has again been fully updated in-keeping with the rest of the property with high specification fittings throughout.

Externally, you have block paved off street parking for two vehicles, the rear the garden extends in excess of 30' and has been laid with Astroturf to make the area as low maintenance as possible.

Connington Crescent is a quiet turning with grass verges and is set close to some very highly regarded schooling. Locally Chingford Hatch has useful shopping facilities that complement the more extensive amenities of Station Road. Zone 4 and 5 tfl transport is on hand.
