detailedDescription:
Viewings Saturday 8th May - By Appointment Only

A beautifully presented two bedroom apartment situated on the first floor of Locke House, a modern development moments from the picturesque grounds of the Leyton Cricket Pavilion.

The apartment is located in a popular area, a short walk from trendy Francis Rd and the buzz of High Road Leyton. There are numerous cafe's, pubs, restaurants and shops nearby. Leyton Midland Overground Station is a two minute walk away and Leyton Underground Station (Central Line) can be reached in under 10 minutes by foot. There are excellent bus links into the City via Leyton High Rd. There is also an excellent selection of parks just moments away.

The entrance to this apartment is wide and welcoming with plenty of storage. The layout is practical and the apartment is stylish, spacious and light. There is an exceptionally lovely open-plan sitting room / kitchen perfect for dining or entertaining. It has two double bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite, and a generous family sized bathroom. Uniquely, this particular apartment has a modern air conditioning upgrade making it the perfect comfortable living space all year round. Additional benefits include secure video entry phone system, bicycle storage, well-kept communal gardens and lift access.

For families, there is an excellent choice of local schools, with twenty primary/secondaries within a one mile radius, all Ofsted rated 'Good' or better, six of which rated 'Outstanding'.

Out and about

Yardarm - Trendy Winery, Bar and Restaurant.

Marmelo Kitchen - Fantastic restaurant on Francis Road.
Deeney's - Unique cafe serving great coffee and Scottish inspired toasties.
Leyton Cricket Pavillion - Grade II listed Victorian Cricket Pavillion with cricket grounds.
Sainsbury’s – 1 minute walk away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A simply stunning three bedroom terraced house on Beulah Road.

Perched on one of the premier roads in Walthamstow Village, this brilliant refurbishment has been expertly planned and realised, resulting in a property that will be a well loved home for years to come. It offers over 1400 square feet of space, set over four floors, as well as a private garden to the rear. The “living” parts of the house are located on the ground and lower ground floors, and consist of a kitchen/breakfast room, sitting room and garden room. The kitchen/breakfast room occupies the entire lower ground floor. It is kitted out with stylish, modern fitted units along one wall, has beautifully tiled flooring, and offers space to eat as well as prepare. The sitting and garden rooms are located on situated on the ground floor. The former is dual aspect, with two feature fireplaces, whilst the latter is flooded with natural light, thanks to large sliding glass doors on one wall and fully glazed door on the other. This room also offers views of (and access to) the rear garden).

Upstairs, the three bedrooms are spread over the upper two floors. All of them are doubles. On the first floor there is a full width double to the front with two large sash windows, and a smaller double behind. Also on this floor is the family bathroom, which is another stylish room. It features a three piece, including rainfall shower over the tub.

Ascend to the second floor and you’ll find the final double bedroom. Dual aspect, it offers views across the Village rooftops.

Outside, the aforementioned garden has a patio area immediately adjacent to the house – perfect for al fresco dining.

Living Here...

The location of this property really is hard to beat.

It’s a stone’s throw from Orford Road, where just about anything you need can be obtained on the Village’s shopping street. If you need a pint of milk or freshly baked pastries on a Sunday, then pop into the award winning Spar. Or head to Parish Wines for a bottle of bubbly or wine for that night in. If you need a caffeine fix, then Froth & Rind is great. Or head to The Village Bakery for the best sandwiches in E17. For some open space wander to Hollow Ponds, and from there continue on and explore the shade dappled splendour of Epping Forest.

If you fancy a Saturday night out, then there are eateries and pubs galore in the Village, meaning you will never be short of choice. And when the weekend is over and work calls, it’s only a short stroll to Walthamstow Central station for the commute into the City via Overground or Victoria lines.

What more could you ask for?

detailedDescription:
An outstanding example of Victorian architecture combining period and contemporary accommodation complemented by a park facing situation and first class transport connections.

Location

Situated in the highly sought after area of North Chingford, the house enjoys all the benefits of a town location whilst being only a short distance from the greenery of Epping Forest where a variety of outdoor country pursuits can be found.

Forest Avenue is perfectly positioned for everything you need on a day to day basis including a choice of café's, bars and restaurants.

Families are drawn to this area for its everyday practicalities. High on the agenda being the local private or state schools, excellent transport links in the form of a train station (Liverpool Street), M25 and M11 and nearby leisure centres, golf course and gyms.

It is worth mentioning that one of the stops on the Chingford Line is Walthamstow where the tube line (Victorian Line) can be picked up.

A further variety of amenities can be found in the neighbouring towns of Buckhurst Hill, Loughton, Epping, Chigwell and Woodford.

London is easily accessed by the train line which is only 0.1 of a mile away. Perfectly for the city commuter.

Description

Forest Avenue is an impressive period property occupying a prominent position in North Chingford with delightful views over the park opposite.

The house dates back to circa 1850 and has been sympathetically updated and improved during the current vendors ownership.

Period features include high ceilings and skirting boards, intricate cornicing and original Victorian fireplaces. Fused with the traditional are a plethora of modern day additions making the family home both comfortable and practical. The well planned accommodation is arranged over three floors and is typical of its era with elegant and spacious rooms and high ceilings.

On the raised ground floor you will find a generous entrance hallway with stunning paneling and stain glass detailing, a large sitting room which gives the sense of grandeur owing to its sizeable park facing window, ornate marble and working fireplace and double height ceilings. A spacious library with feature cast iron fireplace, parquet flooring and beautiful ceiling cornicing. A bright and airy conservatory with stain glass detailing and French doors inviting the outside in.

The kitchen is the epicentre of every family home and this one is no exception. It measures an impressive 26' and features double integrated ovens, steam oven and microwave, gas hob and eye catching extractor. A large picture frame door and window floods the space with natural light and provides access to the patio and garden beyond.

On the first floor is the spacious main bedroom suite which features stunning views of the park and forest, and also a luxurious en suite shower room with double sinks and spacious shower enclosure. Also on the first floor is a further large bedroom with fitted wardrobes and feature fireplace and a lovely family bath and shower room.

To the second floor and there are three further spacious bedrooms and a shower room.

To the front is a newly paved pathway, off road parking and side access to the rear. To the rear a large south facing garden with a paved patio, mature borders and lawn area. To the rear of the garden is a large raised sun terrace which is paved and features a pagoda, raised beds and lighting.

Of particular note and certainly unique to this house is the addition of a 44' long detached garage with vehicular access provided from Gordon Road. This is a very versatile space and could quite easily serve as a studio, home office, gym or tandem car storage.

Square Footage: 3080 sq ft

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A delightfully bright one bedroom apartment on the first floor of a period conversion, in the much sought after Bushwood area. Behind the smart brick frontage of this Victorian terrace you'll find a perfectly formed and generous living space, with storage galore, ready to make your own relaxing home.

Bushwood is about as close as you can get to the countryside in London without sacrificing easy access to the city. A couple of minutes down your quiet street and you'll be in Wanstead Park, free to explore the grassy expanses and woodlands. Or take a short stroll and you'll find yourself at Leytonstone Station, ready to head into central London.

If you lived here

You'll walk up to the first floor and find yourself on your landing. Your reception room is to the front, an expansive 170 square foot with abundant natural light. There's slate-grey carpet underfoot, and a handsome fireplace as well as plentiful built-in shelves and cupboards. Next along the landing is your bedroom, a perfect 100 square foot. Soft pink carpet lies underfoot, and you'll find two integrated wardrobes.

Then you'll come to your sunny kitchen diner of over 125 square foot. A wealth of white units hug the walls and there's an integrated oven and gas hob. Light wood-effect engineered flooring lies underfoot. A hallway to the rear leads you to your fully tiled bathroom. There's a traditional white suite and shower over the tub, with more engineered flooring underfoot. A large window lights up the space.

You're just a ten minute stroll from Leytonstone station, where the Central Line will see you to Liverpool Street in just over a quarter of an hour, or take you to Stratford for the massive Westfield shopping mall in around seven minutes. Drivers will be pleased to find the M11 is only a couple of miles from you, so getting out of the city is simple. If you're staying local, leafy Wanstead is less than a mile away and replete with an excellent range of establishments to eat, drink and shop.

What else?

- Your new local is The Birds, a friendly pub that celebrates the work of local director Alfred Hitchcock while serving superb food and drink indoors and out.
- You're six minutes from locals' favourite Chinese restaurant, Panda dim sum and Singburi Thai restaurant is just across the road.
- You won't want to miss the annual Leytonstone Festival, a feast of arts and music that attracts visitors from far and wide

Reception Room (4.70m x 3.38m (15'5" x 11'1" ))

Bedroom (3.03m x 3.36m (9'11" x 11'0" ))

Kitchen/Diner (2.87m x 4.07m (9'4" x 13'4" ))

Bathroom (2.87m x 1.98m (9'4" x 6'5" ))

Explore our 'Locals Leytonstone' pages for everything this uniquely placed district has in store.

Like much of East London, Leytonstone has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 14 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in less than 25.

The High Road has plenty of shops, cafes, bakeries and boutiques within easy reach. You also have the impressive bustle of one of the largest shopping centres in Europe - Westfield Stratford, just down the road.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. There's a strong sense of community in this creative and evolving area.

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful one bedroom ground floor purpose built flat. The property is being sold on a chain free basis and also benefits from allocated parking. You are greeted at the property by a glorious communal garden. The property is accessed via a communal entrance that benefits from a phone security entry system. The main front door opens into a bright and spacious entrance hall. A large lounge/diner is accessed from the entrance hall and benefits from a sizeable bay window. The bay window not only floods the room with natural light but also allows for a greater floor area in this already spacious room. A brand new kitchen was installed in 2018 and is also accessible from the lounge/diner. A fantastic three piece family bathroom is the next room available and has been finished with white gloss tiles as well as a fully tiled floor. The final room is the generous double bedroom and this room benefits from built in storage as well as a lovely sized window that overlooks the gorgeous communal gardens. The property is being sold with a remaining lease of 155 years as well new flooring been fitted throughout so the property is ideal for someone looking to move straight in. The property is ideally located just on the borders of the Walthamstow Village. Being in such a great location means you have everything right on your door step, whether it’s the local amenities in the Walthamstow village itself or the access to the famous Walthamstow market, this property has access to it all.

detailedDescription:
Three double bedroom end of terrace town house with off street parking.

To book a viewing online 24/7 please visit our website

Located off Boundary Road on a residential development this property is located within 1 mile to Walthamstow Central station and 0.7 miles to St James Street station as well as the local bus routes close by on Markhouse Road.

The property is a modern style ex local authority end of terrace town house and has a rarely available front off street parking car port for 2 vehicles.

The property accommodation is arranged over three floors. The ground floor has a guest Wc and a large kitchen diner with access to the garden.

The first floor has the lounge and a good size double bedroom with storage cupboard. To the second floor is another large double bedroom and a further double bedroom and the family bathroom as well as a storage cupboard and loft access.

The property has gas central heating and could benefit from a cosmetic over hall.

To the rear is a good size rear garden with patio, artificial grass and a sunken pond.

detailedDescription:
A home at the heart of a thriving community, this is a well-proportioned two double bedroom home in a quiet but neighbourly street in Blackhorse Village. What's more, there's a leafy private garden and it's all located a short distance from the shops and cafes of Hoe Street, local parks and transport hubs.

Close proximity to schools is another plus point, in particular Greenleaf Primary School is less than five minutes' walk and was judged 'Outstanding' by Ofsted at its last inspection.

If you lived here

You'll want to make full use of the garden in summer and invite friends and neighbours over for a barbecue in your very own barely-overlooked urban oasis, an inviting patio area leads to a lush lawn flanked by flourishing beds. Head inside via sliding patio doors and to the right your kitchen's bright, white contemporary units and white tiled floors and splash backs makes it the perfect place to prep the sides and salads.

Elsewhere, the Design & Decor follows a similar contemporary aesthetic with cherrywood-finished engineered floors in the dual aspect open plan lounge and dining room (which comes in at an impressive 305 square foot in total) making it perfect for mealtimes and get-togethers alike. Plain white walls throughout heighten the light and offer a blank canvas you can put your own stamp on. Upstairs and lighter flooring continue through both your generous double bedrooms and the white tiled bathroom has a simple, clean design.

Nearby Lloyd Park was the birthplace of designer and social activist William Morris, who gifted the Borough of Waltham Forest its motto 'Fellowship is Life' - as well as textile designs that remain popular to this day. The house is now a museum and gallery dedicated to him set in parkland with cafes, playgrounds and a farmer's market which takes place on weekends. In the mood for pizza? Fashionable Sodo Pizza and Yard Sale are accessible within minutes on Hoe Street, alongside a dazzling array of shops, cafes and restaurants.

What else?

-You're enviably located almost equidistant between Walthamstow Central and Blackhorse Road stations. Both will get you onto the speedy Victoria line, with Walthamstow also offering a direct route into Liverpool St and Blackhorse Road to North and East London via the London Overground.
-A private parking space makes this a convenient choice for car owners and those who commute by road. You can get from your front drive onto the A406 in less than ten minutes.
- The loft space is fully boarded for a wealth of extra storage, and accessible via an extended hatch with built in ladder.

"I wouldn't have lived here for as long as I have if I didn't love this road and community. The past year has really shown the value of great neighbours and streets with a stable population. I've watched the area change and flourish and often spend a Sunday walking through Lloyd’s Park and stopping to enjoy a pastry and tea from the deli. It’s wonderful to have such a beautiful landmark so close. A further 15mins away is the Village - i’ve done the walk many times over the last year! I Not only that, I have completely taken for granted the ease of getting to the station and into the city in 30mins as well as proximity to the market (the longest in Britain), just a short walk away."

detailedDescription:
A wonderfully expansive, 1400 square foot four bedroom family home. Arranged over three floors with a pleasant front yard and sixty five foot rear garden. The interior is finished in a colourful, characterful palette and you have a wealth of sociable space including a dedicated dining room and conservatory.

Highams Park is an increasingly popular family destination thanks to the excellent schools, friendly streets and multitude of green spaces, and you're in the heart of it here, surrounded by nature and with Highams Park station less than half a mile on foot.

If you lived here

You'll be stretching out in this extremely generous yet cosily finished family home. Once you've hung your coat in the porch to the front you'll step immediately into your grandly spacious lounge, totalling more than 225 square feet, with perfectly preserved original floorboards underfoot and a striking red statement wall around the open plan timber stair case, further accentuating the already impressive sense of space. To the rear, your dining room's a handy sixty square feet while your brilliantly bright conservatory covers the whole width of the property with exposed brick walls on either side, and lets you enjoy your garden all year round.

And it's quite a garden, a raised patio gives way to an endless stretch of lawn, flanked by thriving riots of screening greenery and backing onto an expanse of mature natural space. Back inside and your kitchen has a pleasant cottagey feel with a rustic tile splashback, rich timber units and a double width range oven. Upstairs your master bedroom's blessed with another large bay window, bedroom two's a solid double and bedroom three's a generous single, all finished in colourful style. Your family bathroom features terracotta style tiling underfoot, while upstairs your skylit loft bedroom is an impressive 180 square feet with plenty of storage and en suite shower room.

Outside, the thriving neighbourhood of Highams Park surrounds you on all sides with peaceful streets and plentiful greenery. The Highams Park itself is a fifteen minute walk, landscaped by Humphrey Renton in the late 1800s and home to a lake, cafe and playgrounds it's perfect for summer afternoons with the kids, or just a good jog of a morning. Highams Park overground station is closer still, less than a half mile on foot for direct twenty three minute runs to Liverpool Street. Heading to he West End? Walthamstow Central is just two stops and five minutes down for a quick swap to the Victoria line.

What else?

- Highams Park station is surrounded by all the day-to-day amenities you'll need, from supermarkets to cafes and takeaways.
- You have seventeen primary/secondary schools less than a mile on foot from your new home, all rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.
- For your new local why not try the much-loved Royal Oak dining room and guest house? A sumptuous establishment just a ten minute walk away.

A word from the owner...

"We came to Highams Park in the year 2000. My children had already begun junior school here, and built up their friendship group; the area also had a number of other attributes, such as proximity to the forest and good transport links to central London. I was very chuffed to settle down in a home in a quiet road with a stream at the end of the garden but a short distance from Walthamstow and its shops, market and restaurants. Over the years we've seen Highams Park develop from a quiet suburb to a thriving community with great amenities, shops and restaurants of its own. And having the forest so close to hand has been a real boon during the past year of the pandemic! It really does have a lot to offer - especially for families."

detailedDescription:
A grandly spacious and gloriously finished two bedroom, two bathroom duplex apartment on the top floor of a striking designer development ideally placed between Chingford and Walthamstow. With a large balcony and expansive, elegant accommodation, all in superb decorative order, this is a real find.

There are an impressive array of facilities here. You have your own dedicated and secure underground parking space, as well as a gym, a shop, mini allotments and the lifesaving luxury of a on site nursery, opening soon. Your private walled balcony has nothing but sky overhead, so you can sunbathe to your heart's content.

If you lived here

You'll step into your large hallway, walk past your welcome wealth of built-in storage, and find your first bedroom to the left. It's over eighty square foot, with soft carpet underfoot and bright white walls. Your bathroom is next, part tiled in soft sandy shades. There's a modern white suite, large built-in mirror, and shower over the tub. Then you'll come to your second bedroom of around 120 square foot, with en suite to the right including a dedicated shower and concealed cistern toilet.

Upstairs you'll first find your fantastic kitchen diner, offering over 210 square foot of space. Your kitchen hugs one wall, and has plenty of contrasting high gloss grey and white units, an integrated oven and electric hob. Engineered flooring lies underfoot. Patio doors open from here onto your 130 square foot paved balcony, an incredible outdoor room with ample space for relaxing, dining and growing pots. At the other side the room opens onto your lounge, giving you more than 145 square foot to relax in.

You're ten minutes from all the amenities of Chingford, and it's just over a mile and a half to central Walthamstow where you'll find independent eateries and shops galore. Fifteen minutes on foot takes you to the lovely Lloyd Park, and you're just a mile from the serene green expanse of Epping Forest. Drivers will be pleased to find the North Circular is close at hand, and it's eleven miles to the M11, so getting around the city or out of town is simple.

What else?

- The Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre, a multimillion pound sports facility with swimming pools, gym, health suite, climbing wall, running track and plenty of other facilities even including a trampoline park, is just a fifteen minute walk away..
- You can relax knowing there's a nice long lease on this property.
- Your new local is The Dog & Duck, where you can settle into a beer garden beach hut with a delicious fresh sourdough pizza.

detailedDescription:
Situated in Meadow Walk, a cul-de-sac positioned just off of the prestigious Drive running between South Woodford and Wanstead, this home is a short walk from Wanstead High Street and Snaresbrook Station (0.4 Miles) as well as being moments from Snaresbrook Primary School and Nursery rated good by Ofsted.

Externally the home benefits from a large driveway in addition to a front garden, integral garage and handy side access. Internally the property is spacious and offers potential for reconfiguration to the ground floor if desired. A handy porch leads you into the property's hallway and large through lounge, measuring an 27ft 5 by 11ft 11 allowing plenty of room for a lounge and separate dining area. The large conservatory to the back opens up to the kitchen allowing for either an additional reception, playroom or dining room area. The beautiful contemporary kitchen offers a range of inbuilt integrated appliances, space for an American fridge/freezer and plenty of additional cupboard space but there is potential to create a larger kitchen diner by way of incorporating the existing surrounding rooms or by way of an extension (stpc). The integral garage provides additional storage or parking space with easy access from the main property.

To the first floor there is a spacious landing leading to three bedrooms, two of which are large doubles, a generous family bathroom and an additional study. The loft has been converted into a large master bedroom, but is currently utilised as an office, with inbuilt wardrobes with an adjoining en-suite. The garden to the rear is well maintained and a pretty mix of patio and lawn with a storage shed to the rear.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming two bedroom garden flat on Francis Road.

This beautifully presented ground floor property has two solid double bedrooms, as well as the additional benefit of two shower rooms. It’s thus an incredibly practical and easy home in which to live.

To the front sits the reception room. Bay windowed to ensure maximum light and with beautiful flooring underfoot, it’s the perfect spot to relax in after a hard day. Directly behind, off the central hallway, is the first of the two bedrooms, before you then come to the mid-point kitchen. This room is kitted out with swathes of sleek, modern cabinetry, and has stylish tiling on the floor and splashbacks. It also offers access to the rear garden.

Wander past the first shower room and you then come to the second bedroom. Again, this is a proper double, although this one benefits from an en suite shower room. Both of the shower rooms feature modern three piece suites.

Outside there is a low maintenance private garden to the rear.

Living Here...

This flat is located in the top spot in Leyton – Francis Road (and not just because that's where our office is). It's a street that’s changing by the hour, let alone the day. For starters, there are the amazing Marmelo or the recently refurbished Yardarm restaurants for dinner – both fabulous. But don’t just think it’s all about food – there are plenty of other things going on as well. Grab a latte whilst perusing the shelves at Phlox Books, or nip into Venner to pick up something for the home. All things floral are the domain of Edie Rose, whilst on the High Road check out the Leyton Technical, Leyton Star or Coach & Horses, all great for socialising with friends into the wee small hours. If all that sounds too much, perhaps book a class at Pause Yoga, or just sit outside Strange Brew coffee shop and watch the world wander by...

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
A cleverly laid out and generously proportioned one bedroom flat on Francis Road.

With the additional flexibility of a loft room, this split level flat offers practicality as well as space, making it a fantastic home. The first floor comprises open plan reception/kitchen, bedroom and bathroom. The reception room is centred around the feature fireplace, giving it a warm and welcoming feel, and has wood flooring and rear aspect window, whilst the kitchen section has fitted units and work surfaces. The bedroom is a solid double, with more than ample room for free standing storage, and the bathroom features a three piece suite.

The loft room is accessed from the reception room, and really gives this flat something extra. It’s dual aspect, so filled with light, and has stripped wood flooring underfoot. It also has an en suite shower room – very handy!

Living Here...

Ideally positioned is probably the most accurate way to describe this fantastic flat. What else could it possibly be, when it’s located on Francis Road, where your culinary cravings can be satisfied by a trip to Marmelo. Yardarm is the place to go for a bottle of wine or some delicious charcuterie (Dan and Eliza are always happy to help with recommendations). Aimee at Phlox Books is an encyclopaedia of literary knowledge (pun intended!) and the coffee in there is top notch too, whilst if the house needs brightening with something floral, then Helen at Edie Rose is the perfect person to help. And that’s before we even mention the wonderful Sunday roasts at the Heathcote & Star, the proximity of Sidmouth Park and Coronation Gardens if you fancy a stroll, plus of course the convenience of Leyton Central line station just around the corner when work beckons. Ideally positioned – yes, we rather think that sums it up nicely…

detailedDescription:
Located on Hainault Road in Leytonstone, this lovely one bedroom conversion flat provides excellent transport links and a living space perfect for those maybe looking for a first home or buy to let opportunity – presented in a good condition and offered with no chain this homely flat is ready to move straight into

Located on Hainault Road in Leytonstone, this lovely one bedroom conversion flat provides excellent transport links and a living space perfect for those maybe looking for a first home or buy to let opportunity – presented in a good condition and offered with no chain this homely flat is ready to move straight into.

Positioned on the top floor, the property entrance hall has additional space and height for added storage or even a small desk space, before continuing further up into the property itself. Reaching the top you get a real sense of warmth to this nice bright property, which includes windows to the stairs and sky light windows to both the bathroom and the bedroom. The bedroom is big enough for a double bed and the bathroom although petite has everything you need.

The Kitchen area has room for all necessary appliances with plenty of side board space and the living room has lovely double French doors to a small balcony space.

As previously mentioned the location means both Leytonstone Central Line Station and especially Leyton Midland Overground are both within short walking distance, great for commuter links. Leytonstone has plenty on offer, whether it for an evening out at the likes of the Birds, Red Lion or perhaps the Luna Lounge to take in some live music or a meal out at the many offerings of Restaurants along the High Street. In addition there are plenty of cafes to catch up over a coffee plus some retail outlets plus a large Tesco Superstore for that bigger grocery trip, and Epping Forest is also nearby.

To view this property, please get in touch with one of our friendly and helpful property experts.

detailedDescription:
Situated in the heart of North Chingford, in a highly sought after quiet residential street, within a stones throw distance of local shops and amenities is this superbly presented one double bedroom conversion apartment occupying the entire ground floor of a detached house.

This absolutely charming property has had a conservatory extension built in recent years which provides a second reception area. The conservatory is bright and airy enjoying views over the delightful rear garden. The superb rear garden measures approximately 50ft in depth, is landscaped and benefits from lovely mature trees and a leafy private aspect. Situated at the rear of the garden is a timber build storage shed. There is immense potential to build an outhouse or a log cabin, at the end of the garden, to create even more versatile space if one wished to do so.

Further benefits include a share of freehold, no ground rent and allocated parking for one car to the front of the property. Also there are no service charges to worry about making this property an ideal first home or a buy to let investment purchase.

The flat is also located within a 5 minutes walking distance of Chingford Train Station. The stunning and ancient Epping Forest is located on the door step. There are many quality restaurants, cafes, and bars located on Station road accessible within a short 5 minute walk of this property.

The property represents an incredible opportunity to purchase a stunning garden flat within a very central location and comes with no maintenance charges attached.

Please call our sales team to book a viewing appointment on at your earliest convenience.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A box fresh, two double bedroom Warner flat on Clementina Road.

Arranged in the quintessential Warner layout, this fantastic property offers all the comforts of modern living, wrapped in a beautiful vintage shell. To the front there is a full width reception room, with bay window allowing natural light to stream in. It’s easily able to accommodate relaxing and dining areas, making it a multi-functional, practical space. Directly behind sits the first of the two double bedrooms, this one being dual aspect. Both of the bedrooms offer plenty of room for free standing storage, with the second enjoying views over the rear garden.

In the middle of the flat are the kitchen and bathroom. Both are sleek and modern, the former having fitted units arranged in galley style and the latter a stylish three piece suite and exquisite tiling.

Outside there are gardens to the front and back, both of which are divided equally between the ground and first floor flats.

Living Here...

Perched on the border of E10 and E17, this area is definitely on the up. Don’t believe us? Well, check out the Hare & Hounds pub, which is literally just a few yards up along Lea Bridge Road. This is a brilliant “local”, whether for a cheeky pint after work, or for meeting family and friends at the weekend. If you fancy fantastic coffee, awesome cakes and mind blowing toasted sandwiches, check out Lighthaus on the Argyll Avenue industrial estate – the décor is as cool as the food is amazing. If you fancy heading further afield, jump on a bus and head to Chatsworth Road, where there are plenty of places to eat and drink, or perhaps hop on the Overground to Stratford, where Westfield and the Olympic Park are one stop away. If all that sounds like too much, wander down Seymour Road to Leyton Jubilee Park, where you can sit on a bench and watch the world go by…

detailedDescription:
Register now to book your viewing!

Three beds starting from £127,500 (Based on 25% of the full market value of £510,000) - parking included

Mixing contemporary urban style with laidback comfort it’s a building that stands out from the crowd!

One of East London’s most sought-after new areas to live, Leyton now has the homes to match these exciting changes. The clean lines and bold brickwork of the exterior draws the eye while mirroring the historic Victorian terraces of the neighbouring streets.

The modern open plan living areas are as stylish as they are comfortable. Wool mix carpet brings a touch of indulgence to the bedrooms, carefully planned to provide the best space, light and storage. Individually designed fully fitted kitchens include a built in oven, hob and extractor. Each apartment also includes fridge freezer, dishwasher and washer drier. Each apartment benefits from either a balcony or terrace area.

Transport

nest E10 is within 10 minutes walk from Leyton underground station where the Central Line carries commuters and shoppers into Liverpool Street and the West End in less than 30 minutes. Nearby Stratford International is now a major transport hub with King Cross Eurostar just 7 minutes away.

Rather explore the neighbourhood by bike? London Fields and Clapton are less than 20 minutes ride away. Make the most of the transport connections with the new cycle hub at Leyton Underground where you will find Brompton bike hire.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
2 bedroom apartment now available for £124,375 in Walthamstow!

Available to purchase with Shared Ownership, buyers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

2 bedroom 4th floor apartment offering 71.7 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.

£124,375 for a 25% share of £497,500 and a deposit as low as £6,218 and a minimum income of £66,629.

The Chain
Walthamstow is seeing an unprecedented rate of growth and investment into the town centre and surrounding areas. Waltham Forest's residents and businesses stand to benefit significantly from the economic growth taking place across London. The boroughs well-connected location in the east of London, the cultural heart of the capital, along with its unique identity founded in cultural heritage, its burgeoning arts and creative industries, and abundant green spaces all contribute towards the urban vibrancy that makes Waltham Forest a special place to live. In relative terms, Waltham Forest is now growing faster than any other borough in London. In the last five years the number of jobs in the borough has increased by 30 per cent (the highest in London) and the number of businesses by 40 per cent (the sixth highest increase in London). This in part is due to the significant effect of investment in Olympic legacy projects but also in the overall growth in London and the movement of the capitals economic activity eastwards.

Walthamstow Connections
The Chain is perfectly positioned, close to three train stations with excellent transport links. More green space to walk, run, or cycle than any other part of London. Located near South Grove, The Chain is just a 10 minute walk to Walthamstow Central where you'll find shops, bars and restaurants as well as your favourite retailers within The Mall shopping centre. Walthamstow Leisure centre is an 8 minute walk from The Chain, or just a 3 minute bus journey and offers a 68-station gym, 6 Badminton courts, 2 Squash courts, an Ofsted registered crèche, 5-a-side red-crumb football pitch, a studio and gymnasium.

Dimensions
Living/Kitchen/Dining Room 5.12m x 4.81m 16'9" x 15'9"
Master Bedroom 4.06m x 3.25m 13'4" x 10'8"
Bedroom 2 3.84m x 3.49m 12'7" x 11'5"
Balcony 7.2 sq m 77.5 sq ft
Total 71.7 sq m 772 sq ft

What is Shared Ownership?
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don't own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%. *Household incomes are based on joint applications. Single applications are able to apply but may need to increase their deposit contribution to meet shared ownership affordability requirements.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A bright and sizeable two bedroom apartment bursting with potential on the second floor of a low rise block with private garage. Here you're sat within an eight minute walk of the amenities of both Chingford Mount and Chingford Hatch, with the wild open greenery of Epping Forest within easy reach.

Fancy a work out? Nuffield Health Chingford Leisure Centre is a mere four minutes around the corner and features a gym, swimming pool and fitness classes.

If you lived here

You'll be relaxing in your huge 170 square foot lounge/diner with its twin set of windows ushering in an abundance of natural light and framing a leafy street view. Design & Decor may need updating but the fundamentals here are strong. Your kitchen's next door and is dressed in an elegant white suite, an on-trend forest green mini backsplash, wine rack and a charming rooftop vista.

Head back to the hallway and your bathroom comes with a traditional white suite and timber flourishes, shower over the tub and a heated towel rail. Your master bedroom's a generous double coming in at over 120 square feet, while bedrooms two's a fifty five square foot single with built-in storage. Lastly, your private garage is outside and accessible from the rear.

Highams Park station is a seven minute cycle away, or hop onto the W16 bus from the Grove Road stop (a three minute walk from your front door) to be sped there in minutes. From here you can get directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three minutes. The 357 bus route from the same stop will whisk you to Walthamstow Central if you want to join the speedy Victoria line or spend a Sunday afternoon ambling around the leafy streets of Walthamstow Village. Finally the 444 will take you straight to Turnpike Lane for the Piccadilly Line or the retail options of Wood Green.

What else?

- Parents will be pleased to know that you have ten primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius rated 'Good' by Ofsted. Larkswood Primary Academy is just three minutes' walk.
- Not only do drivers have their own private garage, they can be cruising on to the arterial North Circular in less than ten minutes.
- Hungry? Head to Super Sushi, it's an eleven minute stroll on Old Church Road, Chingford Mount. It more than lives up to its name, offering up delicacies including the Spicy Dragon Roll with tempura prawn, avocado and flying fish roe as well as a whole host of vegetarian and vegan options.

Reception Room (4.6m x 3.4m (15'1" x 11'1" ))

Kitchen (3.5m x 2.1m (11'5" x 6'10" ))

Bedroom (3.6m x 3.1m (11'9" x 10'2" ))

Bedroom (2.9m x 2.1m (9'6" x 6'10" ))

Bathroom

Explore our 'Charms of Chingford' pages for everything this picturesque part of East London has to offer. Previously part of Essex, Chingford became an urban district in 1894, an early sign of what would prove to be increasingly close ties to the capital as improved transport links brought professionals flowing to the suburbs in search of bargains.

The local landscape is mostly sturdy post-war terraces and semi-detacheds, with pockets of more contemporary developments and plenty of parks, not to mention golf, cricket and country clubs. Modest parades of local shops are scattered about the area, with most social life focused on the stretch of Station Road between Kings Head Hill and Chingford Golf Course.

Bordered by the wild green expanse of Epping Forest, and with Liverpool Street just twenty seven minutes by train, Chingford links Essex and the capital to this day, for the very best of both worlds.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A pleasingly stylish and spacious three bedroom apartment on the first floor of a striking designer development sat amongst expansive lush green grounds and surrounded by the wild natural space of Epping Forest and Wanstead Flats. The development features secure residents parking and bike storage.

If you ever tire of your vast communal grounds, you can be jogging, cycling or strolling through a wide range of natural spaces within moments. You'll forget you're in London. Alternatively, drivers can be speeding out of town on the M11 in around ten minutes.

If you lived here…

You'll be stretching out in an unusual amount of space for a London apartment, 750 square feet in all, artfully arranged along one flank of the development for tranquil green views from every room and a wealth of sociable options. Your 200 square foot reception lies at one end of the property, with twin windows and striped hardwood floors underfoot. Step into the long corridor and your kitchen's on the right, sleekly finished in sandstone and cream.

Next door is the first of your three bedrooms, a decent double that would make an equally fine home working space. Then it's the first of your two bathrooms (a lifesaver on busy mornings) decked out in white and slate grey, with tiling from floor to ceiling. Bedroom two's another double while your master bedroom comes in at over 120 square feet, complete with en suite and dedicated corner shower cubicle.

Outside, and the much loved social hub of Winchelsea Road is less than a five minute cycle away across the flats, its railway arches home to an increasing variety of bars, taprooms and restaurants. Craft beer enthusiasts are particularly well catered for with Pretty Decent Beer and The Wanstead Tap, but foodies will also find plenty to love at the rave reviews Arch Rivals restaurant. Cyclists can also get to Leytonstone tube station just as quickly.

What else?

- Sat on the speedy Central line, Leytonstone station will get you directly to Liverpool Street in fourteen minutes or Tottenham Court Road in twenty three.
- The apartment is offered chain free so we can get you in with the absolute minimum of hassle.
- Parents will be pleased to know you have twelve primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.

Reception Room (5.19m x 3.80m (17'0" x 12'5"))

Kitchen (2.37m x 2.68m (7'9" x 8'9"))

Bedroom (2.43m x 2.74m (7'11" x 8'11"))

Bathroom (1.78m x 3.05m (5'10" x 10'0"))

Bedroom (2.77m x 3.08m (9'1" x 10'1"))

Bedroom (2.97m x 4.25m (9'8" x 13'11"))

Ensuite

Explore our 'Wonders of Wanstead' pages for everything this picturesque part of East London has to offer.

Just 18 minutes direct from Liverpool Street, the long High Street nevertheless has a real village feel with a great range of fine pubs and restaurants.

Still somewhat off the beaten track, Wanstead is a place of broad peaceful avenues, open green spaces and generously proportioned properties.

With prices still amongst the capital's more affordable, Wanstead is proving a popular destination for those looking to upscale and first time buyers alike.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Cash buyers only
A bright and spacious studio apartment with a brand new kitchen, enviably situated in Walthamstow Village on the ground floor of a large semi-detached with generous communal garden. Not only is the Village on your doorstep, but Walthamstow Central and Epping Forest are each just an easy stroll.

Presented chain free, we can get you into this keenly priced property straight away and hassle free.

If you lived here…

You'll be blessed with one of the most enviable locations in our beloved borough – Grove Road is a peaceful residential street on the border of Walthamstow Village, our leafy, part pedestrianised paradise that's home to some of the finest restaurants, pubs and gastropubs for miles around. From the traditional charms of The Queens Arms to the artisanal gins at Mother's Ruin, you're sure to find the perfect spot no matter what the ocassion.

Inside, your main living space is a generous 240 square feet, with plenty of natural light spilling in from the oversized, floor to ceiling bay window. Soft carpet runs underfoot in the lounge area, with soft tranquil tones on the walls. The kitchen is brand new, with timber worktops, sleek fitted units and light blonde hardwood underfoot. Finally, your separate bathroom is tiled from floor to ceiling with dedicated shower cubicle.

You're well served for transport links here too, with Walthamstow just ten minutes away on foot (or five by bike). We're at the top of the Victoria line here, so you'll always get a seat and you can be ion Kings Cross in fifteen minutes or Oxford Circus in twenty. Heading to the City? Liverpool Street is just twenty minutes direct via the overground. There's also a huge range of bus routes to whisk you all over the capital.

What else?

- With the Village on your doorstep you're spoilt for choice when it comes to a new local, but be sure to give The Castle a try, it's a wonderfully welcoming gastropub with a delicious menu and outdoor seating front and back.
- You have a cycle rack in your street, and two wheeled enthusiasts can zip to London's largest nature reserve, the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands, in just ten minutes.
- The leafy waterways of Hollow Ponds are just a half mile away. Have a sandwich at the Log Cabin cafe, hire a row boat to explore the ponds and then finish it off with a pint at the Sir Alfred Hitchcock Hotel, the perfect spot to watch the sun go down over the trees.

Lounge/Kitchen/Diner (4.9m x 4.6m (16'0" x 15'1"))

Shower Room

A word from the owner....

"Everyone who has visited has commented how very peaceful and quiet it is at the property. The neighbours on both sides, and residents in the other flats, are friendly. We’ve loved spending evenings in the restaurants and pubs in Walthamstow Village and walks in Whipps Cross park. It’s only a few minutes’ walk to the underground and national rail and it’s been fantastic just to have a short journey into work at Euston always getting a seat at
the end of the line. "

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A lovely, well-presented two-bedroom flat in period conversion property, ideally located between Walthamstow, Leyton, and Leytonstone.

Superbly located on a tree-lined, attractive street, Walthamstow Village and Leyton’s Francis Road are each only a short walk away. There’s an abundance of transport routes: In particular, Leyton Midland Overground is one stop away from the Victoria Line; or the Central Line is a 10-minute stroll. The lively Abbot’s Park and tennis courts at the end of the street highlight the close-knit local community, and nearby Epping Forest provides plentiful options for walks and enjoying the outdoors. A visit to Stratford is also close, including Westfield Shopping Centre and the Olympic Park.

This first floor flat has excellent natural light, oak wood flooring, and is finished to a high standard throughout. The space comprises two double bedrooms, a lounge/dining room, and a well-kept, modern bathroom. A separate kitchen includes an oven and hob unit, integrated fridge-freezer, and washing machine.

Being sold with no onward chain, the sellers have loved living in the property and plan to stay in the area.

A message from the sellers:

“Pre-Covid we enjoyed a daily commute in and outside of London, but in general we’ve loved feeling so close to so much of London and the life it offers. The homeliness of the property and lovely neighbours; the eateries and local community; the access routes, and so much more, has made this a home we’ll dearly miss. Unsurprisingly we’re staying in the area for our onward move!”

detailedDescription:
This wonderful detached property boasts huge curb appeal and is located on a quiet residential street, close to Walthamstow's town centre and excellent transport links. The house has been carefully renovated and decorated with no expense spared while retaining a wealth of features. There is a lovely open plan living space which includes a bay fronted lounge and a contemporary fitted kitchen/dining room which leads out directly to the rear garden perfect for those summer BBQ's and evening cocktails. Upstairs are three good sized and very well-presented bedrooms as well as a stylish fitted The property offers flexibility for a growing family and this has utterly stunning finishes that we think you will need to see for yourself.

Round the corner is Walthamstow Village where you have a great choice of places to eat and drink as well as the many shops and boutiques. You are also just a short walk to the Wild Card Brewery, God's Own Junkyard and Wood Street with its quirky vintage market and over-ground train into Liverpool Street (15 mins via Hackney). Walthamstow Central is also just a 10 minute walk away along with The Scene; Walthamstow's multi-screen cinema and restaurant complex and E17's famous street market.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £255,000 - £265,000. This one bedroom flat is conveniently located on Leytonstone High Road itself, giving you direct, on-the-doorstep access to a whole range of shops and trendy places to eat and drink. Less than fifteen minutes from Leyton Tube Station and located right on several bus routes, this property is ideal for those looking for the perfect place from which to commute.

Guide Price £255,000 - £265,000. This one bedroom flat is conveniently located on Leytonstone High Road itself, giving you direct, on-the-doorstep access to a whole range of shops and trendy places to eat and drink. Less than fifteen minutes from Leyton Tube Station and located right on several bus routes, this property is ideal for those looking for the perfect place from which to commute.

Entering the flat, you're met by a wide entranceway, bordered by two large inbuilt cupboards providing plenty of handy storage space, and to your immediate right is the entrance to the living room.

As you enter into this lovely living space, you'll be instantly struck by the amount of natural light that floods the room, giving it a light and airy feel. The hardwood flooring in combination with the white décor makes the room feel classy, chic and modern. This central social hub of the apartment has more than enough space for a living room suite, TV set, bookshelves, and a coffee table. There's also space for a dining table too, if you want to get even more use out of this area. The triple-paned windows set into the back wall bring in all that fantastic natural light while also offering a view out onto the communal garden below.

Stepping through to the back of the living room, an open entrance brings you through to the kitchen on your left. This compact kitchen is brightened by the large windows and brilliant white fittings and furnishings. The gleaming white kitchen units are overlaid with sleek grey countertops, which, complemented by the white tiling with purple detailing, amplify the chic aesthetic of the space. Meanwhile, the overhead cabinets provide ample storage for all your food, crockery and cooking accessories.

As we head back to the front door, on your left is access to another cupboard, and also a handy wall hanging letter holder. At the end of the entranceway is the bathroom, tiled in white with black detailing and black floor tiles. The bathroom has a modern and clean finish, it includes a bathroom suite and an over-bath shower, alongside a lovely shelving space helpfully fitted above the sink.

The generously sized double bedroom is also accessible from the entranceway. As you walk in, you'll be immediately struck by the size and scope of this contemporary and well-lit room. With more than enough room for your bed, dresser, wardrobe and bed-side table, the room is bathed in sunshine thanks to the windows, which - like the living room - lend a lovely view onto the green space below. This room, ideal for any couple or individual seeking to make a home for themselves, is delightful in both size and aesthetic. It's the perfect space to make your own!

Not only is the flat impressive internally, but it also offers some excellent facilities outside. There's a parking space around the back of the property – so you can wave good-bye to the stress of searching for a space on the street! There's also a lovely open green garden, shared with the other residents of Paramount House. This is a lovely space to get outdoors and perhaps get chatting to your neighbours.

On the topic of outdoor space, if you choose this flat as your next home, there's a wealth of luscious green areas very nearby to explore and enjoy. Langthorne Park is only a three minute walk away and Hackney Marshes and Wanstead Flats are also close by, for those in search of a proper connection with nature or a larger space for picnics, exercising or simply relaxing in the sun.

On the high street itself you'll find something to meet your every day-to-day need. A Tesco, a grocery and a post office promise to provide all your supplies and key services, while endless opportunities exist for food, drink and socialising. There's cuisine from all over the world available, hearty gastro pubs for those who don't want all the fanfare and a growing selection of trendy chic bars: Whoever you are and whatever you prefer, you're guaranteed to find plenty in the area to suit your style and tastes.

This one bedroom flat with its phenomenal location and modern finish promises to make an excellent home. Situated on the second floor, you're offered privacy from the street, whilst nevertheless being able to benefit from all of Leytonstone High Road's exciting opportunities. There's everything to like about this fashionable and accessible flat – it's simply ready and waiting for you to move in and make your own mark!

What the seller says:
'I have absolutely loved living in the flat for the past seven years; the last two of which i've had my fiancée sharing the space with me. The location is perfect for our work and socialising needs. Being within walking distance of Leyton, Maryland and Stratford stations, to name a few, makes it an ideal spot to live. Leytonstone is a vibrant, multicultural area with lots of great pubs and restaurants. It offers a sense of community in what can be an anonymous city. We will be sorry to say goodbye to this space we have made our home and would love to see it go to someone who will care for it like we do'.

These property details These property particulars have been prepared by Trading Places Estate and Letting Agents under the instruction of the owner and shall not constitute an offer or the basis of any contract. They are created as a general guide and our visit to the property was for the purpose of preparing these particulars. No form of survey, structural or otherwise was carried out. We have not tested any of the appliances, services or connections and therefore cannot verify them to be in working order or fit for the purpose. This includes heating systems. All measurements are subject to a margin of error, and photographs and floorplans are for guidance purposes only. Fixtures and fittings are only included subject to arrangement. Reference made to the tenure and where applicable lease term is based on information supplied by the owner and prospective buyers(s) must make their own enquiries regarding all matters referred to above.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Fountain Court, Hainault Road, London E11
detailedDescription:
Positioned in the desirable location of Upper Leytonstone, this lovely chain free, two bedroom flat is not only within walking distance of Leytonstone Central Line station and High Road but Leyton Midland Overground also.

Positioned in the desirable location of Upper Leytonstone, this lovely chain free, two bedroom flat is not only within walking distance of Leytonstone Central Line station and High Road but Leyton Midland Overground also.

Set back from the road by the cared-for communal grounds, this purpose-built block is home to only a small number of flats, with this one located on the first floor, which is accessed via security intercom.

Internally, the property has been neutrally decorated throughout allowing for the new owner to furnish the property to their own style. The entrance hall is large enough to allow for storage furniture and there is also a built-in cupboard.

The reception room is of a good size with enough space to include a dining table should you wish and with the large double glazed window the room is bright, airy, and inviting.

The two bedrooms, are of double dimensions and are both positioned to the rear of the property away from the roadside for additional privacy. The fairly new bathroom is fully tiled and includes a bath with shower fitting and a glass shower screen. Finally, the kitchen has an abundance of cupboard space for storage, with room to fit those essential appliances.

Other benefits include gas central heating, double glazing, a shared communal garden with a driveway leading to a secure garage to the rear.

Located close to Epping Forest, with Hollow Ponds boating lake a popular destination especially during the hotter months, also useful for dog walkers, joggers, or a quick kick about with the kids. Also, nearby you have Whipps Cross Hospital the Sir Alfred Hitchcock Hotel. As mentioned Commuters are very well catered for with Leytonstone Central line station within easy walking distance, with links into Stratford, for Westfield and Olympic Park and beyond into London. Road users have quick access to the A12, M11, and M25 plus excellent local bus links.

Owners Comments….
'What initially attracted me to the property was the garden and the location. The large rear garden provided the perfect private spot for many a BBQ and allowed for children to play safely. The location, close to the tube while being in a very nice residential area close to pubs, restaurants and green space was an enjoyable place in which to live. The second major benefit was the fact that the flat has two good size double bedrooms, not a box room. We spent many happy years living in this flat.

To view this property, please get in touch with one of our friendly and helpful property experts.

detailedDescription: Perfectly located on a quiet cul de sac within the desirable Bakers Arms area of Walthamstow, this wonderful two-bedroom first floor Victorian flat offers tremendous kerb appeal from the moment you walk up the path. Just a few of the many benefits include a well-maintained private garden, a bright & spacious living accommodation including a lovely lounge along with a modern fully fitted kitchen and stylish bathroom suite with Turquoise Metro tiles. Call our friendly sales team to book an immediate viewing. Available on a chain free basis.

address: Linnet House, Dunedin Road, London E10
detailedDescription:
Register now to book your viewing!

Two beds starting from £107,500 (Based on 25% of the full market value of £430,000)

Limited parking available.

One of East London’s most sought-after new areas to live, Leyton now has the homes to match these exciting changes. The clean lines and bold brickwork of the exterior draws the eye while mirroring the historic Victorian terraces of the neighbouring streets.

The modern open plan living areas are as stylish as they are comfortable. Wool mix carpet brings a touch of indulgence to the bedrooms, carefully planned to provide the best space, light and storage. Individually designed fully fitted kitchens include a built in oven, hob and extractor. Each apartment also includes fridge freezer, dishwasher and washer drier. Each apartment benefits from a balcony.

Transport

nest E10 is within 10 minutes’ walk from Leyton underground station where the Central Line carries commuters and shoppers into Liverpool Street and the West End in less than 30 minutes. Nearby Stratford International is now a major transport hub with King’s Cross Eurostar just 7 minutes away.

Rather explore the neighbourhood by bike? London Fields and Clapton are less than 20 minutes ride away. Make the most of the transport connections with the new cycle hub at Leyton Underground where you will find Brompton bike hire.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This two bedroom flat on the first floor of a converted Victorian house gives an excellent opportunity for a buyer looking to put their own stamp on a property. Having been owned by the current owners for several years the flat is now in need of full refurbishment and gives good potential for anyone looking to renovate. The rooms are well proportioned and with the Share of Freehold it also could give additional options such as converting the loft (subject to permissions).

The flat is in an excellent location with Leytonstone High Street and a great selection of amenities just moments away at the end of the road. Central Line tube services are within 5 minutes walk at Leytonstone sation, and a few minutes in the other direction brings you out to the open Green Spaces of Wanstead Flats.

Comments from the owner:

Why are you selling?

We are buying a new home.

What do you love about the area?

It's an up-and-coming area with good transport links to central London and close to Westfield Stratford City shopping centre. There are lovely facilities nearby; restaurants, particularly like La Bella Vita, are great friendly options for eating in and take away. For the evenings and weekends there are good pubs and local live music.

detailedDescription:
*guide price £800,000 - £850,000*
Substantial, five bedroom semi detached family home. In exceptional condition and with a rear garden in excess of 100'.
Popular North Chingford location with excellent access to local parks, Forest, school, shopping facilities and tfl 5 transport.

Available to view now, Butler & Stag are delighted to offer this exceptional five bedroom semi detached period family home.

Providing over 1700 SqFt of living accommodation as well as an additional garden room, the property provides superb family living space in a popular North Chingford location.

Offering a bright bay fronted reception room with high ceilings as well as a dining room and fitted kitchen both that flow through to a spectacular conservatory, making the rear of the house a real focal point for family gathering and entertaining.

Upstairs, four well proportioned double bedrooms and a fifth/study give ample space, there is a fitted family bathroom on the first floor and the master bedroom offers en-suite facilities.

Outside space consists of the rear garden that extends in excess of 65' and benefits from a South Westerly aspect and a garden room that makes an ideal home office/studio space. To the front of the property there is off street parking for several vehicles and an integrated single garage.

Endlebury Road is a popular residential street and is well located for local facilities. There are several highly regarded local schools nearby, North Chingford overground (tfl 5) gives convenient access to the City and West End and the area is well served for outdoor activities with several award wining parks, golf courses and Epping Forest nearby.

address: Moreno House, Marlowe Road, Walthamstow, London E17
detailedDescription:
Situated within a 5 minute walk of Wood Street station is this beautifully decorated one bedroom third floor flat. This is a fantastic home offering bright, generously proportioned rooms. This incredibly well-presented home offers 536 square feet of internal space. The main part of the flat is the capacious, open-plan kitchen/diner/lounge with Amtico dusty walnut flooring and charming balcony where you can enjoy a glass of wine at the end of a long day. The master bedroom benefits from a fitted double wardrobe. There is an additional modern fitted bathroom and extra storage in the hallway.

With fast trains to Oxford Circus, and trains to Liverpool Street taking just 17 minutes, it's no wonder that our well-connected east London town of Walthamstow is such a hit with the local community. You're just a half mile walk from the heart of Walthamstow Village, which lives up to its name with plenty of peaceful greenery and historic architecture, not to mention a great selection of award-winning bars, restaurants and gastropubs.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming and characterful one bedroom apartment artfully arranged in the vaulted first floor of a two storey development with allocated parking in Chapel End. Here you're on a tree-lined street near our ever-evolving Wood Street neighbourhood and within easy reach of an array of open green spaces.

The landscaped gardens of Lloyd Park are just six minutes on foot from your front door, ideal for relaxing in nature or reaching Fitbit goals. Head in the other direction to be at Walthamstow Forest in nineteen minutes and pay a visit to the Gypsy Stone which marks the spot where renowned evangelist Rodney 'Gypsy' Smith mbe was born in 1860.

If you lived here

You'll be loving the layout of your 155 square foot living area, its bespoke seating coming with all-important storage underneath and room for dining or home working. It's all wonderfully skylit with views across your leafy street and natural light bouncing off those pristine white walls. The kitchen area's blessed with another skylight, a timber effect suite of cabinets and classic chessboard vinyl underfoot.

Continue through for a bathroom decked out in the same gorgeous chessboard flooring as the kitchen, a pedestal sink and shower over the tub. Lastly, your bedroom's an immaculate and sizeable double of 170 square feet with a wealth of storage, home working area and a cosy nook that's the perfect space for a double bed.

Take the thirteen minute stroll to Wood Street to find an ever-increasing array of independent shops, cafes and bars. Try the handmade Turkish delicacies at family-run Teras or try go-to spot Dudley's for the best coffee in town and buttermilk and honeycomb pancakes out of this world. There's also a thriving vintage market and Wood Street station will get you to Liverpool Street in twenty minutes. Drivers, meanwhile, can be on the North Circular in less than five minutes.

What else?

- For your new local, you can't do better than The Dog & Duck, a wonderful family friendly gourmet pub with brilliant beer garden, just four minutes around the corner. The bus stop outside here will whisk you to a myriad of destinations including Walthamstow Central and Stratford.
- A long lease means you'll have zero renewal hassles.
- Waltham Forest Feel Good Centre is a mere nine minutes' stroll and features a huge range of health and fitness facilities including two pools, athletics track, climbing wall, health suite and much, much more.

Reception Room (2.75m x 5.24m (9'0" x 17'2"))

Kitchen (1.50m x 3.28m (4'11" x 10'9"))

Bathroom

Bedroom (4.66m x 4.35m (15'3" x 14'3"))

A word from the owner...

"i've loved living in this area, taking a quick cycle into Lloyd park or into Epping Forest in just minutes. There are great pubs and breakfast spots close by and a real 'local' and homely feel to the area - whether it's walking up to Walthamstow village, heading down Wood street or visiting one of the (many!) local breweries for a beer - it really does have so much to do!

The flat is warm, cosy and bright, the light is amazing and it's been a sanctuary of peace and safety!"

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Viewings Highly Advised

Guide Price £830,000 - £850,000

Chain-Free Sale

This stunning bright and spacious four bedroom family home in the heart of Leytonstone is now available to buy. This wonderful property flawlessly renovated across all three floors features four bedrooms, two bathrooms, a separate reception room, a spacious kitchen-diner with bifold doors leading to a beautifully landscaped garden ideal for entertaining during the warm summer months. On the ground floor you will find beautiful Herringbone flooring, exposed brick chimney breasts, a Victorian marble fire place and a top of the range kitchen with high end appliances. With no expense spared this property is ideal for buyers looking for a home they can move into and start enjoying right away.

Location

Located on a quite road in Leytonstone and only a five minute walk to Leytonstone Underground Station this property is ideal for commuting to and from central London. You are also a short walk away from Leytonstone Overground Station easing access to the North East of London.

Close by you have amazing cafes, restaurants, pubs and parks including the newly opened Unity Café on the corner of Richmond Road, The Wild Goose Bakery, The Red Lion, Heathcote & Star, Filly Brook and The Birds, as well as an increasingly interesting range of shops and businesses, from books to yoga, and flowers to gifts. Not to mention the great primary and secondary schools in the area which makes it ideal for any family.

You will benefit from being a short walk away from the ever so popular and trendy Francis Road where you have amazing café’s, bookshops, pubs and some great spots for a weekend brunch.

detailedDescription:
This two bedroom Victorian conversion second floor flat is the ideal purchase for a first time buyer or for a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include an open planned kitchen and reception room, is moment away from Walthamstow Village and is being sold on a chain free basis.

This two bedroom Victorian conversion second floor flat is the ideal purchase for a first time buyer or for a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include an open planned kitchen and reception room, is moment away from Walthamstow Village and is being sold on a chain free basis.

The property is situated on the second floor via a communal entrance. You are welcomed by a generously sized landing space which gives access to the open planned reception room and kitchen to the front of the property. The dual aspect room offers the ideal space to entertain friends and family and gives ample room for dining. The second bedroom is next and is bright and spacious, followed by the three piece family bathroom suite. Completing this charming home is the master bedroom to the rear which includes two windows allowing the room to be flooded with natural light. Storage can be located in the bathroom and via the landing.

In terms of locality you are ideally situated a stone's throw away from the iconic Walthamstow Village and Lea Bridge Road where you will find an abundance of local amenities on offer including a selection of bars, restaurants and coffee shops. Walthamstow Central is 1 mile away (20 minute walk) giving access to the Victoria line, whilst Wood Street station is 0.4 miles away (8 minute walk) giving access to the overground.

When it comes to schools you are truly spoiled for choice including Henry Maynard Primary School, St. Mary's C Of E Primary School, Walthamstow School For Girls, and many more to choose from.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £525,000 - £550,000. This three bedroom, single bayed, Victorian style terraced family home is absolutely immaculately presented throughout. Being sold on a chain free basis, the house offers a lovely light and airy lounge, dining room and a fully fitted kitchen to the ground floor. Upstairs, there are three good size bedrooms and a family bathroom. The house has a warm, homely feel throughout and an internal viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate what is on offer here.

detailedDescription:
This two bedroom split level maisonette is the perfect property for a first time buyer or for a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include being refurbished to a high standard throughout, access to a balcony, is situated over two floors and is being sold on a chain free basis.

Guide price £320,000 to £340,000

This two bedroom split level maisonette is the perfect property for a first time buyer or for a buy to let investor looking to add a solid property to their portfolio. Further benefits include being refurbished to a high standard throughout, access to a balcony, is situated over two floors and is being sold on a chain free basis.

The ground floor of the property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with a storage cupboard ideal for storage and is accessed on your right hand side. Next, the kitchen welcomes you on the same side and includes part integrated appliances with space for dining and has been tastefully decorated in keeping with the rest of the property. The reception room is located to the rear of the property and offers the ideal space to entertain friends and family, whilst also giving access to the balcony allowing for outside space. Further to this you will have the added benefit of access to the communal gardens on the development.

The first floor of the property is made up of two double bedrooms which include wall to wall windows allowing for natural light to flood both rooms. Completing this charming property is the three piece family bathroom suite smartly decorated.

In terms of locality, you are ideally situated a stone throw away from Church Road and Lea Bridge road where you will find an abundance of local amenities on offer including a selection of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. Leyton Midland station is 0.9 miles away (15 minute walk) whilst Lea Bridge Road Station is 1.1 mile away (20 minute walk).

When it comes to schools you are truly spoilt for choice including St. Josephs Junior School, George Mitchell Primary School, Riverly Primary School and many more to choose from.

detailedDescription:
Chain-Free Sale

Are you looking for a property that you could transform into your dream home in Leytonstone? Then look no further. This mid terrace Victorian three bedroom family home on Drayton Road with a driveway is now available to buy. On the ground floor the property offers a double reception room, dining room, kitchen, WC, cellar and a garden. On the first floor you will find three double bedrooms and a bathroom.

With high ceilings throughout, orginal Victorin period features and potential to extend subject to planning permmsion, this property is ideal for buyers looking for a home they can add their own stamp on.

Location

Located on Drayton Road and only a five minute walk to Leytonstone Underground Station this property is ideal for commuting to and from central London. You are also a short walk away from Leytonstone Overground Station easing access to the North East of London.

Close by you have amazing cafes, restaurants, pubs and parks including the newly opened Unity Café on the corner of Richmond Road, The Wild Goose Bakery, The Red Lion, Heathcote & Star, Filly Brook and The Birds, as well as an increasingly interesting range of shops and businesses, from books to yoga, and flowers to gifts. Not to mention the great primary and secondary schools in the area which makes it ideal for any family.

You will benefit from being a short walk away from the ever so popular and trendy Francis Road where you have amazing café’s, bookshops, pubs and some great spots for a weekend brunch.
