detailedDescription:
This five bedroom mid terrace house is situated over three floors and offers families a wealth of living space throughout. Further benefits include a through lounge, a brick built summer house with electricity in the garden, has three toilets and is situated moments away from Lea Bridge Road amenities.

***Sincere Property Services are still operating at full capacity and we are doing all we can to ensure the home buying process is safe for all clients and vendors. Full safety protocols will be followed on all viewings. Please call us for more information on this. As we know these are hard times for everyone, we are offering an out of hours service whereby you can contact justin the sales manager directly between the hours of 8AM to 10PM. Please call the office for more information. We are open for whatsapp messages, calls and video calls whatever suits your needs best. All properties have virtual tours so you can safely and remotely view the properties which are all available on rightmove. Please stay safe during these times and take care***

This five bedroom mid terrace house is situated over three floors and offers families a wealth of living space throughout. Further benefits include a through lounge, a brick built summer house with electricity in the garden, has three toilets and is situated moments away from Lea Bridge Road amenities.

The ground floor of the property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with the through lounge situated to the right hand side. The through lounge includes the bay window flooding the room with natural light and giving more usable space. The ground floor toilet is accessed via the hallway and is ideal for when guests come over. The kitchen diner is located to the rear and gives access to the garden which is paved over allowing for little maintenance. The brick built summer house includes full electrics and can be used for storage or as a stylish home office.

The first floor of the property is made up of three generously proportioned bedrooms with the master bedroom including the bay window. Completing the first floor is the three piece family bathroom. The second floor consists of two bedrooms and a three piece shower room which completes this charming family home.

In terms of locality you are situated a stone's throw away from Lea Bridge Road which offers an abundance of local amenities including a selection of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. Lea Bridge Road station is 0.3 miles away (5 minute walk) whilst Leyton Midland station and Walthamstow Central station are both within walking or driving distance.

In terms of schools you are truly spoilt for choice including Lammas School, Willow Brook Primary School, Riverley Primary School, Clapton Girls Academy and many more.

detailedDescription:
Situated over three floors is this wonderful four bedroom period family home which has been beautifully decorated throughout. On the ground floor you will find a large bay fronted lounge with doors that open on to the contemporary extended fitted kitchen/dining room that certainly seems to be the heart of the home where many a family meal can be cooked and enjoyed. Outside there is a tranquil 40ft rear garden. On the first floor you will find the stylish fitted family bathroom and two double bedrooms, whilst on the second floor there are two further bedrooms and a shower room. Throughout this house it feels modern, spacious and bright. Beyond that as soon as you walk through the door there is a fantastic feeling of home.

There are terrific restaurants and a multi-screen cinema in the scene, only a ten-minute walk away. And of course, don’t forget Walthamstow Village, which is just a hop, skip and a jump away too. If you work in the City then that long commute in and out of London can be a thing of the past, as you are spoilt for choice for stations with walthamstow central and Queens Road stations within reach.

detailedDescription:
*rare opportunity in sought-after conversion*
This bright and airy one-bedroom flat is located on the first floor of a stunning warehouse conversion in a highly desirable area moments from Walthamstow Central and the picturesque Walthamstow Village. The property boasts many original features, including wooden floors and huge Crittall windows, which have been recently renovated and fitted with bespoke shutters and blinds.

The apartment is flooded with light, and offers a spacious, high-ceilinged living room, plus a fitted kitchen, large double bedroom and a bathroom. There is also the rare advantage of secure gated parking with an allocated space, as well as the added benefit of a shared garden to the rear of the property. A new oven and a boiler with a ten-year warranty have been installed within the last six months.

The current owners say: “We've loved living here, and will be sad to say goodbye to our gorgeous, light-filled flat, friendly neighbours and peaceful corner of Walthamstow. We’ve become used to having the Village’s boutiques and bustling atmosphere, God's Own Junkyard, the farmers' markets, Walthamstow Sunday Social, and cosy pubs, right on our doorstep. We're selling our flat because we’re moving out of London, but this has been the ideal, characterful home from which to explore everything the local area and the capital have to offer.”

Location

Walthamstow has recently been named one of London’s six best places to live by The Sunday Times, and the flat lies within a conservation area on a popular no-through-road on the edge of Walthamstow Village and its artisan shops, restaurants, and gastro pubs. The Sunday Times also praised the area’s outstanding schools, its multicultural food scene, and the stunning Wetlands.

Walthamstow Central station is less than a five-minute walk away, providing excellent transport links to Central London via the Victoria Line Underground, and the Overground service to London Liverpool Street. Viewings can be flexibly booked 24 hours a day, and an internal viewing is highly recommended.

Approximate Information: Share of freehold - 992 years remaining on current lease

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful development of stylish mews houses on Coopers Lane & Elizabeth Mews. Each home has it’s own private garden, but is also set around a communal garden area, designed to increase opportunities for social interaction and engagement. As such they are absolutely ideal for those looking to buy a future proof home for their growing family.

Each of the six houses which make up this new development is presented to the very highest of standards. Externally the properties are finished in Black Bassalte brick to the ground floor, with Canadian Western Red Cedar timber. Internally you’ll find (amongst other things), engineered oak flooring with underfloor heating, low energy recessed downlights and video entry phone system. The kitchens feature high gloss units, quartz worktops and integrated smeg appliances, whilst the bathrooms have underfloor heating, a Kaldewei steel bath and ceramic flooring and wall tiling.

This particular property is a four bedroom detached house and makes for the ideal home for owner occupiers looking for something speacial. It stretches to over 1100 square feet across two floors, with a ground floor cloakroom and a first floor family bathroom, in addition to the en suite shower room off the principal bedroom. The ground floor has a largely open plan feel, with the rooms seamlessly flowing into each other and swathes of natural light leading to a private garden. It also has a communal courtyard garden for all owners to interact, as well as a fantastic first floor balcony.

Living Here...

Following the gentrification footsteps of Islington and Hackney, Leyton is now a desirable enclave for a new generation of young professionals and families who are attracted to the town by its rising cultural status and its cosmopolitan atmosphere of vibrant shopping streets buzzing with bars, restaurants, independent coffee shops, and fascinating boutiques. Stratford station is easily accessible with its major multi-level interchange operating services across the Capital including Crossrail from 2019. The legacy of Olympic 2012 is deceptively close with its superlative sporting facilities, London’s finest shopping malls, and fabulous eateries. The generous open spaces of the local parks are aplenty - from of ancient woodland of Epping Forest to the cycle paths along the River Lea of Walthamstow Wetlands are all within 15 minute’s drive away.

In This Area...

Leyton is home to the only shop that can be seen from space. Ok, that's not entirely true, but the carnival shop on the High Road is definitely bright. There's no way you'll miss this multi coloured wonder, it looks like it's made of Lego. The shop sits opposite Coronation Gardens, a beautiful park with a little maze, pond and fountain. The High Road is also home to the Leyton Technical, a lovely pub that occupies the ground floor of the old town hall. It has good beer, good food, and the longest walk to the toilet you'll ever find. If you like beer, Leyton is the place for you, as both Brodie's Beers and Signature Brew (voted UK Brewery Business of the Year 2018) are based in E10. Sidmouth Park, just behind the carnival shop, is a hit with kids as there's loads of stuff to play on. If you are hungry or thirsty, wander to Francis Road and you'll find a bucket load of nice cafes, including Yardarm, Marmelo Kitchen, and Albert & Francis, as well as an increasingly interesting range of shops and businesses, from books to yoga, and flowers to gifts. There’s even a friendly estate agency there...

detailedDescription:
A terrific two bedroom apartment, bursting with character and with breathtaking Epping Forest views. On the first floor of an impeccable period property, with no less than two balconies and over 700 square foot of living space plus loft, this is a splendid and unusual property in a superlative spot.

This Leytonstone location couldn't be better for anyone who needs that sense of being close to nature. You'll look out every day over Leyton Flats, an expanse of greenery home to the serene Hollow Ponds and Eagle Pond, all a haven for dogwalkers and birders. Any time you want to get away from it all, you can just pop across the road and find yourself a new walking route across the flats or through the woodland.

If you lived here

You'll step into your hallway and turn left into your lounge diner. It's a spectacular 300 square foot, with a huge curved bow window. Stripped boards lie underfoot. To the left is your kitchen of over 115 square foot, with a wealth of cream units topped by dark worktops and a chunky gas hob. A door takes you out onto your first veranda-like balcony, the perfect place to sit and take in the gorgeous view.

Back through your hallway you'll find your bathroom to the left. It's fully tiled in sandy shades, with a modern white suite and shower over the tub. Next is your first bedroom, almost 110 square foot of space with soft carpet underfoot. French doors open onto your second balcony. Lastly there's your second bright bedroom, a similar size, with more pale pine hardwood underfoot.

You're less than a mile on foot from leafy Wanstead, and ten minutes' walk from charming central Leytonstone, full of great pubs and lovely cafes. The Leytonstone Festival happens once a year and offers an unrivalled programme of arts and music. Fifteen minutes on foot takes you to Leytonstone Underground, where the Central Line will see you to Stratford in seven minutes and Liverpool Street in seventeen.

What else?

- Drivers will be pleased to find there's a car park here, as well being moments from the A12, making it easier to get around the city or out of town.
- Your new local is the hidden gem The North Star, with a fascinating history and a delicious Thai menu as well as a superb range of craft beers.
- Whenever you feel like seeing the world from the water, you can hire a row boat on Hollow Ponds.

A word from the owner....

"We have loved living at Forest Lodge, every day we have enjoyed green views of Hollow Ponds from our front balcony, and then the afternoon sun from the rear balcony. The house is really well situated and a short walk from Leytonstone station, Wanstead High Street and we are right on top of the forest and the flats.

During lockdown use of our mature garden, the access to nature and the community spirit has been a real support and gave use tremendous enjoyment. We will miss living here!"

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful two bedroom split level conversion flat. The property is being sold with an extended lease of 163 years remaining as well as sole use of the front garden. You are greeted at the property by a well maintained full paved front garden that gives access to the main front door. Your own front leads directly into the entrance hall that gives access to the first floor. The spacious and bright first floor landing gives access to firstly a generous lounge located to the front of the property. The lounge benefits from laminate flooring that is only seven years old as well as gorgeous tailor made shutters that were only installed last year. The first large double bedroom is also located on the first floor to the rear of the property and also benefits from a sizeable rear window that floods the room with natural light. The first floor landing then gives access to a u shaped staircase that leads to the second floor. The second floor consists of a large kitchen/diner that benefits from two generously sized windows that really brightens this fantastic space. A second double bedroom is also accessible from the second floor landing and a three piece family bathroom completes the property. A brand new roof was fitted to the property just six years ago as well as the kitchen being fully updated just four years ago. This property is located on St John's Road and has easy access to Chestnuts playing fields that are located just behind the Waltham Forest council building. This location also gives great access to Wood Street which combines Wood Street Station as well as the very popular Wood Street shopping parade which consists of shops, pubs and restaurants as well as an indoor Georgian market.

detailedDescription:
Rare to the market is this double fronted 4 bedroom detached house which is located in popular Landscape Road and is ideal family home. A short walk to Woodford Station, open green spaces and popular schools. Offers an attractive wrap around garden and off street parking

Guide Price £750,000 - £800,000

This unique double frontage family house is located in this premier part of Woodford Green and is set in popular Landscape Road.

The house is full of charm and has been well maintained by its current owners. As soon as you set foot in the property it offers a friendly and warm welcoming feel.

The property offers many features including a log burner in the lounge which creates a lovely atmosphere and a perfect place to relax with the whole family. The property offers good size accomadtion with its 25ft which is split into a sociable sitting room and dining area, fully-fitted kitchen, second reception room and ground floor W.C.
The first floor has 4 bedrooms and a modern family bathroom.

The landscaped garden has been very well maintained with artificial lawn and patio area, where you can enjoy BBQs and the summer sun. There is a raised decking area with seating and shelter which is perfect for entertaining.

The property offers the best of both worlds, being on the cusp of amazing open green spaces, whilst at the same time having all that Woodford has to offer on its doorstep.
The property also benefits from having a car port and off street parking.

Landscape is a sought after location which is perfect for commuters who travel into London via the Central Line. Woodford station is only a few minutes' walk and goes directly into Liverpool Street (20mins) and the West End (27 mins). Also close by are the array of restaurants, independent shops and supermarkets on The Broadway, and other local amenities.

A few words from the owner...………
Living at 12 Landscape Road the past 6 years has been an absolute pleasure for us as a family. The location of our home has allowed our children to attend the highly sought after Churchfields Infants and Junior school. Not only did we have the option of them attending Churchfields, but we also had the option of other outstanding primary and secondary schools.
The community and great relationships with our neighbours have been the perfect complement to the quiet road the house faces on to as it has allowed the kids to cycle and play outside with freedom and peace of mind.
And last but not least the actual house, we have loved living here as the house has various living spaces - a wonderful log burner that forms part of many a family night, a kitchen that allows for great cooking and company, and a garden that supports our love for the outdoors and all kinds of sport. We hope the next owners will be just as happy as we were.

detailedDescription:
A capacious four bedroom terraced house on Pretoria Road.

This extended property offers over 1000 square feet of space, spread across three floors. The ground floor comprises two reception rooms, kitchen and bathroom. The receptions are configured as lounge and dining room, and both have café style shutters at the windows and beautiful parquet flooring underfoot. Directly behind the dining room is the kitchen. It is galley in layout, with modern fitted units ranged in parallel along two walls. It in turn leads to the family bathroom, which is fully tiled and features a three piece suite including shower over the tub.

The first floor houses three bedrooms and a WC. Each of the bedrooms is well proportioned and presented, with the largest stretching across the full width of the front of the property and, like the lounge below, benefitting from a bay window.

The second floor loft extension contains the principal bedroom suite. It comprises a dual aspect double bedroom and an en suite shower room.

Outside, there is a private garden to the rear, featuring a low maintenance artificial lawn and raised planting at the far end.

Living Here...

This part of E10 is a great place to live, and not just because of your friendly, neighbourhood estate agents on Francis Road! There is so much to see and do, particularly at weekends, that you will never be at a loss for options. How about dinner on Saturday night at Marmelo on Francis Road, followed by a couple of drinks at your local, the Heathcote & Star? Or maybe start at the Northcote (the pizzas there are amazing), and then head down to the Leyton Technical, Leyton Star or Coach & Horses afterwards. On a Sunday it has to be The Royal on the High Road for a hangover curing breakfast (egg and mushrooms on toast for us please!), followed by a stroll around Coronation Gardens to walk it off (that’s if you aren’t heading over to Westfield for some retail therapy). At lunchtime it’s a hop, skip and a jump up to the Heathcote & Star for a knockout Sunday roast, after which you will welcome the chance to relax with the Sunday paper in Yardarm’s garden, happy in the knowledge that you live an amazing part of East London…

detailedDescription:
2 bedroom apartment now available for £123,750 in Walthamstow!

Available to purchase with Shared Ownership, buyers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

2 bedroom 3rd floor apartment offering 71.7 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.

£123,750 for a 25% share of £495,000 and a deposit as low as £6,187 and a minimum income of £66,300.

The Chain
Walthamstow is seeing an unprecedented rate of growth and investment into the town centre and surrounding areas. Waltham Forest's residents and businesses stand to benefit significantly from the economic growth taking place across London. The boroughs well-connected location in the east of London, the cultural heart of the capital, along with its unique identity founded in cultural heritage, its burgeoning arts and creative industries, and abundant green spaces all contribute towards the urban vibrancy that makes Waltham Forest a special place to live. In relative terms, Waltham Forest is now growing faster than any other borough in London. In the last five years the number of jobs in the borough has increased by 30 per cent (the highest in London) and the number of businesses by 40 per cent (the sixth highest increase in London). This in part is due to the significant effect of investment in Olympic legacy projects but also in the overall growth in London and the movement of the capitals economic activity eastwards.

Walthamstow Connections
The Chain is perfectly positioned, close to three train stations with excellent transport links. More green space to walk, run, or cycle than any other part of London. Located near South Grove, The Chain is just a 10 minute walk to Walthamstow Central where you'll find shops, bars and restaurants as well as your favourite retailers within The Mall shopping centre. Walthamstow Leisure centre is an 8 minute walk from The Chain, or just a 3 minute bus journey and offers a 68-station gym, 6 Badminton courts, 2 Squash courts, an Ofsted registered crèche, 5-a-side red-crumb football pitch, a studio and gymnasium.

Dimensions
Living/Kitchen/Dining Room 5.12m x 4.81m 16'9" x 15'9"
Master Bedroom 4.06m x 3.25m 13'4" x 10'8"
Bedroom 2 3.84m x 3.49m 12'7" x 11'5"
Balcony 7.2 sq m 77.5 sq ft
Total 71.7 sq m 772 sq ft

What is Shared Ownership?
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don't own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%. Household incomes are based on joint applications. Single applications are able to apply but may need to increase their deposit contribution to meet shared ownership affordability requirements.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented 3 bedroom house that has been fully refurbished throughout, set in a quiet location within minutes of the amenities of Chingford Hatch.
The house has a stylish contemporary feel throughout and has been extended to the rear and also into the loft.
Accommodation on the ground floor includes a spacious reception room, shower room and versatile home office/fourth bedroom and a stunning fully integrated kitchen with quality appliances. From here you can access the private rear garden.
On the first floor there is the master bedroom and bedroom two and a luxuriously appointed three piece bathroom, then take the stairs to the converted loft space which would make an ideal children's playroom or occasional guest bedroom.

The property falls into the catchment area of several good schools including Longshaw Primary and Heathcote Secondary school.

Multiple bus routes are available from nearby Hatch Lane, while the nearest stations are Highams park and Chingford (overground rail) for easy access into Walthamstow central (Victoria Line) and London's Liverpool Street in around 25 minutes, while the wide open spaces of Epping Forest are minutes from your door.

detailedDescription:
A uniquely charming one bedroom apartment on the ground floor of an end terrace conversion, in the sought after Chapel End neighbourhood. With the added bonus of a dedicated entrance and a secluded garden, together with generous living space and great location, this is the whole package.

You're on a quiet street a fifteen minute walk from Walthamstow's favourite green space of Lloyd Park. Even closer is Epping Forest, just eleven minutes from your door. It's fifteen minutes on foot to the Village too. It's only a mile and a half to the North Circular for easy navigation around the city, and a half-mile stroll takes you to buzzing Wood Street.

If you lived here…

You'll step inside directly via your secluded rear garden, home to an expanse of low-maintenance paving and a pleasing lawn. A glass door to the right leads straight into your reception and one on the left takes you into your kitchen. It's sixty foot of bright space, with white units and stylish dark grey tiled backsplash. Next is your airy bathroom, half tiled in a sandy shade, with modern white suite, a shower over the tub and a double mirror cabinet sitting above a vanity sink.

The hallway takes you into your reception of close to 180 square foot. Engineered flooring lies underfoot and there's a pleasing cream/ivory fireplace providing a focal point among the bright white walls. Lastly there's your bedroom, almost 140 square foot to relax in, with a dove grey feature wall more immaculate engineered flooring, and lots of natural light.

You're just over a mile from Walthamstow Central here, where the superfast Victoria Line will take you to Kings Cross in around fifteen minutes, or the Overground will whizz you across the marshes to Liverpool Street in twenty. Everything you need day to day is close at hand, from essential amenities to one-off independent shops.

What else?

- Your new local is The Bell, an impressive crossroads gastropub with a friendly welcome and plenty of space inside and out to relax with a pint.
- Indulge your burger craving by stopping by Buns, six minutes away on Forest Road.
- A seventeen minute stroll takes you to famous local attraction God's Own Junkyard, a neon workshop and gallery with cafe bar that's a feast for all the senses.

A word from the owner....

"The house is perfect for BBQs with friends, specially during the summer days. And really warm and cosy over the winter. Epping forest is at walking distance, and around the corner you have the Village and also Lloyds park, with an amazing food market on Saturday that I really recommend."

detailedDescription:
Ideal for first-time buyers and investors alike this lovely two-bedroom Victorian Conversion flat is now ready to view.
Stylish, bright, spacious and well maintained throughout by the current owners, the property benefits of an inviting large reception room, a larger than the average double bedroom, an additional second good size bedroom currently used as an office, a contemporary bathroom and a modern fitted kitchen.
Additional benefits include the allocated parking space, a true rarity for those living in Leytonstone.

A word from the owners..
‘We love the high ceilings and the big bay windows which mean the flat is always full of light. We love watching sunsets from the big kitchen window. An additional room has given us plenty of space for working during covid, as well as acting as a gaming den in the evening. The area has an abundance of great pubs and restaurants. We loved hosting our birthday party at the nearby Heathcoat & Star, currently also serving amazing Thai food. In the summer we spend days walking around Hollow ponds and Wanstead flat which are local.’

Additional info:
Lease remaining- 89 years left.
Service Charge - agreed as hoc with other residents. Over last 2 years we have spent about £1500 on this.
Ground Rent - £75 per year.

Location

Location

Kingswood Road is ideally located in the sought-after Upper Leytonstone, just a short stroll from Leytonstone Tube Station perfect for those commuting to Central London.
It is also conveniently located for easy access to major roads such as the A12 providing links to central London locations including Stratford, Canary Wharf and City of London as well as the UK’s major motorway network such as nearby access to the M11 and M25.
In recent years Leytonstone has become a popular and trendy area, with an ever-increasing selection of popular restaurants, independents cafes and grocery stores, offering a variety of options for dining out as well as shopping. In addition, for those loving green spaces Epping Forest and Wanstead Flats offer the perfect area for sports, long walks and picnics.

detailedDescription: This immaculate four bedroom, Victorian family home offers a wealth of period features balanced with a contemporary finish for modern family living. The property is ideally nestled on a quiet, residential street and yet is within walking distance of the Woodford High Road, Broadway amenities and underground station. The ground floor comprises of a bright and airy hallway leading onto the lounge⁄dining room awash with natural light and oozing features from the bay window and period fireplace with slate hearth to the high ceilings. Further down the hallway leads to the wonderful kitchen with space for casual dining with a back door leading to the rear garden. The first floor offers three double bedrooms with the original master bedroom spanning the width of the house as well as benefiting from a built in wardrobe, and a family bathroom. The second floor is home to the impressive master bedroom with a bespoke walk-in wardrobe leading to a shower room benefiting underfloor heating and walk-in rainwater shower. This impressive home further boasts a charming front garden with restored quarry tiled pathway and a paved patio in the rear garden ideal for entertaining, leading to a raised lawn. With Woodford Central Line Station only a short walk away and parents being well catered for with outstanding schools close by as well as the beautiful area with forests, lakes, country parks and open green spaces this really is a charming home ready for its next family.

detailedDescription:
Investment opportunity

Two existing large four bedroom apartments with approved planning to create a third two bed two bath dwelling.

Planning

Full planning has been granted by Waltham Forest Council for the construction of a mansard roof extension with six front and four rear dormer windows to create a third floor providing a 2 bedroom self- contained flat (Class C3).

Vacant

Tenure
The apartments are both sold with a 200 year lease.

Location
The development is located on the eastern side of High Road Leytonstone in the London Borough of Waltham Forest. 744-746 High Road is part of a terrace building of four units (742 to 748 High Road), which is positioned between Browning Road and an existing private access road immediately north of 748 High Road and around to the rear on the building.

Leytonstone High Road is a rapidly developing and the building is situated within the desirable Bushwood area. The property is less than half a mile from Leytonstone Station and is close to a variety of amenities.

Further details available upon request.

Like much of East London, Leytonstone has great transport links with the city and central London. Liverpool Street is just 14 minutes away, and you can reach Tottenham Court Road in less than 25.

The High Road has plenty of shops, cafes, bakeries and boutiques within easy reach. You also have the impressive bustle of one of the largest shopping centres in Europe - Westfield Stratford, just down the road.

Housing stock is mostly sturdy Edwardian or Victorian terraces, developed over time to provide a wide range of houses and apartments. There's a strong sense of community in this creative and evolving area.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £875,000 to £925,000. Flanked on all sides by green open spaces, we're pleased to present this generously sized semi-detached, four-bedroom house for sale in Wanstead, E11. This spacious property comes with off-street parking for two cars, a good sized rear garden and is offered with no onward chain.

Guide price £875,000 to £925,000. Flanked on all sides by green open spaces, we're pleased to present this generously sized semi-detached, four-bedroom house for sale in Wanstead, E11. This spacious property comes with off-street parking for two cars, a good sized rear garden and is offered with no onward chain.

This substantial four bed property is perfectly positioned on an idyllic, tree-lined residential road, and offers the ideal opportunity for those looking to enjoy the East End suburbs in a property that has plenty of scope for modernisation – allowing you to turn this fantastic house into a wonderful home to suit your individual needs.

As you pull up to the property its curb appeal is instantly apparent, set back from the road by a large private driveway with its beautiful Victorian architecture taking centre-stage.

Once inside, the entrance hall offers a welcoming space leading straight to the sweeping staircase with decorative banisters that adds a real sense of grandeur. To the left you'll see the first reception room laying to the front of the property – with its characteristic wooden floorboards running throughout the ground floor.

This reception room is not just a great family-sized space, but it also includes some attractive additional features such as a ceiling rose, a traditional fireplace with in-built shelving to the alcoves either side, and a large bay window, drawing in plenty of natural light.

Head back to the hallway and turn left and you'll note a large storage cupboard to your left hand side, and the second reception room up ahead. With the adjoining kitchen to the rear, this would make an impressive dining room and entertaining space, stretching the full width of the property and also featuring a traditional-styled fireplace.

Facing the rear of the property, this room offers access to both the kitchen and the large conservatory - both overlooking the back garden - and these two rooms are also joined by another door for additional convenience and a fantastic flow throughout.

The kitchen is a lovely size with a nice, bright and open layout to make cooking those meals a breeze and offers plenty of storage space with ample room for all the essential appliances, plus views out to the extensive rear garden.

The adjoining conservatory is another generously sized room, with its bay window/door combination suffusing the space with light which feeds right into the rear reception room thanks to the double doors and surrounding windows. The perfect place to enjoy your morning coffee or watch the birds on a lazy Sunday afternoon.

To complete the ground floor, there's also a handy downstairs WC with sink, plus access to the large basement which is already laid out as a very useful additional storage space.

The garden is mainly laid to lawn with fencing to all sides and features a patio area - perfect for enjoying the sun during warmer months - and also includes two sheds at the rear. There's gated access to the side of the property and the new owners will also benefit from the real sense of privacy offered by this outdoor space with bags of potential.

Moving up the stairs to the first floor, you'll find three bedrooms all of plentiful proportions. The main bedroom positioned to the front of the property features two built-in wardrobes and a bay window, with the similarly sized rear room next door offering a window overlooking the garden and another useful built-in wardrobe.

Next to this is a slightly smaller room, also overlooking the rear and with an integrated cupboard and opposite. Across the landing you'll find the spacious family bathroom which boasts a double shower unit, a separate bath, WC, sink with under-cupboard and built in shelves.

A further staircase takes you to the loft extension – a lovely private and fully functional part of this gorgeous property, complete with another large bedroom plus a four-piece shower room. The bedroom has a dormer style window at the rear offering full headroom, plus a smaller, low Velux window to the front.

Windsor Road is a wonderful, peaceful residential street with the added advantage of being located nearby to an abundance of expansive green open spaces such as Wanstead Park, Wanstead Flats, and Bush Wood. Leytonstone High Road, including its Central Line Station is within walking distance, as is Wanstead High Street – both of which offer a great mix of restaurants, pubs, and cafes for socialising and meeting with friends and family. In addition to the nearby rail and tube stations, the area is also serviced by frequent bus routes – excellent news for commuters.

To view this property, please contact a member of our friendly and helpful sales team.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly magnificent four bedroom, two bathroom Victorian end terrace house, on the sought after Church Hill just moments from Walthamstow Village. With brick frontage, bay windows, an encircling garden and original features enhanced by a modern finish, this is a fabulously comfortable family home.

The indoor living space is very generous, with each bedroom a sizeable double set in an eminently practical layout. Outside you'll find over 800 square foot of private green space to the side and front, with a gate connecting the two. You can choose to keep it low-maintenance or stretch your green fingers – your family is bound to love spending time there in any case.

If you lived here…

You'll walk through your front garden and step into your hallway, see the staircase ahead and turn left into your reception. It's a perfect size at 175 square foot, with bay window to the front and stripped floorboards underfoot. Cornicing runs around the ceiling, and a marvellous black cast iron fireplace draws the eye without dominating.

Through from here is your kitchen/diner of almost 150 square foot. There's plenty of pine toned units, a white tiled backsplash and gas hob. There would still be space for an island and dining table if you so chose. French doors open from here onto your glorious garden, with patio giving way to lush lawn – a versatile outdoor space for playing, dining or entertaining.

Up the stairs to the first floor, you'll find two bedrooms and the first of your two bathrooms. Your first bedroom is almost 150 square foot, with cool blue walls and stripped boards underfoot. Your second bedroom to the front is over 170 square foot, with bay window, another grand cast iron fireplace and more beautiful original floorboards.

Your bathroom is next along, with traditional white suite, shower over the tub, and dark turquoise walls complemented by white metro tiling. Up the stairs again are your third and fourth bedrooms, each offering 150 square foot of space with carpet underfoot, and your shower room with traditional white suite.

You're in a superlative position, perfectly placed for everything Walthamstow has to offer. Fewer than five minutes on foot and you're in the peaceful Village, surrounded by the oldest buildings in the area and with an amazing choice of shops and eateries. You're also just a seven minute walk from the Underground and Overground, from where you can be at Kings Cross or Liverpool Street in as little as quarter of an hour.

What else?

- Schools rated as 'Outstanding' by Ofsted near your new home include Walthamstow School for Girls just around the corner, Greenleaf Primary and St Mary's Primary.
- Your new local is The Nags Head, a unique cat-friendly pub with a glorious fairy-lit beer garden and live music every Sunday.
- You're just over a mile from Leyton Flats and the serene Hollow Ponds, perfect for a weekend ramble.

title: 5 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A brilliantly bright and spacious one bedroom apartment, cutting edge and on trend in both style and execution, with high end designer fixtures, fittings and features throughout. It's all part of a modern development with the amenities of Chingford Mount and Highams Park station all within easy reach.

You have an immaculate private patio garden, filling your bedroom with light and the perfect secluded spot for morning coffee or an evening glass of wine.

If you lived here…

You'll be enjoying contemporary department, living at its most generous and stylish – between the floods of natural light, generous square footage and double height ceilings this is an unexpectedly expansive property, with a wealth of sociable space. Your immaculate lounge/kitchen comes in at over 250 square feet, with underfloor heating and Smeg appliances artfully integrated into the sleek bespoke cabinetry, with Artemistone Quartz worktops.

Engineered oak hardwood runs underfoot, pale grey to accentuate the natural light, while elsewhere you have an indispensable utility room perfect for laundry or simply storage. Elsewhere your bedroom's a substantial double of 150 square feet, elegantly appointed in soft bright tones with a view of your courtyard. Finally your bathroom is as exquisite as you'd expect, finished in large format tiling from floor to ceiling.

Outside and the open green spaces of Memorial Park are all less than five minutes from your front door, perfect for morning jogs and evening strolls. A short hop past the park is Chingford Mount, your local crossroads and social hub packed with all the amenities, supermarkets cafes and restaurants you could want. In the mood to strike out further? Riverside strolls along the River Lea are just twenty minutes away on foot.

What else?
- Two wheel enthusiasts will be pleased to discover the development's secure bike storage facilities
- Highams Park station is around a fifteen minute walk (or five minute cycle) and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in twenty three minutes. Alternatively, Walthamstow Central is five minutes and one stop down, for a quick switch onto the speedy Victoria tube line.
- Communal areas are well maintained and the development features a gated entrance, CCTV and a secure video entryphone system.

detailedDescription:
This stunning home is well presented and finished to a high standard throughout. The home benefits from an open plan layout with a spacious and bright living area, great for spending quality time with friends and family. The kitchen area is modern and highly functional, with base and wall mounted units and integrated hob, oven, fridge freezer, and extractor fan.
The home has a spacious double bedroom with plenty of natural light from large, full-height windows and a bespoke built in fitted warddrobe. The shower room is modern and consists of a three-piece suite with a walk-in shower.
Wood laminate flooring, double glazing, and modern insulation throughout the home keep the running costs low and the heat in.
The options for entertaining are further enhanced by the private decked area, perfect for enjoying those warm summer evenings.

The home also benefits from communal gardens as well as ample bike storage and has excellent transport links with Blackhorse Road, Walthamstow Central, and St James St stations just a ten-minute walk around the corner. There are a wide array of local amenities close by including shops, a cinema, galleries, and museums as well as vast open green spaces close-by.

The four-story innovative and award-nominated development was designed by Gort Scott for Pocket Living, with this particular flat featuring in the Architects' Journal, Architecture Today, and other press.

The purchaser for this home must reside or be employed within the London Borough of Waltham Forest, not be a current homeowner and have a household income below the London Plan upper limit as set by the Mayor of London (currently £90,000 per annum).

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity has arisen to acquire this substantial end of terrace residence in Upper Walthamstow. Located on this quiet residential street, and boasting extended accommodation, it is easy to see why this one will not hang around for long. Castleton Road is wonderfully placed for Epping Forest, whilst transport links are plentiful with Wood Street and Highams Park along with South Woodford all connecting you to various parts of the city in a matter of minutes. If you prefer to drive the M11, A12, A13 and A406 are all readily available.

Whether it be the amazing second floor master suite with a walk in wardrobe/dressing room and modern family bathroom, or the bright and spacious ground floor kitchen extension, no expense has been spared to create this amazing contemporary style family home. With bi-fold doors to the rear and a skylights, the kitchen floods with natural light, making it an ideal entertaining space which overlooks the 54ft rear garden. The first floor comprises of three good sized bedrooms and a family bathroom whilst the top floor offers the master bedroom with en-shower room.

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful three bedroom split level maisonette, The property is being sold on a chain free basis and is only a three minute walk to Wood Street Station. You are greeted at the property by large communal gardens ideal for multitudes of leisure activities. The communal entrance benefits from a phone entry system for added security. As you enter the property you are welcomed into a spacious entrance hall. The sizeable lounge/diner is the first room accessible from the lounge and benefits from laminate flooring as well as a large east facing window that floods the room with early morning sunlight. The next room off of the entrance hall is the ground floor w/c. The final room accessible from the entrance hall is the fully fitted kitchen. The double aspect kitchen was update roughly seven years ago and also gives access to the full length balcony. Back inside the property and up the stairs you are presented with a first floor landing. The landing gives access to three double bedrooms as well as the family bathroom. The property is fully double glazed and in good condition that would allow you to move in straight away. The property is situated a stone's throw away from Wood Street Station, and the very popular Wood Street shopping parade which consists of shops, pubs and restaurants as well as an indoor Georgian market. The property is ideal for a young couple looking to start a family or even an investor as the location will guarantee a decent yield. Do not miss out on the opportunity to view this fantastic property.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price: £575,000 - £600,000. A spacious three bedroom mid-terrace house on Pentire Road.

This family home has already been extended to the rear to create a sizeable family home, and it could be further extended into the loft if you wished (subject to the usual consents and permissions). The ground floor comprises lounge/diner, second reception, kitchen and WC. The lounge/diner is over 26 feet in length, with polished tiled flooring. It’s a multi-functional space, easily able to accommodate family and friends, whether for dinner or simply relaxing. The second reception is the perfect TV snug and, like the lounge diner, leads onto the kitchen. That latter room has swathes of fitted units and offers uninterrupted views of the rear garden.

The three bedrooms on the first floor are all well proportioned and presented, whilst the family bathroom is fully tiled and has a three piece suite.

The rear garden is mostly laid to lawn, and has a large outbuilding at the far end.

Living Here...

The location of this property is ideal, whether for work or play. Equidistant between Wood Street and Highams Park stations, and with the A406 easily accessible, the daily commute should be a doddle, whether by car or train. However, all work and no play is never a recipe for happiness, and fortunately there’s plenty to keep you occupied locally. Take a stroll over to Wood Street and sample the burgers at The Duke, or grab a pizza at Marilucia. Head in the opposite direction and Highams Park is rapidly changing - check out the old cinema (hopefully soon to be refurbished), before sampling a glass of something delicious at Vinoramica – the selection is always fab. If you have a canine member of your household (or enjoy splashing through the mud on your mountain bike), then Epping Forest is right on your doorstep.

detailedDescription:
This wonderful terraced Victorian property is situated in one of Walthamstow’s most popular areas with a great local community. If you're looking for a charming home with plenty of space that you can move straight into, this is the one for you. This four bedroom family size terraced property features an open plan lounge/dining room and an extended modern fitted kitchen/breakfast room that overlooks the charming 30ft rear garden. On the first floor you'll find a spacious fitted bathroom and two double bedrooms. On the second floor are two further bedrooms and a fitted shower room.

Salop Road is ideally located on the edge of Walthamstow Marshes and the river lea Nature reserve, which is one of Europe’s largest city Wetlands and Nature reserve. The reserve is one of the few remaining pieces of London’s once widespread river valley grasslands. Early viewing is recommended as properties of this kind are rare to the market.

detailedDescription:
A light and airy two double bedroom, split level apartment on Pembroke Road.

This fantastic property offers 750 square feet of internal space, set across the first and second floors. To the front of the first floor sits a double height, open plan kitchen/diner/lounge. The plethora of windows and skylights ensure plenty of natural light, accentuating the cool, monochrome walls and rich tones of the flooring. There is plenty of room here to both dine and relax, whilst the kitchen, which is situated in one corner, is kitted out with sleek, modern units and worktops.

The first of the two bedrooms sits at the back of the first floor. It has floor to ceiling built in wardrobes along one wall, and more of that beautiful flooring underfoot. The first floor is then completed by the three piece bathroom.

Upstairs, overlooking the lounge diner via vast internal windows, is the larger of the two bedrooms. It stretches across the full width of the flat, has skylights to the rear, and an abundance of room for free standing storage.

Living Here...

With any property in and around the Village it’s all about location, location, location. That’s partly because Walthamstow Central is just a short walk away, but let’s be honest, what you really want to hear about are the local amenities, right? Ok, well for the caffeine addicts amongst you (count us in!), have a wander along to Grove Road’s very own coffee shop, Huck’s. Armed with your latte (or in our case double espresso please) meander past Grosvenor Park and head on up to the centre of the Village. On Orford Road itself you will find plenty of places to eat and drink, whilst if you are in a more artistic mood, carry your coffee onwards to investigate local history at the Vestry House Museum (checking out the Ancient House along the way) or investigate all things neon at God’s Own Junkyard. Alternatively just sit down opposite St Mary’s Churchyard, relax, and watch the world go by…

In This Area - By Walthamstow Diary

Despite what people may tell you, Walthamstow Village was not invented by estate agents. It’s called Walthamstow Village because it was once exactly that, a village. Once the administrative heart of Walthamstow, the Village is now content to simply be the neon capital of Europe. An unlikely claim you might think, but visit God’s Own Junkyard on Ravenswood industrial estate and you’ll see what I mean.
When your mind has been blown by the neon, pop in to Mother’s Ruin Gin Palace and Wildcard Brewery. All three businesses are based on Ravenswood, making it the most exciting industrial estate on the planet. The Village is full of quiet residential streets that all have easy access to bucket loads of pubs and restaurants. Take in the jazz at The Nags Head on Sunday afternoon, enjoy the excellent food and beer at The Queens Arms, and sample the legendary chicken and bacon jam burger at Eat17.
To walk off all the food you’ve eaten, wander to the 15th century Ancient House, check out St Mary’s Church and its ivy clad church yard, have a pint in the garden at The Castle Pub, then admire the art in the windows of the old iron mongers.

detailedDescription:
This five bedroom Victorian end of terrace house is the complete family home on every level. The property benefits from being situated over three levels, includes a summer house, benefits from a side and rear extension, and includes three bathrooms\shower rooms.

This five bedroom Victorian end of terrace house is the complete family home on every level. The property benefits from being situated over three levels, includes a summer house, benefits from a side and rear extension, and includes three bathrooms\shower rooms.

The ground floor of the property comprises of the spacious entrance hallway with the through lounge located to the left hand side. The through lounge is the heart of the home and includes the bay window which floods the room with natural light and offers more usable space. The fully fitted kitchen\diner located to the rear includes integrated appliances and benefits from the side extension giving space for dining and allowing for entertaining friends and family. Completing the ground floor of this charming property is the rear extensions which includes the utility space and ground floor three piece bathroom suite. The garden is accessed via the utility room and is paved over creating a low maintenance garden.

The first floor of the property is made up of three well proportioned bedrooms, again with the master bedroom including the bay windows giving more light and space. The bedroom to the rear of the property also includes a three piece en suite shower room tastefully decorated in keeping with the rest of the house. The second floor of the property consists of two further spacious bedrooms and another en suite three piece shower room.

In terms of locality you are ideally situated just off Lea Bridge Road where you will find an abundance of local amenities on offer including a selections of bars, restaurants and coffee shops. The property offers four local station all within 20 to 25 minutes walks and includes St. James Street (15 minutes), Lea Bridge Road, Walthamstow Central and Leyton Midland stations.

When it comes to schools you are truly spoilt for choice including Sybourn Primary School, Thomas Gammuel Primary School, Edinburgh School and many more.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Sat on the top floor of a modest three storey contemporary development, this one bedroom apartment is smart and bright, with plenty of natural light and sleek Design & Decor throughout. You're enviably located here too, sat amongst leafy green grounds less than a half mile on foot from The Village.

You have dedicated off street parking and drivers can be on the North Circular in around ten minutes, and speeding out of London on the M11 in less than fifteen.

If you lived here…

You'll be stretching out in a lovingly finished suite of rooms with leafy green treetop views all around. Take your 150 square foot lounge/diner; beautifully bright and airy with pale pine hardwood underfoot and a constellation of recessed spotlights overhead. Next door your kitchen's immaculate in pristine, curvaceous cabinets, matching countertops, metro tile splashbacks and a full complement of integrated appliances.

Elsewhere, your bedroom's a substantial double of 125 square feet, with more pale hardwood underfoot, its own set of recessed spotlights and a welcome wealth of floor to ceiling mirrored fitted storage accentuating the sense of space. Finally, your bathroom's flawlessly finished floor to ceiling in luxurious large format dusky sandstone tiling.

Outside and our borough's leafy green oasis of Walthamstow Village is just a half mile on foot and home to a huge range of independent wining and dining establishments, from the artisanal gins at Mother's Ruin to Pillars Brewery's Craft Beers. Also be sure to check out the cosy fires and friendly cats at The Nag's Head, fine Sunday lunches at The Castle and many more places besides. You're sure to find a favourite just a short stroll away.

What else?

- Your new home's also handy for the transport links of Walthamstow Central, just ten minutes walk for direct, twenty minute runs to Liverpool Street and Oxford Circus.
- The developments' grounds really are impressively spacious and you'll have no trouble finding a spot for a picnic on a sunny afternoon.
- Walthamstow's increasingly cycle friendly, fans of two wheeled transportation can be at London's largest nature reserve, the 500 acre Walthamstow Wetlands, in less than ten minutes.

Lounge/Diner (2.90m x 4.65m (9'6" x 15'3"))

Kitchen (2.00m x 3.96m (6'6" x 12'11"))

Bathroom (1.92m x 1.66m (6'3" x 5'5"))

Bedroom (3.75m x 2.98m (12'3" x 9'9"))

A word from the owner....

"This has been a fab first home for us! We love cooking and benefitted from having a new kitchen with lots of counter and storage space. The bathroom is our oasis, with the large bathtub which is perfect for relaxing in. We wish we could bring the fitted mirrored wardrobes with us which have transformed the bedroom and been super practical.

The area is also amazing! The flat is in walking distance to The Village where you can tuck into a delicious Sunday roast at The Kitchen (our fav!) or a couple of pints in the large beer garden at the Village Pub.

It's also been great being so close to transport links, less than a 10min walk, which could get you to either Liverpool Street or Oxford Circus in 20mins."

detailedDescription:
*** Guide 350 - 370. Viewings evenings and Saturday (choose your time via Strike online) ***
This charming Warner garden flat is situated on a quiet residential street just minutes away from Leyton Jubilee Park, WaterWorks nature reserve and bird sanctuary and Hackney Marshes. It is well connected to central London: A cycleable distance for the keen, and a 5 minute walk to Lea bridge train station which has regular trains to Blackhorse Road or Tottenham Hale from where you can catch the Victoria line.
The flat has Victorian wood doors, fittings and original wooden floorboards throughout. Warner flats are purpose built so you benefit from your own separate front door.
This flat is unique in the surrounding streets in having the entire full width rear garden to itself, which the kitchen opens onto, as well as being reached through a side access from the street (ideal for plants, pets and kids). Planning permission was previously granted for an extension of the kitchen into the garden; using it as a kitchen/living room would turn the flat into a 2 bed.
The property offers a bedroom, living room (has been previously used as a second bedroom), generous bathroom and kitchen with french doors opening into the garden.
Offered with no onward chain. 1000 year lease.
Great neighbourhood amenities: Schools, pubs, family run food and convenience stores at the end of the street, and Aldi just round the corner, Walthamstow Village and Hackney just minutes away.

detailedDescription:
L&Q at Blackhorse View

Shared Ownership homes launching soon
What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder. The minimum
share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

Offering a stepping stone to home ownership in Walthamstow the first collection of 1 bedroom Shared Ownership apartments at Blackhorse View are launching soon.

In a superb Zone 3 location opposite Blackhorse Road station, Blackhorse View is a brand new development of 350 new homes in the thriving creative and cultural hub of Walthamstow in East London, London Borough of Culture 2019 - part of a £200m transformation of the area.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a light and spacious ground floor Warner flat located on a quiet, tree-lined street close to transport links.

Lea Bridge Road Overground Station, one stop to Stratford International or Tottenham Hale, is a few minutes’ walk away. Buses run into Hackney and the City from the end of the street, as do the extensive Mini-Holland cycle lanes.

Numerous green spaces nearby include Jubilee Park, Hackney Marsh and the River Lea, perfect for a summer stroll.

This two double bedroom Warner property has been completely renovated, including new heating and electrics. The sitting room is spacious, light and tranquil and has a large feature bay window. There is a double bedroom overlooking the garden and a large single bedroom. The bathroom is sleek and modern with a walk-in shower. There is a modern galley kitchen with a door that opens out onto a 25 ft private garden.
Out and about

Chatsworth Road - A short walk across the Hackney marshes, Chatsworth Road has an abundance of cafes, pubs, restaurants and a fantastic Sunday market.
Hackney Marshes - Green open spaces moments away. Perfect for weekend walks.
The Princess of Wales - Popular Victorian gastro-pub overlooking the River Lea.
Leyton Jubilee Park - Great facilities for sports and recreation and a natural meadow during the summer. Grab a coffee from the cafe or an ice lolly on a hot summer’s day.
Walthamstow Wetlands Nature Reserve - Area of protected wetlands soon to be open to the public is within a 20-minute walk.
Walthamstow Market and High Street - Access the excellent shopping facilities in the Walthamstow Mall and peruse the longest street market in Europe.

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

address: Shirley Close, Addison Road, London E17
detailedDescription:
An ideal introduction to the delights of Walthamstow Village. This perfectly presented two bedroom apartment sits on the first floor of a modest, secure contemporary development in the heart of our most sought after neighbourhood, with so much more that makes our borough so special within easy reach.

Nature's never far away here, with the landscaped gardens Lloyd Park, one of our borough's proudest landmarks, just a fifteen minute stroll and the great green expanse of Epping Forest and the tranquil blue waters of Hollow Ponds just a half mile on foot.

If you lived here…

You'll have the many and varied delights of Walthamstow Village right on your doorstep – the leafy, part-pedestrianised streets, historic architecture and regular farmers market are just half the story. This peaceful oasis is also home to a whole host of high end, independent wining and dining establishments. From sumptuous, traditional gastropubs, to bars and taprooms serving up classic cocktails, artisanal gins, fine wines and craft beers, you're sure to find a favourite establishment just moments away.

Inside, Design & Decor is classic and immaculate, with broad blonde hardwood flowing underfoot from the hallway into your 150 square foot living room, dual aspect with tranquil treetop views. Your kitchen's laid semi open to your sociable space, with a wealth of pale pine fitted cabinets and grey marbled countertops.

Elsewhere, your master bedroom's extremely generous at just a shade under 180 square feet, with artfully distressed grey hardwood underfoot. Bedroom two's another double, with twin windows and matching flooring, also ideal for anything from a second reception to the ideal home working space. Finally, your family bathroom's pure and pristine in white with impeccable tiling from tub to ceiling.

What else?

- Despite your peaceful location, the comprehensive transport hub of Walthamstow Central is just a ten minute walk. From here you can get directly to Liverpool Street in twenty minutes via the overground, or Oxford Circus just as quickly via the Victoria line (you're at the top of the line here so you'll always get a seat).
- A welcome and all too rare feature in London apartments, you have a large walk-in storage area just opposite the lounge, plus more fitted storage in the hallway and second bedroom.
- With The Village on your doorstep you're spilt for choice when it comes to a new local, but be sure to try the esoteric charms of The Nag's Head, with its cosy fires, friendly cats and delicious food and drink.

Explore our 'Wonders of Walthamstow' pages for everything our awesome community has to offer.

From the critically acclaimed bars and restaurants of Walthamstow Village, to the wide green spaces of Lloyd Park and Hollow Pond.

From the 20 minute tube ride into Oxford Street to the fact that you don't have to be a Russian Oligarch to afford a family home here.

For these reasons and more, people have spent the past two years flocking to E17 and surrounding areas.

detailedDescription: Beautiful one bedroom waterside apartment located moments from all good amenities. Set on the first floor of the popular Paradise Park development this superb property boasts spacious, well-proportioned rooms throughout. The accommodation comprises a generous living and entertaining space with smart well-appointed kitchen with integrated appliances and calm waterside views; stylish bathroom and large double bedroom with built-in wardrobe, also boasting views over the water. The green open spaces of Millfields Park and Chatsworth Road's eclectic array of eateries, independent shops, pubs and coffee bars are situated nearby. There are excellent transport links to The City and West End with numerous good bus routes, and trains to Liverpool Street from Clapton Station (Overground).
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly gorgeous one bedroom apartment in the very heart of Central Walthamstow. On the ground floor of a purpose built block set in green communal grounds, with generously sized and beautifully presented rooms, this is an impeccable and comfortable home ready for someone new to make their own.

Drivers will be delighted to find this home comes with its own off street parking space, a rare find in London. If you're not in the car then travelling is equally easy, as you're just five minutes on foot from Walthamstow Central station. Everything you want is on your doorstep, from everyday shops to one-off independents, transport links to green spaces.

If you lived here…

You'll step through your front door and find yourself in the long hallway. First on the left is your bedroom, giving you 120 square foot of space. Soft carpet lies underfoot and the walls are a light cornflower blue. Next along is your lounge, at 160 square foot, offering you plenty of room for dining as well as relaxing. Warm wood toned engineered flooring lies underfoot and there's plenty of natural light.

From here you'll find the door to your eighty square foot kitchen, a brilliant space with bright white units and warm wood worktops. White metro tiling forms the backsplash, and there's lots of shelf space as well as built-in storage. Back through the lounge at the end of the hall is your bathroom. There's a modern white suite with shower over the tub, and designer patterned tiling underfoot.

You really couldn't be in a better spot for everything Walthamstow has to offer. You're tucked away close to the High Street with our famous street market, and there's a huge choice of places to eat, shop and drink. The Village is a short stroll away, and Lloyd Park is easily walkable too. Meanwhile the Victoria Line can whizz you to King's Cross in fifteen minutes, and the Overground to Liverpool Street in around twenty.

What else?

- Your new local is the wonderful Chequers, where you can enjoy one of the best Sunday roasts in town by the fire in winter, and chill out in the secluded beer garden when it's warmer.
- Just five minutes from you is East of Eden, offering yoga and reformer pilates whenever you need to do some serious stretching.
- Be sure to catch the farmer's market at the top of the High Street on a Sunday morning, offering incredible fresh produce moments from your door.

Hall

Bedroom (2.85m x 3.85m (9'4" x 12'7"))

Lounge/Dining Room (3.22m x 4.85m (10'6" x 15'10"))

Kitchen (2.20m x 3.20m (7'2" x 10'5"))

Storage

Bathroom (3.11m x 1.90m (10'2" x 6'2"))

A word from the owner...

"We have loved every minute of living in Walthamstow and this flat, which is why we are staying in the area.
The location cannot be beaten as the flat is only 5 minutes walk to the Victoria Line & Overground, minutes away from pubs, restaurants and cafes. Closest of all we are only 1 minute walk to the nearest Supermarket and Gym. We have also made excellent use of being walking distance from Lloyds Park, St James Park and the Walthamstow Wetlands. Epping Forest is also easily accessible on the many cycle paths that are throughout the area."

detailedDescription:
Spacious 3 bedroom period PROPERTYThis attractive 3 bedroom house with a spacious garden, situated in this quiet tree lined street on Pearcroft Road is an oportunity not to be missed.

On the ground floor you have a spacious living area as well as an open plan kitchen/dining area with a downstairs bathroom and a large shed at the rear of the garden.

On the first floor you have two double bedrooms and one single bedroom with the potential to go into the loft and convert into a 4 bedroom (STPP)

This property benefits from easy access to the A406 North Circular and the A12 as well as a short walk from both Leyton Station (0.4 miles) and Leytonstone Station (0.9 miles) which gives access to London Liverpool Street Station within 20/25 minutes. Leytonstone is currently an up and coming area due to its popular location for buyers and tenants, and the Leyton/leytonstone Abrahams Estates area is a particular hot-spot due to the many places to relax and enjoy evenings and weekends.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful two bedroom split level purpose built flat. The property is located just 0.1 miles to Wood Street Station and comes with a wealth of space and storage. You are greeted at the property by a communal entrance benefitting of a phone security entry system. Up a flight of stairs and you come to your own front door. Upon entering the property you walk into a spacious entrance hall with stairs to the first floor as well as access to the kitchen/diner and the lounge. The kitchen/diner is a generous space and was fully updated only five years ago. The large double aspect lounge is spread across the rear of the property and benefits from built in storage. Back into the entrance hall and up the stairs, you are greeted by a spacious landing that has loft access that is currently being used for additional storage. The first floor comprises of two large double bedrooms as well as a fully tiled three piece family bathroom which was again fully refurbished only five years ago. The property benefits from over 100 years remaining on the lease as well being fully double glazed and gas central heated from a combination boiler that is only four years old but has been regularly serviced. The property is situated a stone's throw away from Wood Street Station and the very popular Wood Street shopping parade which consists of shops, pubs, restaurants as well as an indoor Georgian market. The property is ideal for a young couple looking to start a family or even an investor as the location will guarantee a decent yield.

detailedDescription:
What the landlord says :
'I have lived in this property for four years and loved it. Other residents are friendly, and the local area has a lovely community feel and is filled with great places to go out. We are a stone’s throw from the beautiful Wanstead Flats, a great place to go for a walk, run, or picnic!”

Amenities
Apartment is all electric. There are electric heaters in bathroom, living area, bedroom area, and in the kitchen. There is an electric shower and pump for hot water in the taps.

Double glazed windows throughout. Apartment furnished with all basic amenities (fridge, washing machine) provided. Lots of storage - bookshelves, built in wardrobe, underbed storage. There is also a comfortable sofa bed for guests.

Ample parking, with one spot per resident.

Dimensions
Kitchen: 6’ 11” by 6’ 6” (2.12m by 2m) Recently renovated. Fitted washing machine, base units, and oven/cooker.

Living Room: 12’ 1” by 10’ 8” (3.7m by 3.26m) Good size, ample book storage, bright with bay window and window-seat. “

Bedroom: 9’ 4” by 8’1” (2.86m by 2.47) Separate sleeping area separated by curtain. Airing cupboard and ample underbed storage.

Bathroom: 7’ 10” by 5’ 6” (2.4m by 1.7m) Recently renovated. Bath and electric shower, radiator, extractor fan.

Travel/Local area
The flat is 7 mins walk from Leytonstone tube, and 3 mins from Leytonstone High Road Overground station. The flat is part of a small block on a quiet cul-de-sac just off Leytonstone High Street, where there is a huge choice of great shops, cafe’s, restaurants, and pubs. The flat is is 10 minutes walk from a 24 hour Tesco Superstore. The beautiful Wanstead Flats are 3 minutes walk away, and Epping Forest begins at the top of the High Street.
Breakdown of bills:
Council Tax: £89 with single person discount.
Energy: Only electric. Depending on your use this works out at £30-40 per month for a single person, and around £60 per month for two.
Internet: Currently approx £20 a month.
Water: £370 per annum.

Completion Sales are delighted to offer for sale this luxuriously designed by the existing owners five double bedroom house in a convenient and upcoming part of Walthamstow. Practically designed and refurbished to a very high standard the property benefits from five spacious bedrooms and two bathrooms.

The Ground floor layout comprises a large reception room, an extremely large fully fitted modern kitchen diner, a large decked garden, utility room and a dressing rooms. The garage has been converted to be used as a fully functional office space with its own W.C. And kitchenette. The first floor comprises of four bedrooms and a first floor family bathroom. Stirling road is located within walking distance to Blackhorse Road Station and local amenities and Walthamstow Wetlands is within walking distance offering capital’s largest urban wetland. There are plenty of good schools and parks in the area. Walthamstow has fast become an attraction for young families and professional due it various attractions for families and fast connectivity to central London. Living in Walthamstow, you cannot run out of things to do, places to explore and restaurants to enjoy!

Comfort and innovation are the hallmarks of this beautiful house. Designed in from the outset, quality is fundamental to the house with fire check doors throughout, tiled and wood flooring, brick paving on the front of the house, a laid to lawn garden with decking and a big shed. Everything is carefully designed with high quality interior finishing.

Please call completion on to arrange an appointments.

title: 5 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
The Chain is a new development in Walthamstow, consisting of 518 with both shared and full ownership available. The development is ideally situated close to three train stations, with excellent transport links. Designed with community in mind, the development benefits from shared communal gardens as well as private outdoor space in the form of balconies or terraces to each apartment.

The area

Walthamstow is seeing an unprecedented rate of growth and investment into the town centre and surrounding areas. Waltham Forest's residents and businesses stand to benefit significantly from the economic growth taking place across London. The borough's well-connected location in the east of London, the cultural heart of the capital, along with its unique identity founded in cultural heritage, its burgeoning arts and creative industries, and abundant green spaces all contribute towards the urban vibrancy that makes Waltham Forest a special place to live. In relative terms, Waltham Forest is now growing faster than any other borough in London. In the last five years the number of jobs in the borough has increased by 30 per cent (the highest in London) and the number of businesses by 40 per cent (the sixth highest increase in London). This in part is due to the significant effect of investment in Olympic legacy projects but also in the overall growth in London and the movement of the capital's economic activity eastwards.

A home where travel is made easy

The site is uniquely located within walking distance of 3 train stations, St James Street, Walthamstow Queens Road & Walthamstow Central, all the 3 stations are in travelcard zone 3.

St James Street 0.2 miles away (London Overground)
Some convenient destinations are:
  • Chingford - 15 Minutes
  • Liverpool Street - 17 minutes
  • Bank - 24 Minutes
  • Farringdon - 30 Minutes
  • Oxford Circus - 32 Minutes

Walthamstow Central 0.5 miles away (London Overground, Victoria Line)
Some convenient destinations are:
